Lily's mom hears Lily and Spot. She runs to the big tree. She sees Lily's hand. She sees the nail. She hugs Lily and says, "Don't worry, my sweet. I will make it better." She takes Lily and Spot to the car. She drives to the doctor. The doctor cleans Lily's hand and puts a band-aid on it. He gives Lily a sticker and a lollipop. He says, "You are very brave, Lily. The nail can't hurt you anymore."
Lily smiles. She says, "Thank you, doctor. Thank you, mom. Thank you, Spot." She hugs them all. She feels better. She still likes to run in the park with her dog Spot. But she doesn't put her hand in the hole anymore. She knows the nail is there. She knows it is dry and sharp. She knows it is not a toy.

Lily and Tom were playing with their toys in the living room. Lily had a big tank that could shoot balls and make noises. Tom had a small car that could go fast and beep. Lily liked her tank very much and did not want to share it with Tom. Tom liked the tank too and wanted to try it.
"Can I play with your tank, Lily?" Tom asked.
"No, it is mine. You have your car," Lily said.
"But your tank is so cool. Please, let me have a turn," Tom begged.
"No, go away. You are annoying," Lily said.
Tom felt sad and angry. He wanted to make Lily share. He had an idea. He took his car and drove it towards the tank. He bumped the tank hard and made it fall over. The balls flew out of the tank and rolled everywhere. The tank stopped making noises.
"Hey, what are you doing? You broke my tank!" Lily shouted.
"I wanted to play with it. You are mean," Tom said.
Lily was very mad. She grabbed her tank and threw it at Tom. The tank hit Tom on the head and made him cry. Tom dropped his car and held his head.
"Ow, that hurt. You are meaner," Tom said.
Lily and Tom started to yell at each other. They did not see their mom coming into the living room. She saw the mess and the tears and the toys.
"What is going on here? Why are you fighting?" Mom asked.
Lily and Tom stopped yelling and looked at Mom. They felt scared and sorry.
"We were playing with the tank and the car and we had a fight," Lily said.
"We both wanted the tank and we broke it and we threw it and we hurt each other," Tom said.
Mom sighed and shook her head. She picked up the tank and the car and put them on the table. She took a cloth and wiped the tears and the dirt from Lily and Tom's faces.
"You two need to learn how to share and be humble. The tank and the car are just toys. They are not worth hurting each other. You are brother and sister. You should love and help each other," Mom said.
Lily and Tom looked at each other. They felt ashamed and sorry.
"We are sorry, Mom. We are sorry, Lily. We are sorry, Tom," they said.
Mom smiled and hugged them. She gave them each a kiss and a cookie.
"That's better. Now, why don't you play something else together? Something nice and fun," Mom said.
Lily and Tom nodded and smiled. They took their cookies and went to their room. They decided to play with their blocks and make a castle. They shared and helped and had fun. They did not fight anymore. They were happy.

Sara and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they find a big box under a tree. They think it is a treasure.
"Wow, look at this!" Sara says. "Maybe there are toys or candy inside!"
"Let's open it!" Ben says. He tries to lift the lid, but it is too heavy. He asks Sara to help him.
They push and pull, but the box does not move. They are sad. They want to see the treasure.
Then, a tall man comes to the tree. He has a hat and a coat. He sees the box and the children.
"Hey, what are you doing?" he says. He sounds angry. "This is my box! Go away!"
Sara and Ben are scared. They do not know the man. They do not want to make him mad.
"But we found it first!" Sara says. "We want to see the treasure!"
"There is no treasure!" the man says. "This is just a box of old books! They are mine! Now leave!"
He grabs the box and walks away. He does not look at the children. He does not say sorry.
Sara and Ben frown. They are not happy. They think the man is mean. They wish they could see the treasure.
They go to the swings and try to forget the box. They hope to find a real treasure someday.

Anna and Ben like to play with crayons. They have many colors and they make marks on paper. Sometimes they make marks on the wall too, but Mommy does not like that. She says it is not polite to make marks on the wall.
One day, Anna and Ben are playing with crayons in their room. Anna wants to make a mark on the wall. She thinks it will be fun. She takes a red crayon and strikes the wall hard. She makes a big mark. She smiles and says, "Look, Ben! I made a mark on the wall!"
Ben sees the mark and he is scared. He knows Mommy will be angry. He says, "No, Anna! That is bad! Mommy will be mad! You should not make marks on the wall!"
Anna does not listen to Ben. She thinks he is silly. She says, "It is not bad. It is pretty. I like to make marks on the wall. You can make one too. Here, take a blue crayon and strike the wall."
Ben does not want to make a mark on the wall. He wants to be polite. He says, "No, thank you. I do not want to make a mark on the wall. I want to make marks on paper. That is polite. Mommy likes that."
Anna gets angry. She says, "You are no fun. You are boring. I do not want to play with you. Go away!"
Ben feels sad. He does not want to fight with Anna. He loves his sister. He says, "I am sorry, Anna. I do not want to go away. I want to play with you. But please do not make marks on the wall. Mommy will be sad. And we will be in trouble."
Anna thinks for a moment. She looks at the mark on the wall. She looks at Ben. She looks at the crayons. She says, "You are right, Ben. I am sorry too. I do not want to make Mommy sad. I do not want to be in trouble. I want to be polite. Let us make marks on paper. That is fun too."
Ben smiles. He says, "OK, Anna. Let us make marks on paper. We can make many colors and shapes. We can make a picture for Mommy. She will be happy."
Anna and Ben hug. They take their crayons and paper. They make marks on paper. They make a picture for Mommy. They are polite. They are happy.

Lily liked to paint. She had many colors and brushes. She painted flowers and animals and houses. She made a big mess on the table and the floor. But she did not care. She was happy.
One day, she painted a picture for her grandma. She painted a big heart and wrote "I love you" with red paint. She was very proud of her picture. She wanted to send it to her grandma. She asked her mom for help.
"Mom, can you help me send this picture to grandma?" she said.
"Sure, Lily. That is a very nice picture. Grandma will love it. But first, we need to clean up your mess. Look at all the paint on the table and the floor. We need to be organized and tidy," her mom said.
"Okay, mom. I will help you. But can we send the picture today?" Lily said.
"Yes, we can. After we clean up, we will put the picture in an envelope and write grandma's address. Then we will go to the post office and mail it. Grandma will get it in a few days," her mom said.
Lily nodded. She was excited. She hoped grandma would like her picture. She helped her mom clean up the paint. She was organized and tidy. She put her colors and brushes in a box. She wiped the table and the floor with a cloth. She thanked her mom for helping her. Then they went to the post office and mailed the picture. Lily smiled. She loved her grandma. She could not wait to hear from her.

Lily and Tom were playing with their toys in the living room. They had a lot of fun making a big castle with blocks, cars, dolls and animals. They used glue to stick some parts together, so the castle would not fall down.
"Look, this is the king and the queen, and this is their baby princess," Lily said, showing Tom her dolls. "They live in the castle and they are very happy."
"That's nice, Lily," Tom said, nodding. "And this is the dragon, he is very big and strong. He protects the castle from bad guys. He can breathe fire and fly in the sky."
"Wow, Tom, your dragon is cool," Lily said, admiring his toy. "Can he be friends with the king and the queen?"
"Sure, he can," Tom said, smiling. "He is a good dragon, not a mean one. He likes the castle and the people in it."
They played for a while, making up stories and sounds for their toys. They were having a lot of fun, until they heard a loud noise from the kitchen.
"What was that?" Lily asked, scared.
"I don't know, let's go see," Tom said, curious.
They left their toys on the floor and ran to the kitchen. There they saw their big brother Sam, who had knocked over a jar of cookies and made a mess.
"Sam, what are you doing?" Lily asked, angry.
"I was hungry, and I wanted a cookie," Sam said, shrugging. "But the jar was too high, and I dropped it."
"You are so clumsy, Sam," Tom said, shaking his head. "You broke the jar and the cookies. Mom will be mad at you."
Sam looked at the broken jar and the crumbs on the floor. He felt bad and sorry. He didn't mean to make a mess. He wished he could fix it.
"Maybe we can help you, Sam," Lily said, kindly. "We have glue, we can glue the jar back together."
"Really? You would do that for me?" Sam asked, surprised.
"Sure, we would," Tom said, nodding. "You are our brother, and we love you. And glue is important, it can fix things."
They ran back to the living room and got the glue. They carefully glued the pieces of the jar together, and put the cookies back inside. They were very proud of their work.
"Thank you, Lily and Tom," Sam said, hugging them. "You are the best. You saved me from trouble."
"You're welcome, Sam," Lily and Tom said, smiling. "But next time, ask mom for a cookie, okay?"
"Okay, I will," Sam said, nodding. "And next time, can I play with you and your castle?"
"Okay, you can," Lily and Tom said, nodding. "But you have to be careful, and not break anything."
"Okay, I will," Sam said, nodding. "And I will protect the castle with you and your dragon."
They all laughed and hugged. They were happy and glad. They were a family, and they stuck together. Just like glue.

Lily and Tom were going to the park with Mom. They liked the park. They could play on the swings, slide down the slide, and run on the grass. They were very happy.
But on the way, they saw a cat. The cat was on the road. It looked scared and hurt. It had a cut on its leg. Lily and Tom felt sorry for the cat. They wanted to help it.
"Mom, can we stop and help the cat?" Lily asked.
"Of course, dear. We can delay going to the park for a little while. The cat needs our help. You are very compassionate, Lily and Tom," Mom said.
Mom parked the car and got out. She took a blanket and a bottle of water from the trunk. She gently wrapped the cat in the blanket and gave it some water. The cat purred and licked Mom's hand.
"Thank you, Mom. You are very kind," the cat seemed to say.
Lily and Tom smiled. They were glad the cat was feeling better. They petted the cat and talked to it softly.
"Can we take the cat home, Mom?" Tom asked.
"Well, we have to find out if the cat has a home already. Maybe it has a collar or a tag with its name and address. If not, we can take it to the vet and see if they can find its owner. If no one claims the cat, then maybe we can adopt it. How does that sound?" Mom asked.
Lily and Tom nodded. They liked that idea. They hoped the cat would be their new friend.
They got back in the car and drove to the vet. They did not mind delaying going to the park. They had found a better way to spend their day. They had shown compassion to a cat in need. And they had learned a valuable lesson. Sometimes, helping others is more fun than playing.

Anna and Ben are twins. They like to play outside when it is sunny. But today it is rainy and they have to stay inside. They are very bored.
They look at the window and see a big puddle. They want to jump in the puddle and splash. They ask their mom if they can go outside. Mom says no, it is too wet and cold. They have to wait until the rain stops.
Anna and Ben are sad and angry. They think mom is mean. They look for something fun to do inside. They find an umbrella in the closet. They open the umbrella and pretend it is a tent. They crawl under the umbrella and make funny noises.
Mom hears the noises and comes to see what they are doing. She sees the umbrella on the floor and the twins under it. She smiles and says they are very clever. She asks if they want to play a game with her. They say yes, they want to play.
Mom takes the umbrella and holds it over her head. She says she is a giant and they are tiny ants. She pretends to chase them around the room. They run and hide and laugh. They wave at mom and she waves back. They have fun and forget about the rain. They are not bored anymore.

Lily and Ben were very happy. They were going to the park with Mom and Dad. They liked to play on the swings, the slide and the sandbox. They also liked to see the animals in the pond. There were ducks, fish and turtles. Sometimes they fed them bread crumbs.
"Look, Mom, look!" Lily shouted. "There is a big white truck. What is it?"
Mom smiled. "That is an ice cream truck, Lily. It sells cold and sweet treats. Do you want some?"
"Yes, yes, please!" Lily and Ben said. They ran to the truck with Mom and Dad. They heard a funny song from the truck. It made them laugh.
The ice cream man was very nice. He had a big hat and a big smile. He showed them different kinds of ice cream. There were cones, cups, bars and popsicles. There were many colors and flavors.
"What do you want, Lily?" Mom asked.
"I want a pink cone with sprinkles, please," Lily said.
"And you, Ben?" Dad asked.
"I want a blue bar with chocolate, please," Ben said.
The ice cream man gave them their ice cream. They paid him with coins. They thanked him and walked away.
They found a bench to sit and eat their ice cream. They licked and bit their ice cream. It was cold and sweet. They were very happy.
But then they saw something. It was a big black dog. It was running towards them. It had a long tongue and sharp teeth. It looked hungry and angry.
Lily and Ben were scared. They dropped their ice cream. They hugged Mom and Dad.
"Help, help!" they cried. "The dog is coming!"
Mom and Dad were calm. They did not move. They did not scream. They waited for the dog to arrive.
The dog arrived. It sniffed their ice cream. It licked their ice cream. It ate their ice cream. It wagged its tail. It looked happy and friendly.
"See, Lily and Ben, the dog is harmless," Mom said. "It just wanted some ice cream. It did not want to hurt you."
Lily and Ben looked at the dog. They saw that it was harmless. They felt sorry for their ice cream. They felt sorry for the dog.
"Can we give the dog some more ice cream, Mom?" Lily asked.
"Can we pet the dog, Dad?" Ben asked.
Mom and Dad nodded. They smiled. They walked to the ice cream truck with Lily and Ben. They bought some more ice cream. They gave some to the dog. They petted the dog. The dog licked their hands. It made them laugh.
They made a new friend. They were very happy.

Tom and Anna were bored. They wanted to play catch, but it was raining outside. They looked around the house for something to do.
"Let's play catch in the kitchen!" Tom said. He saw a big ball on the floor.
"OK!" Anna said. She liked to play catch. She followed Tom to the kitchen.
They threw the ball to each other. They were careful not to hit anything. They had fun.
But then, Tom threw the ball too hard. It flew past Anna and hit the refrigerator. The refrigerator door opened. A lot of food and drinks fell out. Some of them broke and spilled on the floor.
"Oh no!" Tom and Anna said. They were scared. They heard their mom coming.
"What is this mess?" their mom said. She was angry. She saw the ball, the food, and the drinks. She saw Tom and Anna.
"Tom and Anna, you are in big trouble!" she said. "You should not play catch in the kitchen. You should be quiet and careful. You wasted a lot of food and drinks. You have to clean this up and go to your rooms. No more playing for today!"
Tom and Anna felt bad. They said sorry to their mom. They helped her clean the kitchen. Then they went to their rooms. They were sad. They wished they had played catch outside.

Tommy was very happy. His birthday was soon. He wanted to invite his friends to his party. He asked his mom for help.
"Mom, can I invite Sam and Lily and Ben and Anna to my party?" he said.
"Of course, my dear. You can invite whoever you want. It's your special day," his mom said.
"Can I invite Aunt Lucy too?" he said.
His mom frowned. She did not like Aunt Lucy. Aunt Lucy was ignorant. She always said mean things to Tommy and his mom. She did not know how to be nice.
"Tommy, I don't think Aunt Lucy would enjoy your party. She doesn't like fun things. She likes to sit and complain. She might make you and your friends unhappy," his mom said.
"But she is my aunt. She is family. Maybe she will be happy if I invite her. Maybe she will be nice to me," Tommy said.
His mom sighed. She loved Tommy very much. She wanted him to be happy. She did not want to hurt his feelings.
"Okay, Tommy. If you really want to invite Aunt Lucy, you can. But don't be sad if she doesn't come or if she is rude. You have many other people who love you and who will celebrate with you," his mom said.
Tommy smiled. He hugged his mom. He was excited for his party. He hoped Aunt Lucy would come and be nice. He hoped she would learn how to have fun. He hoped she would not be ignorant anymore.

Lily and Tom were hungry. They wanted to eat dinner. Mommy was cooking in the kitchen. She had a big pot of water on the stove. She put some potatoes in the water. She said, "The potatoes will be soft and yummy soon. But don't touch the pot. It is very hot and dangerous. You can get hurt."
Lily and Tom nodded. They played with their toys in the living room. They waited for the potatoes to be ready. They smelled something good. They heard Mommy say, "Dinner is ready. Come and eat."
Lily and Tom ran to the kitchen. They saw Mommy put some potatoes on their plates. She also gave them some cheese and broccoli. They said, "Thank you, Mommy. This looks delicious."
They started to eat. They liked the potatoes. They were soft and yummy. They also liked the cheese and broccoli. They ate everything on their plates. They said, "We are full. We finished our dinner."
Mommy smiled. She said, "I'm proud of you. You ate all your vegetables. You can have some dessert now. How about some ice cream?"
Lily and Tom cheered. They said, "Yes, please. We love ice cream."
Mommy gave them some ice cream. They ate it with spoons. They licked their lips. They said, "This is the best dinner ever. Thank you, Mommy."
Mommy hugged them. She said, "You're welcome, my sweeties. I love you."

Sara liked to help her mom in the kitchen. She liked to stir the soup, cut the bread, and taste the cheese. But she did not like onions. Onions made her cry and smell bad. She always tried to hide them under her plate or give them to the dog.
One day, mom asked Sara to spend some time with her dad in the garden. She said they had to pick some onions for dinner. Sara did not want to go, but she did not want to make mom sad. She put on her boots and hat and followed dad outside.
The garden was huge. There were many plants and flowers and bugs. Sara liked to look at them and touch them. But she did not like the onions. They were big and round and had long green hair. Dad said they were good for the soup and the salad and the meat. He gave Sara a basket and a knife and told her to cut some onions.
Sara did not want to cut the onions. She wanted to play with the bugs and the flowers. She looked around and saw a butterfly. It was yellow and black and very pretty. She ran after it, leaving the basket and the knife behind.
Dad did not see Sara run away. He was busy cutting onions. He filled the basket with many onions. He was proud of his work. He wanted to show mom and Sara how many onions he had. He picked up the basket and the knife and walked back to the house.
Sara followed the butterfly to the other side of the garden. She saw a big tree with red apples. She liked apples. They were sweet and juicy and crunchy. She wanted to have one. She climbed the tree and reached for an apple.
But she did not see the bee. The bee was on the apple. It was angry and scared. It did not like Sara. It stung Sara on the nose. Sara screamed and fell from the tree. She dropped the apple and the butterfly flew away.
Dad heard Sara scream. He dropped the basket and the knife and ran to Sara. He saw her on the ground, crying and holding her nose. He saw the bee and the apple and the tree. He understood what happened. He felt sorry for Sara. He hugged her and kissed her and said:
"It's okay, Sara. It's just a bee sting. It will go away soon. You are brave and strong. I love you, Sara."
Sara looked at dad. She saw his eyes and his smile and his beard. She smelled his breath and his shirt and his hair. She smelled the onions. She did not like the onions. But she liked dad. She loved dad. She said:
"I love you too, dad. But I don't like onions."

Sam and Ben are best friends. They like to play with cars and balls and blocks. They go to the same school and sit next to each other. They have a lot of fun.
But one day, Sam is sick. He has a fever and a cough. He has to stay at home and rest. He cannot go to school or play with Ben. He is sad and bored. He misses Ben a lot.
Ben is sad too. He does not have Sam to play with. He does not have anyone to share his snacks or jokes or stories. He misses Sam a lot.
The next day, Sam feels a little better. He wants to see Ben. He asks his mom if he can go to school. His mom says no, he has to stay at home for one more day. But she has a surprise for him. She gives him a big envelope. She says it is from Ben.
Sam opens the envelope. Inside, he finds a drawing of him and Ben playing with cars and balls and blocks. He also finds a small toy car with a zipper on it. He can unzip the car and put things inside. He thinks it is very cool and playful. He smiles.
He sees a note from Ben. It says: "Dear Sam, I miss you. I hope you feel better soon. I made this car for you. You can unzip it and put your snacks or jokes or stories inside. Then you can zip it and keep them safe. I can't wait to play with you again. Your friend, Ben."
Sam feels happy. He hugs the drawing and the car. He says thank you to his mom. He says thank you to Ben in his heart. He does not feel so bored or sad anymore. He still misses Ben, but he knows Ben misses him too. He knows they will play together soon.

Sara and Ben were playing with bubbles in the park. They had a big bottle of soap and a wand. They blew bubbles and watched them fly in the air. They laughed and clapped when the bubbles popped.
"Look, Sara, I made a big bubble!" Ben said. He held the wand up and showed Sara a huge bubble. It was shiny and round.
"Wow, Ben, that's a great bubble!" Sara said. She was proud of her brother. He was good at making bubbles.
But then a mean boy came and saw the bubble. He wanted the bubble for himself. He ran to Ben and grabbed the wand.
"Give me that! I want the bubble!" he demanded. He tried to pull the wand from Ben's hand.
"No, it's mine! Go away!" Ben said. He held on to the wand. He did not want to share with the mean boy.
"Stop it! You are being rude!" Sara said. She came to help Ben. She pushed the mean boy away.
The mean boy was angry. He stomped his foot and shouted. He blew hard at the bubble. The bubble burst and splashed soap on his face.
"Ow! That hurts!" he cried. He rubbed his eyes and ran away.
Sara and Ben hugged each other. They were happy. They had their wand and their bubbles. They did not like the mean boy. He was not nice.
They continued to play with bubbles. They made more big bubbles and small bubbles. They had fun. They were proud of their bubbles.

Lily likes to play with her dolls. She has many dolls, but her favorite is Anna. Anna has a fancy dress and a hat with a flower. Lily likes to pretend that Anna is a princess who lives in a big castle.
One day, Lily finds a shiny teaspoon in the kitchen. She thinks it is a perfect spoon for Anna. She takes the teaspoon and runs to her room. She puts the teaspoon in Anna's hand and says, "Look, Anna, this is your spoon. You own this spoon. You can use it to eat your cake and tea."
Lily makes a pretend cake and tea with her blocks and cups. She sets them on a small table next to her bed. She invites Anna and her other dolls to have a tea party. She gives each doll a cup and a plate. She says, "This is a very special tea party. Anna has a fancy spoon that she owns. She can share it with you if she wants."
The other dolls are happy to see Anna's spoon. They say, "Wow, Anna, your spoon is so shiny and pretty. Can we see it? Can we try it?" Anna is very kind and lets the other dolls use her spoon. She says, "Thank you for coming to my tea party. You are my friends. You can use my spoon, but please be careful. It is very important to me."
Lily smiles and claps her hands. She is proud of Anna and her spoon. She thinks Anna is the best doll in the world. She says, "I love you, Anna. You are a very nice princess. You have a fancy spoon that you own, but you also share it with your friends. You make me happy."

Tommy likes to play with his rubber ball. He can bounce it, throw it, and catch it. He has fun with his ball every day.
One day, Tommy wants to try something new. He sees a big hill near his house. He thinks it would be fun to roll his ball down the hill and see how far it goes. He runs to the hill with his ball.
He puts his ball on the top of the hill and gives it a push. The ball starts to roll down the hill very fast. Tommy runs after it, but he cannot catch it. The ball goes faster and faster, and Tommy gets tired.
The ball reaches the bottom of the hill and keeps rolling. It rolls into a pond. The pond is cold and deep. Tommy stops at the edge of the pond and looks at his ball. He is sad. He cannot get his ball back.
Then he sees a duck. The duck is swimming in the pond. The duck sees the ball and swims to it. The duck picks up the ball with its beak and brings it to Tommy. Tommy is happy. He thanks the duck and takes his ball. He hugs his ball and smiles.
Tommy learned something new. He learned that rolling his ball down the hill is not a good idea. He also learned that ducks are nice and can help. He decides to play with his ball in his yard instead. He succeeds in having fun with his ball and making a new friend.

Sam and Mia were playing in the park. They liked to ride their bikes on the paths and go down the slides. They wore helmets to keep their heads safe. They were lively and happy.
"Look, Mia, a big hill!" Sam said. "Let's go up and see what's on the other side."
"OK, Sam, but be careful!" Mia said. "The hill is steep and bumpy."
They pedaled hard and reached the top of the hill. They saw a pond with ducks and a bridge. They also saw a sign that said "No bikes allowed".
"Wow, this is pretty!" Mia said. "But we can't go on the bridge with our bikes. What should we do?"
"Let's settle our bikes here and walk across the bridge," Sam said. "We can come back for them later."
They got off their bikes and left them by the sign. They took off their helmets and held them in their hands. They walked across the bridge and fed the ducks some bread. They had fun watching the ducks swim and quack.
After a while, they decided to go back to their bikes. They put on their helmets and got on their bikes. They rode down the hill and back to the park. They were lively and happy.

Lily and Max were best friends. They liked to play at the park together. They liked to swing, run, and climb. But their favorite thing was the slide.
One day, they went to the park with their moms. They saw a big, shiny slide. It was new and looked fun. Lily and Max ran to the slide. They wanted to try it.
But when they got there, they saw a long line of kids. They had to wait for their turn. Lily and Max were anxious. They wanted to slide now.
"Please, can we go first?" Lily asked a big boy in front of them.
"No, you can't. You have to wait like everyone else," the big boy said. He was rude and mean.
Lily and Max felt sad and angry. They didn't like the big boy. They looked at their moms for help.
Their moms saw what was happening. They came to the slide. They talked to the big boy and his mom. They explained that Lily and Max were very excited to try the new slide. They asked if they could let them go ahead, just this once.
The big boy's mom was nice. She told her son to be polite and share. She said he could go after Lily and Max. The big boy nodded. He moved aside and let Lily and Max go first.
Lily and Max smiled. They thanked the big boy and his mom. They climbed up the ladder and slid down the slide. They felt happy and proud. They had so much fun.
They waved to their moms and ran back to the line. They wanted to slide again. And again. And again. They made new friends and played nicely. They had a great day at the park.

Tim and Lily were friends. They liked to play with toys and draw pictures. One day, Tim saw a new toy in the shop. It was a big red car that could make noises and move. Tim wanted the toy very much, but he had no money.
He saw Lily coming out of the shop with her mom. Lily had a new doll that she was very happy with. Tim felt angry and jealous. He ran to Lily and snatched the doll from her hands. He shouted, "This is mine now! You have too many toys!"
Lily started to cry. Her mom was very angry and scolded Tim. She took the doll back and told Tim to go away. Tim ran away with the big red car that he had stolen from the shop. He thought he was clever and lucky.
But soon he felt guilty. He knew he had done a bad thing. He had hurt his friend and stolen a toy. He wanted to say sorry to Lily and give the toy back, but he was afraid. He hid the toy under his bed and hoped no one would find out.
The next day, he had a meeting at school. It was a meeting with his teacher, his mom, Lily, and Lily's mom. The teacher had found out what Tim had done. She showed the big red car to everyone and asked Tim to explain. Tim felt very ashamed and scared. He wished he had never taken the toy. He regretted his actions, but it was too late. He had lost his friend and his trust. He had to face the consequences. He had a bad ending.

Tommy was miserable. He had a cold and his nose was runny. He could not play with his toys or watch his favorite show. He only wanted to sleep, but he could not. He heard loud noises outside his window. He looked and saw big trucks and cars zooming by. They made a lot of speed and noise. Tommy hated them. They kept him awake.
"Mommy, make them stop!" he cried. He pulled his blanket over his head.
Mommy came to his room and hugged him. She felt his forehead and gave him some medicine. She said, "I'm sorry, Tommy. They are fixing the road. They have to work fast. They will be done soon. Then it will be quiet."
"But I want to sleep now!" Tommy whined. He sniffled and coughed.
Mommy smiled and kissed him. She said, "I know, honey. How about I read you a story? Maybe that will help you relax and fall asleep."
Tommy nodded. He liked stories. Mommy picked up a book and sat on his bed. She read him a story about a brave knight and a friendly dragon. Tommy listened and imagined the adventure. He forgot about the noise and the cold. He felt warm and cozy. He closed his eyes and drifted off to sleep. Mommy tucked him in and turned off the light. She whispered, "Good night, Tommy. I love you."
The end.

Lily and Max are friends. They like to play in the field near their house. The field has many flowers and bugs and birds. Lily and Max like to look at them and talk to them.
One day, they see a big dog in the field. The dog is brown and furry and has a long tail. The dog runs and jumps and barks. Lily and Max are scared of the dog. They sit behind a bush and watch the dog.
"Who is that dog?" Lily asks Max. "I don't know," Max says. "Maybe he is lost. Maybe he is hungry. Maybe he wants to play."
The dog sees Lily and Max. He runs to them and sniffs them. He wags his tail and licks their faces. Lily and Max are surprised. The dog is friendly and gentle. He does not bite or scratch.
"Hello, dog," Lily says. "What is your name?" The dog barks and wags his tail. "I think he likes us," Max says. "Can we pet him?" Lily and Max pet the dog and hug him. The dog is happy and warm.
Lily and Max are not scared of the dog anymore. They play with him in the field. They throw a stick and he fetches it. They run and he chases them. They sit and he cuddles with them. They are alert and watch for his owner. They hope he will come back and find him. They want the dog to be safe and loved. They are his new friends.

Tom and Sue were excited to go to the park with Mom. They liked to play on the swings, the slide and the sandbox. They also liked to look at the birds, the flowers and the big trees.
One day, they saw a new path in the park. It was narrow and rocky, and it went up a hill. Mom said they could explore it, but they had to be careful and stay close to her. Tom and Sue agreed, and they followed Mom up the path.
The path led them to a cliff. It was very high and steep, and they could see the river and the bridge far below. Tom and Sue were amazed by the view. They wanted to see more, so they walked closer to the edge of the cliff.
"Look, Mom, look!" Tom shouted. "I can see a boat and a fish and a duck!"
"Be careful, Tom, don't go too close!" Mom warned. "The cliff might break and you might fall!"
But Tom did not listen. He took one more step, and then he heard a loud crack. The ground under his feet broke, and he started to slide down the cliff. He screamed and reached for Mom.
Mom was quick and brave. She grabbed Tom's hand and pulled him back to safety. She hugged him and scolded him. "Tom, you were very naughty and foolish! You could have hurt yourself or worse! You have to listen to me and follow the rules!"
Tom was scared and sorry. He cried and said, "I'm sorry, Mom, I'm sorry! I won't do it again, I promise!"
Sue was also scared and sorry. She hugged Tom and said, "I'm sorry, too, Mom. I should have stopped Tom. I love you, Tom, and I don't want you to get hurt!"
Mom was relieved and glad. She hugged them both and said, "I love you, too, Tom and Sue. I'm happy you're both safe and sound. But you have to be more careful and sensible next time. Now let's go back to the park and have some fun!"

Tim and Kim are twins. They like to play and eat. One day, they see a big jar of butter in the kitchen. They love butter on their bread.
"Let's take some butter," Tim says. "Mom won't know."
"OK," Kim says. "But how do we get it?"
Tim has a creative idea. He gets a chair and a spoon. He climbs on the chair and reaches for the jar. He scoops some butter with the spoon and puts it in his pocket.
"Good job, Tim," Kim says. "Now it's my turn."
She gets another spoon and climbs on the chair. She also scoops some butter and puts it in her pocket.
They are very happy. They run to their room with their butter. They find some bread and make butter sandwiches. They eat and smile.
But they don't know that Mom is watching. She sees them steal the butter. She is not happy. She goes to their room and knocks on the door.
"Tim and Kim, what are you doing?" she asks.
They look at Mom. They see her angry face. They feel bad.
"We are sorry, Mom," they say. "We took some butter. We were hungry."
Mom sighs. She knows they like butter. But she also knows they should not steal.
"Tim and Kim, stealing is wrong," she says. "You should ask me first. And you should not put butter in your pocket. It will make a mess."
She shows them their pockets. They are full of melted butter. It drips on the floor.
They see their pockets. They are shocked. They did not think of that.
"Oops," they say.
Mom shakes her head. She makes them clean their pockets and the floor. She also makes them share the rest of the butter with their brother and sister.
They learn their lesson. They do not steal butter again. They ask Mom first. And they use a plate.

Lila and Ben were friends who liked to play outside. One day, they saw a big pile of snow in the park. They ran to the snow and started to make a snowman.
"Let's make him a hat and a scarf," Lila said. "And a nose and eyes and a mouth."
"OK," Ben said. "I have a hat and a scarf in my bag. And I have some buttons and a carrot."
They put the hat and the scarf on the snowman's head and neck. They used the buttons for the eyes and the mouth. They used the carrot for the nose.
"Look, he is so cute!" Lila said. "But he needs something else. Something orange."
"Like what?" Ben asked.
"Like this!" Lila said. She picked up an orange from her bag and threw it at the snowman.
"Hey, don't do that!" Ben said. "That's not nice. That's my orange. I was going to eat it."
But it was too late. The orange hit the snowman and broke into pieces. The pieces fell on the snow and made it look dirty.
"Oops," Lila said. "I'm sorry. I didn't mean to make a mess. I just wanted to make him more colorful."
"Well, you didn't," Ben said. "You made him worse. And you wasted my orange. That was not a good thing to do."
Lila felt bad. She realized she had been selfish and rude. She wanted to make it up to Ben.
"I'm sorry, Ben," she said. "I was wrong. I should have asked you first. And I should have been more careful. Can you forgive me?"
Ben looked at Lila. He saw that she was sincere and sorry. He decided to be kind and forgiving.
"It's OK, Lila," he said. "I forgive you. But next time, please think before you act. And don't throw things at people or things. That can hurt them or ruin them."
Lila nodded. She learned her lesson. She hugged Ben and said, "Thank you, Ben. You are a good friend. And so is our snowman. Even if he is not orange."
They smiled and played with the snowman. They made him an icy heart and gave him a hug. They hoped he would stay for a long time. They were happy.

Tom was a boy who liked to demand things. He always wanted to have the biggest toy, the most candy, and the best seat. He did not like to share or wait for his turn. He thought he was the best and everyone should do what he said.
One day, he went to the park with his mom and saw a big slide. He ran to the slide and pushed the other kids away. He shouted, "I want to go first! Move, move, move!" The other kids were scared and angry, but they moved away. Tom climbed up the ladder and sat on the top of the slide. He felt very proud and happy.
But then, he heard a loud noise. It was a dog barking. Tom looked down and saw a big, black dog at the bottom of the slide. The dog was wagging its tail and jumping up and down. It wanted to play with Tom. Tom was afraid of dogs. He did not like their teeth and their fur and their noise. He screamed, "Go away, go away, go away!"
The dog did not go away. It thought Tom was playing with it. It barked louder and jumped higher. Tom was stuck on the slide. He could not go down or up. He cried and cried. He wished he had not pushed the other kids away. He wished he had not been so rude and bossy.
His mom heard him crying and came to help him. She shooed the dog away and hugged Tom. She said, "It's okay, Tom. The dog was just friendly. He did not want to hurt you. But you should not demand things from others. You should be kind and polite and share. That's how you make friends and have fun. Do you understand?"
Tom nodded and said, "I'm sorry, mom. I'm sorry, kids. I was wrong. Can I play with you?" The other kids saw that Tom was embarrassed and sorry. They forgave him and let him join them. Tom learned his lesson and played nicely with the other kids. He had more fun than ever. He did not demand things anymore. He said, "Please" and "Thank you" and "Sorry". He was a good boy.

Tom and Lily were twins who liked to play in the farm. They saw many animals and plants there. They liked to feed the chickens and pet the cows. But their favorite thing was to play with the pumpkins.
The pumpkins were big and round and orange. They grew in a patch near the barn. Tom and Lily liked to roll them and stack them and make faces on them. But they also liked to throw them.
One day, they found a very big pumpkin in the patch. It was bigger than their heads. They wanted to see how far they could throw it. They lifted it together and carried it to the hill. They counted to three and threw it as hard as they could.
But they were careless. They did not see where the pumpkin was going. They did not see the farmer's truck parked at the bottom of the hill. They did not hear the crash and the smash and the honk.
The farmer was angry. He saw his truck with a big dent and a broken window. He saw the pumpkin splattered all over the ground. He saw Tom and Lily hiding behind a bush. He shouted at them and told them to come out.
Tom and Lily were scared. They knew they did a bad thing. They said they were sorry and they did not mean to hurt the truck. They said they just wanted to have fun with the pumpkin.
The farmer was still angry, but he was also kind. He saw that Tom and Lily were young and did not know better. He told them to help him clean up the mess and to be more careful next time. He told them to never throw pumpkins again.
Tom and Lily nodded and did what the farmer said. They learned their lesson. They still liked to play with the pumpkins, but they did not throw them anymore. They were more careful and respectful. They were happy and so was the farmer.

Anna and Ben are friends. They like to play with toys and books. One day, Anna has a new toy. It is a kite. The kite has a long string and a tail. It is red and yellow and blue.
"Can I borrow your kite?" Ben asks Anna. He wants to fly the kite in the sky.
"Okay, but be careful," Anna says. She gives Ben the kite and the string. "Do not let go of the string. The kite will fly away."
Ben takes the kite and runs to the field. He throws the kite in the air. The wind makes the kite go up and up. Ben feels the string pull in his hand. He smiles. The kite looks like a bird.
Anna watches Ben from the bench. She sees the kite fly high and far. She sees the string get smaller and smaller. She feels sad. She misses her kite.
"Ben, come back!" Anna calls. "It is time to go home. Give me back my kite."
But Ben does not hear Anna. He is too busy with the kite. He does not see how distant the kite is. He does not notice that the string is loose. He does not feel the string slip from his hand.
The kite flies away. The string falls to the ground. Ben looks up and sees nothing. He feels sad. He lost the kite.
"Anna, I am sorry," Ben says. He runs to Anna with the string. "I did not mean to lose your kite. It was an accident."
Anna is angry. She does not want the string. She wants her kite. She does not forgive Ben. She does not want to be his friend.
They go home. They do not talk to each other. They do not play with toys and books. They are lonely and unhappy. They wish they had their kite and their friend.

Lily liked to zoom on her bike. She zoomed fast and slow, up and down, left and right. She zoomed to school every morning with her mom. She zoomed back home every afternoon with her dad.
But at school, Lily felt lonely. She did not have any friends to play with. The other kids did not zoom on their bikes. They played with balls, dolls, cars, and blocks. Lily did not like those things. She only liked to zoom.
One day, a new kid came to school. His name was Ben. He had a bike too. It was red and shiny. Lily saw him zooming in the yard. She wanted to zoom with him. She went to him and said, "Hi, I'm Lily. I like your bike. Can we zoom together?"
Ben smiled and said, "Hi, I'm Ben. I like your bike too. Yes, we can zoom together. Do you want to race?"
Lily nodded and said, "Yes, I want to race. Let's go!"
They zoomed around the yard, laughing and cheering. They zoomed fast and slow, up and down, left and right. They zoomed past the other kids, who watched them with curiosity and envy.
Lily did not feel lonely anymore. She had a friend to zoom with. She was happy. She zoomed to school every morning with Ben. She zoomed back home every afternoon with Ben. They zoomed and zoomed and zoomed. They were the best zoomers in the school.

Bee and Ant were friends. They liked to play and help each other. One day, they saw a big hive on a tree. The hive had many bees and honey.
"Bee, is that your home?" Ant asked.
"Yes, it is. Do you want to see it?" Bee said.
"Can I? Is it safe?" Ant said.
"Of course, it is safe. You are my friend. Come with me. I will show you around." Bee said.
They flew and crawled to the hive. Bee introduced Ant to her family and friends. They were very nice and gave Ant some honey to taste. Ant liked the honey. It was sweet and sticky.
"Wow, your home is amazing. You have so much honey and so many bees. How do you make it?" Ant asked.
"We work hard and cooperate. We collect nectar from flowers and make honey. We also build and improve our hive. We make it bigger and stronger. We have a queen who leads us and cares for us." Bee explained.
"That is very impressive. You are very smart and organized. I admire you." Ant said.
"Thank you, Ant. You are very kind and brave. I admire you too. You can carry many times your weight and you live in a big colony. How do you do it?" Bee asked.
"We also work hard and cooperate. We gather food and store it. We also dig and improve our nest. We make it deeper and wider. We have a queen who lays eggs and makes more ants." Ant explained.
"That is very amazing. You are very strong and loyal. We have a lot in common." Bee said.
"Yes, we do. We are both insects and we both live in groups. We both have queens and we both make food. We are both friends and we both like to learn." Ant said.
They smiled and hugged. They decided to visit each other more often and share their knowledge and skills. They also invited their families and friends to join them. They had a lot of fun and made more friends. They improved their hive and their nest. They also improved their friendship. They were happy.

Lily and Ben are twins. They like to play with their toys. Sometimes they share, sometimes they disagree.
One day, they find a telephone in the closet. It is old and has buttons and a cord. Lily wants to play with it. She says, "I am a doctor. I need the telephone to talk to my patients."
Ben disagrees. He says, "No, I am a firefighter. I need the telephone to call for help. There is a fire in the kitchen."
They both pull the telephone. The cord breaks. The telephone falls on the floor. It makes a loud noise.
Mom hears the noise. She comes to the closet. She sees the broken telephone and the wet carpet. She asks, "What happened here?"
Lily and Ben look at each other. They feel sorry. They say, "We are sorry, Mom. We disagreed about the telephone. We broke it. We spilled the water."
Mom is not happy. She says, "You should not disagree so much. You should not break things. You should not make a mess. You need to clean up and say sorry to each other."
Lily and Ben nod. They hug each other and say sorry. They help Mom clean up. They learn to play nicely. They do not disagree anymore.

Lily and Ben are playing in the backyard. They pretend they are builders and they have a big hammer and some blocks. They want to make a house for their toys.
"Bang, bang, bang!" Lily says, hitting a block with the hammer. "This is the wall of our house. It is very strong."
"Bang, bang, bang!" Ben says, hitting another block. "This is the roof of our house. It is very high."
They work hard and make a lively house with many colors and shapes. They are happy and proud.
But then, Max, the big dog, comes running. He sees the house and thinks it is a toy. He jumps on it and knocks it down. The blocks fall and the hammer flies.
"Hey, stop!" Lily shouts. "That is our house! You are ruining it!"
"Bad dog!" Ben cries. "Go away! Leave our house alone!"
Max does not listen. He barks and wags his tail. He thinks they are playing with him. He grabs the hammer and runs away.
Lily and Ben are sad and angry. They look at their broken house and their missing hammer. They do not want to play with Max anymore. They want to make a new house. But how can they do it without a hammer?

Tim and Kim are twins. They like to play in the garden. One day, they see a big hedge. The hedge is green and thick. They wonder what is behind the hedge.
"Let's go and look," says Tim.
"OK," says Kim.
They run to the hedge and try to peek over it. But they are too small. They cannot see anything.
"Maybe we can lie on the ground and look under it," says Kim.
"Good idea," says Tim.
They lie on the grass and crawl to the hedge. They see a small gap under the hedge. They look through the gap. They see a silly sight.
They see a dog and a cat. The dog and the cat are friends. They are playing with a ball. The dog throws the ball with his mouth. The cat catches the ball with his paws. They take turns throwing and catching the ball. They are having fun.
"Wow, look at that!" says Tim.
"That is so silly!" says Kim.
They giggle and watch the dog and the cat. They forget about the hedge. They are happy.

Lily liked to play school with her dolls. She was the teach and the dolls were the kids. She had a big book, a chalk and a board. She showed the dolls how to write and read. She gave them stickers when they did well.
One day, she wanted to serve lunch to her dolls. She had some bread, cheese and juice. She cut the bread and cheese into small pieces. She poured the juice into cups. She put everything on a tray and carried it to the table.
"Time for lunch, kids!" she said. "Come and sit down. Be careful, the juice is wet. Don't spill it on the floor."
The dolls came and sat down. They looked at the food. They smiled and said, "Thank you, teach. You are very nice. We like your lunch. You are the best teach ever."
Lily felt happy. She liked to be the teach. She liked to serve lunch to her dolls. She thought she was very popular. She ate some bread and cheese and drank some juice. She shared with her dolls. They had a good time.

Ben and Lily were playing in the park. They liked to jump on the swings, slide down the slide, and run around the grass. They saw an enormous dog with black and white fur. The dog was friendly and wagged its tail.
"Hello, doggy!" Ben said. "What is your name?"
The dog barked and licked Ben's face. Ben giggled and petted the dog.
"Can we play with you, doggy?" Lily asked. "We can play fetch or tag or hide and seek."
The dog barked again and nodded. He picked up a stick with his mouth and ran away. Ben and Lily chased after him. They had fun playing with the dog.
After a while, the dog's owner came. He was a tall man with a hat and a beard. He smiled and called the dog.
"Come here, Spot!" he said. "It's time to go home."
The dog dropped the stick and ran to the man. He jumped on him and licked his face. The man laughed and hugged the dog.
"Thank you for playing with my dog," he said to Ben and Lily. "He loves making new friends. Do you want to hear a joke?"
Ben and Lily nodded. They liked jokes.
"Okay, here's one," the man said. "Why did the chicken cross the road?"
Ben and Lily thought hard. They tried to guess the answer.
"Because he wanted to go to the other side?" Ben said.
"Because he was hungry?" Lily said.
The man shook his head. He smiled and said, "No, because he wanted to jump over the moon!"
Ben and Lily looked confused. They did not understand the joke. They looked at the dog. The dog barked and wagged his tail. He understood the joke. He thought it was funny.
Ben and Lily shrugged and smiled. They did not mind. They were happy to play with the dog and the man. They said goodbye and thanked them. They went back to the swings, the slide, and the grass. They had a great day in the park.

Lily liked to play with her dolls. She had a big doll with long hair and a small doll with a hat. She gave them names and voices. She was the boss of the dolls. She told them what to do and how to do it.
One day, she wanted to have a tea party with her dolls. She put a tablecloth on the floor and some cups and plates on it. She went to the kitchen and asked her mom for some jam. Her mom gave her a jar of jam and a spoon. She told her to be careful and not make a mess.
Lily took the jam and went back to the floor. She opened the jar and put some jam on a plate. She gave the plate to the big doll. She said, "This is your jam. Eat it and say yum." She made the big doll eat the jam and say yum. She was happy.
She put some jam on another plate and gave it to the small doll. She said, "This is your jam. Eat it and say yum." She made the small doll eat the jam and say yum. She was happy.
She put some jam on a third plate and gave it to herself. She said, "This is my jam. I will eat it and say yum." She ate the jam and said yum. She was happy.
She looked at the jar of jam. It was still full. She wanted more jam. She said, "I want more jam. I will repeat." She put some jam on a fourth plate and gave it to the big doll. She said, "This is your jam. Eat it and say yum." She made the big doll eat the jam and say yum.
She put some jam on a fifth plate and gave it to the small doll. She said, "This is your jam. Eat it and say yum." She made the small doll eat the jam and say yum.
She put some jam on a sixth plate and gave it to herself. She said, "This is my jam. I will eat it and say yum." She ate the jam and said yum.
She looked at the jar of jam. It was still full. She wanted more jam. She said, "I want more jam. I will repeat." She put some jam on a seventh plate and gave it to the big doll. She said, "This is your jam. Eat it and say yum." She made the big doll eat the jam and say yum.
She put some jam on an eighth plate and gave it to the small doll. She said, "This is your jam. Eat it and say yum." She made the small doll eat the jam and say yum.
She put some jam on a ninth plate and gave it to herself. She said, "This is my jam. I will eat it and say yum." She ate the jam and said yum.
She looked at the jar of jam. It was still full. She wanted more jam. She said, "I want more jam. I will repeat." She put some jam on a tenth plate and gave it to the big doll. She said, "This is your jam. Eat it and say yum." She made the big doll eat the jam and say yum.
She put some jam on an eleventh plate and gave it to the small doll. She said, "This is your jam. Eat it and say yum." She made the small doll eat the jam and say yum.
She put some jam on a twelfth plate and gave it to herself. She said, "This is my jam. I will eat it and say yum." She ate the jam and said yum.
She looked at the jar of jam. It was empty. She had no more jam. She was sad.
She looked at the floor. It was sticky. There was jam everywhere. She had made a mess. She was scared.
She heard her mom coming. She said, "Oh no. Mom will be mad. I was too bossy. I repeated too much. I ate too much jam. What will I do?" She hid under the tablecloth with her dolls. She hoped her mom would not see her. She was sorry.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to watch the birds outside his window. One day, he saw an incredible pigeon with colorful feathers. 
"Mommy, look at the incredible pigeon outside!" Timmy exclaimed. 
His mommy came over to see the bird. "Wow, that is a beautiful pigeon. Did you know that pigeons can fly very far?" she said. 
Timmy was amazed. "Can we print a picture of the pigeon to show my friends?" he asked. 
"Of course, we can print a picture and put it on the fridge," mommy replied. Timmy was very happy and couldn't wait to show his friends the incredible pigeon.

Once upon a time, there was a poor little bird who lived in a pit. The bird was very hungry and wanted to eat some berries. But, when the bird went to pick the berries, a big, mean cat came along and scared the bird away.
The bird was sad and hungry, so it flew to a nearby house to ask for help. The little girl who lived in the house saw the bird and asked, "What's wrong?"
The bird replied, "I'm hungry and scared. The cat won't let me eat the berries."
The little girl said, "Don't worry, I'll help you." She took the bird to her backyard where she had a bird feeder. The bird was so happy and thanked the little girl. From that day on, the bird never had to refuse a meal again.

Once upon a time, there was a lovely little girl named Lily. She had a pet cat named Olive. Lily loved to play with Olive and follow her around the house. Olive was always so soft and cuddly, and Lily loved to pet her.
One day, Lily and Olive went outside to play in the garden. Lily decided to play a game of follow the leader. She would lead and Olive would follow. Lily ran around the garden and Olive chased after her. They had so much fun playing together.
As the sun began to set, Lily picked up Olive and carried her back inside. She gave Olive a big hug and said, "You're my best friend, Olive. I love you." Olive purred and snuggled up to Lily. They both fell asleep, dreaming of all the fun they would have together the next day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and cuddle with her soft blanket by the fireplace. One day, Lily's mommy told her they were going to have a special visitor. 
Lily asked, "Who is it, mommy?" 
Her mommy replied, "It's a surprise, but I think you'll like them." 
Lily was excited and waited by the fireplace. Suddenly, she heard a knock on the door. Her mommy opened it and in walked Lily's grandma! 
Lily was so happy to see her grandma and they hugged tightly. They sat by the fireplace and talked about all the fun things they would do together. Lily's grandma told her stories and Lily listened intently. 
After a while, it was time for Lily's grandma to leave. She gave Lily a big hug and said, "I'll come back soon to tell you more stories by the fireplace." 
Lily smiled and waved goodbye as her grandma walked out the door. She couldn't wait for her next visit and more stories by the cozy fireplace.

Once upon a time, there was a happy little girl named Lily. She loved to visit her grandma's house. One day, Lily went to visit her grandma and she gave her a big hug. Her grandma had a sore shoulder, so Lily gave her a gentle pat. Then, they played games and sang songs together. Lily was so happy to visit her grandma and couldn't wait to come back again soon.

Once upon a time, there was a big farm with lots of animals. The farmer who lived on the farm had a naughty horse who liked to run away. One day, the horse ran so far away that it got hurt. The farmer had to repair the horse's leg with a bandage.
The next day, the farmer went to check on his ranch and saw that the fence was broken. Oh no! The animals could run away! The farmer quickly got his tools and started to repair the fence.
Finally, everything was fixed and the animals were safe. The horse was happy to be back in its stable and the farmer was happy that he could keep all his animals on his ranch. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat toast for breakfast every day. One day, she left her toast on the table and went to play. When she came back, her toast was gone! Someone stole it! 
Lily was very sad because she loved her toast. She didn't know who took it. She asked her mom and dad, but they didn't know either. 
Days passed and Lily forgot about her stolen toast. But one day, she saw another little girl taking someone else's toy. Lily knew how it felt to have something stolen, so she told the girl that it wasn't nice to steal. 
The little girl didn't know that it was wrong to steal. She was ignorant. But Lily taught her that it's always better to ask for permission before taking something that doesn't belong to you. 
From that day on, Lily knew that even if someone took her toast again, she would forgive them because she learned that being kind and teaching others is more important than being angry.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She loved to eat fruits and vegetables because they were healthy. Her mommy always cut them with a knife before giving them to her. 
One day, Lily wanted to own her own knife so she could help her mommy. She asked her mommy if she could have one. Her mommy said she could have a special kid's knife that was safe for her to use. 
Lily was so happy to have her own knife. She used it to cut up some apples and carrots for a snack. Her mommy was proud of her for being so helpful. From then on, Lily used her own knife to cut up her healthy snacks.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a cute and adorable puppy named Max. Lily and Max loved to play together all day long.
One day, Lily's mom took her and Max to the park. They played on the swings, the slide, and even had a picnic. As the sun started to set, Lily's mom said it was time to go home.
Lily didn't want to leave the park yet, but she knew she had to. She said to Max, "I regret that we have to leave now, but we'll come back soon." Max barked happily and followed Lily to the exit. When they got home, Lily gave Max a big hug and promised to take him to the park again soon.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to swing on her swing set in the backyard. One day, her friend Max came over to play. They both wanted to swing on the swing set, but there was only one swing. They started to argue and Lily became pale with anger. 
Suddenly, Lily's mom called them inside for lunch. As they were eating, Max had to go to the toilet. But when he tried to flush, the toilet wouldn't work! Lily's mom had to call a plumber to fix it. 
While they were waiting for the plumber, Lily and Max decided to play a game. They took turns swinging on the swing set and had so much fun that they forgot about their argument. When the plumber arrived, he fixed the toilet and they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a big teddy bear. He loved to sit on the bed and play with his friends. One day, he heard a little girl crying. "What's wrong?" he asked. "I lost my favorite toy," she replied. "Don't worry, I'll help you find it," the teddy bear said.
They looked for the toy everywhere, under the bed and behind the chair. Finally, they found it under the seat of the little girl's bike. She was so happy and hugged the teddy bear tightly. But then, the teddy bear accidentally fell off the bed and broke his arm. The little girl was sad and didn't know how to fix him. The teddy bear couldn't move anymore and had to stay in bed forever. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside with her friends. One Wednesday, the sun was shining and it was so warm outside. Lily's mom encouraged her to go play outside and have fun.
Lily ran outside and saw her friends playing hopscotch. She joined in and they all had a lot of fun. They played until the sun started to go down and it wasn't so warm anymore. 
Lily's mom was so happy that she encouraged Lily to go outside and play. Lily was happy too because she had so much fun with her friends on that warm Wednesday.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a big house with her mom and dad. One day, Lily went outside to play and saw a big mill in the distance. She ran over to see it up close. The mill was very tall and had big blades that spun around and around in the wind. 
Suddenly, Lily heard her mom calling her name. She ran back to the house and saw that her little brother had spilled his juice all over the floor. Her mom was very angry and said she would punish him by making him clean it up. Lily felt sad for her brother, but knew he had to learn not to make a mess. 
That night, Lily's mom made a bitter vegetable for dinner. Lily didn't like the taste, but she knew she had to eat it all or else her mom would punish her too. After dinner, Lily went to bed and dreamed about the big mill. She hoped one day she could go back and see it again.

Once upon a time, there was a friendly horse named Brownie. Brownie lived in a big field with lots of other animals. One day, Brownie got stuck in a big puddle of mud. He tried to get out, but he couldn't. 
Luckily, a boy named Timmy saw Brownie and wanted to save him. Timmy ran to get his dad, who came with a big rope. They put the rope around Brownie and pulled him out of the mud. Brownie was so happy to be free! 
From that day on, Brownie and Timmy became good friends. They would play and run around the field together. Brownie was grateful that Timmy had saved him, and Timmy was happy to have a new friend. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily was playing outside when the rain started to fall. She didn't like the rain because it made her wet and cold. So she ran inside her house and sat by the window. 
Lily's mom came to her and said, "Don't be sad, Lily. The rain will stop soon and the sky will be clear." Lily felt a little better knowing that. But she still felt sad. 
Then, her dad came and gave her a big hug. He said, "I'm here to comfort you, Lily. The rain will stop and we can play outside again." Lily felt much better now. She snuggled up with her dad and watched the raindrops fall from the window. She felt happy and safe with her family.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy lived in a small town with his mommy and daddy. Timmy loved to play with his toys every day, but his favorite toy was his toy pipe. 
One day, Timmy went to play with his toy pipe outside, but he couldn't find it. He looked everywhere, but it was nowhere to be found. Timmy started to cry because he missed his toy pipe so much. 
His mommy and daddy saw him crying and asked him what was wrong. Timmy told them that he lost his toy pipe and he couldn't find it. His mommy and daddy tried to help him look for it, but they couldn't find it either. 
Timmy was very sad because his toy pipe was no ordinary toy. It was very special to him. His mommy and daddy promised to buy him a new toy pipe, but Timmy still missed his old one. Finally, one day, Timmy found his toy pipe in the bushes outside. He was so happy and hugged it tightly. From that day on, he made sure to always keep his toy pipe safe.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to help her mommy in the kitchen. One day, her mommy asked her to wear an apron so she wouldn't get her dress dirty. Lily was obedient and put on the apron right away. 
Together, they made yummy cookies. Lily helped her mommy mix the ingredients and put the dough on the tray. They put the tray in the oven and waited for the cookies to bake. 
Finally, the cookies were ready! Lily and her mommy took them out of the oven and let them cool. They were so happy to complete the cookies together. And when they tasted them, they were delicious!

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She had a big wardrobe with smooth doors. She loved to play hide and seek in it. One day, Lily was playing in her wardrobe when she accidentally closed the door. She was stuck inside and couldn't get out. 
Lily tried to shout for help but no one could hear her. She was scared and alone in the dark. She wished she didn't have to play alone in her wardrobe. She wished she had a friend to play with. 
Hours passed and Lily started to feel hungry and thirsty. She wished she had some food and water with her. She wished she had listened to her mom when she told her not to play in the wardrobe. Sadly, Lily never made it out of the wardrobe and was never seen again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy was very sleepy and wanted to take a nap. He went to his room and lay down on his bed. He closed his eyes and started to dream.
Suddenly, he heard a noise coming from his cooler. He opened his eyes and saw that the cooler was making a loud sound. He got up from his bed and went to check on it. He saw that the cooler was broken and needed to be fixed.
Timmy's dad came to help him fix the cooler. They worked together and fixed it. Timmy was very happy and went back to his bed to take a nap. He closed his eyes and fell asleep, feeling cool and comfortable with his fixed cooler.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she went outside to play with her friends. Suddenly, the sky turned dark and she saw lightning in the sky. It was scary!
Lily's friend, Timmy, said, "We need to go inside, it's not safe to play outside when there's lightning."
Lily nodded her head and said, "Okay, let's go inside." They ran to Lily's house and her mom opened the door. "What's wrong?" she asked.
"It's not safe to play outside when there's lightning," Timmy said.
Lily's mom said, "You're right. It's important to stay inside when the weather is bad. Thanks for being so clear about that, Timmy." She lifted Lily up and gave her a big hug.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One evening, she went outside to play with her pink ball. She was having so much fun bouncing it around when she heard a noise. 
"Hello?" she called out. 
"Hello, Lily," said her neighbor, Mrs. Johnson. "What a pretty ball you have there." 
"Thank you," said Lily. "Do you want to play with me?" 
"I would love to," said Mrs. Johnson. And so, they played together until the sun went down and it was time for Lily to go to bed. She fell asleep with her pink ball beside her, happy to have made a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a naughty boy named Tim. Tim liked to pinch his sister's toys and eat all the cookies. One day, Tim's mother gave him a piece of coal and told him to keep it with him all day.
Tim didn't like the coal. It was black and dirty. But he listened to his mother and kept it with him. Throughout the day, Tim felt the coal in his pocket and remembered what his mother said: "If you are naughty, you will get coal instead of presents from Santa."
Tim realized that he didn't want coal for Christmas. He wanted toys and cookies. From that day on, Tim stopped being naughty. He played nicely with his sister and shared his cookies. And when Christmas came, he got lots of presents from Santa because he was a good boy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she went on an adventure to a village. She saw many interesting things like colorful flowers and big trees. 
While exploring, she found a locked door. She wanted to see what was behind it, so she tried to unlock it. After a few tries, she finally unlocked the door and saw a beautiful garden. 
Lily was so happy that she found the secret garden. She spent the whole day there, playing with the butterflies and smelling the pretty flowers. When it was time to go home, she promised herself that she would come back and visit the interesting village again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved going to the library with his mommy. They would read books together and Timmy would always pick out his favorite books. 
One day, Timmy saw a man with a big bag of money. The man looked very wealthy. Timmy asked his mommy why the man had so much money. His mommy told him that the man must have worked hard to earn it. 
Suddenly, the man twisted his ankle and fell down. Timmy and his mommy rushed over to help. Timmy asked the man if he needed any help. The man said yes and Timmy helped him up. 
The man was so grateful for Timmy's help that he gave him some money. Timmy's mommy told him that it was important to help others, even if they have more money than you. Timmy learned that it's not about how much money you have, but how you treat others that matters.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big wardrobe in her room where she kept all her clothes. One day, Lily was very excited because she was going to a party with her friends. She went to her wardrobe to pick out her favorite dress.
As she reached for her dress, she heard a snap sound. She looked down and saw that the floor was covered in tiny pieces of wood. The wardrobe had broken! Lily was sad because she couldn't wear her favorite dress to the party.
But then, her dad came into the room and saw what had happened. He said he would fix the wardrobe and make it even stronger than before. Lily was happy again and couldn't wait to wear her dress to the party. And from that day on, she always made sure to be careful when opening her wardrobe.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved drawing and always used her crayons to make beautiful pictures. One day, she drew a great picture of a butterfly and showed it to her friend, Timmy.
Timmy looked at the picture and said, "That's not very good. You colored outside the lines."
Lily felt sad and didn't know what to do. She showed the picture to her mom and said, "Timmy said it's not good. What should I do?"
Her mom said, "Don't worry about what Timmy thinks. You did a great job and that's all that matters. Thank you for showing me your picture, Lily. I love it."
Lily felt happy again and realized that she didn't need to worry about what others thought. She was proud of her picture and that was all that mattered. She put a mark on the picture to remember that it was special and thanked her mom for her kind words.

Once upon a time, there was a dog named Max. Max was a wild dog who loved to run and play outside. One day, Max went for a walk and got lost. He was scared and didn't know what to do. Suddenly, he saw a kind lady who wanted to help him. She put a collar on Max and took him home. Max was so happy to have someone to help him. From that day on, Max never wandered off again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to drink milk. One day, she saw a cute little kitten playing outside her house. She picked up the kitten and brought it inside her house. "Can I keep this kitten, Mommy?" Lily asked.
Her mommy replied, "Sure, but you have to be careful with it. Kittens are harmless, but they need to be taken care of." Lily was very happy and promised to take good care of the kitten. 
Every day, Lily would give the kitten milk to drink. One day, Lily's little brother came into the room and accidentally knocked over the milk. Lily became very upset and started to cry. Her mommy came into the room and said, "It's okay, Lily. Let's fold a towel and clean it up together." 
Lily learned that accidents happen, but it's important to clean up after them and not to cry over spilled milk. The moral of the story is that it's important to take care of harmless animals, and to always be responsible and clean up after accidents.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys and ride his bike. One day, Timmy saw a motorcycle and thought it was cool. But his mom told him motorcycles were dangerous and he should stay away from them.
Timmy listened to his mom, but he still thought motorcycles were good. One day, he saw a man riding a motorcycle really fast and making a lot of noise. Timmy didn't like that and said, "I hate loud motorcycles!"
From then on, Timmy knew that motorcycles were not always good and he promised to always be careful when he was near them.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat yummy food, especially ice cream. One day, Lily went to the store with her mommy to buy some ice cream. 
Lily saw a big object in the store and asked her mommy, "What is that?" Her mommy said, "It's a toy for big kids. We can't buy it today." 
Lily was sad, but her mommy said they could still get ice cream. They went to the ice cream section and Lily picked out her favorite flavor. When they went to pay, Lily asked her mommy if she could pay. Her mommy gave her some money and Lily gave it to the cashier. 
The cashier smiled and gave Lily her change. Lily was so happy to have her yummy ice cream and to have paid for it herself. She told her mommy, "I paid for it!" and her mommy was proud of her.

Once upon a time, there were two friends named Timmy and Tommy. They loved to explore new places together. One day, they found a big cave while walking in the forest. They were scared at first, but then they went inside to see what was there.
Inside the cave, they found a perfect spot to sit and talk. They discussed what they wanted to do next and how much fun they were having. Suddenly, they heard a noise and got scared again. They decided to leave the cave and go back home.
On their way home, they talked about how brave they were to explore the cave. They couldn't wait to tell their parents all about it. From that day on, they always remembered the perfect spot they found inside the cave and how much fun they had discussing their adventures together.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. He loved playing with his hammer, which was very big and heavy. One day, Timmy's friend Sarah came over to play. She asked to use Timmy's hammer, but he said no because he didn't want her to break it. 
Sarah got upset and started to cry. Timmy felt bad and decided to let her use the hammer. But Sarah swung it too hard and the hammer broke into two pieces. Timmy got mad and told Sarah to leave his house. 
Sarah felt bad and left with tears in her eyes. Timmy felt sad too, but he knew he had to teach Sarah how to be careful with things that were thick and heavy like his hammer. The next day, Timmy invited Sarah over again and showed her how to use the hammer safely. They played together and had fun, and Timmy was happy he didn't have to leave his friend behind.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to dance and sing. One day, she went to see a band play music. The band played so loud and fast that Lily started to dance and spin around. She loved the speed of the music! 
After the band finished playing, Lily went to get some candy. She picked a red lollipop, but when she tasted it, it was bitter. She didn't like it at all! She threw it away and went back to dancing. 
The band started to play again, and Lily danced even faster. She had so much fun! When the concert was over, she went home and fell asleep dreaming about dancing to the fast music of the band.

Once upon a time, there was a big farm. On the farm, there was a happy hen. The hen loved to lay eggs. She laid eggs every day in her cozy nest. 
One day, the farmer picked up the eggs and put them in a wide jug. The jug was big enough to hold all the eggs. The farmer took the jug to the market to sell the eggs. 
The hen missed her eggs and felt sad. But she knew that laying eggs was important. She continued to lay eggs every day. And the farmer continued to put them in the wide jug and take them to the market. 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She liked to play in her backyard where there was a long fence. One day, Lily saw her neighbor sign a paper while leaning on the fence. She was curious and asked her neighbor what she was doing. Her neighbor told her that she was signing a paper to buy a new car. 
Lily thought that was cool and wanted to sign a paper too. She asked her mom for a paper and a pen. She signed her name on the paper and proudly showed it to her mom. Her mom smiled and told her she did a great job. From that day on, Lily loved to sign her name on papers. 
Every time she saw her neighbor leaning on the long fence, she would wave and say hello. The fence became a special place for Lily, where she learned how to sign her name and made a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a kind doctor. He helped people who were sick or hurt. One day, a little girl came to him. She had a big boo-boo on her knee. The doctor put a band-aid on it and said it would heal soon.
