He dribbled the basketball up and down the long driveway. He tried to run very fast, but he kept tripping over the basketball!
His mum and dad laughed a lot and they said, "It's OK! You'll get better at dribbling the basketball."
The boy smiled and kept trying, until he was very tired. He gave the big, long basketball one more try and finally he succeeded! He dribbled all the way up the driveway, triumphantly!
Mum and dad cheered and said, "Well done! You kept trying and now you know how to dribble the basketball."
The boy felt very proud of himself and smiled a big smile. He was so happy to have finally succeeded in dribbling the long basketball.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Lucy. She was only three years old. Lucy loved to explore her house but today she was feeling scared.
She tip-toed through her house until she found the kitchen. She was scared of the kitchen because it was so dark and brown. She could hear strange noises coming from inside. 
Lucy held her teddy bear tight and stepped into the kitchen. She was scared but she was brave too. Lucy walked over to the big brown door and opened it. 
Suddenly out jumped the biggest, softest, fluffiest cat she had ever seen! Lucy was so surprised she screamed out loud. Then she burst out laughing.
The cat was very friendly and loved to be tickled. Lucy had never been so happy before! She knew she would never be scared of the kitchen again.

Once there was a little girl who loved to swim. She swam in the lake every day with her friends. Her favorite part was when they would all dive in and swim under the big, white veil. It was like swimming in a cloud!
One day while they were swimming they saw a fish. It was so big and so beautiful! The girl was so generous, she wanted to share the amazing experience with her friends. She used her veil to softly cover the fish so it wouldn't get scared. And then she swam away very slowly so that her friends could get a good look.
The little girl loved her generous nature and was sure that the fish did too. Every day she swam in the lake and visited the fish. After all the wonderful memories, this was the best swimming experience of her life!

Once upon a time, there was a nice little puppy. He was always so happy, playing with his friends and wagging his tail. One day, the puppy's best friend got very sick. The puppy felt so sad and didn't know what to do. He started to weep. He wept and wept until his mommy saw him. His mommy told him it was going to be ok and hugged him tight. She took him to see his friend the next day, and the puppy's friend was all better. The puppy was so happy he started to run and jump around, barking and playing with his friend again. They were best friends forever and always had nice days together. The end.

Once there was a little girl named Sally. She was only three years old. She had a mommy and daddy who loved her very much. They were very compassionate.
One day Sally was playing in her backyard. Suddenly she heard a noise coming from near her neck. It sounded like someone was calling her name. She looked around but she couldn't see who was calling her.
Sally became scared and started to cry. Her mommy heard her cries and ran outside. She quickly saw what was happening. On Sally's neck there was a little bird. The bird was calling to Sally.
Sally's mommy smiled at Sally and picked up the little bird. She told Sally that the bird was calling for help. She was so happy that Sally had been so compassionate to help the bird.
Sally's mommy told her that caring for others was such an important lesson. She hugged Sally and said that she was very proud of her. From that day Sally and the bird became the best of friends.

Once there was a big pool. The water was shiny and one day a bell began to ring. Everyone was so excited because it meant that it was time to have fun.
The children ran to the pool and dashed in. They laughed and splashed around in the big pool. One of the kids found a big floaty and floated around for a while. Then they started playing games like diving for toys and having races.
When the bell rang again, it was time to get out and dry off. Everyone was so tired from the fun they had been having. They dried off know that they had had a great time in the big pool.

Once upon a time there was a charming little girl called Lola. She loved to spin very quickly in circles, which made her laugh and giggle. Lola spun around the room so fast her toes flew up into the air!
She kept on spinning and spinning until her toes were all a jumble! She stopped and bent over to try to sort out her toes. But as soon as Lola tried to put them in the right places she started spinning again - just for fun.
When Lola felt ready to slow down, she held out her arms and spun round and round until she came to a stop. She looked down and saw that her toes were all in the right places- a perfect pattern!
Lola kept spinning, happy in the knowledge that her toes looked charming and tidy. She spun and spun and spun, until she was too tired to spin any more. A happy smile filled her face and Lola knew that spinning was her favorite game.

Once upon a time there was a little girl. Her name was Suzy and she had a very special igloo. She set it up in her backyard, and she liked to play inside it every day. 
One day, Suzy noticed something smelling yucky inside the igloo. She thought it must be something smelly, and she didn't like it at all. 
So she decided to take a look and see what was causing the smell. She peeked around inside the igloo until she spotted a smelly old skunk. He was hiding in one of the corners and he looked very unhappy. 
Suzy thought it would be best to get rid of the skunk, so she opened the door of the igloo and very gently shooed him away. He quickly ran off with his smelly tail between his legs and Suzy was very happy! 
She was able to go back to playing in her igloo without the smelly old skunk. She had set up her igloo again, and she was ready to have all sorts of fun.

One day, there was a pebble in the garden. It was very small and round. The pebble was very tired and was rolling around in circles.
Suddenly, a rabbit appeared. She wanted to play with the pebble, so she hopped over to it and pushed it around. The pebble went far away and got stuck in the ground.
The rabbit tried to get it out, but she couldn't. In frustration, she dug around the pebble and destroyed it. The pebble was broken into tiny pieces and scattered in the garden. 
The rabbit was sad. She had wanted the pebble to play with, not to destroy it! But the pebble was gone forever.

Once upon a time there was a small boy named Tom. Tom was a very strong boy, but he did not know how to use his feet. He tried to use them to run and jump, but he kept falling over.
One day, Tom asked his mom to help him learn how to use his feet. His mom was so proud of him and taught him how to use his feet.
First, she showed him how to stand on his own two feet. Then she showed him how to walk. Tom practiced and practiced until he could walk without falling over. 
Next, Tom learned how to jump. He practiced and practiced until he could jump high and move his feet quickly. He was so happy and proud of himself!
Tom was so strong and he knew how to use his feet. Now he could run and jump and have so much fun playing with his friends. Everyone was amazed at how much Tom had learned!

Once there was a boy who was only three. His mom and dad said to him, "We dare you to go outside the house". The young boy was a bit scared because he had never seen the outside world before. But he was brave and accepted the dare. He grabbed his mom's hand and cautiously opened the door.
When the boy looked out, he saw a huge world. There were so many humans walking around and all the buildings were towering into the sky. He saw a small park nearby and it looked so inviting. Without thinking twice, he ran towards it.
When he reached the park, the boy saw dirt, sticks, and leaves scattered everywhere. He was so excited to start playing in the huge pile of dirt, but then his mom warned him. "Don't touch the dirt, it is filthy". The boy had never heard that word before and he asked his mother what it means. She explained that things that are filthy are not clean and can make us sick.
Disappointed, the young boy reluctantly stepped away from the dirt and started playing with the leaves instead. He had so much fun that he didn't even realize it had gotten dark outside. Finally, his mom called him back inside and they both had a good laugh at the adventure they had gone through.

Once upon a time there was a rude girl called Helen. One day, Helen was playing with her scissors. She wanted to cut a picture of her best friend, Jack. But as she cut, her scissors got stuck! 
Helen was frustrated and she shouted at Jack. She was very rude to him. Jack didn't like it and he ran away.
Helen chased after him, holding her scissors. But Jack was too fast and he managed to escape. So Helen stopped running and just stood still. 
She couldn't believe she had been so rude. Suddenly, she saw Jack a few metres away, looking at her sadly. Helen slowly smiled and waved at him. Jack smiled back and waved. 
The situation had ended. Jack and Helen both realised that being rude wasn't nice. They hugged and made up, then went off to play together.

Mummy and Daddy came into Suzy's room to see what she was doing. inside they saw that everything was very tidy. Suzy was sat in the middle of the room smiling. Daddy asked Suzy what she was up to. Suzy pointed to the window. 
Mummy and Daddy went over to the window to look. Suzy had made it very pretty with stickers. She had stuck some flowers around the window sill and across the glass. Daddy laughed and said how lovely it looked. Then he asked Suzy if she would like to go outside to pick some more flowers. Suzy jumped up and asked, "Please?". 
Mummy and Daddy smiled and said yes. Suzy rushed over and grabbed her coat. She was so excited for the adventure outside. They all went outside and Suzy spotted some beautiful daisy flowers. She quickly ran to them and started picking them. She was so proud when she was able to make a lovely bouquet of flowers to bring home and stick on her window. When Suzy opened her bedroom door with her bouquet, Mummy and Daddy couldn’t believe how tidy everything was. The window was now even more beautiful with a new arrangement of flowers. 
Mummy and Daddy were so proud of Suzy and told her how wonderful it was that she had kept her bedroom so tidy. Suzy was happy that Mummy and Daddy liked her window and her tidy bedroom, and she couldn't wait to

One day, Peter met a new friend. His name was George and he was very nervous.
Peter asked George why he was nervous and George said he wanted to sign up for a special club.
So, Peter and George decided to go the club. They had to do lots of laundry to join the club.
Peter and George worked hard together on the laundry and they both worked until it was finished.
When they were done they put their sweaty hands together and signed their names. Peter and George were very proud and they both joined the club.

Jojo wanted to watch TV. He was very excited.
Mommy said he had to eat his dinner first. Jojo wanted to try something new. He tasted the food and it was yummy!
After dinner, it was time to watch TV. He sat on the cozy couch and happily watched. Jojo really liked TV because it was so interesting and fun.
When Jojo grew up, he became very successful. He remembered the happy times of watching TV as a little boy and smiled. He was so glad that he had tasted new things and enjoyed them.

Paul was an adventurous three year old. He loved to explore new places and try new things. One day he decided he wanted to visit the library. He wanted to see all the fancy books on the shelves. 
When they arrived at the library, Paul was so excited that he ran through the library. He was so eager to look at all the books that he wasn't careful. He ended up knocking over some of the shelves of books and making a big mess.
The librarian came and scolded Paul. She told him that he doesn't have enough respect for books and needs to be careful. Paul felt so bad about what he had done that he started to cry. 
The librarian was very kind and hugged Paul. She told him that it was ok and gently showed him how to handle books with care.
Paul was so sorry for making such a mess. He promised himself he would never do it again and he would listen to the librarian from then on. He regretted not being more careful and knew he should always show respect to the books.

Once there was a little girl named Poppy. Poppy was 3 years old and very happy. One day, Poppy was walking in a park and she saw something very special. She saw a big, red poppy! It was so beautiful. Poppy was amazed and she wanted to take it home with her.
Poppy got close to the poppy and she looked at it very carefully. She touched it gently and it felt so soft. Poppy knew the poppy was very special so she picked it up and hugged it with her hands.
When Poppy got home with the poppy, she showed it to her mommy. Her mommy smiled and said,
"That's a very good poppy, Poppy"
Poppy was so happy and smiled very big. She would keep the poppy forever as a special thing to remember. In the end, Poppy learned that some things can be very good when you look carefully.

Once upon a time there was a big house. Inside the house, there was a little boy. His name was Tim. One day, Tim wanted to go outside and take a walk. 
Tim took a step out the door. He could see an amazing sky. It was so clear! He stepped further outside, and he saw some trees. They were so tall. He stepped some more and he saw a pond. It sparkled in the sunlight.
Tim stepped closer to the pond. He spotted something on the ground. It looked like sauce! He heard a voice. It was coming from the pond. Tim stepped closer to hear it. 
The voice said, "You will be a happy boy. Just remember to stay clear of the sauce!" Tim smiled and thanked the voice. He stepped away from the pond, and went back inside the house. 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a bear that wanted to find something good. One day, the bear decided to go on an adventure and arrived at a pond. As soon as the bear arrived, a frog hopped to the edge of the pond and asked the bear why he was there. The bear explained that he was there to find something good. The frog then pointed to a drain nearby and said it would be a good place to look. 
The bear was excited and cautiously arrived near the drain. To his surprise, he found an old carrot stuck in the drain. The bear was very pleased and used his big paws to grab the carrot. The carrot looked and smelled so good that the bear happily nibbled away. 
After finishing his snack, the bear thanked the frog for helping him find something good and said goodbye. He was so happy that he had found something delicious to eat on his adventure. The bear waved goodbye and embarked on a new journey.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Ella. She lived with her mom and dad. But, one day her Uncle came to visit and things got really exciting!
Uncle brought with him something amazing: an incredible bucket. Inside the bucket were some funny things. "What are they?" Ella asked her Uncle. Uncle told her that they were treats. He said, "Why don't we pour them onto the table?" 
So Ella and Uncle poured the treats onto the table. They both grabbed handfuls and started to eat. The treats were so yummy and Ella couldn't believe how incredible they all tasted.
When Ella and Uncle had finished all the treats, Uncle scooped all the crumbs into the bucket and put it away. Ella gave her Uncle a big hug for bringing such wonderful treats. Ella and Uncle promised to do it all again soon. 
The End.

Once upon a time, there was a flower named Rose. Rose was very pretty, but she felt sad and lonely. Then one day, the sun shone down on her and she began to bloom. She opened her petals and felt so happy that she was able to bloom with the other flowers.
Rose started to learn about the truth of the world. She found out that patience was the key to finding joy. Gradually, she became less impatient, and more understanding of the things she couldn't control. 
Soon, it was time for Rose to bloom again! She opened her beautiful petals and stretched towards the sky. All the other flowers cheered for her accomplishment and she felt proud. Rose had learned that with patience, everything can bloom.

Once upon a time, there was a small, cute factory. It was owned by a friendly man named John. Every day, John would watch the factory make lots of beautiful things.
One day a magical spark appeared in the factory. It floated around, singing a sweet song. John watched this spark as it flew around, and he felt so happy.
Soon, the little spark changed and grew. It began to glow and turn in circles. Suddenly, the magical spark became a beautiful bird! The bird flew high in the sky, and then down towards John.
John felt so excited and hugged the bird. The bird sang its sweet song as they both danced around the factory. From then on, John and the bird were best friends. They played and laughed together every day, and watched the factory make lots of wonderful things.

Once there was a wise owl. He lived in a tall tree. One day he was feeling grumpy and he wanted to do something fun. So he decided to build a stack. But it didn't turn out the way he planned. 
The stack just kept getting higher and higher. Soon it was the highest stack ever made! The wise owl was so excited that he started to yell out loud. Everyone in the forest heard him and came to see the tall stack. 
The animals all cheered and clapped for the wise owl. They couldn't believe how big the stack was. They all thanked the wise owl for making such a fun stack. 
From then on, the wise owl would build a stack whenever he felt grumpy. It always cheered him up and made him happy. He became the most famous owl in the forest!

Once upon a time there was a girl called Emily. Emily was three years old and she lived with her family. Every day Emily would go outside and play. One day, Emily was being very careless and not looking where she was going. Suddenly, she tripped and fell onto the ground! Emily was not hurt and she quickly got back up again. Suddenly she noticed something on the ground - it was a picture! Emily was so happy she had received a picture. She picked it up and took it home.
When Emily got back, she showed her picture to her family. They were so happy to see what Emily had received. Emily's mom gave her a big hug and said, "That was very lucky Emily! Thank you for being so careful". From then on Emily was very cautious when playing outside! Emily and her family kept the picture for a long time and looked at it often. They all loved the picture and were so happy she had received it that day.

One day, Tom and his little brother, Joe, were in the kitchen. Tom was stirring something in a pot on the stove, while Joe was looking around. He looked up and noticed a wrap hanging from the handle of a drawer. He tugged on it and it came off!
Tom asked "What have you got there, Joe?" Joe replied "It's wrap!"
Tom smiled, "That's right. It's a wrap. It's a bit lazy," he said, pointing to the handle. "Let's wrap this around that handle so nobody can open it."
Tom and Joe wrapped the wrap around the handle. Tom said "Now it's nice and tight. Now nobody can open the drawer without taking the wrap off."
Joe laughed and said, "That was fun!" Tom smiled, glad he had helped his brother to be so smart and successful.

Once upon a time, there was a chubby little boy. He was wearing a nice red jacket.
The boy was walking along in the park when he suddenly lost his balance. He dropped the red jacket and started to cry.
Suddenly, a big and kind lady came to help him. She picked up the dropped jacket and handed it back to the chubby little boy.
The boy smiled and thanked the kind lady. He was so happy that he put on the red jacket and twirled around in circles!
The chubby little boy was so excited to have his red jacket back that he ran off to play in the park with his friends.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Ellie wanted to enjoy music. But every time, her big brother prevented her. He was envious, and wouldn't let her listen to music!
Then one day, she found a way. Her mom taught her how to sing, so she could make her own music! She practiced hard and sang louder and louder.
Soon, all the neighbors started to listen to Ellie's songs. They smiled and sang along, it was so much fun!
 of the songs. Her brother was so envious, but he couldn't prevent her from making her own music. 
Ellie was so proud of what she had done. Every day she sang her heart out, and her brother had to accept that he could never prevent her from doing what she loved. 
The end.

Once there was a fish who loved to bounce. Every day he would jump out of the water and bounce as high as he could. He was always so happy when he bounced.
One day the fish decided it would be fun to explore the world outside of the water. He jumped up and bounced out onto the land. He looked around and everything was so new and exciting.
Soon the fish got bored. Everything was so boring. He wanted to bounce again. So he found a big bendy tree and he bounced up and down it. It was so much fun bouncing on the tree and it made the fish smile. 
Eventually the fish had to go back to the water. He bounced into the water and felt so happy again. He knew he would always enjoy bouncing and exploring.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Sophie. She was three years old and loved to play. Every day, Sophie would go outside and look for things to add to her collection of toys.
One day, she went outside and saw a big pile of leaves. She was so excited! She put her hands in the leaves and added some to her collection. 
When Sophie was finished adding the leaves to her collection, she went to get a closer look. She was amazed. The leaves were so colourful and felt so comfortable. She just wanted to keep looking at them. 
Then, Sophie went home with her collection of leaves. She was so happy and couldn't wait to show them to her family. 
The end.

Alice was hungry. She saw a fan in the corner of the room and it made her happy. She ran over to it, and skipped around it. She enjoyed the cool breeze it gave her.
Then she got an idea. She skipped to the kitchen to get a snack. She found some yummy cookies and she grabbed one. She skipped back to the fan to eat the cookie.
While she was eating the cookie, she kept feeling the breeze of the fan. She was very happy and it kept her cool while she enjoyed her snack.
Once she was done, she gave the fan a big hug and said, "Thank you, fan!" and she skipped away, feeling very content.

Once upon a time, there was a naughty little boy called Jack. He loved looking out of the window to see the view outside. Every morning, Jack's mommy would thank him for not being too naughty and remind him to keep looking out the window. 
One day, Jack saw something very exciting in the view. He could hardly believe his eyes. A big elephant was walking through the grass and eating all the juicy plants! Jack was so excited that he started shouting and jumping around. 
His mommy heard Jack from the other room and ran to see what was happening. When she came to the window, she saw the elephant. She thanked Jack for bringing to her attention the magnificent view outside. 
From that day on, Jack thanked his mommy every morning for appreciating the view he often showed her. Seeing the view made them both so happy.

Once upon a time, four friends were at a special meeting. They looked up in the sky and saw a beautiful point. It was a star twinkling with a special sparkle! The friends were fascinated and wanted to see it up close.
So they decided to go on a special adventure. They stepped on the bus and soon they were at the star. They stepped out, and it was all so beautiful. The star seemed to shine brighter, and they looked at it with curiosity.
The star had a special message for them, which made them all smile. Then they had to say goodbye. But before they left, they decided to have a meeting again and went back home.

Once there was a beautiful little girl. She was only three years old and was very sad. She had never had a doll before and so she was very lonely.
One day the little girl's mother saw how sad she was and gave her a handmade doll. The doll was so special because it had been stitched with lots of love and care. 
The little girl was very happy when she saw the doll. She hugged it close and it made her feel comforted. She promised that it would be her best friend forever. 
They did lots of fun things together and the little girl was never lonely again. She loved her beautiful doll and cherished it forever more.

Once upon a time there was a lion. He was big and strong with a loud voice and bright yellow fur. Every day he would wake up early and roar up to the sky with all of his might, which everyone could hear.
Some of the animals living in the nearby forest were scared of the roaring, but one brave little songbird enjoyed it. She found the lion's roar lively and full of energy and eventually she started singing her own song in response.
The lion was happy to hear the little bird. He would roar and the bird would sing. And soon all of the other animals, from elephants to monkeys and even more songbirds, started joining in. The noise was happy and loud with everyone singing and roaring and playing together.
The lion and his animal friends had lots of fun making music together. Their song would go on until the sun went down and a peaceful nighttime win over the forest.

Once there was a monkey named Tom. He was a very graceful monkey and he was always looking for new adventures. So one day, he decided to travel to the jungle. His mum said he had to get her permission first, so he asked and she permitted him to go.
Tom was so excited that he started to dance and jump around. He ran off to the jungle right away!
When he got there, he saw lots of things. He saw exotic birds, big snakes and colourful flowers. Tom was having so much fun!
Then he saw a graceful monkey in a tree. She was doing somersaults and playing with the tree branches. Tom wanted to join in the fun, so he climbed up the tree and introduced himself.
The two monkeys spent the day playing together. They chased each other through the trees and sang silly songs. Tom had the best time!
At the end of the day, Tom said goodbye to his new friend and ran back home. His mum was so happy to see him. She gave him a big hug and said he was always welcome to go on more adventures. Tom was so happy!

Once upon a time there were two friends who went to a classroom. They were both very excited to learn new things.
The teacher showed them lots of different objects, each one was special in its own way. The friends enjoyed learning about them.
At the end of the day, the teacher said it was time for sleep. The two friends said their goodbyes and went to their beds.
The next morning, the two friends went back to the classroom. Everything seemed different now, with the morning sun shining through the windows. It looked really beautiful.
The two friends spent the morning learning and playing together. They enjoyed their time in the classroom together, until it was time for sleep again.
That night, when they got into bed, the two friends were tired but also very happy. They had had a really wonderful day.

Once there was a little boy named Sam. One day Sam went to school and heard a really weird lecture. The teacher was speaking so fast that Sam could not understand anything. But then all of a sudden he saw something strange. He saw a little bird flying through the window and it was flying so fast! It passed over the teacher and Sam was so surprised. 
The teacher said "That was a very weird bird, but it passed quickly so we can continue with our lecture". The kids all laughed and Sam started to feel better. He stopped worrying so much and focused on the lecture. Soon he started understanding the lesson and he was very happy because he had figured it out.
Sam felt very proud of himself and he couldn't wait to tell his mom about the weird passage of the bird!

One day, Charlie went to the park. He felt something funny on his nose. He put his finger up to it and felt an itch. He wanted to scratch it but he didn't want to ruin his perfect day. He kept playing. Suddenly, he smelled something delicious. He was so hungry! He looked around and saw a pretzel cart. He went over and asked for a pretzel. It smelt perfect. Charlie took a big bite of the pretzel and it tasted so yummy. His tummy was so happy! The itch had gone away. Charlie ate the rest of the pretzel and it was the perfect snack. He was so glad that he didn’t have to deal with anymore itches!

Once upon a time there was a clumsy little mouse. He was always getting into trouble and making mistakes because he was so clumsy. But he was happy and cheerful. 
One day he was off running around looking for something fun to do, when he stumbled across a bag of pastels. In his curiosity, he decided to open the bag curious to see what was inside. 
But when he opened the bag, he heard a voice. It was a demanding voice that was very strong and it said "you must keep this bag of pastels safe". The mouse was scared and confused, but he knew that he had to obey the voice's demand. 
He picked up the bag and he decided to hide it in a secret spot. He looked carefully and found an old tree stump, so he put it behind there and he covered it with stones and grass so it was hidden from view. 
 
The mouse breathed a sigh of relief and he hopped away with a smile on his face. He had done what the voice demanded and his secret was safe. 
The End

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Anna. She did not know what to do one day so she decided to go on an adventure. She went to stay in a fake house. It was made of cardboard and it was much too small for her to fit in.
Anna began to explore the fake house until she came to the door. But the door was stuck, so Anna started to pull and push to try and open it. Suddenly it swung open and Anna saw something she did not know existed - a secret garden! In the garden there were lots of flowers, buzzing bees and colourful butterflies. Anna was amazed at all of these things she did not know about before.
She stayed in the secret garden for a while, until the sun started to go down. Anna got a bit scared, so she ran back to her house and closed the door behind her.
She had had a wonderful adventure and she now knew about the secret garden. She was happy to have found it and now she knew how to get back there whenever she wanted to stay.

One day, a near the sea, a boy found an oyster. He was so excited, he immediately took it home.
The boy's mom had a reliable plan to open the oyster. She put the oyster on a flat surface and used a special tool to spin it open.
The boy watched intently as the spinning made the oyster's shell break apart. When the oyster was finally opened, the little boy saw something shining inside!
He was so surprised and amazed - it was a beautiful pearl! The boy had never seen anything so sparkly and special before. He knew it was now his most prized possession. 
The boy thanked his mom for making his discovery possible. He cherished the pearl and was so happy with his new treasure.

Once upon a time there was a little girl who was enthusiastic. Everywhere she went she showed her excitement. She wanted to learn more and more each day.
One day she heard her parents talking about a wise old man who was said to have amazing wisdom. The little girl wanted to meet him, so she asked her parents if she could. They said yes, and the little girl set off happily.
When she arrived, the old man was busy, but the little girl was so enthusiastic that he stopped to talk to her. She asked him many questions and the old man answered them with his kind smiles and wise advice.
The little girl was so delighted that she took a moment to close her eyes and mind the conversation. She thought about all the wisdom she'd learnt, and smiled inside with joy. She had learned so much from the old man and couldn't wait to tell her parents all about it when she got home.

Once upon a time there was a cupboard. It was big and brown and felt very happy. Then one day, something changed. Something bad happened to the cupboard. It became spoiled. 
The cupboard felt very sad. Nothing wanted to be near it because it looked so different now. Then one day, a little girl called Lily saw it. She smiled and said that she could make it better. 
Lily took out a brush and some paint. She painted the cupboard all the colours of the rainbow. She added some sparkles and made the cupboard look beautiful again. And when she finished, she opened the cupboard to find it full of special presents. 
The cupboard was so happy! It hugged Lily and thanked her for making it feel special. The cupboard and Lily became very good friends. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She had a big, messy notebook. Every morning, her mom and dad would give her a big hug and ring the bell to wake her up.
The little girl loved ringing the bell. She would run to the bell and ring it as loud as she could. Every time she heard the bell ringing it made her happy.
One day, she wanted to ring the bell herself, so she got her messy notebook and wrote the word "ring". Then she took it to the bell and showed it to her mom and dad. They were so proud of her, and they helped her ring the bell again.
The little girl was so happy that she could make the bell ring. From then on, every morning she would write the word "ring" in her messy notebook, and she would always ring the bell. 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She was three years old, and her name was Mia. Mia was at home with her mom, and it was time for the mailman to come by. Mia was very scared when the mailman knocked on the door. 
Her mom opened the door, and the mailman handed her a big stack of mail. Mia's mom thanked him, and the mailman said goodbye.
Mia's mom put the mail on the kitchen table, and Mia wanted to go look at it. She slowly crept up to the table and grabbed a letter that had her name printed on it. She was so excited!
Mia's mom saw her daughter sitting at the table, and asked her if she wanted to help her deliver the mail. Mia shouted "Yes!" and grabbed the mail. She went to each mail box in the neighborhood and put the mail inside.
Mia was so proud of herself. She had done an important job, and she couldn't stop smiling. She felt brave and strong.
The end.

Once upon a time there was a nice boy named Jacob. Jacob loved to imagine all sorts of things. He imagined visiting the moon, playing with elephants and even having his own pet dragon! Every day he would tell his mom all the amazing things he had imagined. 
One day, Jacob's mom decided to surprise him. She told him that they were going on a visit! He was so excited! He couldn't wait to see where they were going. 
Jacob put on his nice shoes and watched as his mom drove the car to an amazing place! He was so excited as he stepped out of the car, for he could see a big lake with a beautiful beach! Jacob ran to the sand, dug in the sand and splashed in the lake. He played in the lake for hours and enjoyed every minute of it!
When the sun began to set, Jacob's mom said that it was time for them to go home. Jacob was sad to leave, but promised to himself that he would come back soon with his mom and imagine even more dreamy adventures.

Dee-Dee was very excited today. She had a big surprise cooking in the kitchen! She asked her mom what it was, but her mom just said it was a surprise. Dee-Dee couldn't wait to find out what it was!
Finally, Dee-Dee's mom said it was time to try the surprise. Dee-Dee saw a big plate of delicious cookies on the table! She clapped her hands and excitedly reached for one. Dee-Dee loved the cookies! They were so yummy!
Dee-Dee thanked her mom for the surprise. She had fun cooking with her mom and enjoying the delicious cookies!

Once upon a time there was a big dragon. It had a huge head and fire would come out of its mouth. The dragon lived high up in a mountain and it always looked very angry.
One day, a brave knight rode up to the mountain and stood in front of the dragon. He was ready to fight the dragon, but he did not have to. The dragon said "it is time for me to release the fire inside me".
The knight was surprised. He wanted to know how the dragon was going to do that. The dragon said "Just wait a little bit." So the brave knight waited.
And then, a huge burst of light surrounded the dragon. It was like its head opened up, and all the fire inside was released out into the world. The dragon smiled and it looked very happy.
The brave knight was amazed. He said "you look so different". The dragon said "Yes, now I am free". Then the knight and the dragon became good friends.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sarah. She loved enjoying the outdoors, especially on stormy days. Every time the sky became grey, Sarah would run outside and jump in puddles and watch the lightning.
One stormy day, Sarah went to the park with her mom. She was so excited to be outside. They enjoyed throwing a ball around, but then the rain started to come down harder. Mom said it was time to go home.
When Sarah and her mom got home, Mom said it was time for Sarah to shut her eyes and take a nap. She was so tired from playing in the rain! Sarah soon drifted off to sleep, dreaming of lightning and yummy snacks.
When Sarah woke up, her mom had made her a special treat. Sarah was thrilled to see her plate of her favorite food - scrambled eggs with toast. She quickly ate every bite and smiled with joy.
From then on, Sarah loved storms and the sound of the rain on her window. She loved going outside to play in the rain and watching the lightning. Sarah knew that no matter what, she would always be safe and cozy in bed with her mom.

Once upon a time there was a little rabbit called Ted. Ted was always very careful whenever he went out for his adventure. One day, as he was hopping around, he saw a very yummy looking carrot. He said to himself "I must have a bite of this delicious carrot". So Ted hopped closer and took a big bite!
It was the yummiest carrot Ted had ever tasted, but something was different about this carrot. As it slipped down his throat, he felt a strange wetness. So Ted hopped over to a nearby pond to take a look. The pond was full of tasty carrot juices!
He quickly hopped back to the carrot patch and found that all the carrots had soaked up all the water from the pond! "Wow!" Ted said, "I'm so lucky I got here quick. I need to be careful next time!"
Ted hopped away with a full tummy, happy to have had such a great adventure. All thanks to that one special carrot!

Once upon a time, there lived a girl named Janet. She was very excited to paint her room. She needed permission from her mum before she could start, so she went to her mum to ask. "Mum, will you please permit me to paint my room?" Janet asked. Her mother smiled and said, "Yes, of course, you can do it."
Janet felt very grateful, so she smiled and thanked her mum. She rushed off to grab her paintbrush and paint. Janet was so excited to start painting her walls that she couldn't wait! 
When she finished, she looked around and was very pleased with her work. She smiled, happy that she had permission to paint. She was grateful for her mother for letting her. 
The end.

Once there was a little girl named Ann who loved to learn. She asked her mom to teach her something new every day. Ann's mom was happy to teach her. Today, Ann's mom taught her about hurricanes. She told Ann about how powerful hurricanes were and how they moved around the world.
Ann was fascinated by hurricanes and asked her mom to teach her all about them. Ann's mom taught her how hurricanes are colorful and that they come from the ocean. The wind and the rain makes them so powerful and fast. Ann was so excited to learn about something new.
Then, her mom asked her if she knew the best way to be safe from hurricanes. Ann thought for a bit and then answered, "I should prepare for hurricanes by staying safe indoors?" Her mom smiled and said, "That's exactly right!" Together, Ann and her mom put together a colorful safety kit to prepare for a hurricane.
Ann and her mom felt proud. Ann had learned a new thing, and was ready to be safe in case of a hurricane.

Once upon a time there lived a girl who was very independent. Her name was Mary. Mary liked to explore the world and take risks. One day, Mary decided to take a step into the open.
Mary stepped softly with her little feet and looked around. Everything was so exciting to her! She could feel the freedom of the open and it made her heart race with joy.
Mary took many steps forward, discovering new places and things. She explored the world with her own two feet. When she was tired, she would take a break and rest.
Mary kept stepping and eventually, she experienced a moment of independence. She felt proud and content with all of her accomplishments. From then on, Mary continued to step into the open, learning and growing along the way.

Once upon a time there was a small boy who loved to relax. Every day after school he would lie down in his bed and close his eyes. He would think of all the fun things he had done and the people he had met that day.
One day while he was lying in his bed, he found a small pencil. He picked it up and looked at it. He liked the way it felt in his hand and wanted to use it.
He sat up in his bed and looked around. He had a piece of paper and he wished to draw something. He closed his eyes and started to relax. Soon, he was thinking of a house or a tree or something else he wanted to draw.
He opened his eyes, picked up the pencil and started to draw. He filled the paper with small, beautiful pictures that made him smile. Every time he looked at them, he relaxed even more.
The pencil and the pictures helped the small boy relax and have fun. They were his special friends who made him feel so happy. From then on, he always kept the pencil nearby so that he could continue to draw whenever he felt like he needed to relax.

Timmy was walking in the park one day. He saw a shiny gold piece next to the bench. He smiled and picked it up. It looked so easy to carry! He was happy to have found it. 
Timmy walked around the park showing off his shiny gold piece to everyone he saw. But as he walked and showed it off, the shiny gold piece started to disappear. He became very sad, and he frowned. 
Suddenly, a nice old man standing next to him saw his frown and asked him why he was sad. Timmy told him about the shiny gold piece and how it had started to disappear. 
The man smiled and said, "That is an easy thing to fix." He then showed Timmy a special trick he had. He took out his handkerchief and rubbed the gold piece back and forth until it glittered again. 
Timmy was so happy, he was grinning from one ear to the other! He thanked the man for being so kind, and ran off to show off his shiny gold piece to all of his friends.

Once upon a time there was a small hill near a family house. A family of four lived near the hill. Mom and Dad had a daughter and a son. One day, they all went outside and decided to teach their children to climb the small hill.
First, Mom and Dad said to their son and daughter, “Look at the small hill. It’s very easy to climb. Let’s try it!”
The kids were excited to try it. Mom and Dad showed them how to put their feet on the hill and walk up. They also taught them how to be careful and use their hands and feet to help them stay balanced.
The two kids tried hard, but they were just too small. They needed more practice. So they kept trying. Little by little they learned how to climb the hill. Finally, they both made it to the top.
They were so proud! They hugged their parents and celebrated their success. From that day on, they loved climbing the small hill and showed everyone what they had learned.

Once there lived a poor family with two children, Jane and John. Jane was three years old. Every day, Jane's family would gather around the kitchen table and laugh at the jokes that Jane told. 
One day, Jane noticed that her brother John was leaning against the wall. She asked him, "Why are you leaning?" John smiled and said that he was resting. 
Jane thought that was a funny joke and started to laugh. She went over to her mother and said, "Mama, John is leaning on the wall like a lazy cat!"
Her mother smiled and said, "That is a funny joke, Jane. But let's not make poor John feel bad. We should both help him stand up." 
So, Jane and her mother both held John's hands, helping him to stand up. Then, they all started to leave the kitchen and Jane was laughing the whole way. 
From then on, Jane and her family shared a lot of funny jokes, but they always were kind to each other.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved to explore the nature. She wore her favorite red boots and ventured out. As the little girl stepped into the nature, she noticed how thick the grass felt beneath her feet.
The little girl stepped deeper into the tall grass, feeling the warmth of the sun's rays on her skin. She was in awe of the beauty of her surroundings. The sun shone high in the sky, and the air was filled with the sweet scent of wildflowers.
The little girl stepped closer to a beautiful bush, the leaves the most vibrant green and the petals of the wildflowers a beautiful sight. She reached out her small hand, her fingertips touching the delicate petals.
The little girl stepped ever closer to the nature, feeling the thick ground beneath her feet. Everywhere she looked, she could see beauty. She could hear the birds singing around her and the gentle breeze blowing around her.
The little girl stepped onto the path home and said goodbye to the beautiful world of nature. But she knew that she would be back again soon to explore the beauty of the nature.

Once there was a family who liked to go on tours. They were a very rich family, so they could afford to go wherever they wanted. One day, the parents told their children about a special tour they had planned for the weekend.
The children were very excited, but they started to complain because they wanted to bring their toys along with them. The parents said no, and the children kept whining and moaning about it.
The family finally went on their tour and had a great time. They visited many places, ate delicious food, and made lots of new friends.
The children finally stopped complaining and enjoyed the tour. They learned that complaining only spoiled the fun of the tour, and they never made the same mistake again.

One day, there were two little kids that wanted to go on an adventure. So, they slowly pulled their big red luggage and started walking down the road. Suddenly, they noticed a funny number written on a wall. It said '3'.
The kids thought that was funny and decided to find out what was so special about the number. So, they kept counting and counting, until they reached the number 3 again. When they did, a big surprise came out of the luggage! It was a giant clown with balloons!
The kids were so excited. The clown even picked up the big red luggage! He slowly carried it away, laughing the whole time. With the clown gone, all that was left was the special number 3. That will always remind the kids of their wonderful adventure!

Once upon a time, there was a hairy monster who lived in the sand. He was very lonely, so he decided to rise up out of the ground to look for a friend.
The monster rose up higher and higher out of the sand, until he stopped at the top of a hill. From there, he could see the whole beach. He saw a child playing in the sand and it made him very happy.
The monster waved his hands and he smiled his monster smile, but the child was too scared to come near him. He kept running away but he kept looking back at the monster.
Finally, the monster was so happy, he flew up and up in the sky. With a big smile on his face, he waved goodbye to the child and flew away to find new friends.

Once there was a little yellow cat. He loved to play and run around. His favourite game was to speed around the house. Every day he would run faster and faster.
One day, the little cat was feeling really brave. He decided to take an exam and see if he was fast enough. He was so excited he couldn’t wait.
On the day of the exam, the little cat sped around the room faster than ever before. He was so fast he made all the other cats jealous. But he didn’t care, he was proud of himself.
When the exam was over the little yellow cat had done the best he could. He knew he was the fastest cat in the world.

Daniel liked to play in his backyard. One sunny day, he noticed a big tree that gave a lot of shade. He thought it looked like a great place to play so he ran over to it.
When he got to the tree, he saw a rabbit under there. The rabbit was hopping around. Daniel was so excited. He wanted to talk to the rabbit, so he said, "Hello, Rabbit!"
The rabbit stopped hopping and looked at Daniel. Daniel started to discuss why the tree was so nice and cool. The rabbit agreed, saying it was a kind shade for them to play in. They talked and talked about how much fun it would be to play together. 
Daniel and the rabbit became great friends. Every time the sun was out, they would meet under the tree shade and discuss their day. They even shared snacks together. 
Daniel was so happy to have such a kind friend. He thanked the rabbit every day for being so friendly.

Once upon a time, a little girl was walking through the woods. She was carrying an axe and looking for something to do. Suddenly, she saw a store ahead. When she got closer, she noticed that it was a fake store! The little girl was so excited. 
She started to explore the store, looking at all of the fake things. There were fake bags and fake shoes and even a fake axe! She picked up the fake axe and started to play with it. She chopped some fake trees in the store and pretended to be like a real lumberjack. 
Suddenly, she heard a noise coming from outside. It was the storekeeper! He came in and saw what the little girl was doing with the axe. He shouted at her and said, "Put down that axe!" 
The little girl quickly put down the fake axe and ran away. She never went back to the fake store again!

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sue. Sue was three years old. She loved to explore the world around her.
One day Sue went for a walk in the forest. She looked under rocks and around trees to see what she could find. Suddenly, Sue realized there was a big, ugly trunk at the bottom of a tree.
Sue smiled and opened the trunk. Inside she found a beautiful doll. She was so excited that she jumped for joy. She decided to take the doll home with her.
Sue hugged the doll and took it back home. She realized that the ugly trunk had been full of surprises!

Once there was a circle. It travelled around and around but it couldn't find its way out. Until one day, a clear voice said, "reverse!"
The circle started to go backwards. It went all the way back to the start, right where it had begun. With a second clear voice, it said, "go forward!"
And the circle started to go around and around, this time going forward. Finally, it found the way out of the maze and was so very happy. It was free!
The circle thanked the clear voices and continued on its way. It went around and around, making a path of joy wherever it went.

Once upon a time there was a girl named Mary. Mary liked to play in the park. She liked to swing and slide. One day she was at the park and she saw something brown. Mary believed it was a puppy. She walked over to it to take a closer look. But when she got closer she saw it was not a puppy but an old brown bear! Mary was so surprised and scared. She ran all the way home! She never expected to see a bear in the park. Mary will always remember what she saw in the park that day.

Once upon a time, there was an ugly flute. No one wanted to play it. One day, a little girl heard the sad flute and decided to act. She took the flute and blew softly into it. Instead of a sad sound, the flute made a bright, beautiful noise. Everyone was so surprised! 
The little girl was so happy, she acted again and again. Everyone began to love the sound of the flute and came from far and wide to listen. It was the most beautiful music they had ever heard.
The little girl was so proud of what she had done. She had turned the ugly flute into a beautiful song. Everyone was happy and they lived happily ever after!

Once upon a time there were two friends called Sarah and Jane. They wanted to celebrate because it was Sarah's birthday.
Sarah and Jane wanted to have a tea party. They rushed to Sarah's house and got her special birthday tea set. Sarah's tea set had thin, pink cups and saucers.
They put the cups and saucers on the table and began to fill them with tea. Sarah made hers sweet, and Jane made hers with milk. They laughed and chatted as they enjoyed the tea.
When it was time to leave Sarah said: "Let's always celebrate my birthday together!"
Then Jane and Sarah hugged and ran off. They still have tea parties every year when Sarah's birthday comes around.

One day, the mommy and the baby went for a walk. They found a big door and looked at it. It said "Exit". They wanted to test to see if it opened. Mommy pushed it, and it opened! She was surprised. They went inside and saw a lot of colors and toys. The baby was so excited that he laughed and bounced around.
Soon, the baby started to get tired. Mommy knew he was tired and was ready to go home. She said, "Let's go to the exit and test if it opens". The baby was happy and followed mommy. When they reached the exit, they tested it. It opened! They both hugged and laughed. They left and went home together. 
The day was fun, but the baby was so tired. He went right to bed. Mommy gave him a big kiss and said, "Good night".

Once upon a time, there was a table that was very tall. A little kid wanted to get on the table, but it was very hard. He tried pushing, but it was too tight.
The kid had a great idea. He got some paper and a pencil and started to draw a map. Then he grabbed some tape and marked one side of the table for the beginning, and the other side for the finish.
The kid ran around the table, to record his fast time. He did it again and again, trying to beat his fast time.
One day, he did it! His time was the fastest he had ever made. He was so proud that he celebrated by jumping on the table and dancing around.
Now, the little kid has a record that he knows no one else can beat.

Once there was a bulb that was pale. It was very lonely. One day, it heard a noise coming from outside. It was a loud sound that made the bulb very scared. 
The bulb looked outside and saw two little children running around in the garden. 
The bulb thought that it would be nice to make friends with them. So, it separated itself from the ground and rolled towards the children. 
The children were so excited to see the bulb! They were so happy that they started playing together.
The pale bulb was now part of a happy family. They would play together in the garden every day.

Once upon a time there was a little girl who loved animals. Every day she would take care of her animals, feeding them and playing with them. One day as she was feeding them, a strange gate appeared in the middle of the field. It was unusual, like nothing she had ever seen before. 
The little girl was curious and walked up to the mysterious gate. She grabbed the latch and opened it. To her surprise, inside the gate there were lots of new animals that she hadn't seen before. 
The little girl was so excited. She started to feed all of the new animals and was amazed at how gentle and friendly they were. She spent the rest of the day playing with and feeding the animals.
When she was done, the little girl closed the gate and waved goodbye to her new animal friends. She was glad she had found the unusual gate and even happier that she had made some new animal friends.

Cora was a very curious little girl. Every day she would explore the garden in her neighborhood. One day, she wandered too far and saw something very interesting. It was a colorful lizard! She had never seen a lizard before.
Cora saw the lizard wearing many things. It had a hat that looked like a flower, a necklace made of shiny stones, and a bracelet made of colorful beads. She was so amazed by the sight that she couldn't believe her eyes.
The lizard looked at Cora and gave her a friendly nod. It was as if he wanted to say hello. Cora smiled and waved back at the lizard. They soon became friends.
Every day Cora would play with her colorful, new friend in the garden. The lizard wore different things each day, so Cora always had something new to discover. It was the best day of Cora's life.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Jess. Jess was three years old and very excited! She had just been playing in the garden and was now looking for something else to do.
Suddenly, she realized that she hadn't been inside the house for a while. With butterflies in her tummy, Jess slowly opened the front door and crept inside.
Jess looked all around. She noticed the beautiful curtains and way up high, a lock! Jess went to have a closer look. There was something special about this lock and Jess knew she had to find out what it was for. 
Jess watched carefully as her dad took a key out of his pocket and unlocked the door. A whoosh of cool air blew past Jess. It was so nice and calm inside. Then Jess realized what the lock was for - it was to keep her safe while she slept! 
Jess smiled and gave the lock a hug. She knew that she would always be safe and secure if she had a lock like this.

Once, there was a pink wheel that belonged to a little girl. She was so excited to get the wheel, so she quickly put it on and started to ride down the street. As she was riding and having lots of fun, she got very tired. She yawned and her eyes got heavy and all she wanted to do was sleep.
So, the little girl stopped riding and got off the pink wheel. She decided to take a nap right next to the wheel, so she could take it with her when she woke up. She was snoring happily when suddenly the wind started blowing harder. The pink wheel started to move away and the little girl woke up in a shock.
She quickly got up and started running to get her wheel. But before she could reach it, the pink wheel stopped near a small pond. She was so lucky to find her wheel, so she picked it up and put it on again. She was so happy to have her wheel that she yawned with a big smile on her face.

Once upon a time, there was a bad mouse. The mouse was very wicked and mean. He liked to sneak around and cause trouble for everyone.
One day, the mouse was making a mess. He knocked over a pot and it broke into many pieces. The people were very angry and quickly chased after the mouse. 
At the same time, someone was bringing a very nice present. It was neatly wrapped in colorful paper and a big red bow. The mouse saw the present and had an idea.
He quickly ran over and grabbed the present. He wrapped himself up in it and shouted happily. He thought no one would find him now. 
But the people were clever. They soon worked out what had happened and came to catch the mouse. The mouse tried to run away, but he was stuck in the present! He was soon caught by the people and taken away. 
And the mouse never caused any more trouble again!

Once upon a time, there were two best friends, Tom and Tim. Tom wanted to invite Tim to a meeting, but Tom's mom said no. She didn't permit the boys to go to the meeting. Tim was very sad. 
He got an idea. He asked his mom if he could go to the meeting, but this time with Tom's mom too. His mom thought it was a great idea and she agreed. 
Tom and Tim were so excited to go to the meeting. But when they arrived, it was terrible! The meeting was so boring that they couldn't even stay. They decided to leave and play together outside instead. They had so much fun playing in the sunshine and the fresh air. 
Tom and Tim were very happy that they didn't have to stay at the terrible meeting!

Once upon a time there was a squirrel who lived in the woods. He was fit and strong and he loved the forest. He was often seen scurrying around the trees and frolicking in the meadow.
One day, he saw something he had never seen before - a school. He watched the children playing and enjoying themselves and wondered what was going on.
The next day, the squirrel found his way inside and saw the children learning. He was curious, so he decided to stay and learn too. The children taught him all kinds of things, like how to read and write, and he was getting smarter every day.
The squirrel soon became the best student in the entire school. He amazed all the other children with his knowledge and they were very proud.
The squirrel had become fit and clever. He had learned all kinds of new things and he had made a lot of friends. He was so happy that he decided to stay in the school and learn even more.

One day, a large cat was walking outside. The cat was looking for something to catch. Suddenly, the cat noticed a watch. It was shiny and sparkled in the sun. The cat wanted to catch the watch so it could have something special.
The cat ran as fast as it could and managed to catch the watch. The cat was so proud of itself. It decided to take it home as a surprise for its owner.
The cat showed its owner the large watch. The owner was so happy that the cat had managed to catch it. They gave the cat lots of cuddles and praised it for being so clever.
The cat and its owner enjoyed playing with the watch together. And after that, the cat was always proud when it was out looking for things to catch.

Once upon a time there was a boy who was brave and strong. He was always looking for ways to help people and have fun. 
One day he saw a pole in the field. He dared himself to climb the pole. He grabbed onto it, but it was very tall and he couldn't reach the top. 
He looked around and saw a ladder. It was very dull and made of wood, but it was tall enough to help him reach the top of the pole. He grabbed onto it and bravely started to climb. 
Slowly and steadily, he went higher and higher. He reached the top of the pole and smiled with pride. He had done it! He felt so happy and brave. 
He had taken a daring challenge, and he had succeeded. He was a hero!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She wanted to study and learn lots of things. So every day, she would get her stuff, like her books and pencils, and sit down to study.
Sometimes it would hurt her. The numbers and letters looked hard. But she kept studying and eventually she got better and better.
After awhile, she had learned lots of stuff. She was so proud of herself. Then, she started to teach her friends what she had learned. They all liked learning from her.
The end.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Emma. She had a very reliable friend. His name was Mark. Mark and Emma wanted to play together all the time.
Every day they would do all sorts of fun things. But their favourite thing to do was to play sock game. They both loved this game very much.
Mark and Emma would take turns in hiding the sock. When it was Emma’s turn, she would always find the most creative places to hide it. Then it was Mark’s turn. He had to use his problem solving skills to try to find it.
No matter how hard it was, Mark always found the sock. He was so reliable and Emma loved that about him. They would smile and hug each other when he found it.
Mark and Emma continued to play the sock game every day. And they will continue to love and play together forever.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue was very patient, which meant she was very good at waiting. One day, Sue asked her mom for something to do. Her mom said that she could borrow something special from the attic. Sue was so excited! 
She walked up the stairs and opened the door to the attic. It was so dark, but Sue was brave and she kept going. She looked around until she found something that caught her eye. It was an old box, and inside was a sparkly surprise!
She was so happy that she could borrow the sparkly surprise to play with. She ran downstairs to show her mom the sparkly surprise. Sue was so grateful that she was able to borrow the surprise from the attic! 
From then on, Sue was very patient when she wanted something and her mom always said that she could borrow it. Sue never forgot how special it was to borrow from the attic.

Once upon a time there was a beautiful girl. She had twinkling eyes and long, dark hair. 
Every morning the girl would put on her clothes. She especially loved to dress in pretty dresses and skirts. All of her friends would often compliment her outfits, telling her how lovely she looked. 
One morning, the girl put on a dress that was very special. It was bright and sparkly and made her feel like a princess. Her eyes shone with joy as she looked at herself in the mirror. 
When she went outside all of the birds sang to her and the butterflies flew around her. Even the sun seemed to be shining brighter than ever. Everyone around her said, "What a pretty dress!"
The girl twirled, danced and laughed all day. This was a special day that she would never forget. From that day on, the girl made sure to dress in her most beautiful and special clothes every day.

Once upon a time there was a fit elephant. Every day he went for a long walk in the forest. He looked around and saw all the animals who were wild and free. The elephant loved feeling the sunshine on his back as he ambled around the woods.
One afternoon, the elephant felt exhausted. He stopped and lay down beneath a big tree. He was so tired, he decided to have a nap. He curled up and went to sleep.
The elephant slept for a long time and dreamed of the days ahead. When he woke up, he felt refreshed and ready to continue his journey. He stood up, stretched his trunk, and said goodbye to the forest. Then, he set off on his way again.
The fit elephant happily returned home after his nap. He had had a wonderful day exploring the forest and resting under a tree. He knew he was ready for more adventures ahead.

Once there was a baby who loved to sleep. Every night, the baby would crawl into bed, close her eyes and go to sleep. But one night, the baby woke up feeling scared. Something smelly was in the room! 
The baby listened carefully and heard a noise coming from the corner. Suddenly, the baby saw something turn and she screamed! It was a mouse!
The baby quickly hid under the covers and the little mouse ran away. After that, the baby felt safe and went back to sleep. And the next morning, the baby woke up feeling happy and not so scared of the smelly mouse!

John saw a big, tall tent in the yard. He felt so excited and he wanted to explore it. So he quickly ran to it and went inside. But when he opened the door, he saw two cats. They were hissing and looked very worried. John didn't want to separate the cats, so he decided to leave the tent. He slowly walked away and went back to his house. He was so sad he couldn't explore the tent. He thought the cats looked so sad and worried. He wished he could help them stay together.

Once upon a time, there was a gifted little girl named Lucy. Every day, she would march around her house with a big smile on her face. She loved to explore and learn new things. 
One day when Lucy was marching around the house, she found an ashtray under the kitchen table. She was curious about it and stopped to take a closer look. She picked it up and felt how heavy it was. She wondered what the ashtray was made for. 
Lucy carried the ashtray to her mom, who explained that it was a special container used for holding cigarettes. Lucy listened carefully and nodded her head. She thanked her mom, then marched around the house with her new knowledge. 
From that day on, Lucy became even more gifted. She was so curious and eager to explore her world. Every day she marched around her house, learning and discovering new things in her own special way.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She was three years old and her name was Sally. One day, Sally saw a lady at the park. She had lots of toys and she asked Sally if she wanted to play with them. 
At first, Sally said 'Yes, please!' but suddenly she changed her mind. She thought the toys looked fake and she didn't want to play with them. So she refused the lady. 
The lady was very sad and asked Sally why she said 'No'. Sally said she didn't like fake toys.
The lady smiled and said that she understood. She gave Sally a big hug and said 'Thankyou for being honest and refusing the toys'. Then she said goodbye and left the park. 
Sally was happy that she stayed true to herself and refused the fake toys. She went home and played with her real toys instead. The end!

One day, a stubborn little girl and her mom went to the beach. The girl wanted to buy a reef. Her mom said, "No, we can't buy a reef." But the little girl was very stubborn and didn't listen. She kept asking her mom to buy a reef. Finally, her mom agreed to help her buy a reef. They walked to the store together. The mom bought a big, beautiful reef for the girl. The girl was so happy. She thanked her mom and ran back to the beach. When she got there, she waved the reef in the air and shouted for joy. She had her new reef and couldn't be happier.

Once upon a time there was a chubby mouse. He wanted to make a special sauce for his friends. He went all around the house looking for things to put into the sauce. He found some carrots, a bit of butter and some pepper. But he still needed something extra.
He decided to go outside to find what he was looking for. After a while he saw a big juicy tomato. That was it! He quickly grabbed it and ran back home.
He began to cut up everything and mix it together to make his special sauce. When he was finished he tasted it and it was delicious! He was so happy he had completed his sauce.
He took the sauce to his friends and they all loved it. They had lots of fun eating it together.
The chubby mouse was very proud of his special sauce. He wished he could make it again, but he knew it had been really lucky to find that special tomato.

One day, a boy was playing in a pond. He was splashing with his hands and feet, having a wonderful time. Suddenly, he saw an interesting something out of the corner of his eye. He looked closer, and found that it was a piece of lumber! He was so excited, because he had never seen something like that before. He reached out his hand and grabbed it. He splashed it around in the pond, making big splashes and making tons of noise. He was having the best time ever! After a while, he decided it was time to put the lumber back in the pond and try something else. He said goodbye to the piece of lumber and went on to play other exciting games.

Once upon a time, there was a famous pistol. It was big and shiny, and all the other pistols in the world were jealous. One day, a nice man called Tom saw the pistol and thought, "I need to wrap this pistol up so it is kept safe." So Tom took some nice, sparkly paper and he wrapped the pistol all up. He tied it with a big, pretty bow and put it under a tree. 
When Tom opened the box to show the pistol, everyone was astonished. It was so beautiful! People clapped and cheered for the famous pistol and wanted to take a look. Tom smiled and was very proud of the pistol. 
The pistol was so happy to be looked after and wrapped so nicely. From that day on, the famous pistol lived happily ever after.

Ben was very excited. Today he was going to the supermarket with his Mum. He liked to go shopping with her. It was very popular.
As they walked in, he saw something exciting. There was a shelf full of milk. It was fat. He liked fat milk. It was white.
Mum asked Ben to help pick the milk for their breakfast. He was happy to help. He picked up one big carton and put it in their shopping trolley. He was so happy that he dropped the carton. It spilt on the floor and was all over. 
Ben and Mum cleaned up the spilled milk.  He was sad. He felt badly that he had dropped the milk. It was a big mess.
Mum said not to worry. She explained that it was a common mistake. Everyone drops things sometimes - even Mum.
After shopping, they went home. They made some yummy breakfast with the milk. It was very tasty. Ben knew that sometimes things don't always go as planned, but it can still be a fun day.

Once there was a little boy named Tim. He liked to play outside every day with his friends. One day, he saw a flag blowing in the wind. He went to pick it up and could feel that it was really wet. He wondered what had happened and asked his friend, "What's wrong with the flag?"
His friend said, "It was raining yesterday and the flag soaked up all the water. So it's really wet now." Tim thought this was really cool and ran off to find his parents. He asked, "Can I have a flag too?"
His parents said, "Yes, but only if you promise to take care of it and keep it dry." Tim did just that and was so helpful to keep the flag clean and dry. He was very proud of his flag and looked after it every day. He flew it high and was so proud of it. 
The end.

A nosy pink mouse lived near a kitchen. She loved to watch the humans cook. One day she decided that it was time for her to try cooking something.
The mouse went to the cupboards and grabbed some flour. She put it in a big bowl and mixed it together with a spoon. Then she added some water to make it sticky.
Next she cut some butter into tiny pieces and put it in the bowl. She mixed it all together and added some sugar to make it sweet. Once it was all mixed, the mouse put it in a pan and waited for it to cook.
While it was cooking, the mouse smelled something delicious. She knew it was done when it turned a golden brown color. She was so excited about her first creation! She carried it carefully to the table and tried it. It was delicious - the perfect treat for a nosy pink mouse!

Once upon a time, there was a huge nail. It was so big that it almost looked like a mountain. Every day, the nail was in the same place and never moved.
One night, when all the birds were asleep, the huge nail suddenly vanished! It was gone. No one knew where it went. 
All the animals searched and searched for the huge nail. They looked everywhere, but they couldn’t find it. 
One day, a little bird flew over a tall tree and saw something shiny in a hole. As it got closer, it saw the huge nail! The animals were so happy to find the huge nail, and they never forgot that it could vanish.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mary. Mary was three years old and she loved exploring nature. One day, she went outside to explore her backyard. What she saw was the most beautiful sight! There was a field of pale grass that seemed to go on forever. When she saw it, she was filled with happiness, and she ran out to explore.
As she ran, she felt the soft blades of grass between her toes. She laughed and skipped and twirled through the grass, feeling so much joy. Time passed quickly, and before she knew it, the sun was setting. Mary sighed and said goodbye to the grass, not wanting to leave.
The days went by, but Mary could still feel the grass tickling her toes. She missed the soft feeling and the pale color. She wanted to go back to the field of grass, and feel the same joy again.
So, every night, Mary wished for just one more chance at exploring the field of grass. A chance to feel the soft blades beneath her toes and to smile at the beauty of it all. Her wish was the same every night, until finally the stars shined brightly down on the field one night. And with that, Mary hurried out to explore again.

Once upon a time there was a sweet little rabbit. He was so charming with his furry white fur and big floppy ears. His name was Benny and he loved exploring the woods.
One day Benny was hopping contentedly around the woods when he came to a small clearing. He saw something that made his eyes light up! There was a soft, green seat just for him. He hopped around it and snuggled up in the grass next to it. 
Benny decided that this was the perfect seat for him. He would come back to it every day and just sit there, listening to the birds and watching the squirrels. He felt so content sitting there and never wanted to leave. 
Benny lived there happily ever after and was always so cosy and comfortable on his charming little seat.

Once there was an old man. He liked to write. One day he took out his old knife and wrote on a piece of paper. He wrote about lots of happy things. Then he put the piece of paper and the knife back in his bag.
The old man enjoyed writing so much, he wrote everyday. He wrote about animals, the sky, and the trees. He even wrote about his friends.
One day, he wrote a special story. This story was about a little girl and her adventures. The old man liked it so much, he put it in a special place.
So this old man kept writing and writing. Every time he wrote a story, he was so happy. He was very proud of his writing.

Once upon a time, there lived two good friends - Joe and Will. One day, the two friends went to the opera. On the way, Will saw something unusual. It was a big pile of shiny things. Joe wanted to take them, so he started to pinch some of the shiny things.
Will saw this and he said, "Joe, don't pinch them! They don't belong to us!" Joe agreed and put them back. But when Joe stepped away, Will saw an even more unusual shiny thing. He couldn't help himself and he pinched it. 
Joe was surprised and he said, "Will, what are you doing? You shouldn't pinch things that don't belong to us." Will was embarrassed and put the shiny thing back. He said, "Sorry, Joe. I just wanted to see what it was." 
Joe smiled and said, "That's OK. Let's enjoy the opera now." So the two friends entered the opera and had a wonderful evening. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a popular bird. He lived in a colourful birdcage in the garden. Every day he hopped around the garden, singing beautiful songs. He was happy in his birdcage.
One day, he decided to jump out. He did a big jump and landed on the grass. He hopped around the garden and sampled different types of food. He was so excited.
But then, a big scary dog came running towards him! The bird was really scared and did a really big jump, flying back into his birdcage.
He was safe but he was a bit sad. He wanted to feel the cool grass beneath his feet and eat different types of food. But most of all, he wanted to be popular again and enjoy his birdcage.
So, he jumped out of his birdcage one more time. He hopped and flew around the garden, singing beautiful songs. Everyone loved him and he was the most popular bird in the garden!

Bella wanted to have some fun. She picked up a crayon and began to draw. Everywhere she drew, the colors were so bright and spicy. Suddenly, an idea lead her outside. 
The sun was shining in the sky and the birds were singing in the trees. Bella looked around and soon spotted a new path. She knew she had to follow it. Bella lead herself down the pathway, crayon in hand.
She found a secret garden. The flowers in the garden were the most beautiful colors - there were reds, blues, pinks, purples, and so many more. Some of them smelled so spicy! Bella decided to draw the garden on the pathway with her crayon.
