Lucy sat through the entire movie without saying a word. She acted like she was a grown up. She was so proud of herself.
At the end of the movie, Lucy and her mommy held hands and walked out of the theater. Lucy was so happy she got to act grown up for her special treat.

Once there was a man who worked in a lab. He was very busy measuring things. He had lots of warm tools: a ruler, a tape measure and a thermometer. He was measuring things both big and small. One day, he was measuring something very small and he made a discovery. It was something magical! He showed it to his friends and they were all very excited. Everyone wanted to know what it was and how he found it. He said, "I found it in the lab while measuring something small". Everyone was so happy. They had never seen anything like it before. Now, they all wanted to measure things small, to see if they could discover something magical too.

One day, a yellow bird left its nest. It flew away, chirping and flapping. The bird flew over the town, and soon it found a big puddle. The puddle was sparkling in the sun. 
The bird flew down and hovered over the puddle. It saw its reflection in the water, and it jumped in. The bird splashed around and had so much fun. It sang and jumped, and made a big splash. 
When the bird got tired, it left the puddle. It flew up high into the sky, and went home to its nest. 
The bird was tired and happy. It had a fun time in the yellow puddle.

Once upon a time there was a boy who loved to listen to the birds sing in the sky. But one day he heard something different.
It was like the sound of water pouring out of a pipe. He thought it was interesting but he couldn't figure out where it was coming from.
So he started to listen harder as he walked around his neighborhood. He looked under bushes and in the trees, but he couldn't find the sound.
Finally, he looked up in the sky and spotted it! High up in the sky was a pipe spraying water from one end. As he watched the water danced through the air.
He thought it was the most interesting thing he had ever seen. So each day he would make sure to listen for the sound of the pipe and watch the water twirl around in the sky.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who had a big owie. She felt sad and sore, so she went to the doctor to get help. The doctor was very kind and gentle. He said that he had a special place for her to go, where she would feel more comfortable and could heal. 
The little girl went to the special place and it was like a secret space. Inside, it was full of pillows, blankets and soft toys. The walls were painted with pictures of stars and she had a cozy corner with a big, comfy chair. 
The little girl stayed in this special place every day. She did puzzles and played with the toys and sometimes she snuggled up in the chair with a blanket and read books. Gradually, her owie began to heal and she felt better. 
The little girl was so thankful for the special space and she felt much better after her visit. She smiled and thanked the doctor for helping her to heal.

Once upon a time there was a girl named Lucy. She loved nature. Every day, she would take a thin stick and go walking in the forest.
One day, Lucy saw a bird flapping his wings in the sky. She wanted to fly like the bird, so she asked her mom for help. She requested for some wings.
Her mom smiled lovingly and told Lucy that only nature can give her wings. She said, “Look around you, Lucy! Nature has many gifts to offer.”
Lucy looked around. The trees were waving in the breeze, the little birds were chirping happily and the sun was shining brightly. Lucy smiled and said, “Yes, nature is a wonderful place!”
From that day on, Lucy would always take a thin stick and explore her beautiful nature. She knew that if she was patient, nature would reward her with the gift of wings one day.

One morning, Jane woke up and smiled. She saw a big, hairy dog running down the road. She watched it blink as it ran. Jane wanted to follow the dog, so she put on her shoes and ran after it. She called out to the dog, but it was too far away. She was about to give up, when she saw the hairy dog turn down a side street. Jane ran faster and followed the dog. When she got closer, she could see that the dog had stopped. Jane smiled and blinked. The dog was just waiting for her! She petted the dog and it licked her. Then, they both ran down the road together and played until it was time for Jane to go home. And they had the most wonderful adventure!

Once upon a time there was a very lucky waffle. He lived in a big happy town and everybody loved him. He was so happy, he wanted to marry. One day he saw a beautiful waffle who also wanted to marry. So they got married right away! 
The marriage made everyone in the town so excited. They all wanted to join in on the celebration! They put up decorations and made special waffles. Everybody was eating and having a good time.
The lucky waffle and his wife were so content. They both smiled and hugged each other. Everyone in the town was so happy they married.
The happy couple had a beautiful marriage. They were always together and were so in love. They were always encouraging each other. Everyone in the town was so happy for them, because they were so lucky!

Once upon a time, there was a mom and her daughter. The daughter was very sweet and pretty. She loved jam. Every morning, she would help mommy spread jam on her toast.
One day, the girl wanted to make her own jam. She asked mommy to help. Together, they cut up some apples and cooked them on the stove. After awhile, the apples smelled yummy and the jam looked nice.
The girl was so excited, she wanted to give the jam to all of her friends. She put the jam in some jars, but mommy told her that she had better stay home. The girl felt a bit sad, but she knew her mom was right.
When her friends came over, the girl gave each of them a jar of her very own jam. They all said it tasted so yummy and that the girl was very clever. The girl was so proud, she danced around the room.
The jam was always a reminder of the special time that the girl and her mom shared. From then on, the girl always remained happy.

One day, a little girl named Sarah wanted to take her puppy to the veterinarian. She promised her puppy that it was going to be fun.
The veterinarian was really nice, and he promised Sarah he would take good care of her puppy. He said it would be quick and cheap. 
The veterinarian checked if her puppy was healthy. He checked all of its eyes, ears and teeth. Everything looked good. 
The puppy was so happy everything was ok. Sarah promised to take better care of her pet and to take it to the veterinarian more often. 
The little girl and her puppy thanked the veterinarian for being so kind and for helping her puppy, and then they both left the clinic very happy.

Once there was a rabbit who was hungry. He knew he would have to find food, so he started to look. He saw a carrot and thought it looked tasty. 
He hopped over to the carrot and asked, "Can I have a bite?"
The carrot answered, "Yes, of course you can!" 
The rabbit was so happy and thanked the carrot for being so kind. He took a big bite and was very satisfied. 
But then he realised he had been too eager. He hadn't asked the carrot's owner for permission. The rabbit felt ashamed for not asking and ran away quickly. 
The end!

Once upon a time, there was a penguin. He had a big task to do, but he was feeling very nervous. He had to pass something very important to another penguin.
The nervous penguin walked slowly and carefully. He wanted to make sure he did not trip or drop the item. He was almost at the other penguin when suddenly he heard a loud noise. He was so scared that he dropped the thing and it fell all the way down to the bottom of a deep hole!
The nervous penguin was so sad and he felt like he had failed his task. He sat down and started to cry, but then he had an idea. He waddled over to the edge of the hole and stretched his neck as far as he could. He was able to reach the thing, and he carefully passed it up to the other penguin.
The other penguin was so pleased. He thanked the nervous penguin and they both hugged. Everything was alright in the end.

One day, a little girl named Lucy was walking through the park. She was very alert and looking around for any fun things to do. Suddenly, she saw a big tree with lots of sharp leaves. She was excited, so she started to jump around and touch the leaves. She had to be careful not to get any cuts!
After a while, Lucy decided to take a break and sat down on a park bench. Suddenly she heard a loud noise, like a beeping sound. Then she saw something she had never seen before—a big, green test! It wasn't moving, but Lucy could tell it was very important. 
She walked over to it and tried to touch it, but it was too high up. She was about to walk away when something caught her eye—a button! She was so alert that she noticed it right away. She reached up and pressed it.
Suddenly, the test changed colors and made a loud noise. Lucy was so excited that she started to jump around again. She didn't know what had happened, but she was glad it worked! Then she took one more sharp look around and then ran off to find new adventures.

Once there was a girl named Sarah. She was three years old and loved to dance. On a sunny day, Sarah found an object that she really wanted to play with. It was big and round and blue. Sarah held it tight and started to dance. She smiled as she jumped up and down and twirled in circles. She was dancing so fast that the object flew up into the air! Sarah caught it and continued to dance. She held it tight again and moved her arms and legs up and down. She danced around the whole house, having lots of fun. Sarah was so happy that she kept on dancing until it was time for dinner.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. Her name was Sally and she was three years old. One day, Sally was sitting in the kitchen. She saw something that made her very excited. It was a big pot of yellow spaghetti! 
Sally smiled and asked if she could have some. Her mom said yes and put some spaghetti on a plate. Sally sat down at the table and started to eat the spaghetti. It was very good. 
After she ate the spaghetti, Sally was very full. She sat down on the couch and closed her eyes. She was so happy and content. 
The End.

Molly and Jenny were best friends. One day they were playing together in the park when they saw a big cat. Molly was scared of the cat so Jenny said to her, "Don't worry Molly, I'll tell him to go away." Jenny told the cat to go away, and it did. Molly felt so happy that Jenny was so bossy with the cat.
The next day the girls were playing together again. This time they found a small white pill on the ground. Molly wanted to pick up the pill but Jenny said no. She was being bossy but she was doing it to help Molly. Jenny told Molly that the pill was not safe, and that she should not touch it. Molly was so happy that Jenny was looking out for her that she hugged her.
Molly and Jenny kept playing happily together for the rest of the day. They were having so much fun. They knew that being best friends meant that Jenny could always tell Molly when something wasn't safe. And Molly knew that Jenny would always look out for her and keep her safe.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird. He had the softest, fluffiest feathers and the cutest little beak. The bird loved to sing. Every morning, he would wake up, flutter his wings, and sing the sweetest songs.
One day, the little bird met a bigger bird. The bigger bird taught him some new songs. They sang together and flew around the sky, creating a beautiful melody. The little bird loved learning the new songs and he practiced them every day.
The little bird kept singing the new songs and he soon became the best singer in the forest. All the other birds came to listen to him and he even began teaching them the new songs. He taught them how to chirp in perfect harmony and soon, the whole forest was singing together!

Once upon a time, there was a truck. It was very high. Two little boys were playing with it. They were counting how many wheels the truck had. One, two, three, four - they counted the four big wheels! Then they moved to the back and counted the two tiny wheels. One, two! The boys were so happy. Then they started to count how many bumpers the truck had. One, two. Now they were ready to race with the truck. It was so much fun! They both shouted: "higher, higher!" until the truck was very high in the sky. It was the best day ever!

Once upon a time there was a little boy. He loved exploring and one day he decided to explore a new place. He came across a hidden path in the woods. He followed the path and soon came to a clearing where he discovered something amazing - a magical week! It glowed with a bright light. The little boy was so excited and decided to pinch it. As soon he touched the week it started to grow and suddenly became larger and larger.
The week got so big that the little boy had to take a step back. But before he knew it the week had grown so large it filled the clearing and the little boy got lost in it. He was so excited to explore. He pinch each day, as he went. He saw different things and discovered new adventures every day. 
He eventually found his way out of the hidden week and back home safe and sound. He had the most amazing adventure and never forgot it. He would pinch the week whenever he closed his eyes, so the adventure would always stay with him.

Once there was a little girl. Her name was Bella. Bella was very happy. One day, Bella was playing outside with her friends and she saw a puppy. She wanted the puppy very badly. She asked her mom if she could have the puppy as a reward, but her mom said no. Bella was very upset and started to cry.
Bella's dad heard her crying and came to get her. He asked her why she was upset, and she told him she wanted the puppy. So Dad told her if she cleaned her room and did her chores, he would get her a puppy as a reward.
Bella was so excited, she ran off to clean. She worked so hard that soon her room was all clean, and she was so proud. When Dad saw what a good job she did, he told her he was getting her the puppy she wanted so much. 
Bella was so happy she jumped up and down and started to cry tears of joy. Her Dad hugged her and told her how proud he was of her. That was the best reward ever!

Once upon a time there was a colorful plastic duck. Every day, the duck would go for a swim in the puddle. But each time it got out, it would be all slimy and covered in mud.
One day, the duck's mother saw all the mud and knew it was time to give the duck a wash. She filled up the bath and put in some bubbles. Then she put the duck in the bath water and began to scrub it with a sponge.
The duck felt scared but it also felt good to be in the warm, soapy water. Soon it began to feel squeaky clean and its yellow and orange colors shone brightly again.
The duck's mother took it out of the bath and dried it off with a towel. The duck felt so much better and happy to be clean again!

Once upon a time there was a tough train. It ran all around the city every day. One day, it got stuck in a valley and couldn't go any further. All the passengers were very scared. But luckily, a brave firefighter saw what had happened and decided to help.
He ran over to the train and tried to push it. But it wouldn't move! He tried and tried, but the train was too heavy. Then the firefighter had a clever idea. He asked everyone to help him push it. So everyone got together and pushed and pushed. After what felt like forever, the brave firefighter managed to save the train!
The passengers clapped and cheered, they were so happy that the brave firefighter had saved the train. He was very happy too, because he had been very tough and worked very hard.

Once upon a time there was a naughty little boy. His parents did not like how rude he was. One day, the boy decided to play near a well in the forest. He thought it would be fun to destroy it.
He quickly found some stones and started throwing them into the well. Splash, splash! He laughed and threw more and more in. Soon, the well was full of stones, and the water had vanished.
The boy's parents were very angry. They scolded him and taught him a lesson. He learned that it was not nice to destroy things. From then on he was a good boy and never destroyed anything again.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Sarah wanted to visit her grandpa. She asked her mom if they could go on an adventure, and her mom said yes.
They got in the car and drove for a long time. As they drove, Sarah noticed the ground shaking. She asked her mom what it was, and her mom told her that it was an earthquake.
The car stopped in front of a big house. Sarah was so excited to see her grandpa. She knocked on the door and Grandpa opened it. His voice was soft and kind. He welcomed Sarah with a big hug.
They went inside, and Sarah couldn't believe how cozy it was. She saw a big kitchen and a soft bed. She played there with her grandpa all day, until it was time to go home. 
Before they left, Sarah gave her grandpa a big hug. It was the best visit ever!

Tommy was an enthusiastic little boy and always loved to play outside. One day he saw a big pipe in the garden rolling around. He thought it looked fun and wanted to play with it.
He talked to his mom and she said he could roll the pipe around the garden if he was careful. So Tommy excitedly grabbed the pipe and started pushing it around. He rolled it over the grass and through the flowers.
He kept rolling the pipe all around the garden until he got tired. So he took the pipe back to where he found it and said goodbye. 
Tommy had such a great time playing with the pipe and he was already looking forward to the next time he could roll it around the garden.

Once upon a time there was a brilliant oyster. It lived in the sea with many other oysters. Each day it was filled with joy and it loved to play and explore with its friends. 
One day, the oyster decided to clean its shell. It wanted to make sure it was shiny and sparkly. So, it scraped and scrubbed with all of its might. It worked so hard that it was soon finished and its shell was the shiniest in the sea. Everyone admired its brilliant shell.
The oyster was so happy with its work. From that day on, it always kept its shell clean and sparkly—just like a brilliant oyster should.

Fred was a young boy of three. He liked to play and have fun. One day, Fred was getting dressed when he found a new shirt in his drawers. He put it on and it fit him perfectly. He was so excited to wear his brilliantly coloured new shirt.
The shirt was so bright, Fred felt like he was a superhero. He liked his new shirt so much, he even paraded around the kitchen to show it off to his mum and dad. His mum and dad smiled and said that the shirt was brilliant; it suited him perfectly. Fred smiled back and went back to playing.
He couldn't wait to show off his new shirt to all his friends. He was sure they would think it was brilliant too. Every time he put it on he felt special, like he could do anything.
And that's how Fred's new brilliant shirt fit into his life, making him feel like a superhero even at 3 years old.

Once upon a time there was a girl who loved to skip. She had an incredible chain that she wore around her neck. It was her favourite thing in the world.
One day, she went to the park to skip with her chain on. She didn't know that it would come off. She skipped and jumped and choreographed leaps through the grass.
Before she knew it, the chain was gone. She looked everywhere, but it was not to be found. She became very sad, realising that her chain was lost.
But then, something incredible happened. As she looked back at the park, a bright light shone from a chain in the grass. The girl rushed over and couldn't believe her eyes. It was her chain! It was still there! 
The girl quickly put it back around her neck and vowed never to lose it again. She was so incredibly happy.

Once upon a time, there was a fast bunny. He always wanted to go faster and faster. One day, he found a special apron. When he put it on, he could suddenly go in reverse! He was so excited to be able to go much faster. He went faster and faster, but he didn't know how to stop! He had so much fun going backwards that he forgot how to go forwards. 
The rabbit's friends were worried about him, so they found another special apron and invited the bunny over for lunch. When the bunny put on the new apron, he was able to go forward again! The bunny was so happy and thanked his friends for the apron. He never forgot to watch where he was going ever again! The end.

One day, a little infant was crying. Her mommy came to give her a hug. Then, she gave the infant a toy to play with. The infant was very happy.
This made the little infant laugh. This made Mommy smile. Then, she gave the little infant her favorite blanket. The little infant felt so cozy.
The little infant wanted to give something too. She looked around the room and saw a little flower. She picked it up and gave it to Mommy. Mommy was very happy. She gave the little infant a big hug. 
The little infant was so happy. She laughed and laughed. Then, Mommy and the little infant snuggled up together. They were so happy to be together.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Sarah. She was very excited to explore nature. Sarah was so excited that she ran quickly outside.
Sarah saw many exciting things around her. She saw mountains, trees, and birds. She was so amazed that she felt a bit dizzy. She couldn't believe how beautiful nature was!
Sarah ran around in the grass and played with the animals. She chased butterflies and laughed a lot. It was so exciting!
Eventually, Sarah got so dizzy from running around that she had to stop. She lay down and enjoyed the view of nature all around her.
Sarah felt so happy and excited about exploring nature. From that day forward, she knew that she would always love to explore the great outdoors.

John had a drum. He loved playing it fast. Every day after playing John would take a nap. He would sleep so soundly and for a long time. After his nap he would wake up and play his drum again, as fast as he could. He would practice hard every day, getting better and better every time. After playing he would be so tired that he could hardly keep his eyes open. He would put his drum away and then go have a nice long nap. John enjoyed sleeping and playing the drum, they were his favorite things to do.

Once upon a time, there was a big room. In the middle of the room was a big open microphone. One day, a little boy named Jack went to the room. He saw the open microphone and he was very excited. He walked up to the microphone and said "hello". 
Then, a beautiful angel appeared. The angel said to Jack, "I am so happy to meet you". Jack was so amazed and he said "Wow, this is so cool". The angel and Jack became fast friends.
Jack and the angel talked for a long time. They talked about all kinds of things. Jack asked questions and the angel answered. He was so happy to meet the angel.
After a while, Jack and the angel had to leave. Jack waved goodbye and said, "It was so nice to meet you". The angel smiled and said, "I hope to see you again soon". And they both left the big open room.

Once upon a time, there was a prince who was very stubborn. He always wanted to do things his own way. One day, the prince decided that he wanted to have a crown of his own. The prince searched everywhere for a crown but he couldn't find one.
So the prince decided to make a crown for himself. He gathered some ribbon, glitter, and glue. He worked hard, and soon he made a beautiful crown. It was colorful, sparkly, and perfect for him.
The prince decided to put his crown on his head and wear it all the time. He proudly strutted around the palace. Everyone complimented the prince on his crown.
The prince was very happy and decided that he would always be stubborn, but if anyone ever tried to argue with him he would simply tap his crown and they would know that he was the king!

One day, there was a powerful cabinet in a room. Nothing could disturb it. But then a little three-year-old girl came along. She wanted to see what was inside the cabinet. She tugged and pulled but the cabinet was too powerful for her to open. 
The girl grabbed a nearby chair and used it to climb up to the top of the cabinet. Then she stretched her arm out and pulled the cabinet door open. Inside the cabinet, the girl found lots of interesting things!
The girl was so excited that she began jumping around the room. The powerful cabinet shook and wiggled and finally, it crashed to the ground! The girl jumped in surprise and ran out of the room.
From then on, the girl never disturbed the powerful cabinet again!

Once there was a sweet hippo who lived in a pond. He loved to dive and swim. Every day he would dive into the water. He would splash and play with the other pond animals.
One day, a large crocodile came to the pond. The hippo was scared and wanted to hide. He quickly he dove under the water. But he was too slow. The crocodile snuck up and grabbed him with his sharp teeth.
The hippo was scared, but he was also brave. He tried to swim away from the crocodile. Using his strong legs, the hippo kicked and tried to escape. After a few moments, the hippo was able to break free and dive down deep.
The hippo swam away and was safe. He swam back to the pond, where he dove and swam to his heart's content, enjoying being sweet and free.

Once upon a time, there was a black axe. It lay in a field, still and quiet. Everyone was staring at it, wondering who owned it and why it was there.
Suddenly, an old man walked up to the axe. He grabbed hold of the handle and held it tight. He let out a loud grunt and chopped the air with the axe. Everyone kept staring, not sure what the old man was doing.
The old man looked around the field and found a big tree stump. He put the axe over the top and slammed it down. The axe gave out a big 'thump' and the old man smiled. He took the axe, put it over his shoulder, and walked away.
The old man had used the axe to make something special. Everyone was staring to see what he had created. To their surprise, the old man had used the axe to make a beautiful wooden toy car, with four black wheels! 
The old man smiled and handed the toy car to a little child. The child's eyes lit up and the old man winked. Everyone in the field smiled and stared at the little car.

Once upon a time there was a little boy. He was never very busy, but he still had dreams. Sometimes his dreams were scary nightmares.
One night in his dream he was walking down a long, dark road. Suddenly, he saw a big dragon. He was very scared and started to cry. But then the dragon smiled at him and gave him a hug. 
The dragon said, "It's okay. I just wanted to give you a hug." Then the dragon blew softly on the little boy and made the tears dry. 
The little boy laughed and thanked the dragon. The dragon told the boy to never be scared of his nightmares. With that, the dragon said goodbye and flew away. 
The little boy felt much better and didn't feel so busy anymore. He smiled and went to sleep, knowing that his nightmares weren't as scary as they seemed.

Once upon a time, there was a young boy called Jack. One day, Jack was feeling really sad and he didn't know what to do. He was missing his friends a lot. 
Then his grandma had an idea. She said, "Let's make you feel better. Let's give you a special hug!"
So she gave him a big, warm hug. Jack was amazed at how it made him feel – he felt so much better. 
The next day, Jack decided that he wanted to improve his hugs. He wanted to make them even better, so he tried to give his friends weird hugs! He wrapped his arms around them, tickled them, and even tried to spin them around. 
His friends were so surprised and laughed happily. Jack was even more surprised - he hadn't known that hugs could be so much fun!
From then on Jack gave everyone he met the same weird hugs. As he kept practising and improving, he found that he could make people smile and laugh every time. 
In the end, he realised that hugs were the perfect way to make people feel better – no matter how sad they were.

Mummy and Daddy decided to buy a pizza. It was a big one. It had lots of yummy cheese and tomato on it. Mummy and Daddy wanted to share it. They were so excited! 
They sat down on the sofa and waited for the pizza to arrive. They heard a knock at the door and rushed off to answer it. It was the pizza man with a big box.
Mummy and Daddy opened the box and it was their pizza. The slices looked big and delicious. Mummy and Daddy clapped their hands. They were very happy.
Mummy and Daddy each took a slice of pizza. They chewed it slowly, savouring the taste. There was so much cheese and tomato juice that it was dribbling down their chins. Mummy and Daddy smiled at each other.
After they had finished their pizza, they both gave a big burp. It was the best pizza they had ever had. Mummy and Daddy were filled with joy.

Once upon a time, there was a track. The track was very attractive. Every day, many little children would come and play on the track. 
One day, a group of children were playing a game. It was called "Number Track". They had to count from 1 to 10 and race around the track. 
The first little boy had a head start, but the second was very fast. He passed the first little boy and ran all the way around the track. 
The group of children cheered for the little boy and hugged him. Together, they all played the Number Track game until it was time to go home. 
The children had so much fun on the Number Track, and they went home tired and happy.

Tina was so excited for her first meeting. She put on her warm coat and shoes and went downstairs. She couldn't believe it - the meeting was actually taking place in her living room.
She saw Mommy, Daddy, and Grandma all sitting there smiling. Tina knew that it was time to take her seat. She sat on the couch and looked around. Everyone in the room was so warm and happy.
Tina was a little bit nervous at first, but the smiles on her family's faces helped her feel better. She couldn't believe that this meeting was taking place at her own house.
They talked and talked until it was time to say good-bye. Tina was sad but also a little bit delighted. She had just taken part in her first meeting and it had been so special. She couldn't wait for her next one.

Once upon a time there was a girl named Emily. Emily had a heavy shirt. She loved to play with it. Every day her mum would encourage her to put on her shirt. Emily was very happy to have it on because it made her look special and beautiful.
One day Emily decided to take her shirt outside and play with it in the garden. She loved to run around in her heavy shirt. It made her feel like a princess. Her mum watched Emily from the kitchen window and always made sure to encourage her.
One day, Emily found a little bird in the garden and wanted to be his friend. The little bird was very scared at first, but Emily gently encouraged the little bird to come to her. Soon enough, the little bird was hopping all around Emily's heavy shirt.
Emily and the little bird became best friends. From that day on, Emily would always encourage the little bird whenever it was scared. Emily was very happy to have a special friend and have her heavy shirt to play in.

Once there was a small boy who was very cheerful. He was playing in the garden when he saw a big brick. He wanted to be cheeky so he decided to break the brick. He made a loud noise as he broke it into lots of smaller pieces.
The boy was very pleased with himself and smiled with joy. He knew he had been naughty, but it was fun!
He looked around to make sure nobody had seen him, but he spotted his mother watching from the window. She was very cross with him and asked him why he had broken the brick. The little boy felt ashamed and apologised.
His mother told him that he should never break things that don't belong to him. She then hugged him and said she still loved him even though he had been naughty.
The little boy felt much better and learned a valuable lesson that day. He never broke anything again, but remained as cheerful as ever.

Once upon a time, there was a fragile jar. All around the jar stood a family of bears. They were all trying to support it. 
The jar was quite big and the bears were very small. They all grabbed onto the jar with their paws. But try as they might, the jar wouldn't budge. 
The bears began to worry. What could they do? They wanted to help the jar, but they were too small. 
Suddenly an idea occurred to them. They asked some of the other animals if they could help. Soon, the giraffes, elephants and crocodiles had all come to help. 
Together they all managed to support the fragile jar. They cheered and gave each other high-fives. It was a job well done!

Once upon a time there was a flame. It was incredible! It lit up the dark sky with its bright light. Everywhere it went, it made the trees, rocks and grass glow beautiful colors.
The flame flew up to the sky. It became so big that it filled the entire sky. People on the ground were in awe and clapped their hands. 
The flame brought warmth and joy to all who saw it. It was wonderful! It danced and swayed in the sky, filling the night with a special kind of happiness.
Finally, the flame began to come back down. It flew all around like a ballerina, touching everything it saw and making everyone smile. 
Then, it was gone. The sky became dark, but everyone remembered the incredible flame. And they had smiles on their faces.

There was a busy church. The pastor saw a little girl crying outside. He decided to go and comfort her. He asked her what was wrong and she said her tummy was sore. 
The pastor took her inside the church and gave her some warm soup and bread. He gave her a big, soft blanket to keep her warm. 
The girl smiled and soon she felt better. She thanked the pastor and he said it was no problem. He said he liked to help people who were unhappy or sad. He said he was there if she ever needed a friend.
The girl thanked him again, said goodbye and went back home. She was so glad that the pastor had been there to comfort her.

One day, there was a careless pilot who decided to change their plans. They wanted to go on a special adventure. So, the pilot got into their plane and began flying. They flew up high in the sky and as they flew, they started to change direction.
The pilot flew higher and higher until they reached the clouds and felt so happy. But then, a big change happened. Suddenly, the plane started to shake and swerve back and forth. The pilot had become careless and forgotten to check the weather.
The pilot started to worry and tried to make the plane change direction, but it didn't seem to work. The plane kept shaking and swaying. Eventually, the pilot was able to get the plane under control and flew back to the ground safely.
The careless pilot learned an important lesson that day - to be careful when flying and always check the weather first!

Once there was a little boy. He was poor, and he was very, very tired. He had been working all day and he wanted to sleep. He decided to take a nap. 
He looked for a place to sleep and found a soft blanket on the floor. He lay down and closed his eyes. Just then, he heard a loud noise. He opened his eyes and saw a big ball. It had dropped from the sky. 
He rolled the ball around and played with it, until he felt sleepy again. Then he curled up on the blanket and went to sleep. But he was so tired that he dropped the ball. 
He didn't wake up again until the morning. Even though he was still poor, he smiled when he remembered the ball and the nap he had taken.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Jane. Jane wanted to get to the sky. She asked her mom if she could get some wings to help her fly. Her mom said she could use a kite instead. So they went to buy a kite.
When they got to the park, they saw that the sky was filled with thin white clouds. Jane was so excited to fly her kite. She held onto the string and ran until the kite was up high in the sky. She felt like she could almost touch the sky.
Jane couldn't believe that she was so close to the sky. She kept holding the string and wishing that she could fly higher and higher. Suddenly the wind got stronger and the kite started flying away.
Jane was so happy and excited. She waved goodbye as the kite flew away into the sky. Finally, she had gotten to the sky.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Lilly. Lilly liked adventures and one day, she went on the biggest adventure of all - she met a dragon!
The dragon was very big and she was a bit scared but when the dragon introduced itself, Lilly smiled. She even noticed that the dragon seemed hungry.
So Lilly picked some big, juicy apples from her bag and offered them to the dragon. The dragon seemed very happy and Lilly was pleased that she could help.
They became friends and Lilly visited the dragon every day after that. They had lots of fun and Lilly fed her dragon friend more apples each time.
The end.

One day, a puppy was born. He had very soft fur, and a little brown collar around his neck. The puppy loved playing in the grass, running around with the children, and eating tidbits of food. He was very brave and clever, and he was sure he could do anything.
One day, the little puppy was out in the garden when he decided he wanted to go explore the world. He raced around the yard and then leapt out over the fence and into the big wide world.
He wasn't too sure what to do, so he just kept running. He raced up and down hills, and through the meadows, feeling the fresh grass between his toes. Finally, he arrived at a brilliant blue lake. He'd never seen a lake before and he thought it was amazing.
The little puppy decided to take a swim. He loved the way he felt as he raced around the lake, feeling free and wild. He promised himself he would come back to the lake every day.
Back at home, the puppy settled in with a contented sigh. He knew he'd made the right decision, and he promised himself he'd wear his collar with pride. Because while it was fun to explore the world, he was happiest at home.

Once upon a time there was a rabbit. The rabbit wanted to find a good place for a nap. It hopped and hopped until it found a long, dark tunnel. The rabbit noticed the tunnel had lots of hairy edges around it. It thought it was the perfect spot.
The rabbit scratched its way around the tunnel and started to gather sticks, leaves and grass. The rabbit carefully placed them near the tunnel entrance. The rabbit was making a cosy bed to sleep in.
When the bed was finished, the rabbit hopped inside the tunnel and settled down for a nap. The tunnel was warm and safe, perfect for snuggling down. 
The rabbit slept until it heard a friendly voice calling its name. The rabbit hopped out of the tunnel and saw its friend, a squirrel, waving at it. The two animals hugged and then hopped and skipped together in the garden, gathering treats and snacks. 
What a great day! The rabbit found a perfect place to take a nap and also found a great friend to play with.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Jack. He was very brave and kind. He was always ready to help someone in need.
One day, Jack went for a jog by the harbor. He saw a man and a dog who were struggling in the water. Jack rushed to help them. He was very compassionate and fearless.
Jack jumped into the water and swam to them. He pulled the man and dog to the shore. Then, he ran to a nearby house and called the police.
The man and dog were taken to safety. Everyone thanked Jack for his brave and compassionate act.
Jack smiled. He was proud of himself for helping those in need. From that day on, Jack knew he could always help others.

Once upon a time, there was a big zoo in the town. Everyone in the town was worried because lots of animals had gone missing.
The people decided to work together to find the noisy animals. They searched everywhere, but the animals were no where to be found.
Soon, the people heard a noise. They followed the loud sound and they saw a group of lost animals in a meadow. They were tired and sleepy, so they could not move anymore.
The people were very glad that they had found the animals and they put them in the zoo. The animals had a nice place to rest.
The animals were happy to be back in the zoo, and the people were not worried any more. Everyone was happy, and had a good rest. The End!

Once there was a boy called Max. He was three years old and he liked to watch movies. One day he was at the park with his family. He was feeling fine and he ran around and chased the birds.
Suddenly, he felt his foot slip and he fell to the ground. He started to cry, but his dad came over and helped him get up. He was all right and his dad was happy too.
They all went to the movies that evening. Max liked the movie because it was fine. He didn't even think about falling. He just enjoyed the movie and all the fun with his family.

Once there was a sailor. He discovered a peaceful island. On this island there were so many animals and plants. He saw monkeys swinging from the trees and colourful parrots flying around. The sailor was so excited to explore this new place and he kept going further.
Then he saw a beach, with clear blue water. He decided to go for a swim and he moved closer to the shore. He could see so many different sea creatures like fish, turtles and crabs. The sailor was amazed by the beauty of the ocean and he wanted to stay there for a long time.
After swimming, the sailor discovered a cove. He stepped inside and saw a beautiful sight. Big rocks were sitting in the middle of the cove, surrounded by sand. On top of the rocks there were colourful birds, singing and enjoying the peaceful surroundings. The sailor was very happy and he knew this was a special place.
He stayed there for a long time, discovering all the wonderful things on the peaceful island.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was an eager little girl and very excited about the day. 
Today, Lily's parents told her they were going to send her some delicious rice in the mail. Lily was full of joy and eagerly waited for it to come.
Every day, Lily asked her mom when her rice would come in the mail. Every day, her mom said it was coming soon.
Finally, Lily could hardly believe it when one day, her mom said her rice had arrived! Lily ran to the mailbox, and sure enough, there it was! 
Eagerly, Lily opened the package and inside she found a big box of rice. She was so excited, she jumped up and down.
Lily's parents were happy to see her so full of joy and they shared the rice with her. It was the most delicious rice she had ever had! 
From then on, Lily looked forward to receiving delicious rice in the mail every day.

Once upon a time, there was a brave little girl named Ruby. She didn't have a lot of money, but she was very brave. One day,Ruby saw an old shield in the street. She knelt down to pick it up and noticed that it was heavy. 
Ruby decided to take the shield home with her. She got an old stick and used it as a handle. She then took the shield and leaned it against the wall. 
When Ruby went to bed that night, she felt a little bit safer. She knew the shield would help protect her in case anything bad happened. 
The next day, Ruby went to the park with her shield. She was so proud to show it off to her friends. She even pretended to be a knight and ran around, trying to keep everyone safe with her old shield. 
Ruby kept the shield as protection for many years. It made her feel safe and brave, even when things were scary. 
The end.

Once upon a time there was a girl named Anne. One day, Anne had a very special wish. She wanted to spin very high in the sky. So, Anne went outside and found a round wheel. She jumped onto the wheel and started to spin round and round. With each spin, Anne went higher and higher into the sky. 
Anne couldn't stop spinning. She spun faster and faster until she reached the sky. Up in the sky, Anne could see all the way to the mountains and the sea. She kept spinning in the sky until the wheel became too weak to spin any more. 
With one last spin, Anne spun high in the sky and then came back down to the ground. Everyone was so surprised to see Anne return to Earth from the sky. From then on, Anne made a wish every day to spin in the sky, but no one ever saw her do it again.

Once upon a time, there was a silly girl who loved playing with yarn. Every day, she would collect a different type of yarn from her mommy and spread it all over the floor. She would laugh and giggle as she scattered the yarn like a rainbow.
But one day, she ran across an ugly, tangled piece of yarn. She held it in the palms of her hands and examined it closely. She was confused and thought it was ugly!
Still, she decided to scatter the ugly yarn along with all the other colorful pieces. She placed it right between the blues and yellows and watched it sparkle in the light.
At the end of the day, the girl was happy with the mess she had made. Even the ugly yarn had a home amongst all the rest! She watched the piece of yarn twinkle, and felt proud that it found its place.

The little girl was feeling sad. She wanted to bring a march. She asked her mom to get her one but she said no.
So the little girl was determined and came up with a plan. She marched to the park and asked everyone she saw if they could bring her a march. Everyone said no and the little girl was feeling more and more hopeless.
But then one old man kindly said that he could help. He took the little girl with him and brought her to a place where march was everywhere! It was an amazing sight for the little girl and she was filled with joy.
But as the old man showed her around, the little girl noticed some ignorant people. They were refusing to accept the march that the old man had been trying to bring to them. This made the little girl feel sad again and she wondered if one day people would be more accepting of march.

Sally saw a perfect tree in her backyard. She was excited and wanted to climb it. She grabbed a hold of the trunk and started to climb.
Halfway up the tree, she saw a worm. It was round and wiggling. She wanted to touch it, so she reached out and touched it gently. The worm wriggled around and then crawled away.
She kept on climbing, until she reached the top. From up there, she could see everything. The view was perfect!
She smiled and hugged the tree. Then, she carefully climbed down. Before she went inside, Sally looked up at the tree and thanked it.

Once upon a time, there was a nice fair princess named Rosemary. She was very friendly, and she liked to talk to everyone. One day, Rosemary was walking in the forest when she met a little boy named Jeff.
Jeff was a brave lad who was carrying a weapon. Rosemary asked him why he was carrying it and Jeff told her he found it in the forest. Rosemary thought it wasn't fair for the little boy to have it. So she kindly asked him if he was allowed to keep it.
Jeff agreed, so Rosemary talked to him about all kinds of things. She asked him if he liked playing in the forest, if he had a pet and what other things he liked to do. They talked and laughed all day until it was time to go home.
 Rosemary and Jeff said goodbye, and Jeff thanked the fair princess for being so kind. As Jeff left, he made Rosemary promise that she would come back one day and talk to him again. Rosemary smiled and said she would!

Once there was a kid. He wanted to swim in the ocean. But he felt guilty. He thought he didn't know how to swim. So he stayed on the beach.
But then he saw another kid in the water. That kid was swimming! He was having a lot of fun.
So the first kid got brave. He jumped into the water too! He tried to swim. And then he found out he could swim! He was so happy.
He swam and swam and then he went back to the beach. He was no longer feeling guilty. He had learned he could swim!

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Jack. He loved the outdoors and especially loved playing in the water. One day he brought a big, orange stick to the river. When he got there, he threw the stick into the water. Then, he waded in and started to splash around. 
He jumped and turned in circles, laughing and clapping his hands. He moved the stick around, making different shapes in the water. Everywhere he swam, big splashes came up. Jack was having so much fun!
At one point, he threw the orange stick far away from him. He laughed as it sped off and drifted down the river. Then, he spun around, twirling his arms and making bigger and bigger splashes. He couldn't stop and kept playing until the sun went down.
Afterwards, he was exhausted, but happy. He said goodbye to the river, ready to come back again soon and have even more fun.

The family was so excited. They were going to the movies to see an impressive show. 
When they got there, they picked the best seat. It was right in the front of the theater. 
During the movie, they laughed and cheered. However, as the movie ended, they felt a strong regret. 
The family had realized that they had missed the most important part of the movie! They had been so busy cheering and laughing that they had missed the end. 
They wished they had watched more carefully. The family was sad and wished they could start again. But, it was too late. They knew that they would have to regret missing out on the important part of the movie.

Mild Bill was walking through the park when he started to feel hungry. He looked around and saw a bright blue label on a big tree. He went closer to read what it said, and saw that it was a label for a yummy apple. He couldn't reach it so he started to look for something to help him get the apple. He found a big stick and used it to pull the apple down. Mild Bill happily took the apple, smiled, and bit into it. The apple was so juicy and sweet! Mild Bill was so pleased he started to dance with joy. He thanked the tree for the yummy apple.

Once upon a time there was a loyal bear named Ben. Ben loved to sing and he sang all of the time. Every day he would help make meals for his family. He would help his mom stir the pot and he always remembered to stir it for a long time so the meal would be extra tasty.
Then one day his mom said he could pick any song he wanted to sing. Ben was so excited! He thought and thought about what song he would pick, but he couldn't decide. So, he just sang all his favorite songs. He sang so loudly that everyone in the house could hear him.
When he was finished singing, his mom said he did a wonderful job. She said she was so proud of how loyal he was to his family. Ben smiled and said that he had lots of love for his family. Then he went off to bed, dreaming of all the songs he wanted to sing.

Once upon a time there was a humble farmer. Every day he requested help from the animals on his farm, but they were too busy to help him.
One day he asked the animals to help him build a raft. The animals were excited and gathered some wood from the forest. They also gathered some strong rope to tie the raft together.
The farmer thanked the animals for their help as they finished building the raft. He happily said he would use the raft to move around the lake. 
The animals waved goodbye as the farmer requested, and the raft slowly moved away. He was so happy with the raft! 
The humble farmer thanked the animals every time he saw them, as they had helped him make his raft a reality.

Once upon a time, there were two friends, Jake and Daisy. They decided to go to Daisy's house. When they got to Daisy's house, they went inside. Daisy showed Jake her bedroom. It was so nice. The walls were pink and there was a toy box in the corner. Jake was so excited.
Then, Daisy and Jake decided to get some snack. Daisy took out some cookies. They were so delicious! Daisy and Jake enjoyed the cookies and then headed outside to play. They had so much fun playing together.
Finally, it was time to go home. Daisy and Jake said goodbye and Daisy helped Jake manage to get home. When he got home, he laid down in his bedroom and soon he was fast asleep.
The end!

Once upon a time there was a wild gym. In the gym there was a big box. Every day, a man and a woman would come and put things inside the box. It was always full of fun stuff!
One day the man and woman put a trampoline in the gym. Then they put a rope swing and some gymnastic mats. The woman put a big hoop and the man put some tall posts. They even put a ladder in the gym. It was so much fun!
The man and woman then started to jump on the trampoline and swing on the rope. They ran around the gym and jumped over the hurdles. After they were all done they put everything away.
The man and woman had lots of fun at the wild gym. They always filled the big box with fun things and it was a blast every time they went to the gym!

Johnny was walking in the park with his uncle. They were enjoying the sunny day and the birds singing. Johnny looked at the tall grass swaying in the wind and smiled. Suddenly, he saw a tough looking bird near a bush. He stopped and gazed at the bird in amazement.
His uncle kneeled down and said, "That's an eagle, Johnny. How cool does he look?" Johnny smiled and kept staring at the majestic bird. They spent the time together just looking at the eagle. 
"Let's keep going, Johnny," said his uncle after some time. Johnny reluctantly took his uncle's hand and they continued walking. Johnny was still day dreaming about the eagle as they walked out of the park.

Once upon a time a little girl lived in a house with a pretty purple rug. She loved the rug and spent lots of time playing on it. Every morning she would wake up and jump on the rug right away.
One day her mom had to go away, so the little girl had to go stay with her grandpa. She was so sad to leave her rug behind and she missed it so much. She asked her grandpa if she could bring it with her, but he said
no.
The little girl was so sad. She tried to play with her grandpa's rug but it wasn't the same. She just wanted her purple rug back. 
Finally her mom came home and the little girl was so excited! She ran right to the rug and hugged it tight. She was never going to miss it ever again!

One night, John had to do something very tough. He grabbed his flashlight and stepped outside. As he came closer to the dark woods, his heart raced. There was no turning back now.
John walked and walked, until he saw something shining in the distance. Flashlight in hand, he cautiously came closer. It was a big bad wolf!
John was scared, but he didn't give up. He yelled, "Go away!" The wolf growled and stepped closer. Suddenly, John heard a noise coming from the bushes. It was his friends coming to help him!
John's friends ran over to him and started to throw stones at the wolf. The wolf was so scared that he ran away!
John and his friends were relieved and hugged each other. Thanks to the tough work of John and his friends, the night was saved!

Once there was a human who was very brave. He wanted to do something daring. So he decided to go and pick some sour apples from a big apple tree. He was determined to pick the apples even though the tree was very tall.
But when he got close to the tree, he realized it was much bigger than he had thought and he was scared. He took a deep breath and started climbing up the tree. Slowly but surely he made it to the top.
When he looked around, he saw that the apples were indeed very sour. But he had promised himself that he would pick them, so he started picking the apples. He was careful not to fall off the tree while picking the apples.
Finally, he had managed to pick the most sour apples from the tree. Satisfied, he slowly climbed down and proudly showed everyone the apples he had gathered. Everyone praised him for his courage and for daring to pick the sour apples.

Bob was a young boy. He had two parents and they loved him very much. They were married and Bob thought marriage was fine. Everyday, his parents spoiled him with toys and love. But one day, something changed.
Bob's parents started to fight a lot. He was so sad. He didn't understand why they were fighting. He wanted them to be happy like before. He hated seeing them fight.
One day, his father left. Bob missed him and felt very sad. But soon his mother told him that his father wouldn't be coming back. She said that they weren't married anymore.
Bob was so sad. He hated that his parents weren't married anymore. He missed his father but was glad they weren't fighting anymore. Still, he wished they could be married and happy like before.

Molly was a 3 year old girl who loved to have fun. Every day, she enjoyed playing in her backyard. Her favourite activity was swinging on the swing set. She thought it was so fun!
Molly would fly high in the air, laughing and squealing with delight. Even though she was not very heavy, she felt as if she was flying like a bird each time she swung.
One day, Molly's mom decided to give her an even crazier experience. She had borrowed an adult sized swing from a friend. Molly was so excited! She had never been on an adult swing before.
When Molly sat on the swing, she felt a bit scared. The swing was much bigger and much heavier than the little one she was used to. But then, mom gave her a big push, and Molly began to enjoy the experience.
Molly loved feeling the weight of the swing as she went higher in the air. She would let out squeals of delight each time she swung by. Molly enjoyed the crazy experience of swinging on an adult swing, and she smiled with glee.

Once upon a time, there was a mom and her little girl. The little girl was very excited when she heard that they were going to have a picnic.
Mommy opened the basket and inside there was a bottle of light wine. She said, "Let's throw it in the air and it will be fun." The little girl knew it would be fun and she wanted to try it.
Mommy threw the wine up in the air and it flew really high. The little girl was so amazed and jumped up and down with glee.
When the bottle came down, Mommy said, "Catch it." The little girl ran and caught the bottle before it hit the ground.
The little girl was so proud and excited to have caught the bottle of light wine. Mommy was happy too, because she knew that the picnic would be even more fun now. They both enjoyed the rest of their picnic together.

Once upon a time, there lived a purple monster. He lived in a far away forest and was lonely - he had no friends. One day, the purple monster had a special delivery. When he opened the box he found a magical purple ball. 
He was so excited and decided to show his new toy to the world. He called his new friends - the birds, the squirrels and the foxes – to come and play. They all had lots of fun bouncing and throwing the ball.
They even made up a game called ‘Delivery’. They took it in turns delivering the ball to each other. When the sun went down, the purple monster had made lots of new friends. He was so happy and never lonely again.

Once there was a bug. It loved living outside with its friends. It was so happy there that it prepared a special picnic. It found a calm spot in the yard and laid out all its food and friends.
The bug invited all the other bugs to join him. He prepared some tasty snacks and flowers to make the picnic even better. All the bugs were very excited and they started eating and playing.
The bug was so happy he had prepared such a fun picnic! Everyone was laughing, playing and eating. It was a peaceful and relaxing afternoon and the bug was so happy.
As the afternoon came to an end, all the bugs said goodbye to each other. They thanked the bug very much for preparing such a wonderful picnic. They all promised to come back soon!

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Harriet. Harriet was humbly dressed and adored jewelry. One day, while out on a walk, she spotted a tiny jewel sparkling at the bottom of a pond. 
Harriet took off her shoes, rolled up her pants and stepped in carefully. She felt around the pond and soon she could feel the smooth, cold surface of the jewelry. She took hold of it and thankfully managed to get it out of the water.
As she looked at it, the jewelry suddenly lit up and Harriet gasped. A magical figure stood before her. It was an old, wise woman who smiled kindly at Harriet. 
She then gave Harriet a special gift; a beautiful necklace with a bright red jewel in the middle. Harriet thanked her and promised to take care of it forever.
The two of them hugged tightly and smiled. It was a moment Harriet would never forget; the moment she met the old, wise woman and was given the most precious jewelry of all.

Once upon a time, there was an adventurous little girl called Sarah. She loved to explore everywhere and learn new things. Today, Sarah wanted to go to the shop. She put on her shoes and grabbed her bag. 
Sarah said goodbye to her mommy and walked out the door. She felt so brave and excited - it was her first ever time walking alone. She skipped and hopped all the way to the shop. 
Once Sarah got to the shop, she started to look around. There were so many things to see and choose from! She saw the sweet treats and colourful toys, and even picked out a new, sparkly headband for herself. 
When it was time to go home, Sarah said goodbye to the shop keeper, who had helped her find some goodies for her friends at home. Holding onto her shopping bag, Sarah took a deep breath and started her walk home. Even when it got a bit dark, she wasn't scared - she knew she would make it home safe. 
When Sarah finally arrived home, she couldn"t stop talking about her wonderful, adventurous day. She was so proud of herself for taking the journey all by herself and couldn't wait to do it all over again!

Jim was walking in the park one day when he spotted something furry by a tree. He went over to examine it closer. It was an attractive, brown squirrel. Jim was fascinated. He had never seen one so close up before.
Jim watched as the little squirrel twitched its nose before scurrying up the tree with its furry tail behind. Jim smiled and went on his way.
The next day, Jim decided to return to the park and search for the squirrel. Sure enough, it was right by the same tree, nibbling on a nut. Jim carefully watched as it examined the nut for what seemed like a long time.
Jim was amazed. He had never seen anyone take the time to examine such a small thing before. He was so enchanted with the squirrel that he decided to visit it every day.

Once there was a little girl who was walking with her mom. They went to the market and the little girl saw something really weird. It was bright pink and had a strange shape. She asked her mom what it was, and her mom said it was a watermelon. The little girl had never seen one before, so she was very surprised.
Then she saw something even more weird. It was big and colorful and full of things. Her mom said it was called a market. The little girl was very curious and she wanted to explore it. She walked around and looked at all the things that were being sold. She saw fruits, vegetables and lots of other things.
Finally, she recognized something special. It was a cupcake with sprinkles. She really liked it and knew she had seen it before. She asked her mom for it and her mom said yes. The little girl was so happy! She remembered it from her birthday party the week before. She was proud of herself for recognizing it. She had a great time at the market and would remember it for a long time.

Once upon a time there was a little girl who was very compassionate. She loved to help people and was always kind to everyone she met. One day she decided to bake a cake for some friends. She put all the ingredients together and carefully mixed them with a spoon until they were combined into a delicious cake.
The little girl was so excited to share her cake with her friends, but when she tried to separate the cake into equal pieces so that everyone could have their own, she realized it was too difficult. 
The little girl began to cry and her friends noticed. They all came together and offered to each take a small piece so that the cake could be separated. With the help of her friends, the little girl was able to separate the cake into eight individual portions, enough for everyone.
The little girl was so grateful for her compassionate friends and thanked them for their help. Then everyone sat down to enjoy the delicious cake that she had made.

Once upon a time, there was a bunny. He wanted a new tent to sleep in, so he asked his mom for one. His mom said he could have it, so he was very happy! He received a tent and quickly put it up.
He spent the next day playing in it. He liked to pretend the tent was a castle. He would dress up as a prince and play with his toys. 
Unfortunately, the next morning, he noticed something was wrong. He saw that his tent was broken! He was so sad and started to cry. He didn't know what to do.
 
Suddenly, his mom had an idea. She said she could help him fix the tent. She gave him some glue and showed him how to use it. The bunny worked on the tent for a long time and eventually he was able to fix it so it was as good as new.
The bunny was so happy! He thanked his mom and kept playing in his tent. The bunny was very proud of his tent and thanked his mom every day for helping him fix it.

Once upon a time there was a mom and a dad who wanted a baby. They hoped and wished for a long time, and finally their wish came true!
One day their baby came. The mom and dad were so happy. They loved to cuddle with their baby and give her lots of hugs and kisses.
The baby began to grow, and one day she noticed something in the sky. It was a fat news bird! The baby pointed to the bird and smiled.
The mom and dad smiled too and said that the news bird had a special message for her. The bird flew away while they watched.
The mom and dad understood the special message. They told the baby that it was time for her to grow even more and that they were so happy to have her. The baby was happy too, and they all hugged and gave kisses. 
 
The end.

Once upon a time there was a giraffe who wanted to have some yummy treat. So she looked all around for something to eat. She saw a cup full of yummy treats! She was so excited she decided to shoot up into the sky. But as she was flying, she started to feel dizzy. She couldn't see straight and the cup dropped far away. The giraffe felt so sad she wanted to cry. She didn't know what to do, so she asked the kangaroo for help. The kangaroo jumped high and caught the cup just in time! The giraffe was so happy, she hugged the kangaroo and thanked him very much. The kangaroo was pleased and they both enjoyed the yummy treats together.

Once there was a mommy and a daddy. They wanted to do something special. They decided to go to the airport. The airport was very big and loud. Mommy and Daddy got to the airport and saw lots of people, airplanes and luggage. Mommy and Daddy were so happy!
They got a healthy snack to eat. They had apple slices and oranges. Mommy and Daddy felt so good, they laughed and smiled. They watched the airplanes take off and felt the wind below their feet.
Mommy and Daddy did something special on the airport day. They had a fun time and felt very healthy. They hugged each other and flew away.

Once upon a time there were two friends, a boy and a girl, who really loved hockey. Every day they would go out to the park to play with their hockey kit. They would have a lot of fun balancing the hockey stick on their hands and playing games together.
One day, the park was really busy and they realised that there wasn't enough space for both teams. After thinking it over, they decided to play a fair game. So they each went to the other side of the park, taking turns to balance the hockey stick.
They had so much fun balancing the hockey stick that they lost track of time. When the sun started to set and the park began to empty out, the boy and girl said goodbye and promised to come back and play again soon.
Another day, the two friends would balance the hockey stick together, playing fair and having loads of fun.

Once there was a tall clumsy girl who loved to run. Everywhere she went, a shadow followed her. When she ran, it ran with her.
One day, the girl decided to give her shadow a gift. She looked everywhere, but could not find the perfect present. Finally, she spotted a shiny butterfly. She reached out, grabbed it gently and gave it to her shadow.
The shadow smiled and thanked her. Then it flew away with the butterfly, never to be seen again. 
The girl smiled. Giving away the butterfly made her happy. She had made her shadow happy too.

Once upon a time there was a bird. The bird was very happy and loved to fly high in the sky. Every day the bird would fly around looking for dinner.
One day the bird found something very bad. It was a dark cloud and it was chasing him. The bird flew and flew as fast as he could but the dark cloud kept getting closer.
The bird kept flying until he saw a very bright light. It was so bright that it made the dark cloud go away.
The bright light was coming from a little house in the forest. The bird flew down to say hello, and the people inside welcomed him in. They gave the bird some tasty dinner, and the bird was so happy that he sang a song of thanks.
The bird stayed at the little house for the rest of the day. He was so happy that he had found a safe place and a delicious dinner. He knew he wouldn't have to worry about the bad cloud ever again.

One morning, there was a white storm. The sky was cloudy, and it looked like it would be raining soon. The wind blew the trees until they were swaying.
The little girl who saw the storm looked out her window. She had never seen a storm like this before, and she was very curious. She wanted to go outside and play in it.
The girl asked her mom if she could go outside, but her mom told her "no." She said it wasn't safe to play in the storm. Instead, she let the girl watch it from the window.
The little girl watched the storm for a long time, until it finally stopped. The clouds cleared and the sun started to shine. The girl smiled, happy that she got to see the storm.

Once there was a little bird that lived in the woods. Everyday in the spring, the bird would flutter and play in the woods. One day when the bird was playing, something disturbed it. It was a dull sound. The bird looked around but could not find what was causing the noise. All around her, the birds sang and the flowers bloomed, but the dull sound kept going and going. Suddenly, a big, scary creature appeared! It was a bear. The poor bird was so frightened! But she quickly flew away and the bear roared before going back to his cave. From that day on, the little bird was extra careful in the spring, to make sure she was never disturbed again.

One day, Tom saw a shiny car and wanted to make his own car shine. He asked his mom for help. His mom got out a cloth and some special polish. She started to polish the car. Tom watched as the car began to sparkle in the sun.
Next, Tom wanted to help his mom. He picked up the cloth and started to polish too. His mom smiled and said, "You're doing a great job, Tom!"
When they finished polishing, Tom noticed a scratch on the car. His mom took out a bandage and put it on the scratch. She said, "The bandage will make the car more flexible."
Tom felt proud of his shiny car. He ran to show it to his dad. Together they admired the polishing job they had done.

Once upon a time there was a tiny little penny. She was small and independent. Every day she enjoyed rolling on the ground and playing with the sunbeams.
One day, the sky got really dark and it started to rain. Drops of water tapped all around the penny. She hurried and rolled as quickly as she could but the rain was too strong. Soon she was very wet, and cold.
The penny lay in the grass, sad and damp. Suddenly a friendly breeze began to blow and the rain started to stop. Slowly, the penny began to dry. She felt warm and happy again.
The penny smiled. She was thankful to the warm breeze for helping her dry. She curled up and rolled down the hill, happy and independent. The sun beamed and the penny enjoyed the rest of her day.

Once upon a time, there was a rabbit named Jack. He loved to eat all kinds of healthy food. Early one morning, Jack hopped into the meadow to look for something delicious to eat. When he arrived, he saw a big patch of juicy carrots. Jack was so excited that he started to munch on them right away! 
Jack was so busy eating that he didn't realize he was in the shade of the big oak tree. The shade felt so nice and cool, so Jack decided to have a nap. He was feeling warm from all the eating, but the shade made him feel much better.
After his nap, Jack thanked the tree for providing such a nice and healthy place to rest. Then he hopped off into the meadow again, in search of more delicious foods!

The train was impressive. It was big and shiny. Jenna looked out the window and gasped with delight. The scenery flew past as the train sped down the track.
Jenna's mom leaned over and asked, "Do you want to know a secret?" Jenna's eyes lit up and she nodded. Mom continued, "I can lift the train!" Jenna's jaw dropped. She said, "Really?"
Mom smiled and said, “Yes, I can lift the train up with my hands!” Jenna thought it was so cool. “Can you teach me how to do it?” she asked eagerly. Mom nodded and said, “Maybe one day when you get bigger, I'll show you!” 
Jenna couldn't wait. She kept smiling as the train rolled on, admiring the impressive sight outside her window.

Once upon a time there was a boy called Jack. He was only 3 years old but he wanted to find something exciting.
One day, Jack looked around the house. He wanted to find something fun. Suddenly, Jack saw something shiny. He looked closer and it was a trumpet!
Jack picked it up and he put it to his lips. He blew as hard as he could and then, a big, loud noise came from the trumpet.
He loved it! He took it with him everywhere he went. He also loved to try new things, so he decided to make his trumpet even more exciting.
He added many different spices, such as chilli and pepper, to make his trumpet spicy. When he blew the trumpet, it made a very spicy sound and it was so delicious, he couldn't stop smiling.
Jack was so excited that he had found such a fun thing, and he enjoyed playing with his spicy trumpet every day!

Once there was a young bull. He was alone in the field but he didn't mind. He just liked to lean against the big tree. From there he could look out and see the whole world.
One day, two kids came to the field. They were only three years old, just like the bull! One of the kids looked at the young bull and asked the other, "What is that?". The other kid said, "It's a bull, and it's leaning against that big tree".
The three kids were so excited! They came closer and closer to the young bull and he didn't move away. The kids patted and hugged the young bull. He was so happy! The kids stayed there for a long time, laughing and playing with the young bull. 
When it became dark, the kids said goodbye to the young bull. He waved at them and went back to leaning against the big tree. He was happy and contented.

There was a package on the table. It was weird and shiny. The little girl wanted to grab it. She wanted to know what was inside. She reached for it, but it was too high for her to reach. 
The girl was sad. She stood on her tippy-toes but she still couldn't stretch far enough. Then she had an idea. She grabbed a chair and used it to help her reach the package. 
She was so excited when her fingers touched the package. She cradled it in her hands and pulled it close to her chest. 
She was also very curious. She carefully lifted the lid and peeked inside. It was full of candy! The girl's eyes lit up with excitement. She quickly snatched one and popped it in her mouth and enjoyed it. 
She felt so happy. She couldn't wait to share her sweet surprise with all her friends.

Once upon a time there was a girl named Lola. Lola was three years old and liked to share her toys with her friends. One day, Lola was playing her favourite game, but when her friend Sarah arrived, something weird happened.
Sarah was surprised to see that Lola was not sharing the game with her like she always did. This was very strange! Lola smiled and said, "I have a surprise! I am going to share it with you!" 
Lola gave Sarah a shock. She had something special up her sleeve, and it was a surprise. Sarah was thrilled! She said, "It's so weird! Is it really a surprise?"
Lola smiled and said, "Yes! Let's share it together." Lola and Sarah opened the box and saw something wonderful inside! It was a beautiful, sparkly toy. 
Both girls were overjoyed and shared the toy together. They laughed and hugged each other, celebrating their amazing discovery. From then on, Lola and Sarah shared many more surprises!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved sweets and pastries. One day, she went to the bakery with her mom. She saw a yummy pastry and asked her mom if she could have it. Her mom said yes and bought it for her.
Lily took a big bite of the pastry, but it tasted bad. She made a face and said, "Mommy, this pastry tastes bad. Can I have a different one?" Her mom said, "Of course, let's go pick out a different pastry."
Lily picked out a chocolate pastry and it tasted much better. She smiled and said, "This pastry is yummy! Thank you, mommy." Her mom replied, "You're welcome, Lily. I'm glad you like it." And they lived happily ever after, enjoying delicious pastries together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily wanted to go to the park but her mom was too busy to take her. Lily felt sad because she really wanted to go. 
Suddenly, a bus stopped in front of her house. A nice bus driver asked her if she wanted to go for a ride. Lily was so happy and said yes. 
When they arrived at the park, Lily saw a boy who had a big, disgusting ice cream cone. She really wanted one too but she didn't have any money. The boy saw that she was sad and said, "I can share my ice cream with you, but you have to pay me." 
Lily didn't know what to do. She didn't have any money. The bus driver saw what was happening and said, "Don't worry, Lily. I will pay for the ice cream." Lily was so happy and thanked the bus driver. She had a wonderful day at the park and made a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a kind and generous grandma. She loved to bake cookies and share them with her friends. One day, she made a big batch of cookies and put them in a jar. She said to her granddaughter, "Would you like to help me mail these cookies to our friends?"
The granddaughter was excited to help her grandma. They went to the post office and put the jar of cookies in a big envelope. The postman said, "What a generous gift! Your friends will be very happy to receive these cookies in the mail."
As they walked back home, the granddaughter asked, "Grandma, can I have a pill for my headache?" The grandma replied, "Of course, dear. Let me get you some water to take the pill with." The granddaughter felt better and said, "Thank you, grandma. You're the best!"

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his blocks. He had a big pile of blocks that he would stack up and knock down. One day, Timmy received a new set of blocks from his grandma. He was so excited to play with them!
