Even though the erase was weak, it still did its job. Everyone was so happy that they got the chance to write on the new blackboard!

The sun was setting on a warm summer evening. Sam and Bella were sitting on their porch, discussing their plans for the evening. Sam wanted to stay home and play with his toys, but Bella wanted to do something more adventurous.
"Let's explore the forest," said Bella.
Sam was very excited. "We can climb trees and look for bugs and birds!" he said.
So Sam and Bella put on their shoes and grabbed a flashlight. They opened the door to the forest, and soon they were exploring in the darkness. They heard crickets chirping and the breeze rustling through the trees.
They discovered so many new things. They saw a groundhog and a fox and even an owl! Sam and Bella had the most adventurous and exciting evening.  When it was time to go home, they both agreed that exploring the forest was the best idea ever.

Once upon a time, there was a nosy girl named Sarah. She was always pretending to be something in the world of make-believe. One day, she had a great idea! She was going to pretend to be a racecar, driving around as fast as she could. She ran around the backyard, speeding in circles.
The next day, Sarah was ready to pretend racecars again. But this time, she surprised herself when she felt like she was really going faster than before. She couldn't believe it! She was actually going faster than ever before.
Sarah couldn't believe it! It was almost like she had gotten some kind of magical boost of speed. Little did she know that her family had bought her a big-wheeled scooter the night before.
The scooter was the perfect tool for Sarah to pretend she was a racecar. She zipped around the yard, pretending to win races. She was so happy with her newfound speed that she kept pretending for days!

Andy and Jane were playing in the living room. Suddenly, Andy heard a noise coming from behind the curtain. He shouted "What is that?" Jane was scared and ran away. Andy didn't know what to do, so he decided to take a peek. He bravely opened the curtain and his heart felt hurt when he saw a mouse. He didn't know how to deal with this and he started to shout and scream. Jane, who had been hiding, came back to help him and she shouted too, which scared the mouse away. Andy and Jane hugged each other and they were relieved that there was no more conflict.

Nina and her mum went to the market. They walked around and looked at all the fruits, vegetables and sweets. Nina was so excited. 
Suddenly, she felt something slip out of her hand. She looked down and saw that she had lost her favourite toy. She started to cry.
Her mum could see that Nina was very upset. She quickly asked some of the people around the market if they had seen it. But no one had.
Nina's mum was becoming angry. She bought Nina some sweets and a balloon to cheer her up. 
They continued to look for Nina's toy. After some time they finally found it! Nina was so happy and hugged her mum tight.

Once there was a lonely gem. It was tucked away in a corner all by itself. Then one day it decided to break free. It tumbled out and was no longer lonely.
The gem rolled and jumped around the room. Everything seemed so new! The walls were so high and the floor so wide. The gem felt so happy and free.
Then suddenly it saw something new. It was a boy! The gem sparkled in the sun and the boy saw it. He picked it up and smiled. The gem felt so special.
The boy brought the gem outside and put it on a rock. Then the boy jumped into a puddle and made a big splash. The gem couldn't help but laugh and smile.
The gem and the boy had so much fun together. They laughed and played around for hours. The gem was so glad it had broken free. Now it was never lonely again.

Sally was sitting in her room and looking out the window. She was sad because her mommy had told her to stay inside and play by herself. She wanted to go to the grocery store to get something yummy.
Suddenly, Sally heard a slow knock on her door. It was her mommy. She said, “Sally, how about if we go to the grocery store? Let’s get something special for dinner!”
Sally was so happy. She quickly put on her shoes and ran down the stairs and outside. They slowly drove to the grocery store. On the way, her mommy told Sally about all the different things they could buy.
When they arrived, Sally saw all the different colors, shapes, and smells. She wanted everything! But her mommy told her to be slow and pick just one thing.
Sally saw some yummy ice cream and decided to get it. As they drove home, Sally’s mommy told her stories about the neighborhood and the stars in the sky.
When they got home, Sally’s mommy and daddy enjoyed the ice cream and smiled at Sally. It was a great day!

Mia and Mark were best friends. They did everything together. One day Mia and Mark were playing in the park. They saw an interesting circle on the ground. 
"What is that?" asked Mia to Mark.
"I don't know," replied Mark. 
Mark leaned in and listened. To Mia's surprise, a silly voice started to come from the circle! They both looked at each other and were surprised.
"Let's listen more," Mia said.
Mark and Mia listened to the silly voice coming from the circle. They heard jokes and funny stories that made them giggle and laugh. They listened to the voice until it was time to go home. 
Mia and Mark smiled and had fun. They loved the silly stories from the circle and thought it was the best day ever.

Once upon a time, there was a frightened little animal called Jim. Jim was very small and liked to hide away from people who might hurt him.
One day, Jim was walking around in the forest when he saw a big cane. He thought the cane looked very dangerous and began to get very frightened. He wanted to run away and hide, but the cane was too close.
Suddenly, the cane started to move and Jim realised it was a snake. The snake was moving closer and closer and Jim was petrified. He was so frightened that he couldn't move. 
Just as the snake was about to bite him, he closed his eyes and thought of his family. He realised that if something happened to him, they would all be very worried. Suddenly, he found the courage to turn around, face the snake and scare it away.
Jim learnt an important lesson that day: no matter how small or frightened you are, you can find the courage to stand up for yourself and protect your family.

Once upon a time, there was an honest ostrich. Her name was Tilly. She liked to run and play in the fields near her home. 
One day, Tilly ran around so much that she got very tired. Then, to her surprise, she fell asleep. 
As she slept something remarkable happened. She began to levitate! Suddenly, Tilly flew above the trees and all over the sky! 
A nearby farmer saw Tilly and he started shouting at her. 
"Come down, Tilly! Come down this instant!", he yelled. 
Tilly nervously called out to the farmer, "I'm sorry, but I don't know how to get back down."
The farmer replied, "You have to trust your instincts and let yourself fall. It will be like you're taking a big jump, but just trust and you'll land safely." 
So, Tilly trusted and fell. And, just like the farmer said, she landed on her feet, safe and sound.

Once upon a time there was a tall tree in the woods. The tree shivered and trembled in the wind. There was a mist in the air, making everything feel strange and cool.
The tall tree was scared. It shook and quivered as the mist floated by. The tree wanted to run but it just couldn't. It wished for a friend to help it feel better.
Then one day, a little bird flew down from the sky and landed on the tall tree. The bird was gentle and kind. The tree stopped trembling and felt safe.
The bird sang a beautiful song and the mist slowly disappeared. The bird stayed with the tall tree for a long, long time and the tree was never scared again.

Once there was a boy who loved to play. He always played with his best friend, the staff. One day, the boy heard a loud noise. He was so frightened he hid in the corner. He didn't move, even when his best friend, the staff, tried to come closer. The staff tried to help the boy but he was too scared. Eventually the noise stopped but the boy was still scared. He never played with his staff again.

Once upon a Tuesday, there was a jolly little girl named Jane. She loved to explore the outdoors and was always wondering what she would find.
One day, Jane was walking through the park and she wondered if she would find something fun. As she continued walking, she saw an old man sitting on a bench. Jane thought he looked very kind and went to talk to him. 
The old man said hello and smiled. Jane said hello back and asked, "What are you doing here?"
The old man said, "I like to come to this bench on Tuesdays and wonder about the world. It makes me happy." 
Jane smiled and thought this was a jolly idea. She sat on the bench with him and asked, "What should I wonder about first?"
The old man said, "Well, what do you think would make you the happiest?"
Jane thought for a moment and said, "I think I'd like to wonder what a rainbow looks like up close." 
The old man smiled and said, "Let's go find it!"
And off they went, wondering what they would find.

One day, Tom went on a long journey. He sailed across the sea and arrived at an island. Tom felt confused when he first arrived and saw that the island was huge and mysterious. 
Tom was also scared because he didn't know what might be on the island. He thought he heard strange noises as he got closer and closer. Suddenly, he started to shiver, as the atmosphere on the island was so cold and eerie.
Tom was brave and decided to explore the island. He soon found the source of the noise. It was a large and friendly dog who was barking. Tom was very happy to find the dog. He decided to take the dog with him and sailed away from the island.
Tom returned back to his hometown with his new friend. He was glad that he was brave enough to explore the island and faced his fear. Tom and his dog were very happy together and will never forget the experience on the mysterious island.

Molly was a funny girl. She was three years old and loved to play with her friends. One day, she wanted to make her meal special, so she asked her mom for some sauce. Her mom said yes, and Molly was really happy. 
But when Molly put the sauce on her food, it was way too spicy for her to eat. She tried to resist the heat, but it was too strong. She knew that the sauce was stupid and she should have asked her mom for something else. 
Molly went back to her mom and asked for something milder. Her mom smiled and gave her a jar of mild sauce this time. Molly was so relieved, and she put the mild sauce on her food. It was just what she needed and she was able to enjoy her meal. 
Molly was happy that she resisted the heat of the spicy sauce. From that day, she would always look for milder options when it came to her meals.

Binny wanted to stay warm, so she put on her coat and hat. She went outside and felt the cold air on her cheeks. She was excited to slide on the snow. 
She stepped into the snow and the texture was rough and squishy. Grinning, she started walking. She was peaceful and happy. 
Suddenly, she slipped and nearly fell, but then she remembered her mom’s words. She could be safe if she “yielded” -she should just move slowly and carefully, like a snail. So Binny took a deep breath, bent her knees and closed her eyes. 
After a few seconds, she opened her eyes and realized that she was still standing. She had yielded to the cold ground and stayed safe. With a satisfied nod, she continued her adventure.

Once upon a time there lived a little weatherfish called Flipper. He lived in a reef in the middle of the sea. Every day, Flipper would swim around looking for food. Most of all, he loved to wrap food in seaweed and eat it! 
One day, Flipper noticed some other fish swimming towards him. They were a popular kind of fish, and they were carrying a package. Flipper greeted them and said, 'Hello, what do you have there?' 
The fish smiled and said, 'We have a special package for the reef. We want to wrap it around the reef so that it can protect it from the wind and the waves.' 
Flipper was excited. He asked, 'How can I help?' 
The fish replied, 'We need your help to wrap it around the reef. Will you join us?' 
Flipper agreed and he started wrapping the package around the reef. He was very careful and wrapped it tightly. 
The other fish thanked Flipper and said, 'You did a great job! Now the reef is safe and protected.' 
Flipper was very happy and swam away in the sea. He was glad he could help protect his reef!

Once upon a time there was a boy who was very eager. He wanted to play and tease everyone he saw because he thought it was fun. 
One day, the boy decided to tease an old man who was sitting at a park. The old man didn't look happy about it. He just stared back at the boy in silence. 
The boy thought the old man didn't understand his teasing. So he kept coming closer and closer to the old man and continued to tease him. 
Finally, the old man stood up. He was bigger and stronger than the boy had thought. He looked very mad and said, "Don't tease me anymore." 
The boy was scared and ran away. He was sad and wished he had stopped teasing the old man sooner. He learned a lesson that day: never tease the old man because he is hard to deal with.

Once upon a time there was a team of special people. They made sure that things that were broken got fixed. That was their job - to repair them. 
One day, the team heard about a mysterious broken thing in a far away place. So they got their tools, hopped on a big truck, and went to the mysterious place.
When the team arrived, the broken thing was very big. But the team wasn't scared. They smiled and said "Let's fix it!" 
So they worked together, with their tools and special parts. They worked hard until finally the mysterious thing was repaired. 
The team cheered and said goodbye to the mysterious place. They knew they had done a very good job.

Nina was a brave little girl. She loved exploring and finding new things. One day, she was playing in the woods when she came across a swamp.
At first, Nina was very curious. She wanted to know what was inside the swamp. But then she felt a little bit frightened. She took a few steps back and hesitated.
Finally, Nina made a decision and grabbed hold of a nearby tree branch. She began to move closer and closer to the swamp until she was right on the edge.
Nina took a deep breath and then she opened the swamp. Inside, she found a treasure! There were all kinds of shiny gems and valuable items lying around. Nina was so happy that she had been brave enough to overcome her fear.

Once upon a time there were two friends, John and Ann. They went outside to play in the cold weather.
John said to Ann, "Let's crawl together!"
Ann said, "No, I want to do some work. I'm too cold to crawl!"
John didn't want to listen. He kept crawling and said, "C'mon Ann, it's so much fun!"
Ann stayed still and said, "No, I'm cold and want to do something else!"
John got really angry. He said, "Fine, I'm going to crawl by myself then!" He crawled away angrily.
But he quickly got cold and lonely. He realized he missed Ann! He crawled back to her and said, "Can we play together now, Ann? I'm sorry I was so mad."
Ann smiled, and said, "Yes, let's play together!"
They crawled back to the house, laughing and having fun!

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Grace. Grace was three years old and she had a mom and dad who loved her very much. One day, Grace and her parents went on an adventure to the park.
Grace was so excited! She ran around the park and played with all the other kids. Suddenly, Grace noticed that her coat was missing. Where could it be? Grace was starting to get scared.
Just then, she saw her dad running towards her with her coat in his hands. He had rescued it from getting caught on a bush! Grace was so happy that her dad had rescued her coat. She hugged him tightly and thanked him.
Grace was so excited to have her coat back that she skipped around the park for the rest of the day! She had a wonderful time with her mom and dad and was never so happy to be reunited with her coat.

Once upon a time, there were two bunnies who were furry and cuddly. They loved to hop around and explore the world.
One day, the two bunnies saw a house on a hill with a great view of the valley. They wanted to see what it was like inside, so they hopped up to the door and knocked.
"Who is it?" a voice from inside shouted. The bunnies were surprised, and a little scared. But one of them was brave enough to answer.
"We're just two bunnies who want to see the view from your house," he said.
After a long wait, the door opened and a friendly old woman appeared. She smiled and invited the bunnies to come in and look out at the view.
The bunnies were so happy to see the valley. As they watched, the sun began to set and the sky melted into beautiful colors.
The bunnies took a deep breath and thanked the old woman.
"Always take the time to enjoy the beauty around you," she said.
The bunnies hopped back to their home, thinking about what the old woman had said. From that day on, they made sure to appreciate all the wonderful views in their lives and to never forget the beauty that melts away too quickly.

Once upon a time there was a little girl who was very curious about everything. She was always looking for new things to discover and explore. One day, she came across a box with a big red ribbon on it. Inside the box was a magic wand.
The little girl couldn't believe her eyes and immediately picked up the wand. She waved it around and said the magical words, "Abracadabra!" Suddenly, the wand began to glow and sparkle.
The girl was so excited that she began to laugh. She laughed and laughed until she accidentally broke the wand in two. "Uh oh," she said nervously.
Suddenly, a funny fairy appeared and said, "Don't be sad! I know how to fix it!" With one flick of her wand, the magic wand was fixed!
The girl was so happy to have her magic wand back that she danced around with glee. She thanked the fairy for helping her fix the broken wand and went on her way.

Molly was so excited. Today was her first day of preschool! As she arrived she noticed a big picture on the wall. She wanted to take a closer look but she slipped on the way there. She felt embarrassed and a bit scared. She didn't know anybody yet, so she felt ignorant and alone. 
Suddenly she felt a gentle hand touch her shoulder. It was her teacher. She was so kind and understanding. She helped Molly get up and brought her closer to the picture. It was a painting of a big rainbow. Molly looked around and saw that everyone was enjoying the picture. She started to feel better and soon made friends with some of the other children. 
Molly realized that nobody was ignorant; they were all just getting to know each other! She was glad she decided to come to preschool and was even more excited to learn more!

John was a big rabbit who loved to explore the forest. He jumped through the trees and hopped around in the grass, looking for interesting things. One day, he spotted a pattern on the ground and he wanted to get closer and have a look. He started hopping towards it, but then he saw something big and scary in the distance - a bear!
John was scared and wanted to escape, so he quickly hopped away. He hopped faster and faster, running away from the bear. He kept running until he couldn't run anymore, but he was still far away from the pattern he had been looking at. He was safe, but he couldn't get to the pattern.
Sadly, John had to give up and go home. He never got to explore the pattern and he was disappointed. He knew he had been brave to try, but he couldn't escape the bear.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He was three years old and loved to explore the forest near his house. One day, he decided to go deep into the forest by himself. As he got further and further away from his house, he started to get fearful. 
Suddenly, a loud noise came from behind the trees. Tim was scared and he ran and ran until he came to a door. He stopped and saw a man near the door. The man grabbed something from his pocket, pointed it at the door and shouted, "BANG!"
Tim was very scared and started to cry. He asked the man why he shot the door. The man explained that he was looking for treasure inside and thought the door might be locked. Tim was still very fearful and started to run away. But the man said in a soft voice, "Wait! I won't hurt you."
Tim stopped and slowly turned around. With a sigh of relief, he saw the man smile at him. He smiled back and finally, Tim realised he was no longer scared. The man gave him a hug and they walked back home together.

Once upon a time, there was a generous rabbit that lived in a castle. He loved to chew on delicious carrots, and he always made sure to leave some for his friends in the castle.
Every day the rabbit would chew on a big, juicy carrot, and then take little nibbles for the other animals in the castle. He was so generous with his carrots, that he became known as the Carrot King!
All of the other animals in the castle were very happy to have the Carrot King around. He was a kind and gentle rabbit, always willing to share and help others.
When the other animals needed help, they would come to the Carrot King and ask for carrots. He was always happy to share, and would give them as many carrots as they wanted.
The Carrot King was loved and respected by all the animals in the castle. He was the king of generosity!

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim had a bicycle that he loved to ride every day. One day, Tim saw a wise old man sitting on a bench. The old man had a long white beard and a kind smile.
Tim rode his bicycle over to the old man and said hello. The old man looked at Tim and said, "You are a smart young boy." Tim felt proud when he heard this.
Suddenly, a big fly landed on Tim's nose. Tim tried to swat the fly away, but it wouldn't go. The old man saw Tim struggling and said, "Sometimes, when a fly won't go, you have to give it a little slap." Tim followed the old man's advice and the fly flew away.
Tim thanked the old man and rode his bicycle home, feeling happy and wise.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved animals, especially wild ones like lions and tigers. One day, Timmy's friend Jack invited him to go on a safari. Timmy was very excited and quickly packed his bag.
When they arrived, Timmy saw all kinds of animals he had never seen before. He saw a monkey swinging from a tree, a giraffe with a long neck, and even a crocodile with a big crack in its tooth! Timmy was amazed and couldn't stop smiling.
As the sun set, Timmy and Jack sat around the campfire and talked about all the wild animals they had seen. Timmy was so grateful that Jack had invited him on this adventure. He knew it was a day he would never forget.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat grapes, especially the purple ones. One day, she saw a grape on the ground and picked it up. She wondered if it was still good to eat.
Lily tried the grape and it was delicious! She was so happy that she found a yummy grape. But then, she dropped the grape and it rolled away. Lily searched and searched for the grape, but it was persistent in hiding from her.
Finally, Lily found the grape under a chair. She was so happy to find it again and ate it right away. From then on, Lily always made sure to hold onto her grapes tightly so they wouldn't roll away again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He liked to play with his toy guns and pretend to shoot bad guys. One day, Timmy's dad took him to the gas station to fill up their car. Timmy saw a man with a confused look on his face trying to figure out how to pump gas into his car. Timmy's dad helped the man and they all drove away happy. Later that day, Timmy played with his toy gun and pretended to shoot the bad guys, but he knew that helping people like his dad did at the gas station was the real way to be a hero.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily had a favorite toy, a teddy bear named Brownie. One day, Lily's friend Tommy came to visit her.
Tommy said, "Hi Lily, can I play with Brownie?"
Lily thought for a moment and then said, "Yes, you can share Brownie with me."
Tommy was happy and they started to play together. But after a while, it started to get dark outside.
Lily said, "Tommy, it's getting dark. I think it's time for you to go home."
Tommy replied, "Okay Lily, I'm ready to go home now. Thank you for sharing Brownie with me." 
Lily smiled and said, "You're welcome Tommy. See you soon!"

Once upon a time, there was a big house with lots of rooms. A family of bears lived there. Mama bear, Papa bear and Baby bear. Baby bear liked to play hide and seek. One day, Baby bear went upstairs to hide. Mama bear called out, "Baby bear, where are you?" But Baby bear didn't answer. Mama bear looked everywhere but couldn't find Baby bear. She thought Baby bear was lying and hiding. Finally, she found Baby bear in a big closet. Baby bear giggled and said, "You found me!"

Once upon a time, there was a big, strong horse named Brownie. Brownie loved to run and play in the fields all day long. One day, Brownie met a little duck named Ducky. Ducky was lost and didn't know how to find her way back home. Brownie knew he had to help Ducky, so he led her back to her family.
As they were walking, Brownie noticed that Ducky was very tired and weak. He asked her if she had eaten anything, and Ducky said no. Brownie knew he had to do something to help her. He went to the farm and found a whip of hay. He brought it back to Ducky and she ate it all up.
After that day, Brownie and Ducky became the best of friends. Brownie learned that it was important to help others, even if they were different from him. And Ducky learned that sometimes, the strongest friends are the ones who are the most caring and kind.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved chocolate more than anything in the world. One day, her mommy let her have a big piece of chocolate. It was mighty delicious!
But then, Lily started feeling a little funny. Her tummy started hurting and she felt sick. Her mommy told her that too much chocolate can make you feel sick. 
From that day on, Lily learned that she should only have a little bit of chocolate at a time. She still loved it, but she was careful not to eat too much. And every time she had a little bit, she remembered how mighty delicious it was, but also how important it was to not eat too much.

Once upon a time, there were two friends who loved playing together. They always had fun and laughed a lot. One day, they found a toy they both really liked. They both wanted to play with it at the same time, but there was only one toy. They didn't know what to do.
One of the friends had an idea. "Let's separate the toy and each play with one part," he said. The other friend didn't like this idea. "I don't want to do that," she said. "I think we should take turns playing with the whole toy."
They talked about it for a while, but they couldn't agree. They each had a different opinion. Finally, they decided to be honest with each other and say how they really felt. They both listened to each other and then came up with a solution they both liked. They took turns playing with the whole toy and had fun together again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to go on journeys with her mommy and daddy. One day, they decided to go on a journey to a big green forest. 
As they walked through the forest, Lily looked around and saw many trees and animals. She saw a big brown bear and a little green frog. 
"Look, mommy! A frog!" Lily said.
"Yes, Lily. It's a little green frog," her mommy replied.
After a while, they came to a beautiful waterfall. Lily loved the sound of the water falling down. 
"This journey is so much fun!" Lily said.
"I'm glad you're having a good time, sweetie," her daddy said. 
After a long day of walking, they went back home. Lily was tired but happy from her journey in the green forest.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved playing with bubbles. She would blow them and watch them float in the air. One day, she blew a big bubble and it popped on her face. She got mad and started crying.
Her mommy came and hugged her tightly. She wiped away her tears and said, "Don't worry, Lily. It's okay. Let's make some more bubbles." Lily smiled and they started blowing bubbles again. They even added some delicious bubble solution to make them taste good.
Lily was so happy and forgot all about her bubble popping on her face. She hugged her mommy and said, "Thank you for making me feel better." Her mommy hugged her back and said, "I love you, Lily." They continued to blow bubbles and have fun together.

Once upon a time, there was a monkey who lived in the jungle. One day, the monkey got confused and lost his way. He climbed up a tall tree to try and see where he was, but he still couldn't figure it out. Suddenly, he saw a bird flying by with a banana in its beak. The monkey knew that the bird must have come from the direction of the banana trees. So, he decided to follow the bird and see where it would lead him. 
After a while, the bird landed on a branch and the banana fell to the ground. The monkey quickly ran over and grabbed the banana. As he was eating it, he heard a loud noise. It was a hunter who had been tracking the monkey. The monkey knew he had to escape, so he quickly climbed up a nearby tree. The hunter tried to catch him, but the monkey was too quick. He used his strong arms to release himself from the hunter's grasp and ran away back into the jungle.

Once upon a time, there was a little bear named Teddy. Teddy loved going on picnics with his friends in the forest. One day, while they were eating sandwiches and cookies, they heard a loud noise. It was their friend, the rabbit, who got stuck in a tree. Teddy knew he had to rescue him. 
Teddy was very flexible, so he climbed the tree to save the rabbit. The rabbit was very happy to be rescued and thanked Teddy. They all continued their picnic and had lots of fun. From that day on, Teddy became a hero in the forest and everyone wanted to be his friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play with her toys and her cat, Mittens. One day, Lily's mom gave her a pretty vase. It was shiny and had flowers on it. Lily loved it very much and put it on her dresser. 
That night, Lily was scared of the dark. She saw shadows on her wall that looked like monsters. But then, she saw Mittens waving his tail and she felt better. Mittens jumped up on her dresser and accidentally knocked over the vase! 
Lily was sad that her vase broke, but she knew it was just an accident. She hugged Mittens and went to sleep feeling happy that her cat was there to wave his tail and make her feel better.

Once upon a time, there was a big train. It went chugga chugga choo choo all day long. One day, the train got tired and needed to rest. 
The train found a nice spot under a tree and took a nap. It felt much better after a good rest. 
Later, a kind man came by and gave the train some water and snacks. The man was very generous and the train was very happy. 
From then on, the train made sure to rest and take breaks when it needed to. And it always remembered the generous man who helped it when it was tired.

One day, a little girl named Lily went for a walk with her mommy. They saw a dog on the street. The dog was very sad. Lily asked her mommy why the dog was sad. Her mommy said that maybe the dog lost his toy or his owner. Lily wanted to help the dog. She asked her mommy if they can give the dog a treat. Her mommy said yes. They gave the dog a treat and the dog looked happy. Lily was happy too.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to go to the gym with her mommy and daddy. The gym was a big room with lots of toys and games to play with. 
One day, Lily's mommy asked her to help wrap a present for her friend's birthday. Lily was so excited to help! She used some paper and tape to wrap the present up nice and pretty. 
After they finished wrapping, Lily's mommy said, "Let's clean up the gym before we go home." Lily helped put all the toys away and wipe down the tables. She was happy to help her mommy and make the gym clean and tidy. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys all day long. He had a big collection of cars, trucks, and planes. Timmy's mom would always tell him to be patient when he got upset because he couldn't find his favorite toy.
One day, Timmy's teacher read a poem in class about sharing. The poem said that when we share our toys with others, we make new friends and everyone is happy. Timmy thought about the poem and decided to share his toys with his friends at school.
When Timmy shared his toys, he made new friends and had even more fun playing. Timmy learned that sharing is important and that it's okay to be patient when things don't go our way. From that day on, Timmy always shared his toys and was a happy boy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toy trains. He had a big train set in his room with lots of tracks and trains to play with.
One day, Timmy's mom made him some soup for lunch. She told him to wait until the steam stopped coming out of the bowl before he could eat it. Timmy didn't understand what she meant by "steam", but he saw the hot air coming out of the soup and knew that it was hot.
Timmy's dad came into the room and saw Timmy playing with his trains. He asked Timmy if he wanted to measure how long the train tracks were. Timmy didn't know what "measure" meant, but his dad showed him how to use a ruler to find out how long the tracks were.
Timmy had a fun day playing with his trains and eating his harmless soup. He learned some new words too, like "steam" and "measure".

Once upon a time, there was a big, fierce lion. He lived in a jungle with many other animals. One day, the lion got hurt while playing with his friends. His paw hurt so much that he couldn't walk anymore. The other animals didn't know what to do, so they went to ask the wise owl for help.
The owl said that they needed a mechanic to fix the lion's paw. The animals didn't know what a mechanic was, so the owl explained that it's someone who fixes things. The animals searched the jungle and finally found a kind monkey who was a mechanic. The monkey was happy to help and asked for permission to fix the lion's paw.
The lion was scared at first, but the monkey was gentle and kind. He fixed the lion's paw and soon the lion could walk again. The other animals were so happy and grateful to the monkey. They realized that sometimes we need help from others and it's okay to ask for permission to get the help we need.

Once upon a time, there was a little chicken named Chickie. Chickie was very selfish, which means she only thought about herself and not others. One day, Chickie found a big bowl and decided to fill it with all the yummy corn she could find. She didn't want to share with her chicken friends because she was too selfish. 
But then, a big storm came and all the corn was blown away. Chickie was sad and hungry. Her chicken friends came to help her and shared their corn with her. Chickie learned that it's important to share and not be selfish. From that day on, Chickie always filled her bowl with enough corn to share with her friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a big green house with her mom and dad. One day, Lily's dad told her they were going to visit a farm. Lily was very excited because she loved animals.
When they got to the farm, Lily saw lots of animals. She saw cows, pigs, and chickens. But her favorite animals were the sheep. They were very quiet and fluffy. Lily wanted to touch the sheep, but her dad told her to be careful.
Suddenly, the sheep started to rush away. Lily was sad because she didn't get to touch them. But then, one of the sheep came back and let Lily pet her. Lily was very happy and she thanked the sheep for being so nice. From that day on, Lily loved sheep even more.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved playing with balloons. One day, Lily's mom gave her a big, red balloon. Lily was so happy and played with it all day long.
Later that day, Lily's mom made some soup for dinner. Lily asked, "Mommy, can I taste the soup?" Her mom said, "Be careful, it's very hot." Lily blew on the soup and tasted it. She said, "Yummy! It's thick and yummy!"
After dinner, Lily was still playing with her balloon. She accidentally let go of it and it flew away into the sky. Lily was sad, but her mom said, "Don't worry, Lily. We'll get you another balloon tomorrow." The next day, they went to the store and got a new balloon. Lily was happy again and played with it all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved animals, especially puppies. One day, Lily's parents took her to the park to play. While they were there, a little puppy came up to Lily and wagged its tail. 
Lily was so happy to see the puppy and wanted to pet it. But her parents told her that she couldn't because they didn't know if the puppy was harmless or not. 
Lily didn't understand why she couldn't pet the puppy, so she asked her parents why. Her parents explained that sometimes puppies can be dangerous and might bite. They didn't want Lily to get hurt. 
Lily understood and agreed not to pet the puppy. She didn't want to get hurt either. The puppy seemed sad that Lily refused to pet him, but Lily's parents explained that it was for her safety. In the end, Lily went home happy and safe, knowing that she made the right choice.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a big house with a large porch. One day, she was sitting on the porch with her mommy.
Lily said, "Mommy, I'm thirsty. Can I have some juice please?"
Mommy said, "Sure, Lily. I'll get you some juice."
As they were waiting for the juice, Lily saw her neighbor's dog running around. She said, "Mommy, I don't like that dog. He's always barking and I can't play outside."
Mommy replied, "I know, Lily. But we can't complain about the dog. He's just doing what dogs do."
Lily thought about it for a moment and said, "Okay, mommy. But can we play inside instead?"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw and color. One day, Lily's mommy brought home a big turkey for dinner. 
Lily saw the turkey and said, "Wow, that's a big bird!" 
Her mommy said, "Yes, it is. But we have to cook it first before we can eat it." 
Lily thought for a moment and said, "I have an idea! Let's draw a picture of the turkey before we cook it." 
Her mommy thought that was a creative idea, so they took out their crayons and drew a picture of the turkey. 
After they finished drawing, they put the turkey in the oven to cook. When it was done, they took it out and put it on the table. 
Lily said, "Now we can eat the turkey and remember how creative we were when we drew it!"

Once upon a time, there was an elderly lady who loved oranges. She would count them every day to make sure she had enough. One day, a little boy came to her house and saw all the oranges. He asked, "Why do you have so many oranges?"
The elderly lady replied, "I love oranges. They are sweet and juicy. I like to count them every day."
The little boy asked, "Can I count them too?"
The elderly lady smiled and said, "Of course, you can count them with me."
So, the little boy and the elderly lady counted all the oranges together. They had so much fun that the little boy came back every day to count oranges with the elderly lady. They became good friends and enjoyed each other's company.

Once upon a time, there was a little rabbit named Benny. Benny loved to play hide and seek with his friends. One day, he found a bulb in the ground and was very enthusiastic about it. 
Benny ran to his friend, the squirrel, and said, "Look, look! I found a bulb! It's so pretty!" 
The squirrel replied, "Wow, that's great! Let's hide it so no one else takes it." 
Benny and the squirrel dug a little hole and placed the bulb inside. They covered it up with dirt and leaves, and then Benny said, "Let's play hide and seek now!" 
They played for hours, but Benny couldn't stop thinking about the bulb. When the game was over, he ran back to the spot where they had hidden it. To his delight, he saw that it had started to grow! Benny was so enthusiastic about his new plant, and he knew he would always treasure it.

Once upon a time, there was a kind girl named Lily. She lived in a big jungle with many animals. One day, Lily saw a leopard who was hurt. She wanted to help the leopard, so she managed to get close to him and give him some food. 
The leopard was happy and grateful to Lily. They became friends and played together every day. But one day, the leopard got scared and attacked Lily. She was hurt badly and couldn't move. 
Lily cried out for help, but no one came. The leopard felt sorry, but it was too late. Lily's kindness had led her to a bad ending.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play outside. One day, she saw a blue butterfly and wanted to catch it. She ran after it, but she didn't watch where she was going and fell down. 
Lily started to cry because she hurt herself. Her mom came outside and asked, "What happened, sweetie?" Lily said, "I fell down and it hurts, please make it better." 
Her mom picked her up and said, "Let's go inside and make sure you're safe." They went inside and put a bandaid on Lily's knee. Her mom said, "Next time, be careful when you run so you don't get hurt." 
Lily felt better and went back outside to play. She saw the blue butterfly again and remembered what her mom said. She walked slowly and carefully towards it and finally caught it in her hands. She was so happy and said, "Thank you, butterfly, for being my friend."

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She liked to wear pretty dresses and shiny shoes. One day, she went to school and her teacher read a poem. Lily liked the poem very much and she clapped her hands.
After school, Lily went to play with her friends. They played tag and hide-and-seek. But then, Lily fell down and hurt her knee. She cried and her friends helped her up. They took her to the teacher who put a bandage on her knee. Lily felt better and thanked her friends for helping her.
That night, Lily's mom read her a bedtime story. Lily fell asleep and dreamt about wearing a beautiful dress and reciting a poem in front of her friends. She felt happy and her knee didn't hurt anymore. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the hot sun. But today, the weather was not so hot. It was cloudy and rainy. Lily was sad because she could not play outside.
Lily's mom had an idea to make her happy. They went to the store to buy decorations. They bought balloons, streamers, and a big banner that said "Happy Birthday". Lily was confused because it was not her birthday. But her mom said they were going to decorate the house to make it look like a party.
Lily helped her mom decorate the house. She put up the balloons and streamers. She was so happy that she forgot about the rainy weather. When they finished decorating, they had a party inside the house. They danced and sang and had so much fun. Lily was no longer sad because she had a fun party inside her house!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to read magazines. He would always ask his mommy to buy him a new one every time they went to the store.
One day, Timmy's mommy bought him a magazine about animals. Timmy was very excited to read it. But mommy told him that some animals can be dangerous and he should be careful.
Timmy asked his mommy, "How can I be safe from dangerous animals?" His mommy replied, "We can prepare by learning about them and staying away from them."
From that day on, Timmy read his magazine every day and learned about all the animals. He knew which ones were dangerous and which ones were not. Timmy felt safe and happy knowing that he was prepared.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy had a toy box with many toys. One day, Timmy's friend came over to play. Timmy's friend wanted to play with Timmy's favorite toy, but Timmy didn't want to share. Timmy's friend got angry and took the toy anyway.
Timmy was worried and sad. He didn't want his friend to take his toy. He went to his mom and said, "Mommy, my friend took my toy. I don't want to share it." His mom said, "It's okay, Timmy. You can separate from your friend and play with your toy by yourself."
Timmy went back to his room and looked for the key to his toy box. He found the key and opened the box. But when he looked inside, his favorite toy was broken. Timmy started crying and wished he had shared his toy with his friend.

Once upon a time, there was a big, fat bear named Coal. Coal loved to eat honey and berries, but one day he ate too much and felt very full. He sighed and decided to take a nap. While he was sleeping, some mischievous squirrels snuck into his cave and stole his honey. When Coal woke up, he was sad and hungry. He looked everywhere for his honey but couldn't find it. Finally, he asked a friendly rabbit for help. The rabbit showed Coal where the squirrels had hidden the honey and Coal was very happy again. From then on, Coal learned to only eat a little bit of honey at a time so he wouldn't feel so full and sleepy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in her backyard. One day, she found a cool hedge that she had never seen before. She wanted to explore it, but her mom said it wasn't safe.
Lily didn't understand why she couldn't play near the hedge. She asked her mom, but her mom just said it was too dangerous. Lily was sad because she really wanted to see what was on the other side.
Later that day, Lily's ball accidentally went over the fence and landed near the hedge. She knew she shouldn't go get it, but she really wanted her ball back. She decided to be brave and go get it.
As she got closer to the hedge, she heard a loud growling noise. She quickly realized that there was a big dog on the other side. She was scared, but she slowly backed away and ran back to her house. She finally understood why her mom said it wasn't safe to play near the hedge.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to draw and cut paper with his scissors. One day, Timmy's mom gave him a new pair of scissors. They were shiny and sharp, unlike his old, dirty ones. Timmy was very happy and hoped to make many new art projects with them.
Timmy's little sister, Lily, also liked to play with scissors. But she was too little and might hurt herself. So Timmy promised to always keep his scissors away from Lily. He hoped she would understand.
One day, Timmy's friend came over to play. They made paper airplanes and cut out pictures from magazines. But Timmy's friend accidentally dropped the scissors on the ground and they got dirty. Timmy was sad, but he knew he could clean them and make them shiny again. He hoped his friend would be more careful next time. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and her favorite toy was a teddy bear. One day, Lily went to the park with her mom and brought her teddy bear in a bag. The sun was shining and the sky was blue.
As they were walking, Lily saw a beautiful butterfly. It was flying in the air and its wings were glowing in the sunlight. Lily wanted to catch it, so she opened her bag and tried to catch the butterfly. But the butterfly flew away.
Lily was sad and wanted to go home. As they were walking back, they saw a big, terrible storm cloud in the sky. It was getting closer and closer. Suddenly, there was a loud thunder and a bright light that made the sky glow. Lily was scared and held onto her mom's hand tightly.
They ran as fast as they could, but they couldn't make it home in time. The storm was too strong and a big tree fell on them. Lily and her mom were hurt and couldn't get up. They called for help, but no one heard them. It was a terrible ending to a beautiful day.

Once upon a time, there was a chubby bunny named Betsy. Betsy loved to eat pastries, especially ones with sprinkles on top. One day, Betsy saw a little bird trying to build a nest in a tree. 
But Betsy didn't like the bird because it made too much noise. She decided to ignore the bird and keep eating her pastry. But the bird didn't give up and kept chirping louder and louder. 
Betsy got angry and tried to scare the bird away, but it wouldn't budge. She realized that ignoring the bird wasn't the right thing to do. So, she decided to share her pastry with the bird as a peace offering. 
The bird happily accepted the pastry and Betsy learned that sometimes it's better to be kind and not ignore others. From that day on, Betsy and the bird became good friends and Betsy even helped the bird build its nest. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny. The bunny loved to run and play in the green grass. One day, the bunny saw a prune on the ground. It was a dark prune, almost black. The bunny picked it up and sniffed it. It smelled sweet! 
The bunny decided to run with the prune in its mouth. It ran very fast, like a race car. It loved the feeling of speed. Suddenly, the bunny tripped on a rock and the prune flew out of its mouth. It was sad, but it learned to be more careful next time. 
From that day on, the bunny always looked for dark prunes to play with. It loved the taste and the feeling of speed when it ran with them. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the rain. One day, it rained so much that the whole street was covered in water. Lily put on her raincoat and boots and jumped in the puddles. 
After playing in the rain, Lily went inside to have dinner with her family. They had fried chicken with oil on it. Lily loved the taste of the crispy chicken. 
But Lily's little brother, Jake, was jealous of her because she got the biggest piece of chicken with the most oil on it. Lily shared her chicken with Jake and they both were happy. And then, it started to rain again. They ran outside to play in the rain together.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Lily went on a walk with her mommy. They saw lots of flowers, but Lily liked the lilies the most. She picked one and smelled it, but it was smelly! 
"Lily, we can't keep that flower. It's not nice to pick flowers from someone else's garden," said mommy. 
Lily was sad, but she understood. "Can we pack a picnic instead?" she asked. 
"Sure, let's go home and pack some sandwiches," mommy replied. And so, they went home and packed a yummy picnic. They sat outside and enjoyed their lunch while looking at the pretty flowers in their own garden. Lily was happy again. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy was very lonely because he didn't have any friends to play with. One day, Timmy went outside to play and saw a bird in his backyard. The bird looked very sad and Timmy wanted to help.
Timmy asked the bird, "Why are you sad?" The bird said, "I can't find any gas to fly." Timmy wanted to help the bird, so he went inside his house and got some bread to give to the bird. The bird ate the bread and felt better.
Suddenly, a bad guy came to Timmy's backyard and wanted to shoot the bird. Timmy was scared, but he knew he had to protect his new friend. Timmy yelled, "Stop! Don't shoot the bird!" The bad guy ran away and the bird flew away happily. Timmy felt happy too because he made a new friend. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little car named Red. Red was very tired after driving all day, so he wanted to rest. He found a nice spot under a tree and parked there. 
Suddenly, he heard a voice saying, "Wow, Red, you have such a cool motor!" It was his friend Blue, who was envious of Red's motor. 
"Thanks, Blue," said Red. "But now I need to rest. I've been driving all day and I'm very tired." 
"Okay, Red," said Blue. "Rest well and I'll see you tomorrow!" And with that, Red closed his eyes and fell asleep, dreaming of all the adventures he would have with his motor.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside with her friends. One sunny day, Lily and her friends decided to have a picnic in the park. They brought sandwiches, fruit, and cookies.
As they were eating, Lily's friend Alex noticed that his water bottle was empty. "I need more water," he said. "Can we go to the water line?" 
Lily knew where the water line was. She had seen it before. "Sure," she said. "Let's go." 
When they got to the water line, they saw a big scale. "What's that?" Lily asked. 
"It's a scale," Alex said. "You can weigh things on it." 
Lily thought that was cool. She wanted to weigh something too. "Can we weigh my cookie?" she asked. 
They put the cookie on the scale and saw that it weighed one ounce. "Wow!" Lily said. "That's not very heavy." 
As they walked back to their picnic spot, they noticed that the sun was getting hot. "It's a hot day," Lily said. "But at least we have water and cookies!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sun. One day, she found a big, red apple on the ground. It looked delicious, but when she took a bite, she realized it was rotten.
Lily's mom saw her making a face and asked what was wrong. "The apple is yucky and rotten," Lily said. "Maybe we can find a better one," her mom replied. But Lily was stubborn and wanted to keep looking for a good apple. 
They walked around the orchard, but all the apples were either too high or too small. Finally, they found a tree with a perfect apple. "Yay, we found it!" Lily exclaimed. She took a big bite and smiled. It was juicy and sweet, just like the sun shining down on them.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys, but he also loved to go on adventures. One day, Timmy went to the store with his mom. He saw a toy he really wanted, but he didn't know the price.
"Mommy, how much does this toy use?" Timmy asked.
"It costs ten dollars," his mom replied.
Timmy didn't have ten dollars, but he really wanted the toy. "Can we go on an adventurous treasure hunt to find the money?" he asked his mom.
His mom smiled. "Sure, let's go on an adventure to find the money for the toy."
So, Timmy and his mom went on a treasure hunt. They searched high and low until they found a shiny coin on the ground. It was worth ten dollars! Timmy was so happy that he could finally buy the toy he wanted.
"Thank you, Mommy, for going on an adventurous treasure hunt with me," Timmy said.
"You're welcome, Timmy. I'm glad we found the money for your toy," his mom replied with a smile.

Once upon a time, there was a lively little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys all day long. One day, Lily's mom asked her to sort her toys into different boxes. Lily did not want to stop playing, but she knew she had to listen to her mom.
As Lily sorted her toys, she noticed that her favorite toy, a teddy bear, was missing. She looked everywhere but could not find it. Lily started to cry because she loved her teddy bear so much.
Suddenly, Lily's little brother came into the room with her teddy bear in his arms. He had taken it without asking. Lily was upset and told her brother that it was not nice to take things without asking. Her brother apologized and gave her the teddy bear back. From that day on, Lily made sure to always put her toys away and keep them safe.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved to play outside in the park. One day, he saw a big truck coming to the park. The truck had a lot of boxes on it.
Timmy asked the man driving the truck, "What are you doing?"
"I'm loading these boxes onto the truck," said the man.
Timmy watched as the man lifted the boxes and put them on the truck. Then, he saw a blue box with an oak tree on it. "That's a pretty box," said Timmy.
"Yes, it is," said the man. "It's going to a store where people can buy things inside."
Timmy waved goodbye to the man and went back to playing. He wondered what was inside the blue box with the oak tree on it.

Once upon a time, there was a man named Jack. Jack had a wife named Jill. They lived in a small house on a hill. One day, Jack and Jill talked about what to eat for dinner. Jack wanted pizza, but Jill disagreed. She wanted to eat salad instead.
"I want pizza," said Jack.
"I don't want pizza. I want salad," replied Jill.
Jack felt upset because he really wanted pizza. But he knew he had to be humble and listen to his wife. So, he said, "Okay, we'll have salad then."
Jill smiled and said, "Thank you for being humble, Jack."
And so, Jack and Jill had a delicious salad for dinner. They both felt happy because they listened to each other and came to an agreement.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny. He loved to hop and play in the fields of wheat. One day, he saw a furry caterpillar crawling on a leaf. He wanted to touch it, but his mother told him not to. She said, "It's not nice to touch things without asking." 
The bunny didn't listen and touched the caterpillar anyway. It made the caterpillar scared and it curled up into a ball. The bunny felt bad for making the caterpillar scared. 
From that day on, the bunny learned to always ask before touching things. He also learned that just because something looks different, doesn't mean it's not important. The caterpillar may have been furry, but it was still special and deserved to be treated with kindness.

Once upon a time, there was a big kangaroo. He lived in a big field with lots of grass to eat. But one day, he got very hungry and couldn't find any food. He looked around and saw a little girl with a basket of apples. The kangaroo hopped over and asked if he could have an apple. The little girl was happy to feed the kangaroo and gave him a juicy apple. 
After eating the apple, the kangaroo felt uncomfortable. He had eaten too much and his tummy hurt. He lay down in the grass and closed his eyes. The little girl felt bad for the kangaroo and decided to stay with him until he felt better. They sat in the field together and watched the clouds go by. Eventually, the kangaroo's tummy felt better and he hopped away, feeling grateful for the little girl's kindness.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy had a red bike with a flat tire. He wanted to ride his bike, but he couldn't because of the flat tire. Timmy's dad said he would fix it for him.
While his dad was fixing the tire, Timmy saw a bird. The bird was singing a pretty song. Timmy wanted to sing like the bird, so he tried to whistle. He tried and tried, but he couldn't whistle.
Finally, Timmy's dad finished fixing the tire. Timmy got on his bike and rode away. The wind was harsh on his face, but he was happy because he could ride his bike again. As he rode, he tried to whistle again. Maybe one day he would be able to whistle like the bird.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to go on holiday with his family. One day, they went to an ancient castle. The castle was very big and had lots of old things inside. Timmy saw a statue and wanted to touch it. But when he did, it fell over and broke! Timmy's mom told him not to pinch things that didn't belong to him. Timmy felt bad, but he learned an important lesson. From then on, he always asked before touching anything.

Once upon a time, there was a big orange lion. He lived in a jungle with many trees and plants. One day, the lion saw a tiny ant walking on the ground. The ant was carrying a big piece of food.
The lion wanted to eat the food, but the ant said, "No, it's mine!" The lion roared loudly, but the ant didn't get scared. Instead, the ant said, "I am small, but I am strong."
The lion realized that the ant was right. He apologized and walked away. From that day on, the lion and the ant became friends and shared their food with each other.

Once upon a time, there was a little birdy named Tweet. Tweet was very shy and didn't like to talk to other birdies. One day, Tweet was flying when he saw a big, scary cat. Tweet was so scared that he didn't know what to do. But then, he remembered that his mommy told him to protect himself.
Tweet decided to fly away as fast as he could. He flew and flew until he found a tree with many other birdies. Tweet felt safe and happy with his new friends. They played and sang together all day long.
Tweet learned that it's important to protect yourself when you're scared. He also learned that having friends makes you feel less scared. Even though Tweet was shy, he made new friends and felt brave. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had long hair that was always tangled. One day, she went into the forest to wander around. She saw many trees and animals. She felt glad to be there.
Suddenly, she saw a squirrel who had a comb in its paw. "Hello, Mr. Squirrel. What are you doing with that comb?" asked Lily. "I am combing my fur. It helps me stay clean and neat," replied the squirrel. "Can I try it?" asked Lily. "Sure!" said the squirrel.
Lily combed her hair with the squirrel's comb. It felt nice and smooth. She was glad she found the squirrel and the comb. They became friends and wandered around the forest together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the park with her friends. One day, Lily's mom gave her a new toy to play with. It was a shiny red ball that bounced really high.
Lily was so happy with her new toy that she wanted to show it to her friends. When she got to the park, she saw that her friends were sad because they couldn't find their treasure box. Lily wanted to help her friends, so she provided them with her new ball to play with.
Suddenly, one of Lily's friends noticed something shiny under a tree. It was the treasure box! They all ran over to see what was inside. They found a bunch of shiny coins and jewels. They were so happy and grateful to Lily for providing them with her new toy. From that day on, they all played together with Lily's shiny red ball and the treasure box. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily and her mom went to a restaurant. The restaurant had a big menu with lots of yummy food on it. Lily looked at the menu and picked out some spaghetti for her dinner.
While they were waiting for their food, Lily played with her straw in her water glass. She accidentally knocked over the glass and the water soaked her mom's shirt. Her mom got a little bit angry and said "that was stupid, Lily". But then they both laughed and had a fun dinner together. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the park. One day, Lily's mom told her to wear her warm sweater because it was cold outside. 
Lily played for a while, but then she started to feel very sleepy. She decided to take a nap on the bench. While she was sleeping, a big gust of wind came and blew away her helpless sweater. 
When Lily woke up, she realized her sweater was gone. She looked everywhere for it, but she couldn't find it. Lily felt sad and cold without her sweater. She cried and cried until her mom came to pick her up. 
Lily's mom was sad too because she knew how much Lily loved her sweater. They went home, but Lily was still cold and sad without her sweater. From that day on, Lily learned to always take care of her things and never take naps with her sweater on.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside in the sun, but it was very hot. His mom told him to drink lots of water to stay cool. Timmy liked to play with his toy cars and make loud "vroom vroom" noises. 
One day, Timmy and his mom went to the park. They played on the swings and the slide. But when it was time to go home, Timmy didn't want to leave. He wanted to stay and play more. His mom said they had to go because it was getting late and they needed to eat dinner. 
Timmy was sad to leave the park, but he was also hungry. When they got home, his mom made him a delicious meal. Timmy felt better and went to bed happy, dreaming of playing in the park again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sunshine. One day, she was running around and she stubbed her toe on a rock. It hurt a lot and she started to cry.
Her mom came over and asked, "What happened, Lily? Why are you crying?"
"I hurt my toe," Lily replied, still crying.
Her mom kneeled down beside her and looked at her toe. "It's just a little scrape, you'll be okay," she said.
Lily stopped crying and felt better. "I was being foolish and not looking where I was going," she said.
"That's okay, Lily," her mom said, "just be more careful next time." And with that, Lily went back to playing, being careful not to hurt her toe again.

Once upon a time, there was a chubby cat named Mittens. Mittens loved to play with yarn and eat fish. One day, Mittens found a case in the backyard. She didn't know what was inside, but she wanted to see. 
As she was about to open the case, a dog named Max came over. Max wanted to fight Mittens for the case. Mittens didn't want to fight, but she didn't want to give up the case either. 
They started to fight and Mittens scratched Max. Max ran away and Mittens was happy she won the case. She opened it up and found a toy mouse inside. She played with the toy mouse all day and forgot about the fight with Max. From that day on, Mittens was known as the champion of the backyard.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved music and he loved to play the piano. One day, Timmy's mommy took him to the music store to buy a piano. When they arrived, the store owner told them that there were no pianos available to buy. Timmy was sad.
But then, Timmy met a girl named Lily. Lily also loved music and she loved to sing. Timmy and Lily became friends and they played music together. One day, Timmy asked Lily if she wanted to marry him. Lily said yes! Timmy was so happy that he played a song on his imaginary piano for Lily. They lived happily ever after, playing music and singing together.

Once upon a time, there were three little bears who lived in a big forest. One day, they decided to go on an adventure and pick some berries. They walked and walked until they found a big berry bush. But the bush was too tall for them to reach the berries. So, they decided to unite and stand on each other's shoulders to get the berries. They picked and picked until they had a big basket full of delicious berries. Suddenly, they heard a noise and saw a harmless rabbit hopping towards them. The bears shared their berries with the rabbit and they all became friends. From that day on, they went on many more adventures together.

Once upon a time, there was a little duckling. The duckling was very small and yellow. It loved to play in the pond with its parent. The parent was a big duck with feathers that were also yellow. 
One day, the little duckling got lost. It didn't know how to come back to its parent. It was very scared and started to cry. But then, the parent heard the little duckling's cries and came to find it. 
When the parent found the little duckling, it was so happy! The parent hugged the little duckling and took it back to the pond. From that day on, the little duckling never wandered off again. It stayed close to its parent and played in the pond all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a little duck named Ducky. Ducky lived in a pond with her friends, the fishies. One day, it rained a lot and the pond started to flood. Ducky got very scared and asked her fishy friends what to do.
One fishy said, "We need to yield to the flood and swim to higher ground!"
Ducky was very sleepy and didn't want to swim, but she knew she had to be brave. So, she followed her fishy friends and they swam to a nearby hill. 
But when they got there, they saw that the hill was already crowded with other animals who had also run away from the flood. They were all arguing about who should be allowed to stay. 
Ducky said, "Let's not fight. We can share the hill and all sleep here tonight."
Everyone agreed and they all had a peaceful night's sleep. The next day, the flood had gone down and they all went back to their homes in the pond, happy to be safe and sound. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside on Sundays. One day, she went to the park with her mommy and daddy. She ran and played on the slide and swings. 
But then, Lily's feet slipped on the wet grass and she fell down. She cried and her parents came to help her. They saw that Lily's knee was bleeding a little bit, but it was not too bad. 
Lily's face was pale and she did not want to play anymore. Her parents took her home and gave her a band-aid for her knee. They cuddled with her on the couch and watched her favorite movie. Lily felt better and was happy to spend time with her family. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily wanted to play hide-and-seek with her friends. She looked for a good hiding spot, and she found a closet. She opened the door and went inside. 
But when she tried to leave the closet, the door wouldn't open. She pulled and pulled, but it wouldn't budge. She started to feel scared and called for her mommy, but her mommy couldn't hear her because she was deaf. 
Lily didn't know what to do, but then she remembered her mommy had taught her some sign language. She signed for help, and her mommy came to rescue her. From then on, Lily knew to always be careful when playing in closets. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in her yard. One day, she saw a big storm coming. She ran inside to tell her mommy.
"Mommy, there's a big storm coming!" Lily said.
"Oh no, we need to get inside and stay safe," her mommy replied.
Lily watched as the storm got closer and closer. The wind was blowing really hard and the rain was coming down in big drops. Suddenly, she saw something change. The trees were bending and swaying in the wind. 
"Mommy, look! The trees changed!" Lily exclaimed.
"Yes, the storm is making everything move and look different," her mommy explained.
After the storm passed, Lily went outside to see the original beauty of her yard. The sun was shining and everything looked fresh and new. She was happy to see that even though things change, they can still be beautiful in their own way.

Once upon a time, there was a happy child. The child loved to play with a ball and would roll it around all day. One day, the child found an empty box and decided to play with it too. The child rolled the box around and had so much fun.
But then, the box rolled too far away and the child couldn't reach it. The child tried to run after it, but tripped and fell. The child got hurt and had to go to the hospital. The box was never seen again and the child was sad. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she went to the park to play. While she was there, she saw a brown dog. The dog looked very friendly, so Lily went to meet him. 
But then, out of nowhere, a big, mean cat appeared! The cat didn't like the dog and started to chase him around. Lily didn't want the dog to get hurt, so she picked up a prune from the ground and threw it at the cat. The cat got scared and ran away.
Lily and the brown dog became friends and played together all day. They had so much fun that Lily forgot about the mean cat. From that day on, Lily would often go to the park to meet her new friend, the brown dog.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One night, Lily was scared of the dark. She wanted to sleep with her flashlight on. Her mommy told her that it's not good to waste batteries. Lily didn't listen and kept the flashlight on.
In the morning, Lily's flashlight didn't work anymore. She was sad and scared of the dark again. Her mommy told her that it's important to save things and not waste them. Lily learned her lesson and promised to save her flashlight batteries from now on.
The moral of the story is that it's important to save things and not waste them, so we can use them when we really need them.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside with her toys. One day, she found a stick and started to measure things. She measured how tall the flowers were and how wide the trees were. 
But then, it started to rain and Lily got very wet. She was miserable because she didn't like being wet. She ran back to her house and her mom gave her a warm blanket to dry off. 
Lily was happy to be inside where it was warm and cozy. She realized that sometimes it's better to be inside when it's raining outside. She hugged her mom and said, "I love you."

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Benny. Benny loved to hop around in the grass and eat carrots. One day, Benny met a bossy squirrel named Sammy.
"Hey Benny, you should pass me one of those carrots," said Sammy.
Benny didn't like how bossy Sammy was, but he didn't want to be mean. So, he passed Sammy a carrot.
But as soon as Sammy took a bite of the carrot, he made a face and said, "This carrot is yucky! I don't like it."
Benny felt sad that he had given Sammy a bad carrot. But then, he had an idea. He hopped over to a different patch of carrots and found the juiciest, sweetest carrot he could find. He brought it back to Sammy and said, "Here, try this one instead."
Sammy took a bite and his eyes lit up. "Wow, this carrot is delicious! Thank you, Benny."
Benny felt happy that he was able to make Sammy happy, even though he was bossy at first. From then on, they were good friends and Benny always made sure to share his best carrots with Sammy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play with her toy cars. One day, she was playing with her red car when she realized it was out of fuel. She asked her mom if she could have more fuel for her car.
Mom said, "Sure, let's go get some fuel at the gas station." When they got there, they saw a man with a thin mustache who was having trouble with his car. Lily's mom asked if they could help him solve his problem.
The man was very grateful, and they all worked together to fix his car. After they were done, the man said, "Thank you so much for helping me solve my car problem. You guys are the best!" Lily was happy that they could help and she went back to playing with her toy cars, now with a full tank of fuel.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and her friends. One day, Lily went to a race with her friends. They all wanted to win the race, but Lily just wanted to have fun.
During the race, Lily saw that her friend was really fast. She wanted to keep up with her, but she couldn't. She started to feel sad, but then she remembered that it's not all about winning. She felt happy just to be there with her friends.
After the race, Lily's friend won the first prize. She was very happy, but Lily wasn't sad. She was happy for her friend and kept a modest smile on her face. She learned that it's not always about winning, but about having fun and being happy for others.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a favorite doll that she loved very much. One day, Lily's little brother came and took the doll from her. Lily was very sad and cried a lot. She wanted her doll back.
Lily's mommy came and saw what happened. She asked Lily's brother to give the doll back to Lily. At first, he didn't want to, but then he saw how sad Lily was. So, he gave the doll back to Lily.
Lily was very happy and hugged her doll gently. She completed her tea party with her doll and her brother. They all had fun together. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to dance. She would twirl and jump around in her room every day. One day, her mommy made her a cup of cocoa, which made her very happy. It was a normal day, just like any other.
But then, Lily's little brother spilled her cocoa all over her favorite dress. She was sad, but her mommy said she could wash it and it would be okay. However, when they went to the laundry room, they saw that the washing machine was broken. Lily's mommy said they would have to take it to the repairman.
The next day, Lily went to the repairman with her mommy. She was so excited to get her dress back, but when they got there, they found out that the repairman had lost her dress. Lily was so sad that she couldn't even dance anymore. She learned that sometimes, things don't always end up normal and happy like she wanted them to.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw pictures with her white crayon. One day, Lily's mommy gave her a stamp to play with. Lily was so happy and started stamping everything she could find. She even stamped her daddy's shirt!
But then, Lily's mommy noticed that some of her important papers were missing. She looked everywhere but couldn't find them. Finally, she asked Lily if she knew where they were. Lily felt sad and told her mommy that she had put them in a sack and stamped them with the pretty stamp.
Lily's mommy was very upset but she didn't scold Lily. Instead, she explained that it's not okay to take things that don't belong to us and put them in a sack without asking. Lily felt sorry and promised to never do it again. From that day on, Lily learned that it's important to be honest and ask for permission before taking or using things that belong to someone else.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she went to the park to play with her friends. While playing, she saw a raven sitting on a tree. The raven looked very big and Lily felt a little fearful.
Lily's friend, Timmy, saw that she was scared and asked her what was wrong. Lily pointed to the raven and said, "I'm scared of that big bird." Timmy smiled and said, "Don't be scared, Lily. Ravens are nice birds. They won't hurt you."
Lily felt better and decided to make a paper airplane. She asked Timmy to help her fold it. They folded the paper airplane together and had a lot of fun playing with it. Lily learned that sometimes things may seem scary, but it's important to not be afraid and try new things.

Once upon a time, there was a man who was very famous. He liked to sign his name on everything he owned. One day, he lost all his money and didn't know what to do. He asked his friends for help, but they didn't have any money either. 
The man felt sad and scared. He didn't want to be poor. Then, he remembered he had a special talent. He could sing! He went to the park and started singing. People liked his singing and gave him money. 
The man was happy again. He realized that being famous and having money wasn't everything. He was grateful for his talent and for the kindness of the people who gave him money. From that day on, he signed his name on his heart, as a reminder to be thankful and humble.
