The fish was so happy to hear that. He thanked the friendly dolphin and swam away. From then on, he continued to explore the ocean, always staying away from the wealthy stamp collector.

Once there were two friends, a kitten and a puppy. The puppy and kitten loved to play together every day. One day, they decided they should get a treat.
The puppy wanted to get a rare cookie, but the kitten wanted to get ice cream. The puppy and kitten could not agree. 
The puppy said, “I want the rare cookie!”
The kitten said, “No! I want ice cream!”
The puppy insisted on the rare cookie and the kitten insisted on ice cream. They argued and disagreed until they were too angry to talk to each other.
The puppy sadly walked away, never to see the kitten again. The kitten was left with no treat at all.

Freddy was walking in the park one day when he saw something huge lying on the grass. He cautiously approached it and realized it was a sausage! He decided to eat it and ran to get his friend Joy to help.
When Freddy found Joy, he shouted: "Look! I found this huge sausage, do you want to eat it?"
"Sure!" said Joy.
They both sat down and the sausage was huge, so they both worked together to eat it. They ate it slowly, making sure they shared it equally.
When they finished, they smiled and said: "That was delicious!". 
They decided they had better not tell their parents about the huge sausage they'd eaten. They agreed it was going to be a secret between them. 
The friends laughed and hugged each other as they walked off into the sunset.

Once upon a time there was a family who had a fridge. The fridge was full of delicious food, but one day it started to get a little bit empty.
Mum and Dad added lots of food to the fridge, but still it was not full. So the family decided to add more food.
The family reached out for help from their neighbours and friends. Everyone added something special to the fridge. Before long, the fridge was full up again with lots of yummy food. 
The family were so happy that they could fill the fridge again. They were thankful for all the help they got, and felt less helpless now that the fridge was full.
The End.

Once upon a time there was an elderly man who was sitting on the park bench. He was eating some butter on his toast and humming to himself. 
Just then a little 3 year old boy came running up to him. He looked up at the elderly man with his big brown eyes and said, "What are you doing, Mister?" 
The elderly man smiled and said, "I'm just enjoying my toast with some butter. Would you like some?" 
The little boy shook his head and said, "No, thank you. But can you show me something?" 
The elderly man looked around and said, "What would you like to see?"
The little boy pointed to the trees and said, "Can you show me how to listen to the trees?"
The elderly man's eyes twinkled and he said, "Yes, of course! Just close your eyes and listen. Can you hear the birds singing in the distance? The wind rustling through the leaves?"
The little boy's face lit up with excitement and he began to listen. Soon he heard the birds singing and the leaves rustling, and he smiled. 
The elderly man smiled too, glad that he was able to show the little boy something new and interesting. He watched on as the little boy listened to the sounds of nature, and thought of all the things he could show him in the future.

Bopus and his mum were at the airport. Bopus wanted to travel to a different city. His mum gave him a passport. Bopus felt very excited!
The passport officer looked at Bopus' passport and said, "Hmm, this record isn't good enough!" Bopus was surprised. His mum got very angry and said, "What do you mean?"
The passport officer said, "This passport has been used too much. You need to get a new passport before we can let you go."
Mum was very ashamed. She said, "I'm sorry Bopus. We can't go this time." Bopus was so sad. He wanted to cry, but he didn't.
They had to go home. Bopus knew Mum was disappointed, but he couldn't do anything about it. He didn't want to make her feel even more ashamed.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Samantha. She was 3 years old and she loved color. Everywhere she went, she looked for the pretty, colorful things she saw. One day, Samantha was in her bedroom, looking for something colorful. On the nightstand, she saw a glass cup. She picked it up and looked at it.
The glass cup was so colorful. She twirled it around in her hands and smiled. Suddenly, the cup slipped and broke into many pieces. Samantha was sad.
Her mom came in and comforted her. She said, "It's okay, Samantha. Accidents happen. But we have to always be careful and not break beautiful things."
Samantha nodded and wiped away her tears. She looked around the room and saw the rainbow of colors. She smiled and decided to look for colorful things, but carefully. She learned that it is important to respect and take care of things that are beautiful.

Once upon a time there was a fat cat named Fluffy. Every day Fluffy would look through a big dictionary she had given to her 3 years ago. Every day she would learn new words from it. She loved to learn new things.
One day Fluffy decided to go for a walk. She was walking and walking and then noticed a tree in the distance. Fluffy wanted to take a closer look so she started to walk towards it.
Suddenly, Fluffy realised she had left her dictionary at home. She quickly turned around and started to run back home. When she arrived, she noticed her dictionary was missing!
Fluffy quickly spoke to her owner, "I miss my dictionary", she said sadly. Her owner said, "Do not worry Fluffy, I will help you find it."
Fluffy started to look everywhere for her dictionary: she looked under the bed, in the cupboard and even in the garden. After a long search, Fluffy finally found her dictionary in the kitchen.
Fluffy happily hugged her dictionary and said, "I missed you so much!"

Once upon a time, there was a smart rabbit named Harry. Harry had a big, fluffy patch of fur on his back that shined like the stars.
One day, Harry hopped around in the forest and saw a bear. The bear said to him, "Why don't you come to my house? We can play together!"
Harry was a bit worried, but he wanted to be brave, so he went with the bear.
The bear showed Harry around his house. Harry saw lots of fun things like books, toys, and tasty food.
The bear said, "Let's spend the night here!"
Harry didn't want to spend the night, but the bear was so eager, he couldn't say no.
Harry stayed awake all night, feeling scared and nervous. In the morning, the bear asked Harry to stay longer, but Harry said no. He was very smart and knew it was time to go home.
Harry hopped away and never went back to the bear's house. Instead, he continued spending his time in the forest, looking for more fun adventures.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Stacy. She had a clean pink dress and wanted to go out and play. But when she asked her mom, her mom said no.
Stacy got a little mad and started to demand to go out. "Why can't I go out and play?" she asked.
Her mom said, "No, it's getting dark and it's not safe. We'll go out tomorrow when the sun is up."
But Stacy didn't like that answer. She really wanted to go out. She started to cry and said, "Please Mommy!"
Her mom felt bad and decided to tell her a story. "Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Stacy," she said.
Stacy listened closely as her mom told her the story. It was about a girl who kept having nightmares. She was so scared that she didn't leave her house for days.
Suddenly, the girl had an idea. She gathered up all her courage and decided to go outside, even though it was dark. To her surprise, all the monsters in the night weren't as scary as she thought.
Stacy smiled and said, "So there's no need to be scared. We can go out for a bit, can't we?"
Her mom smiled back and said, "Yes, of course. As long as we stay in the clean and safe places,

Once upon a time there was a lady. She was a very noisy lady. Everywhere she went, it was noisy.
The lady wanted to be quiet. But every time she tried, something noisy happened.
One day the noisy lady found a place that was very quiet. It was a very quiet spot, but it was hidden away.
She went to the quiet spot everyday and wanted to stay there. It was her happy place.
But one day, the lady couldn't find the quiet spot. It was gone! She was so sad and looked everywhere, but it was no use.
The lady was sad, but she kept trying to find the quiet spot. She knew it was somewhere special.

One day, Jack was playing in his garden. He was wearing his favourite shirt and shorts. Suddenly, Jack spotted something very expensive in the garden. It was a shiny new dress. “Wow,” said Jack. “This dress is so pretty. I want to wear it!”
So Jack grabbed the dress, and put it on. He looked in the mirror, and he felt like a prince. He even jumped and spun around, showing his new dress to the birds and bees. 
Just then, Jack heard his mum calling for him. He quickly ran inside the house and showed his mum the dress. 
“Where did you get this?” asked his mum.
“I found it in my garden,” replied Jack, with a big smile.
Mum smiled too. “Well, it looks like you found a very special dress. You should take very good care of it!”
So Jack carefully hung the dress up in his wardrobe, and knew he would look very special the next time he wore it.

Once upon a time, there was a creature who loved insects. His name was Billy. Every day, he would spend some of his time looking for them.
One day, he found an insect that was really delicious. It was little and orange. Billy was so excited to try this new discovery!
He carefully pinched the insect with two fingers. He could not wait to taste it. It was crunchy and sweet.
"Mmmm, this is delicious!" exclaimed Billy.
He took a few more bites until there was nothing left. Billy was very happy that he found his tasty treat. It would be something to remember forever.

One day, Sarah saw something special. She saw her friends wearing uniforms. She wanted one too! She asked her mother for one, but her mother said it was too expensive. Sarah was sad.
To cheer her up, her mother suggested that they make their own uniform. Sarah was so excited! She ran to her room to get her craft materials.
They cut and spread the pieces of cloth. Then they used a needle and thread to make the uniform. Sarah could hardly believe it! Her very own yummy uniform was finished.
The next day, Sarah wore her uniform to her friends' house. She showed them her new outfit. They were so jealous! But they were also a bit worried.
"Teacher will see you!", they said. Sarah was worried too. "I wouldn't want to get in trouble. What should I do?", she thought.
Then she had an idea! She ran home and grabbed her mother's fabric paint. She quickly spread it all over her uniform and now it looked totally different.
Now Sarah could wear her unique uniform with pride! Her friends were so impressed by her creativity. They all wanted their own yummy uniforms now. In the end, everyone was happy!

Once upon a time there was a fun uncle. His name was Sam. He loved to pretend. One day he asked his niece if she wanted to play. She said yes!
They pretended they were pirates. Sam used a big blanket to make a boat. They sailed around the living room and found amazing treasure. They sang songs and had lots of fun.
Sam was very silly. He made funny noises and faces. His niece giggled and couldn't stop laughing. They had the best time.
When their adventure was over, Sam gave her a hug and said goodbye. His niece still thinks of him and remembers all the fun they had pretending together.

One day, a lazy gorilla decided to make a new friend. He looked around and saw a little boy sitting near the zoo. The gorilla walked over to him.
"Hi, who are you?" said the gorilla.
"My name is Mike," said the little boy, smiling.
"Do you want to be friends?" asked the gorilla.
"Yes!" said Mike.
So the lazy gorilla and Mike played together every day. They would climb trees and swing from vines. Mike even fed the gorilla bananas every once in a while.
After a few months, the gorilla and Mike became the best of friends. Whenever Mike was feeling lazy, the gorilla would give him a big hug and it always made him feel better. 
From that day on, the lazy gorilla and the little boy were always happy to be together.

Once upon a time, there was a huge bear called Peter. Peter lived deep in the forest in a big, cosy cave.
One day, Peter was feeling tired and decided he should go to sleep. So he climbed into his bed and closed his eyes. Suddenly, he heard a noise outside his cave. "What was that?" he thought.
Peter went outside to investigate. He saw a little mouse, and the mouse was in trouble! Its tail was stuck under a big rock and it couldn't get free.
"Don't worry," said Peter. "I'll help you!" He used all his strength to move the huge rock and the mouse ran away.
Peter smiled, but he was very tired now. He said goodbye to the mouse and went back to his cave. He was so exhausted, he fell asleep right away.
From that day on, Peter and the mouse were good friends. They always looked out for each other and helped each other if they got into trouble. And they both slept well each night, knowing they had a friend who would help them out if they needed it!

Linda was a little girl who loved wandering around in nature. She was eager to explore and find what she could. One day, Linda was wandering around in the woods when she spotted a big yellow flower. She was so excited that she ran over to it. She scooped the flower up and inspected it more closely. Soon, Linda realized there was a bee hovering around the flower. She was a bit scared but her eagerness to find and explore was greater than her fear. She cautiously reached out to touch the bee. The bee moved away and buzzing around Linda's face. To Linda's surprise, the bee was not trying to hurt her and it just kept on flying around her. Linda couldn't believe it and looked around for something to show her newly made friend. Finally, she found a nearby field of yellow flowers and excitedly started picking them for the bee. The bee watched as Linda gathered the flowers and flew from flower to flower, never leaving her side. Linda remained brave and eagerly used the flowers to make a special gift for the bee. The bee was so pleased that it rewarded Linda by buzzing around her head and giving her loving nuzzles. Linda laughed and smiled, happy that she had made a new friend.

Bob was out walking on the beach. It was a hot day, and he was looking at the waves. Suddenly, it started to rain. Bob was surprised. Rain was rare in this part of the world, so he was happy it was raining. He wanted to go for a swim, so he started running towards the sea.
When he got closer, he saw a big wave. Bob stopped and looked at it. It was so big! He couldn't believe his eyes. He looked around and saw that everyone else was running away from it.
Bob called out: "Why are you running away from the wave?"
One of the people replied: "It's too big! It will sweep us away!"
Bob was brave. He ran towards the big wave and jumped into it. He was happily swimming in the water. Bob had a rare and exciting experience!

One day, a little mouse was walking along the forest path, looking for something to eat. All of a sudden, the mouse heard a noise behind him. He quickly turned around and saw a big furry human standing right in front of him. The little mouse was very scared and he wanted to run away, but the human reached out and grabbed him with one hand.
The mouse asked him, “What do you want? Please don’t hurt me!” 
The human chuckled and replied, “Don’t worry, I’m not going to hurt you. I just want to play. What’s your name, little mouse?”
The mouse answered, “My name is Max.”
The human smiled and said, “It’s great to meet you, Max. What do you usually do in the forest?”
Max said, “I like to look for food and explore.”
The human said, “That sounds like fun. Would you like to explore with me?”
Max thought for a moment and then said, “Yes, let’s do it!” 
So, the little mouse and the furry human set off on an adventure together. They had lots of fun exploring the forest and finding things to play with. When the sun went down, the human said goodbye and gave Max a

Once there was a bossy little figure named Jenny. She was playing in the park one day when she stumbled and fell down. She started to cry, feeling embarrassed, and a kind old lady came over to help her. 
The kind old lady said, "Don't be afraid, Jenny. Everyone stumbles now and then. What's important is that you get back up, dust yourself off and keep going. That's how you learn and grow." 
Jenny thought about what the old lady said. She then took a deep breath and got herself back up. She was feeling brave and proud of herself. 
At the end of the day, Jenny learned that it was okay to stumble as long as she never gave up.
The moral of the story is that everyone makes mistakes, but it's okay to make them as long as you learn from them and keep trying.

One day, Sam and Jacob were playing outside. They wanted to do something fun. Sam had an idea. He said, “Let’s pretend we’re playing a sport.”
Jacob was excited. He said, “Okay, what kind of sport should we play?”
Sam said, “Ice hockey!”
Jacob replied, “That sounds fun!”
They got their toy hockey sticks and a plastic puck and pretended to play hockey on the lawn. The grass was icy and slippery. Sam and Jacob were having a great time.
Suddenly, there was a loud noise. They looked up and saw a truck driving on the road. The truck was huge and it was coming towards them very quickly.
Sam and Jacob were scared. They ran away from the road as fast as they could. But the truck hit the slippery grass. It was going too fast and it slid right into Sam and Jacob!
They were both hurt. Luckily, they both got better soon. But Sam and Jacob never played pretend ice hockey in the icy grass ever again.

Once upon a time there were two friends called Pete and Matt. Pete was very kind, and Matt was his best friend.
One day, they were playing in the park, when it started to rain. The rain was very heavy, and soon Pete and Matt were very wet. 
Pete said to Matt, "It's getting cold. What should we do?" 
Matt said, "Let's look under the tree, it might keep us warm." 
Pete and Matt found a shelter under thetree, and soon Matt was feeling kind. He said, "See, look! The rain is melting."
Pete looked and smiled. "Yes, Matt! It is melting. We can stay here longer!" 
Pete and Matt stayed under the tree until the rain had melted away. From that day on, they were happy to know that being kind and having a best friend helps you stay warm and dry!

Once there was a cat called Mimi. Mimi loved to sit in the sun and watch the world go by.
One day, Mimi saw a pretty fan on the table. She thought it looked so fun! She wanted to play with it.
Mimi walked over to the fan and said "Hello fan, can I play with you?"
But the fan didn't reply.
Mimi thought for a moment. Then she smiled and said "I know, I'll just pretend you can talk!"
Then Mimi chatted with the fan like it was her best friend. She talked about all the things she wanted to do.
Before long, Mimi was having a wonderful time. And the pretty fan was spinning around, helping to keep Mimi cool!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Emma. She wanted to borrow a motor from her Grandma. So one day she decided to ask, "Can I borrow a motor, Grandma?". 
Grandma said, "Of course you can, Emma." She then showed her a pink motor. It was very pretty, and Emma was excited. 
Grandma said, "You can borrow this pink motor. Here are the keys!" 
Emma was very happy and thanked Grandma. She carefully drove the pink motor to the park. There, she had lots of fun. 
When it was time to go home, Emma returned the pink motor to Grandma. Grandma gave her a big hug and said, "I'm so glad you enjoyed it!"
The End.

Janessa was a three-year-old girl who loved to write poems. One day, Janessa was trying to write a new poem, but she couldn't come up with anything. She felt so frustrated that she started to cry.
Suddenly, she got an idea. She went over to her mom and said, "Mommy, I need help with writing a poem!"
Her mom smiled, and said, "Well, why don't you release all the words in your head onto the paper? That way you can come up with a great poem".
Janessa thought it was a great idea and sat down at her desk. As she started to write, the words started to come easier and she felt a sense of relief flooding through her. She released all the words and ideas she had into her poem.
When she was finished, Janessa was so proud. She felt grateful that her mom had helped her. She ran over to give her mom a big hug. Her mom was so happy for Janessa, and Janessa's poem was very beautiful!

Maria and her dad were walking in the park. Maria was feeling very excited, as it had been a long time since she had been outside. She looked around and saw lots of children playing.
Her dad asked her, "Do you want to join them?"
Maria smiled, "Yes!" She started to walk over to the other kids, but when she arrived she felt very anxious. All the other kids were older and seemed to know each other. Maria felt embarrassed.
Her dad noticed that Maria was getting anxious and put his arm around her shoulder and said, "It's ok, Maria. You don't need to be embarrassed. You can still be with the other children and make friends. You just need to give it a try."
Maria was still feeling embarrassed, yet she did not want her dad to be disappointed in her. She decided to take her dad's advice and try. She smiled and walked over to a group of the older children. They said hello and welcomed her to join them.
Maria felt a huge sense of relief that she had not been too embarrassed to try. She joined in the game and eventually made some friends. Maria had gone from feeling anxious to feeling proud and happy.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Sarah. She had long dark hair and big brown eyes. 
Every day Sarah would go to the river to bathe. She liked to sing her songs while she was playing with the fishes. One day, Sarah was in the river and she noticed a veil floating near her. 
"What is this?" said Sarah. She picked up the veil and tried it on. It made her feel special.
A moment later, some boys came by and saw Sarah in the veil. They started to laugh at her, which made Sarah feel very ashamed. She quickly took off the veil, tucked it under her arm and ran away. 
But in the morning, Sarah felt brave. She went back to the river and put the veil back in the water. 
Then she smiled, said goodbye to the veil and went back home.

Once there was a happy little girl named Jane. Jane loved animals and often went to the park to watch them. One day, while she was at the park, Jane saw that a cute puppy was running in circles around the playground. The puppy was obviously afraid, but Jane wanted to help.
She quickly ran towards the puppy to try and calm him down. Unfortunately, before she could get there the puppy had run away. Jane started to become very sad, but then suddenly there was a loud noise. It was an ambulance!
The ambulance had come to take care of the puppy. Soon, two paramedics came out of the ambulance and help separate the puppy from the playground. Jane felt relieved and happy that the puppy was safe.
The paramedics thanked Jane for her help, and then drove off with the puppy in the ambulance. Jane went back home, feeling happy and relieved that she was able to help the puppy.

Once upon a time, there was a very naughty little three year old called Milly. She loved playing in her garden, but today she had a wild idea - she wanted to fly over her garden. She knew the only way to do this would be with a rocket. 
Milly quickly ran to the park and found an old rocket. It was filthy and covered with dirt, but Milly thought it was perfect! She picked it up and ran back home with it. 
Milly couldn't wait to start flying. She placed the rocket down in her garden and stood on top of it. She counted down from 3 and put on her helmet. But the rocket did nothing. Milly was upset.
Suddenly, Milly heard a voice. It said: "You need to press the red button to make the rocket work". Milly looked around but couldn't see anyone. She thought and thought until she realised the voice was coming from the rocket. 
Milly excitedly ran to the rocket and pressed the red button. The rocket came to life and flew up into the sky! Milly looked down and saw her garden in the distance. She shouted a loud cheer and soared above her home. 
Milly had finally done it, she was flying!

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Abigail. Abigail was three years old and loved to read. Every day she would find a book, sit down and read it.
One day her mom told her that she could get a special reward if she read a thick book. Abigail was very excited and quickly found a thick book. She then started to read it.
When Abigail finished she went to her Mom and said, "Mom, I read the book!" Her mom smiled and replied, "Well done Abigail, Here is your reward!"
Abigail was so happy and ran off with her reward. She couldn't wait to read another thick book and get another reward.

Once upon a time, there was a poor little cube. One day, the lonely cube wanted to jump around so he decided to try it out. He jumped up, up, and up!
Suddenly, the cube heard a voice. He looked around and then saw a little girl. She smiled and said "Hello cube! My name is Susan. Would you like to play?" 
The cube was so excited and he nodded his little block head. "Yes, I would love to play!"
The cube and little Susan played all day. They jumped and jumped and jumped. But soon, the sun began to set and it was time for Susan to go home. 
The cube waved goodbye to Susan and said "Come back soon!" And then the poor little cube jumped up in the air, feeling happy and content.

Once upon a time, there was a clever dog. He lived near a big bench in a park. Every day the clever dog would sit on the bench and look around. 
One day, a strange thing happened. The clever dog wanted to go for a walk, but when he turned around, the bench had disappeared! He looked all around but he couldn't see it anymore. 
The clever dog was very confused. He could not find the bench anywhere. He saw some other dogs in the park, but none of them knew what had happened to the bench. 
The clever dog kept looking for the bench all day, but he never found it. Finally, he had to give up and go back home. 
The clever dog never found out what happened to the bench, but he always remembered that strange day when it suddenly disappeared.

Once upon a time, there was a3 year old girl called Amy. She loved to listen to jazz music.
One day, Amy couldn't hear any jazz music. She was very sad. She asked her mom, "Why can't I hear the happy music?”
Her mom replied, "The jazz music sounded so happy that it woke up the deaf bird in the forest. He was scared, so he flew away and promised never to come back."
Amy was so sad that she started to cry.
But then her mom said, "Maybe we can wake up another deaf bird that will like jazz music!”
Amy was happy and excited. She quickly ran out to the forest to look for another deaf bird.
Later that day, Amy came back with a new friend! The little deaf bird was chirping happily along to the jazz music. Amy was so excited that she couldn't keep from dancing! From then on, she and the deaf bird danced to jazz music every day!

Mia was a three-year-old girl who had very beautiful, long, white hair. Her parents always made sure she combed her hair every day before going to bed. She enjoyed it very much, especially when the shiny teeth of the comb caught the light of the stars when it went through her hair.
One day, Mia asked her dad "Why do I need to comb my hair? Is it because you care about me?"
Her dad smiled and said "Yes, of course! I care about you very much, so that's why I want you to brush your hair. We want it to be clean and healthy. That's why we comb it".
Mia smiled and said "Okay, I will always comb my hair if it shows you care."
From that day on, Mia combed her beautiful, white hair every day. With her dad's help, she was always happy and her hair was always healthy and shining. With her dad’s care, Mia and her hair were happy and healthy!

Once upon a time, there was an infant. The baby was so delicate and small.
The infant was trying to stay awake as it watched playful birds outside its window. It was day-time, so the infant tried its best to stay awake and enjoy the sunlight. 
The infant began to yawn. The yawn was so big that it couldn’t hold it back. Soon, the infant started to feel sleepy. 
“No no, stay awake!” Said the infant to itself. But it was too late and the infant fell asleep.
Suddenly, something bad happened. The delicate infant had a terrible nightmare. When it woke up from the nightmare, it was scared. 
The infant started crying and kept crying until it couldn’t cry any more. The infant was so scared from the nightmare that it never wanted to go back to sleep again. 
The End.

Once upon a time, there was a huge star up in the sky. It was so bright and sparkly, that everyone could see it from far away. Every night, it glowed more and more.
One night, something special happened. The big star started to move. Everyone got excited and followed the star. It stopped in a forest, so they all stopped too.
The star was so big that it made a big hole in the ground. Everyone looked down and could see a tunnel. They all wanted to go inside the tunnel and see what the star had made.
So they all circled around the star and took each others hands. All of a sudden, the big star shot off into the sky! They all shouted and clapped their hands and waited to see what would happen.
After a few moments, the ground started to shake and a bright light came from the tunnel. Everyone ran closer to take a look. In the light was a giant room, filled with colourful stars. Everyone gasped and looked around in amazement. 
Suddenly, the room filled up with laughter, and they all entered the star room. From that day, they all made it a special spot to come and play every night, under the huge, bright star.

Once there was a boy named Tim. He was three years old and very happy. Tim loved to explore the world around him, and he did it a lot. One day, he saw something very special. It was a modern car–shiny, new and cool. Tim's face lit up with a big smile as he admired it.
Then, before he knew it, Tim was behind the wheel. He excitedly moved his hands around, pretending that he was driving. Time flew as he imagined himself zooming around and having adventures in the modern car.
Finally, Tim's mom came to the rescue. She told him it was time to go home. Tim was a bit sad but then he smiled again when his mom promised to take him out for a ride in the car some day. Together, they left for home with a big smile on Tim's face.

Once upon a time, a mommy and her son were walking to the park. On the way they saw a thermometer that had dropped on the ground. The son looked curiously at the thermometer and mommy said, "It looks fragile. I can teach you how to use it if you want?" The son was so excited and said, "Yes, please teach me!"
Mommy patiently explained how to use the thermometer, but every time the son tried to use it he dropped it on the ground. He couldn't get the hang of it.
Mommy said, "Be careful, if you drop it one more time it will break. Then it won't work anymore." But the son was so excited he didn't listen. He kept trying to use the thermometer, and then finally he dropped it one too many times and it broke.
The son started to cry, and mommy said, "That's okay. Maybe tomorrow I can get you a new thermometer. But for now, let's go to the park and play."
The son and mommy sadly walked to the park, knowing this had been a bad ending.

Once there was a boy called Jack who loved to play with cars. Every day he went to the garage, where he looked at all the different engines and dreamed of the things he could do with them.
One day he saw a big, red engine and he immediately knew what he wanted to do with it – he wanted to drive it! He asked his dad, but his dad said no.
Jack was very upset, but he decided not to give up. He had to find a way to make his dream come true.
So, one day he snuck into the garage and sat in the driver's seat. He was really excited, and started pushing all the buttons he could see. The engine roared to life and he tried to drive it.
But the engine had not been taken care of properly, and suddenly it broke down! Not only that, but it created a lot of smoke and noise, which made Jack's dad very angry.
Jack was very sad and he felt very hungry. His dad scolded him and said he could never come back to the garage again.
Jack sadly walked away, feeling very unhappy and never came back to the garage again.

Once upon a time there were two friends, Clara and Bob. They were so excited - they were going to unlock their secret treasure!
Bob took out the key and started to unlock the chest. They both looked inside, and saw a salad! Clara's eyes lit up - salad was her favorite food!
“Look at all of the lettuce, tomatoes, and cucumbers!” Bob said excitedly.
Clara grabbed a spoon from the kitchen, but then she remembered something. “Oh no, the salad is wet! What do we do now?”
Bob shrugged his shoulders. “No problem! I have the perfect solution. Let’s dry it off with a towel.”
Clara smiled. “Yay, that’s a great idea!”
So Bob dried the salad with a towel and they both enjoyed the delicious salad. They both agreed that it was the best salad they had ever tasted.

One day, Jill the 3-year-old girl was walking near the big gate. She knew her mommy would be home soon and she wanted to surprise her! Jill prayed that her mommy would be happy.
Suddenly, she heard a big 'boom'. The gate opened and something was coming through. It was an unknown thing that Jill could not see.
"What is it?" she asked.
The thing said, "I'm here to answer your prayer!" Jill was excited and cheered.
The thing said, "I will give you a special surprise for when your mommy gets home!"
When Jill's mommy opened the door to the house, she saw the surprise! Her face was filled with joy and she thanked Jill for praying. From then on, Jill learned that prayers can be answered in unknown ways.

Once upon a time, there were two friends, Tom and Bob. Tom was a brave boy, and Bob was very shy. 
One day, Tom saw a shiny ball on the ground. He wanted to catch it, so he ran and tried to grab it. Suddenly, he heard a police siren!
“Oh no!" said Tom. "We have to run!"
The police chased them and soon caught them. They took them to jail and locked them in pens.
Tom was ashamed. He started to cry. Bob was too scared to speak.
Tom and Bob stayed in jail for a long time. They never saw each other or the shiny ball again.

Once upon a time, there were two friends, Emily and Joe. 
Joe said to Emily, "Let's pretend that we are going on a trip." 
Emily smiled. "Ok! What should we bring with us?" 
"Let's take the toy luggage," said Joe. 
So Emily and Joe went to the playroom and grabbed the wide toy luggage. 
They pretended that each of them had their own suitcase and imagined a wonderful trip.
They had so much fun that day!

Henry was in his bedroom, looking through his drawers. He wanted something special to do, but nothing seemed exciting. Then, he noticed a plain, ordinary drawer. He opened it and, to Henry's surprise, a tiny creature was inside! The creature, which had bright red eyes, said hello. Henry replied, "Oh, hello, who are you?" The creature told Henry that its name was Percy, and that it lived inside this ordinary drawer.
Henry thought this was very strange, but he decided to ask Percy what it wanted. Percy said it wanted company, as it was lonely living in the drawer all by itself. Henry immediately felt bad for Percy, and he asked how he could help. Percy replied that Henry could take it out for adventures, so Henry quickly agreed. 
However, Henry's parents said that it wasn't a good idea. They said Henry had to put Percy back in the drawer and leave it there, as it was too dangerous to take outside. Henry disagreed, and he said they should at least let Percy have some friends. After a short argument, Henry's parents said they would think about it. 
Henry was relieved and gave Percy a big smile. He knew that his parents were usually reasonable, so he was sure the two of them would come up with a solution soon. Little Percy was very excited too and, in that moment, it felt like nothing could stop them.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Tina. She was three years old and she loved to play.
One day, while Tina was playing with her toys, she heard a loud noise. It came from the kitchen. She ran into the kitchen and saw that the refrigerator was open.
Tina asked her mom, "Mommy, why is the refrigerator open?"
Her mom replied, "I heard a loud and strange noise, so I came to the kitchen to check what it was. Someone must have opened the refrigerator."
Then, suddenly, a big and furry cat popped out from behind the refrigerator. Tina said, "Look Mommy! The cat opened the refrigerator!"
The mom smiled and said, "Yes, Tina. The cat must have struck the door with its paw!"
Tina laughed and said, "That cat is so funny!" Then she chased the cat out of the kitchen.

I went to the store with my mom. She was looking for a special plant. It had to fit in a special spot in our house. She was looking for a sunflower! We saw a big pot of bright yellow flowers. They were perfect! My mom printed some paper and we paid for them.
When we arrived home, we put the sunflower in the special spot. It fit perfectly! We gave it some water and some sunshine. It was so happy.
Every day I would sit and look at the sunflower. Its tall stem made it seem so strong. Its yellow petals were so beautiful. It looked like it was smiling!
When it was time for dinner, I would give the sunflower one last look before I went inside. Seeing it made me feel so happy. That sunflower was a perfect fit!

Momo was a sad three-year-old girl. She had lost her favourite pencil, which was special to her. She was very sad and she wasn't sure how she could find it.
Momo's mom came over to her and smiled. She said, "Don't be sad, honey. I'm sure we can find your pencil." She put her hand on Momo's shoulder and said, "Let me remind you. Where were you when you last had your pencil?"
Momo thought for a moment and then remembered. She said, "I had it when I was drawing in my room." She smiled and felt a bit better.
Momo's mom hugged her and said, "Let's go look in your room." They both went to Momo's room and, sure enough, Momo's pencil was there.
Momo was very relieved and happy. She said "Thank you, Mommy." Momo's mom smiled and said, "Well, my little one, that's what mummies are here for—to help you when you are sad.

Once upon a time, there lived a little girl called Sarah. She was 3 years old and loved playing with her toys. One night, Sarah had a dream. In the dream, an old lady appeared, who warned Sarah not to pick up the heavy rock. Sarah was very scared and did not want to pick it up at all. 
The next morning, Sarah told her mom all about her dream. Her mom smiled at Sarah and said, "Don't worry, it was just a dream! But it's a good warning to not pick up anything too heavy, okay?" 
Sarah smiled and nodded. She thanked the old lady in her dream and promised herself to always listen to warnings.

One day, Mamma was taking her little girl to the park. "Mamma, what's a blueberry?" asked the little girl. Mamma smiled and explained, "A blueberry is a round, sweet fruit. It's usually purple, and tastes delicious!" 
The little girl liked the sound of that, so she asked Mamma to get her some. Mamma took her to the market, and they went to the fruit stand. There were cherries, oranges, and apples. But there, tucked away in the corner, were some soft and plump blueberries.
Mamma picked out the biggest, juiciest blueberries, and the little girl's eyes got very wide. She asked Mamma why there were also some very small, old-looking blueberries beside the big, juicy ones. Mamma explained that the old-looking blueberries were very dry, and wouldn't taste as good, so it was better to get the bigger ones.
The little girl thanked Mamma and took the biggest, ripest blueberry home with her. She quickly ate the entire blueberry in one bite, and smiled proudly. Mamma smiled back and explained that blueberries made her strong and healthy. The little girl nodded, understanding now why blueberries were so important for her.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Sally. Sally's mum had given Sally a trusty mop to do her chores around the house. Sally loved her mop very much, she thought it was cool and hairy. One day, Sally's mum said to her; "Sally, if you use your mop to clean the kitchen I will give you a treat". Sally was very excited at this and said yes.
Sally went to the kitchen to start cleaning, but there was a problem. The kitchen was very messy, and even with her trusty mop it was hard for Sally to clean it. She tried and tried but there was still a big mess. She started to worry until she noticed something weird.
The floor was covered in fur! As Sally looked closer, she realised that it was coming from her mop! The mop was actually really hairy, and it was getting stuck in the mess she was trying to clean up.
Sally went back to find her mum, who laughed and said; "Sally, I knew this would happen with that hairy mop of yours, so I gave you an extra challenge. Now, let's go find you that treat you were promised!"

Tina was so excited. She was going to get to fly for the first time. Her dad prepared the plane for her and filled it with fuel. He then attached the strings and put them in Tina’s hands. When she pulled them, the plane began to lift off the ground.
At first, Tina had a lot of fun. She was so high and the air was making her dizzy. But suddenly the strings attached to the plane started to come loose. Tina tried to pull them, but they would not re-attach. The plane started to drift higher and higher until it was out of sight.
Tina was scared, the plane was going further away and she was all alone. She started to cry and didn’t know what to do. She tried waving her arms, but no one was near to help her. After what seemed like hours, the winds started to pick up and the plane became harder to control. 
The fuel started to run out, and soon the plane was falling from the sky. Tina screamed as it crashed into the ground and she was thrown backward. When the dust settled, Tina was lying on the ground, scared and dizzy. Her dad ran towards her, but he was too late. Tina had been in an accident and she was never the same again.

Once, there was a little girl who loved to hop. One day, she hopped all the way to a pond. When she arrived, she saw a big, white goose. The goose hissed and looked dangerous.
The little girl was scared, so she stepped back a little and said, "Hello, Mr. Goose. I'm sorry I scared you."
The goose seemed angry and stood tall, with his wings spread wide. He said, "If you want to stay here, you'll have to hop away!"
The little girl was scared, but she knew she had to be brave. She took a deep breath and said, "No. I won't go. I want to stay here and play."
The goose was so surprised that he stepped back and hissed again. The little girl smiled and said, "It's okay. I just want to be friends."
The goose suddenly seemed less dangerous. He shook his feathers and said, "Well, if you want to be friends, then you'll need to hop with me around the pond."
The little girl grabbed the goose's wing and hopped around the pond. They were the best of friends and hop around the pond every day.

Once upon a time in a far away land, there lived a princess named Jane. She was very brave and daring, but she was not very good at managing her time.
One day, Jane was late for her swimming lesson and she was very upset. When she got to the pool, it was raining outside and it was very wet.
Jane's teacher asked her, "What took you so long, Jane? You are very late!" Jane replied, "I'm sorry, Miss. I'm having trouble managing my time."
Her teacher said, "Well, let's find you something dry to wear and get you into the pool right away!"
So, Jane and her teacher found her some dry clothes. After she changed, Jane was happy and no longer upset.
The swimming lesson went very well, and Jane finally managed to get her time under control. She learned her lesson and never missed her swimming lesson again.

Once upon a time, two friends David and Amy were walking down a path in the forest. David stopped and said to Amy, "I'm so tired, I have to have a yawn!"
Amy looked at him and felt jealous. She wished she could take a nap too, just like David. David then said, "Take a break with me, Amy. Let's have a rest on the path!" 
Amy thought about this and said, "No, I'm not tired. I can't have a match with you in yawning!"
David laughed and said to Amy, "That's ok, I'm happy to stay here for a bit and rest before we keep walking." 
So the two friends David and Amy stopped on the path and took a few moments of rest. Later, they continued walking down the path, feeling happy and refreshed!

Once there was a town with a small house in the middle. One day, the people in town heard a loud ringing sound coming from the house. Everyone in town thought the ringing was really weird and wondered what was making the noise.
A little boy in the town named Jack was very curious and wanted to find out what was making the sound. So he asked his dad if they could go inside the house. Jack's dad was a bit worried, but said yes because he wanted to help out the people in town.
When Jack and his dad opened the door, they saw a big bell in the middle of the room. Jack thought it was really weird and asked why it was ringing. His dad explained that it was the town's alarm system for when people needed help. 
Jack was excited! He offered to help anyone who needed it, but his dad said it was too late. The people of the town had already solved their problem.
Jack said goodbye to the bell and felt a lot better knowing that it was something good. He waved goodbye to the town and went back home feeling proud that he helped out the town with his dad.

Once upon a time there was a little boy called Joe who was very troubled. He liked to wander out of his garden and explore the world around him. One day Joe stepped outside and saw a mysterious mist in the air. It was strange and he didn't want to get too close.
He heard voices coming from inside the mist, so he decided to take a closer look. As he stepped toward the mist, two figures suddenly appeared out of it. They were two ladies and they both started to stare at him. Joe was so scared he wanted to cry.
The ladies asked Joe why he looked so troubled. Joe told them he was worried about the mist. The ladies smiled and told him it was nothing to worry about. They said it was just the fog and the mist was just a part of the morning. Joe felt so much better knowing what the mist was and he thanked them for the explanation. The ladies smiled and said goodbye before walking back into the mist.
Joe stared at the mist for a while and finally felt peaceful. As he walked back home, the troubled feeling had gone away.

Frankie and Jack were best friends who loved exploring nature together. One day they spotted something very unusual while walking through the forest. What was it?
Frankie whispered to Jack, "It looks like a big, clever bird". Jack was so curious he ran towards it, leaving Frankie behind. 
Frankie, being the clever friend he was, realised it was not a bird but a very big, angry animal! He shouted for Jack to stop and come back, but it was too late. The animal attacked Jack and before Frankie could help, it was too late. Jack was gone.
Frankie was so sad and he knew he would never go exploring nature again with his best friend. He never should have let Jack run off. He should have been more careful. 
The end.

Once upon a time, a 3 year old boy named John was playing in the garden. He went to the pretty flower bed and rubbed the soft petals of the roses. The pretty colors made him laugh and smile. While he was rubbing the petals, he heard a loud noise.
John looked up, and saw an enormous bird flying above him. He was so surprised that he forgot all about the flower petals. The bird looked so beautiful, so he started to search for it in the sky.
John's dad saw his son looking up, so he called out: "What are you looking for my boy?"
John replied, "I'm searching for the enormous bird daddy!" 
His dad said, "Let's keep looking together. It must have gone somewhere!
So John and his dad kept searching for the bird. But no matter how hard they looked, they couldn't find it. After a while, John's dad had to go back to work, so he said goodbye to his son.
But John was determined to find the bird. He kept searching until nightfall. He kept searching until he finally found the enormous bird!
John was so excited. He waved goodbye to the bird and hugged his dad when he got home. No matter how long it took, nothing could stop him from finding what he was looking for.

John was crawling under the tall tree, looking for something. He didn't know what he was looking for, but he felt like he was supposed to be there.
Suddenly, John heard a rumbling noise coming from deep in the ground. He stopped and looked around, but he couldn't see anyone. 
He cautiously kept crawling, but the rumbling was getting louder. Then, he found a message on the ground. It was written on a dull piece of paper and it said "Stay away!" 
John was scared and he started to crawl away, but he was too late. A big creature came out from the ground and grabbed him with its claws.
John screamed. He was so scared, he never made it back home.

Once upon a time there was a chef. He was an expert at cooking. He had a secret recipe for a very special sauce.
One day, he wanted to share his recipe with the world, so he decided to raise his sauce. He wanted to make it bigger and better than ever before. 
But things did not turn out as he expected. Even though he worked hard to make it the same, the sauce was not the same as the original.
The chef was very disappointed. He said to himself, "This isn't the same as my original sauce. It's not the same flavor."
The chef was so upset that he threw away the sauce. It was the end of his secret recipe. He never could recreate the original flavor again.

Clara and her mom were walking in the park. As they were walking, Clara noticed a small, furry creature looking at them. It quickly ran away. 
"Mom," Clara asked, "What was that?"
"That was a mole," her mom replied. "They are very fragile animals."  
Clara knew moles were special and she wanted to find one so she could pet it. She looked around, but she couldn't find one. She kept walking and then blinked. When she looked again, she saw a large mole peeking out of a bush.
"There's one!" Clara shouted excitedly. She slowly approached the mole and stopped for a moment. The mole was shaking and blinking its eyes. 
"Don't worry," Clara said, "I won't hurt you."
She held out her hand and the mole slowly came towards her. She petted the mole gently and smiled. Clara knew that she had to treat the mole with extra care because they were so fragile.

Once upon a time, there lived a girl called Mop. She was only three years old, but she was very independent.
Mop's mom called her into the kitchen, “Mop! Come, help me dress the floor.” 
Mop entered the kitchen and saw a big mop next to the platform. She was so excited! She picked up the mop and started cleaning the floor. 
Once she was done, Mop's mom said to her, “Mop, you did a great job. You are so talented!” 
Mop smiled and said with pride, “Yes, I did a great job!” 
Mop and her mom finished dressing the floor together, and they were very proud of their work.

Tommy was so excited. He had never seen a jet before. He got to the airport and was so amazed. The jet was big and dark. He smiled and waved at it. 
Tommy kept watching until the jet started to move. He was so excited when it started to fly away. Suddenly, the sky went dark. He looked up and saw a storm coming. 
He tried to find his mom, but it was too dark. He started to cry and call out for her. A voice came out of the darkness: "Don't worry Tommy. I'm here." Tommy smiled and hugged his mom. 
But suddenly, a loud crash came from the sky. The jet had been struck by lightning and was falling right at them. Tommy screamed and ran away but it was too late. The jet crash landed, and they were both smushed. 
The end.

Once there was a great bear who wanted to make his house the best. He asked his friends, the penguin and the rabbit, to help him choose the best decorations. But they both disagreed.
The bear said they could paint the walls bright yellow and the rabbit said red. The penguin wanted the walls blue. The bear said it was too hard to decide, so he put labels on the three colour options. The bear asked the rabbit to pick a label. The rabbit chose the label with the colour red.
The penguin disagreed. He said the blue label was the best. He said it would make the house look great. The bear thought the blue label was a good idea too, and so the three of them decided to make the walls blue. They all worked together to make the house look great. The bear was very happy with the results.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny. She was always so full of energy and loved to stretch. She stretched all day long, jumping and hopping around, as bunnies do.
One day she was stretching when she noticed something really deep in the ground. It made her feel a bit worried. The bunny hopped over to get a closer look, but she couldn't quite reach it.
Suddenly, a little squirrel came by. "What is it?" asked the squirrel, who had seen the bunny trying to stretch and reach the deep thing in the ground.
The bunny said, "I don't know what it is, but I'm worried about it."
The little squirrel hopped over to get a closer look, and then said, "Oh, it's just a nut! You don't need to worry about it."
The rabbit was so relieved. She thanked the squirrel for being so kind, and the two of them hopped away, stretching and jumping all around. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy called Bob. He was 3 years old and he liked to play outdoors. One day, he was running around in a field, chasing butterflies.
Suddenly, he slipped on a mud patch and fell down. Bob started to cry because he had hurt his heel.
His mom came running to him, picked him up and said, “Oh, Bob! What happened?!”
Bob replied, “I slipped on something bad and hurt my heel.”
His mom took a look at his heel and saw it was a bit swollen. She said to him, “We need to go to the doctor, so that he can look at it.”
Bob nodded and said, “Ok, mommy.”
So, they went to the doctor and the doctor checked Bob’s heel. He said that Bob had to rest it for a few days to make sure it got better.
Bob nodded and said, “Ok.” He then thanked the doctor for helping him and went back home with his mom.
Bob was happy and thanked his mom for taking him to the doctor. He said, “Thanks, mommy! I’m so happy I’m not hurt anymore.” His mom was glad and said, “You’re welcome, my love! Let’

Lucy was a three year old girl who loved to jump. Everywhere she went, she was jumping. She was in her yard one day, and saw her house's roof. She saw how high it was, and decided to try and jump onto the roof. 
"I can jump up there!" she said happily.
She started to jump, but just kept falling short. No matter how hard she tried, she just couldn't reach the roof. 
Suddenly, a delicious ice cream truck drove by, and Lucy got an idea. She ran to the truck and bought some ice cream.
With the ice cream in her hand, she started to jump again, and sure enough, she made it onto the roof! She sat atop the roof, eating her delicious ice cream and feeling so proud of herself.

Once there was a group of children who were so excited they could barely contain themselves. They jumped up and down and started running around in circles. Suddenly, they saw something that made them all terrified. It was a big, scary spider! The children all screamed in fright and backed away quickly.
But after a few moments, they became curious. What was this spider up to? What did it want? As the children watched, the spider inched closer. It stopped and then started to wave its legs in the air. The kids couldn't believe it! It wanted to play with them!
The group of kids became excited again. They started to wave their arms in the air and laugh. The spider joined in the fun and everyone had a good time. Soon, no one was scared. Instead, they were all filled with joy and laughter.
The children had a great time playing with the spider. They continued to wave their arms and legs in the air as they laughed and shouted with delight. Every day, they looked forward to having more fun with their new spider friend.

Once upon a time there was a nice girl. She was walking through the forest when she found a message. She couldn't read it, so she decided to squeeze it. When she did, a big monster came out! She was so scared. The monster came closer and closer until he squeezed her tight! She felt so sad and scared. Then the monster left and she never saw him again. The message stayed with her forever and gave her a bad feeling. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lola. She was very curious and wanted to explore her world. One day, Lola was walking by the ocean, when she noticed an oyster. She wanted to take a look inside so she began to stir it. As she stirred, the oyster opened and Lola saw a pearl inside.
Lola was so excited. She showed the pearl to her mommy. Her mommy said, "Oh, my! That's a magical pearl. Put it back, Lola and make sure to stir the oyster so it closes again!"
Confused, Lola put the pearl back into the oyster and stirred as her mommy told her. Suddenly, the oyster grew giant and angry. It said, "Why did you stir me? Now I'm so upset!" Lola was scared, but her mommy said, "Oysters usually aren't this size and they don't usually talk. We must have reacted a magical spell by stirring the oyster and that's why it's so angry now."
Lola learned a lesson that day. No matter what she encounters, she should never stir it without thinking first.

Sam was a young boy who was very curious. Every day he wanted to explore new things, like the cable that hung from the wall. One day, he asked his mom if he could touch it.
"No Sam," his mom said. She was very careful. "That cable is special, we have to be careful with it. We can't allow you to touch it."
Sam was sad. He wanted to touch the cable, so he asked his mom if maybe he could touch it just a little bit.
His mom thought for a moment and then said, "OK, but you have to be extra careful. You can only touch it very gently."
Sam was so excited that he was allowed to touch the cable. He was gentle and careful as he touched it. He was so happy that he was able to explore something new.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Jane. Jane was three years old and very curious. 
Every day, she would ask her mom questions. Today, Jane asked her mom, "What is the most important thing to remember?"
Her mom smiled and said, "Always spread value and be ready for anything." 
Jane didn't quite understand so she asked, "What does 'spread value' mean?"
Her mom explained, "If you spread value, it means that you can share something special and make people smile. If you see someone who needs help, you should try to help them and be kind."
Jane nodded her head. She was ready to spread value and make someone smile!

John went to the park on Wednesday. He felt happy to find so many things he liked. He saw lots of birds, trees, swings and slides. He was so excited. 
John kept playing until it got dark. Suddenly, he felt so scared and alone. He started to cry and yelled, "Mommy! Where are you?"
John heard someone calling him. It was his mommy! He ran to her and hugged her tightly. 
John's mommy said, "It's terrible to be alone in the dark. I'm glad you waited here and didn't wander off. Let's go home now." 
John nodded and smiled. He was glad that he found his mommy again.

Once upon a time, there was a large family of bears. They were usually very happy and shared lots of hugs and food together. 
One day, the youngest bear was feeling worried. He didn't want to share his toast with anyone else. 
The mother bear smiled at him and said, "Little one, why don't you want to share your toast?" 
The little bear shrugged sadly and said, "I'm worried that I won't have enough for everyone."
But the mother bear told him that there were enough pieces of toast to share with everyone in the family. Everyone was able to eat a delicious snack. 
The little bear was so happy! They all shared the toast and it was the most delicious snack ever. 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a prince and princess who were very much in love. Every day, the prince asked the princess to marry him but she kept saying no.
One night, a thunderstorm swept through the kingdom. The prince ran to find the princess, who was standing helplessly in the rain. He asked her, "Will you marry me?"
She smiled and said, "I will! Yes, I will marry you!" The prince beamed with happiness and hugged her tightly.
The next morning, the kingdom celebrated the prince and princess's marriage. Everyone was so happy that the prince and princess were together.
And ever since, they have been happily married. The end.

Once upon a time, there lived a boy called Jack. He loved to read magazines and shared them with his sister, Elsa. One day, Jack asked Elsa if they could read a magazine together.
Elsa said to Jack, “No, I don't want to share. I want to keep it all to myself”.
Jack was very sad and he didn't understand why his sister was being so selfish. He said, “But we can discuss the magazine together and have fun!” 
Elsa thought about it and realized she was being rude and selfish. She said, “You're right, let's read the magazine together and discuss it”.
So Jack and Elsa shared the magazine and enjoyed discussing it. They had a lot of fun and it was a good lesson for Elsa to learn that sharing is better than being selfish. The end.

Mina was a three year old girl who loved to explore. She was always eager to make discoveries. One day, she was given the chance to use a microscope. She felt very excited. She put her eye to the microscope and said, "Wow!"
Mina looked into the microscope and saw lots of different things. She was very curious and tried to think of names for the things she saw. Mina was so cheerful. She just couldn't stop smiling.
Mina's mom asked her, "How did you enjoy the microscope, Mina?" Mina replied, "I enjoyed it very much! I saw lots of things and had lots of fun!"
Mina continued to explore through the microscope for the rest of the day and her mom kept asking her how she was getting on. Mina kept replying, "I'm having a lot of fun!". She was so cheerful and her mom was pleased.

Once upon a time there was a rabbit named Mike. He was hopping around in the forest and came across an acorn. Mike stopped and looked at the acorn thoughtfully. He had never seen one before. He decided to ask a nearby frog if he knew anything about acorns.
Mike hopped over to the frog and asked "What is that?" The frog looked serious, but then smiled and said "That's an acorn, it's a very special kind of nut." "What do you do with it?" asked Mike.
The frog said, "People sometimes carve them into holiday decorations or use the nuts for snacks." Mike thanked the frog and hopped away, feeling very curious about the acorn. 
He held the acorn in his paw, looking at it very seriously. He wondered what else he could make with the acorn. Suddenly, he had an idea. He raced back to the frog and asked "Do you know how to answer an acorn?"
The frog replied: "Yes, you can use it to make crafts or you can even use it to store things inside!" Mike smiled and couldn't believe it. He was so excited to have learned something new. He thanked the frog one more time and then hopped away with the acorn in his paw.

Once upon a time, there was a farmer who had a lot of rice. He and his wife were very happy because they had plenty of food. One day, the farmer wanted to go to a neighbouring village to see if he could buy some more rice.
His wife disagreed. She said it was too dangerous because the journey was very long. But the farmer was determined to go and they started to argue.
The farmer finally convinced his wife that it was safe and he left. But little did they know that danger was lurking.
When the farmer arrived at the neighbouring village, he was suddenly attacked by two bandits. They robbed him of all his money and he had nothing left. He returned to his home, feeling sad and with no rice.
The farmer and his wife disagreed no more. They learned a lesson: never go anywhere if it is dangerous.

Once upon a time, in a lush and beautiful forest, lived a persistent deer. She was determined to find the perfect spot to eat some tasty grass and take a nap in the warm sun. Everywhere she looked seemed perfect - but she couldn't seem to settle on a spot. 
Suddenly, she heard laughter. Startled, the deer looked around and spotted a small girl playing in a nearby clearing. The girl's eyes lit up with glee as she spotted the deer and shouted: "Can I hold you?" The deer, feeling shy, shook her head and stepped back. 
The little girl was disappointed and kept insisting: "C'mon, please? I just want to hold you for a second!" The deer felt confused, but eventually agreed. The girl took a few steps forward, her arms outstretched, and reached for the deer. 
The deer jumped away quickly. She felt scared and wasn't sure what the girl wanted. The girl kept trying to reach for the deer but the deer didn't budge. In the end, the girl gave up and thanked the deer for playing with her. Then, after a few moments, the persistent deer continued her search for the perfect spot to take a nap in the sun.

Grandpa was heading up the attic stairs as he heard a little voice calling for him. He smiled when he saw his grandson, Alex, enthusiastically waiting for him. 
“Come on, Grandpa! Let’s go to the attic!”
Grandpa was surprised. He hadn’t expected Alex to be so keen on exploring the attic, but he thought it would be fun to play detective with his curious grandchild.
When they reached the attic, Alex seemed to sense something that startled him. He reached for Grandpa’s hand.
“What’s wrong, little one?” Grandpa asked, squeezing his hand.
“The attic looks so…bitter," Alex said, feeling a sudden chill. He clung onto Grandpa, scared.
Grandpa chuckled softly, “We just need to find the surprise that’s hiding in here. I promise everything will be alright.”
Alex's eyes lit up. A surprise? They searched everywhere, and eventually found it — some old childhood photos of Grandpa and his brother. 
Alex hugged Grandpa and whispered, “I love you, Grandpa!”
Grandpa smiled and said, “I’m so happy that surprised made up for the bitterness we felt before.”

John and his mom were playing in the park. John saw a woman with a clear bag. He asked his mom what she had. His mom said, "Maybe she has toys."
John got excited and said, "Can we ask her if we can play too?" His mom said, "Sure, why not?" 
So John and his mom walked over to the woman. She smiled and said, "Hi there." John asked her if they could play with the toys in her bag. The woman nodded and said, "Of course you can."
John and his mom were very happy. They opened the bag and saw it was filled with pretend toys. John had lots of fun pretending to be a pirate and a knight. His mom even joined in and pretended to be a princess.
John and his mom had a lot of fun that day playing pretend with the woman. John was glad that he asked her about the clear bag. It was a wonderful day of make believe.

One day, Mum was feeling very hungry. She said to her three year old son, "I need sugar". Her son was so excited and ran off to get some sugar for her.
He took an empty bowl from the cupboard and went to the pantry. He opened the door and found a big bag of sugar. He scooped some sugar into the empty bowl and closed the pantry. 
He took the bowl back to Mum and said, "Here you go, Mum, I got you sugar!". Mum was so happy and she gave him a big hug.
Then she poured the sugar into a tea cup and took a sip. "Mmm, this is delicious," she said.
The little boy was so happy that he could help his mum. He had learnt that when someone says they need something, it's important to help them get it.

Once upon a time, there was a furry stamp. It loved to be set on cards and letters. One day, the stamp decided to go on an adventure. It hopped out of its box and off it went!
The furry stamp wandered through the park and came across a big tree. It set itself on a branch so it could look around. As it looked, it saw some squirrels playing nearby. They had furry tails and were so much fun to watch!
The stamp wanted to join in the fun. It set itself down on the ground and the squirrels immediately came over. The stamp couldn't believe it – they wanted to play with it!
The stamp and the squirrels played tag, hide and seek and had so much fun together. Soon it was time to say goodbye, but the stamp was so happy to have new furry friends. 
From then on, the stamp was never lonely - it would often set itself down to play and explore with the friendly squirrels!

Grandpa was always happy to see little Felix. He would scoop him up in his arms and give him a big hug.
Today Grandpa wanted to pay Felix for all his hard work. Grandpa handed him five coins.
"Thank you Grandpa," said Felix.
Grandpa smiled. "These coins will buy you lots of things," he said. 
But Felix was worried. He already had money, but he was saving up for something special.
"Grandpa, I need to save my money for next year. It's going to be a bad year," said Felix.
Grandpa's heart melted. He knew that Felix was very wise for such a small boy.
"I understand," said Grandpa. "Then we'll just have to find a way to pay for it together." 
Felix smiled. Grandpa was the best!

Once upon a time there was a little boy named Ben. Ben loved to play in his backyard. He would play with his blocks and his toys.
One day, Ben decided to climb up on the shed in his backyard. He thought he would be safe up there, but he was wrong. The shed was too high for him and he started to fall. Luckily, just before hitting the ground, his dad caught him!
"Ben, you need to be careful!" his dad said to him. "Things aren't always as comfortable as they seem. You need to think carefully before you try something new like this. You could have been really hurt!"
Ben thought about what his dad said and the next time he went to play in the backyard he chose to stay on the ground. He learned it was better to be safe than to be comfortable.

Once upon a time there was a boy called Peter who had a great friend called Polly. Every morning they got on their bike and cycled to the park.
Peter and Polly would go to the park to play on the swings and climb on the rails. They had ridden on the rails many times and they loved the feeling of being up high.
One day when they were riding, a crazy cat ran across the park and made them both scream! They stopped on the rails and looked down. The cat had gone and everything was quiet.
There were two other boys in the park and one of them shouted up to Peter and Polly “You don’t belong here!” The boys laughed and ran away.
Peter and Polly looked at each other and felt sad. They knew that the crazy cat had scared them off and they wished the two boys had stayed to play.
“Let’s stay here and show them we belong here,” Peter said. So they did. They climbed up the rail again and had a great time playing in the park all day.

Once upon a time there was a sweet little girl who loved to explore. One day she went on a walk and stumbled across a very sparkly jewel. She couldn't resist and reached out to take it. Suddenly the jewel started to twist and twist! She was so scared she ran home as fast as she could. 
When she was safe, she took a closer look at the jewel. It was shiny, with lots of colourful bits inside. She realized it wasn't doing any harm and so she decided to keep it. She twirled the jewel in her hands and made it twist again. 
The jewel made her feel so happy and she showed it to all her friends. They were so amazed and said it was the most beautiful jewel they'd ever seen. From that day on, the little girl always kept her special jewel safe and every time she held it, it made her feel sweet and special too.

Tommy and Patty were very good friends. Tommy had a kite and together they were having so much fun chasing it on a Sunday afternoon. They spoke to each other with smiles. As they flew kites, they laughed and their friendship seemed to unite them.
But then the wind became strong and the kites were flying away. Tommy and Patty both screamed and ran after their kites. No matter how fast they ran, the wind was too strong and flexible.
Tommy told Patty to stay by the tree but Patty was too scared and followed Tommy. Suddenly, a big spark came out of the tree and they got afraid. Tommy told Patty to run but it was too late. Tommy was hit by a spark of electricity and he could not move. 
Patty started to cry and screamed loudly. The ambulance came. Even though they tried to save him, it was too late. Tommy had passed away. Patty was very sad and united in sorrow.

Once upon a time, there were two friends named Jake and Lila. Jake liked to jump, and Lila liked to play hide and seek.
One day, Jake said to Lila, “Let’s start!”
Lila smiled and said, “Ok!”
They started to play, running and jumping around in the park. 
But after a while, Jake said, “I have to separate. My mom is calling me.”
Lila nodded. “OK. Maybe we can start again tomorrow.”
The next day, Jake and Lila wanted to play again, but Jake looked very distant. Jake saw a dark cloud move in, bringing thunder and lightning that made everyone run for cover.
Jake said to Lila, “Let’s separate until the storm passes.”
Lila nodded and said, “Yes, let’s start again when it's safe.”

Once upon a time, there was a ghost who wanted to go on an adventure. He put on his sneakers and started to jog around the world.
Along the way, he saw some yummy food that he wanted to eat. He stopped and licked his lips. Though he was very tempted, the ghost decided to jog away instead.
The ghost continued his journey, until he saw a group of children playing. He heard them talking about how it was important to stay healthy by eating right and exercising. The ghost then remembered why he was jogging in the first place and kept going.
At the end of his journey, the ghost was glad he did not give in to temptation and chose the healthier alternative instead.
The ghost said to himself, “Food can be yummy but staying healthy is much more important!”

Molly loved her bicycle. She always rode it up and down her street. Whenever the day was bright, she would take it out of her tight garage. She always put her seat and her handlebars just so. She was so proud of it and always gave it a big hug.
One day, she tried to ride it and her legs were too short. She needed help to make it go. Her mom saw her struggling and taught her how to pedal and how to keep it steady.
Molly was so happy and felt so proud when she finally rode it on her own. She was spinning around in her drive way and the experience was just grand!
From then on, Molly and her bicycle were like two best friends. They were together all the time, and she would love to ride it even when days were gray. She would wobble and try new tricks and her mom watched her with a smile.
Molly's bicycle was tight on days that it rained. But she always liked to take it out to feel the warm sun on her face. Her bicycle was her pride and joy and she would never trade it for anything else in the world.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Daisy. She wanted to play with something fun. So, she asked her mum if she could try a maze. Her mum said yes, and took out a white maze from the cupboard.
Daisy was excited when she saw it. She asked her mum, "What do I do with the maze?"
Her mum replied, "You just have to find your way through it. Use the walls of the maze to trace the path and get to the end."
Daisy smiled and started exploring the maze. She explored each and every corner of the maze and was very happy when she finally reached the end.
After she had completed the maze, Daisy ran back to her mum and said, "I did it! I solved the maze!"
Her mum said, "Well done Daisy! You must have really wanted it!"
Daisy nodded and said, "Yes, I really wanted to solve the maze!"

Jimmy was so excited to see the blue carpet. He made a big smile and clapped his hands. "Wow, look at the carpet!" he exclaimed.
His mom said, "Yes, isn't it beautiful?"
Jimmy couldn't stop smiling. He felt so happy. He wanted to jump and play on the carpet.
But when he tried to jump, he slipped and fell. His mom's face went sad. "Oh no, the carpet is ruined," she said with a sigh. 
Jimmy felt sad too. He tried to be brave and wiped away his tears. But deep inside, he felt very sad that his exciting time with the blue carpet was over.

Once upon a time, there was a curious little baby bird. The bird wanted to find something special and so he decided to go on a search. He flew all around the meadow looking for clues. 
Then, he saw a green leaf in the distance. He fluttered his wings and flew over to the leaf. When he arrived, he saw it was a special leaf with a sparkly silver wink in the middle. The little bird was so excited! He looked all around but he couldn’t find any more winks. 
So, he decided to go back and tell his family about his discovery. Back at home, he told his parents. “What a lucky little bird!” said his Mom. “If there’s one wink here, there could be more around!” 
The little bird thought about it for a moment and then had an idea. He went back to the meadow the next day and searched and searched all around until he found three more winks. He was so happy! 
He brought the winks home and showed his family. They all cheered and clapped! Now, the little bird has a special collection of green winks that remind him of his special search.

Once upon a time, there was a bird who was very rich. He wore a fancy green suit and a dashing purple hat. Everywhere he went, he showed off his fine garments with pride. He thought that he was the smartest of all the birds in the sky.
One day, the bird spotted a peasant in the nearby meadow. "Ooh, what a handsome peasant," the bird thought to himself. He flew down and asked the peasant, "Do you want to be just as smart and rich as I am?" The peasant responded, "Yes! Tell me how!"
The bird gave the peasant a riddle. "If you can answer this riddle, I will share my riches and smartness with you," he said. The riddle was: "What do I wear on my head?"
The peasant thought carefully for a few moments before responding, "Why, you wear a hat!" The bird was so impressed that he gifted the peasant his fine purple hat in addition to his smartness and riches. The peasant was so pleased, he never had to worry about money or knowledge again.  He could fly as high as the birds, and wear the finest suits to show off his wealth. 
The moral of the story is, be ready and willing to learn, and you may be blessed with great riches.

Once upon a time there was a rich man who had a shelf in his boat. He sailed the boat around the world, looking for treasure. One day, he docked his boat at a small island. As he stepped off his boat, he heard a voice calling to him, “Hey sir, could you help me out?”
