He looked around, but he couldn’t find the voice. Then he saw a small frog sitting on his shelf. “Can it be?” the man asked himself. He looked closer, and there really was a frog!
“What can I do for you, little one?” he asked the frog. The frog replied, “I can make you very rich, but only if you help me. Will you help me?”
The man agreed, and the frog hopped off the shelf and told the man what he must do. After the man did it, the frog said, “Now you are very rich!” The man was so happy that he hugged the frog and set him free.
He thanked the frog and waved goodbye as he sailed away. He vowed he would never forget the rich gift that the frog gave him. 
THE

Once upon a time, there was a little duck who loved to swim in the pond that he lived in with his family.
One day, he noticed that the pond's owner had put a fence around it. The little duck was sad. He asked the owner why he had done it.
The owner explained that the fence was to prevent anything bad happening inside the pond. The duck asked if he could still get in and the owner said yes, but he had to be careful.
The duck became sad again. He wanted to keep exploring the pond and playing with his family in the water. He asked if the fence was flexible so that he could have some freedom.
The owner told him that it was very strong so that nothing could break it, but he understood that the duck wanted some freedom. The owner found a way to fix it so that he could get some of the freedom he wanted.
From then on, the little duck had fun exploring the pond and playing with his family. He was happy that the owner had found a way to make the fence flexible so that he could still enjoy his home.

Once upon a time there was a playful bunny. Every morning he would hop around the garden counting all the flowers. He loved counting and he was really good at it! 
One afternoon he saw a funny little bird fly by with a message in its beak. He was very curious and wanted to know what the message was. He asked the bird what the message said, but the bird just flew away without answering. 
The bunny was so curious that he decided to follow the bird. He ran and hopped around the garden, but the bird was too fast and he couldn't keep up. Suddenly, he heard a voice from above. He looked up and saw the bird on a tree branch. The bird was singing a song and it was the same song as in the message! 
The bunny, who had been so curious to know what the message said, was so happy that he had solved the mystery. He jumped and sang along with the bird until night time, counting all the stars in the sky along the way.

It was a sunny day and everything seemed perfect. But then, a "disturb" came along. Lily, who was a 3 year old girl, saw it and she was scared. She started to cry and she felt "frightened".
Suddenly, her mother appeared and she asked: "What is wrong, Lily?"
Lily replied: "I saw a "disturb" and it scared me". 
Her mother asked: "A disturb? Where?"
Lily pointed to the sky, where a bird was flying. Her mother smiled and said: "Oh, there's nothing to be "frightened" of, it's just a bird, see! Its name is Lily, just like yours!"
Lily smiled and was no longer "frightened". She watched the bird fly until it flew away into the horizon.

One day there was a little boy who found an oxygen canister. He was so grateful that he had something to fill his lungs with so he ran home and grabbed a balloon. He wanted to stay happy forever and promised to keep the oxygen canister with him always. But suddenly, the oxygen ran out and the little boy started to get sleepy. He wanted to stay awake, but the oxygen was all gone. He lay down, feeling very tired and soon the little boy feel fast asleep and couldn't wake up again. He was gone forever. Everyone was very sad and they were grateful for the time he stayed with them.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Daisy. She loved to play and keep herself busy, but she felt very lonely. Every day she saw her mom and dad wearing the same uniform to work. She wished she had a uniform too.
One day she asked her mom, “Mom, can I please have a uniform?” Her mom smiled and said, “Of course sweetheart!”
The next day, Daisy woke up early and put on her new uniform. She felt so excited and no longer lonely. She ran out of the house and said goodbye to her mom and dad.
“Where are you going now, Daisy?” Her mom asked. “I’m off to play with my friends,” Daisy said. She ran off with a big smile on her face.

Mum got a delicious screw from the shop. She brought it home and put it in the cupboard.
Jack saw he mum get the screw and asked for one. Mum said yes, so she gave Jack a delicious screw too. He was so happy.
Jack picked up the screw and played with it. He used it to get things from the cupboard. He opened the cupboard and got out his favourite toy. 
Mum saw Jack playing with the screw and said he was being very clever. She smiled as Jack proudly showed her the thing he'd got out of the cupboard.
They both smiled and played together with the screw and the toy. It was a fun and delicious day!

A green frog and a brown frog were very good friends. One day, the green frog told the brown frog about a war in the sky. He said the sky was full of planes and bombs and that there was a lot of noise.
The brown frog was very scared. He asked what they should do and the green frog said they should hide. So they hopped under a leaf and stayed very still.
They stayed under the leaf for a long time and were very quiet. Eventually the sky went back to being blue and quiet again. All the planes and bombs were gone.
The green frog and brown frog were so happy the war was over. They jumped out from under the leaf, happy to see the sky was peaceful again. They hugged each other tightly and realized how lucky they were to have each other during the war.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Mel. She was three years old and loved to explore. One day, she decided to look for something special in her garden. As she searched, she stumbled across an old and ugly box. She slowly opened it and was surprised to reveal many things inside. There were strange books with colourful pictures, along with some unusual objects. 
Mel was curious and asked her mum, "Mummy, what is all this stuff?". Her mum smiled and said, "This is called yoga, sweetheart. It can help you relax and feel better, but also makes your body stronger". 
Mel was excited and wanted to try it right away! She couldn't wait to show her friends at school.
Once at school, she found her friends and revealed the secret of yoga. Some of them laughed and called it "weird" and "ugly", but this didn't bother Mel. She was so proud to share her discovery, and wanted to show everyone that yoga was more than just an old and ugly box. From that day on, Mel was a big fan of yoga!

Dolly felt excited as she looked around the playground. She saw lots of children playing together, and she wanted to join in the fun. 
"Mama, can I join them?" She asked her mom.
"Yes, my darling," Mama said with a smile.
Dolly skipped over to the children. She waved at them, but they didn't seem to notice her. She tried harder, and finally they noticed her. Everyone was happy and played together. 
Suddenly, the children said they wanted to go the east side of the playground. Dolly asked if she could join them and they said yes. She was so excited to go!
But when they arrived, Dolly noticed something was strange. The east side of the playground felt different. Everyone seemed more careless and not so friendly. 
Dolly tried to join in their games, but they acted like they didn't care. She walked away, knowing something wasn't quite right. 
The next day, Dolly and her mum were talking about the east side. Mama told her not to go there again, and explained that some people who hang out there aren't so nice. Dolly realised what had happened the day before and was grateful her Mama had warned her in time. 
She never went back to the east side again, sticking to the safer parts of the playground instead.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Jack. He had a big blue ticket in his hand. He was so excited that he could hardly stand. 
Jack was about to lay his ticket down when a girl walked up to him. She asked "What is that you have in your hand?"
Jack showed her the big blue ticket and said, "This is my ticket. I'm going to lay it down."
The girl asked, "Where will you lay it down?"
Jack answered, "I'm going to lay it down on the floor."
So Jack carefully lay the ticket down on the floor. He was very excited and he smiled because he knew that something good was going to happen. 
And that's exactly what happened. The moment Jack lay down his ticket the walls of the room began to change and Jack was suddenly taken away on an incredible adventure.

Jack was walking around the park when he saw a battery on the ground. He was so excited! He knew batteries could save an electronic device. He picked up the battery and it was clear he had "saved" the day! He ran to his mom and showed her the battery. She was so proud of him. She took the battery and used it to power some toys. Jack was a hero and it was clear that he was proud of himself!

Once upon a time, there was a cold night. Inside a house there was a door with a handle. A little girl came to the handle and she touched it. It was very cold. She said, "Oh no! It's cold!"
Then she came back to the house and asked her mom for help. Her mom came outside and said, "Let me try." She held the handle, and it was cold, too.
So her mom said, "I know the best thing to do. Let's put a cozy warm blanket on the handle so it will be warm when you come back later."
The girl went and got a warm, cozy blanket, and she put it on the handle. Then she came back to the house.
And when she came back later that night, the handle was nice and warm. She smiled and said, "Thank you mommy! I love this warm handle!"

Once upon a time, there lived a little boy. His name was James. He was three years old.
One day, he said to his mom, "Mommy, I remembered something!" His mom asked, "What do you remember?" 
James replied, "I remember a black rhinoceros!" His mom was surprised. She asked, "Where did you see one?"
James said, "I saw it today when I was playing in the park. It was very big! I was scared." 
His mom smiled and said, "That's amazing that you remember it, James. Rhinos are special animals." 
Then James smiled and said, "I will always remember the big, black rhinoceros."

Once upon a time, there was a little boy called Jack. He loved playing in the garden and one day he found a dirty old comb. 
Jack ran inside and asked his mom, "Can I wash this comb?" 
His mom replied, "Yes, take it to the bathroom and use some soap and water. Then you can use it for your hair." 
Jack ran off to the bathroom and washed the comb with a lot of soap. He was so proud when it sparkled like new. He run back to the kitchen to show Mom. 
Mom was disappointed and said, "That's a spicy comb, not for kids!"
Little Jack was heartbroken and threw the comb away in the trash. 
The end.

Tommy skipped in the park. His mum watched him from nearby. He smiled as he skipped from one side of the park to the other.
Suddenly, Tommy saw something in the grass. It was a ladybug! It had wings that were open and he slowly moved a finger towards it. 
Just as he was about to touch it, the ladybug flew away. Tommy gasped with mazement.
"Well done Tommy," said his mum. "Can you remember what the ladybug wings were like?" 
Tommy thought for a moment. "Open!" he shouted, jumping up and down. 
Tommy's mum smiled and hugged him. "That's right!" she said. "Now let’s go and keep skipping!"

Mia's uncle was always a great guy to be around. He often visited Mia's family, and he was always so kind and generous. One day, Mia's uncle came to visit and he had a big surprise for Mia.
Mia was so excited as his uncle pulled out a large, smooth box. "This is for you," her uncle said, smiling.
Mia opened the box and pulled out a beautiful, smooth wooden toy airplane. She flashed a big smile at her uncle and thanked him.
"This is a special offer just for you," her uncle said, "it's from me to you."
Mia hugged her uncle tight and enjoyed playing with her special new toy the rest of the day. She was so excited to have this special offering from her uncle.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Jack. On Christmas Eve, Jack asked his mom if he could go outside and play with the reindeer. His mom said that he could, but he needed to wear a coat because it was cold outside. 
Jack got ready to go outside and he looked out the window. He could see the reindeer in the snow, and he was so excited. He smiled and ran outside to join them. 
But as Jack stuck his hand out to pet the reindeer, it ran away. He felt so sad and disappointed. He regretted not listening to his mom and not wearing his coat. 
When Jack went back inside, he told his mom what happened. His mom comforted him and they decided they take a walk together the next day. Jack felt much better and he was very excited. 
The end.

Teddy was a little bear who loved to play the piano. He loved to hear it's orange keys and make funny sounds.
One day, Teddy wanted to have a special day of playing. He wanted to show off to all his friends all of the things he could do. He ran to the piano and squeezed the keys. He felt so proud, so excited!
Suddenly, a dragon appeared from out of the orange sky! "What are you doing on my piano!" he bellowed. Teddy was so scared he ran away as fast as he could.
The dragon chased Teddy and caught him. He squeezed Teddy tightly, and tears streamed down his face. Teddy would never play the piano again.

Grandma and Grandpa were so proud one day. They had made something special for their little grandchild. It was a sparkly heart, shaped like a balloon, with all the colours of the rainbow. They filled it with love, and then poured it into a jar with a bow on top. 
"Now, our grandbaby will feel the love each time she looks at it," said Grandma. 
That day the grandparents gave the jar to their grandchild who hugged it tightly and smiled. "Thank you!"
Grandpa was especially proud, his heart almost exploding with love. The grandparents hugged each other and all three of them beamed with joy. 
Grandma said, "Remember, all you have to do, my dear, is pour a little bit of this love into your heart each time you feel sad." 
The grandchild nodded and smiled, happy that she had something so special, made with so much love.

Once, there was a bull who was fierce. He lived in a farm with a lot of other animals.
One day, the bull was walking in the farm when he saw something that made him very angry. He saw a chicken covering an egg. This made the bull feel very fierce and mad.
The bull stomped over to the chicken and said in a loud, fierce voice: "What are you doing?"
The chicken was scared and said in a tiny voice: "I'm covering this egg."
The bull said: "I think you should stop covering the egg. If you don't stop, I'm going to hurt you!"
The chicken was very scared and quickly ran away.
The bull was so fierce and full of rage that he started to cover the whole farm. He was determined to cover everything. In the end, all the animals fled the farm in fear.
The bull had finally gotten what he wanted, but he had also destroyed the place he once called home.

Sally and Shelly were two friends, who loved to use the pool. They loved the feeling of the water on their skin and spending time together.
One day, Sally came to the pool with a big surprise. She said to Shelly, "Look what I have! A competition swimming suit!" Shelly was excited and they both put their suits on.
When they were ready, they began to swim. At first, it was all fun. They enjoyed swimming around and splashing each other. But then Sally started getting competitive—she wanted to beat Shelly and she was swimming much faster.
Shelly got frustrated and said to Sally, "It's not a competition. Let's just have fun in the pool!" But Sally wouldn't listen.
In the end, they both decided to take a break and sit by the side of the pool. They didn't talk much, but Sally finally realized that she had gone too far. She said to Shelly, "We can just be friends. It's not a race." 
Shelly smiled and gave Sally a big hug. They both agreed that having fun was the most important part of using the pool.

Once there was a curious little girl. She looked out the window and saw something shiny in the sky. It was a helicopter! She was so excited. She had never seen one before. She asked her mom to polish her shoes so she could go outside and take a closer look. When she did, she saw that the helicopter was even shinier than before. It was so sparkly and pretty. She waved at the pilot in the cockpit. He waved back and she smiled. She was so happy to have seen the shiny helicopter.

Once upon a time, there was a girl. She was always very happy, and she loved to share.
One day, she had a special surprise for a friend. She had a box of colorful cereal. She was so excited to share it with her friend.
When the girl arrived at her friend's house, they both gave each other a big hug.
"What do you have in the box?" asked the friend.
"It's a surprise!" said the girl with a smile.
They opened the box together and the friend gasped in surprise when she saw the colorful cereal.
"I thought you might like them," said the girl happily.
The two friends shared some of the cereal and talked about their day. After they ate, they hugged again.
The girl knew that sharing the cereal with her friend made them both so happy. And she was grateful that her friend was willing to share.

Once upon a time, there was a man and woman who loved each other. They wanted to get married but the man wouldn't ask the woman. He was scared to ask her, worried that she would say no. So no matter how much the woman insisted, the man wouldn't ask her. 
One day, the woman made him a beautiful veil for their wedding. She said that if he didn't want to ask, he could just put the veil on her head and that would mean they were married. The man still wouldn't ask, but he slowly put the veil on her head.
When the veil was on her head, the man and woman both smiled. It was the perfect moment. The woman laughed and said, "I told you, if you wouldn't asked, you could have put the veil on my head and we'd be married."
The moral of this story is that when we find something that is perfect, we must not be afraid to take the chance. We must always be brave and persistent to get the outcome we desire.

Once upon a time there lived a little girl named Jane. Jane was only three years old and she loved going to the park with her mom.
One day, Jane and her mom went to the park to play. There, Jane found a dirty tape on the ground. She picked it up and showed it to her mom.
"What is it, Mommy?" asked Jane, excitedly.
Her mom smiled and said, "It looks like a tape, Jane. Let's keep it."
They took the tape home and Jane kept it in her room. She would look at it and remember playing in the park.
One day, when Jane came home from school, she found the tape on the floor of her room. It was very dirty and it didn't work. Jane was sad because she wanted to remember the wonderful time she had in the park.
Suddenly, Jane remembered what her mom had said. She smiled and ran to the kitchen to get a cloth and some water. She cleaned the tape and it worked again!
Jane smiled and thought to herself, "Remember to always take care of your things!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Ali. She loved to sing and dance, and she was always in the rhythm. One day, Ali was walking around in the park when she saw a man. He seemed rude and mean. 
"Hi, what’s your name?" Ali asked.
The man said nothing and went away. Ali was sad and felt very lonely.
The next day, Ali went to the park again, but this time she was more careful. When the man showed up once again, Ali decided to stay away from him. She kept a distance and watched him carefully. Suddenly, the man turned around and shouted at Ali in a very rude way.
Ali was very scared and quickly ran home.
The moral of this story is: always be careful of strangers and don't talk to them. It's better to stay away and not get too close.

Once upon a time, there was a large hill with green grass. On top of the hill lived two friends, Stuart and Sally. One day, Stuart and Sally were playing together, when suddenly Stuart felt the raindrops on his face.
Sally said, "Oh, I think it's going to rain. Let's go back to my house." So they ran quickly to Sally's house, and when they got there, Sally's mom gave them both a big smile.
"Go have a nice shower and put on your pajamas!" said Sally's mom. So Stuart and Sally put on their pajamas and went to the shower. They felt the warm water on their backs, and when they came out, they were both feeling much better.
Suddenly, a voice came from the sky. It said, "Rise and stand tall!" Stuart and Sally looked up, but they couldn't see who was talking to them. Then the voice said, "The rain has come to wash away your troubles. Always remember to stand tall and be brave, even in difficult times." 
Stuart and Sally nodded their heads and smiled. They knew that the voice in the sky was right. With courage, anything is possible!

Mikey was very excited. He had just found a drum. It was a clear drum and it was very pretty. He wanted to play it. Mikey grabbed the drum and ran outside. He banged his hands on it and the sound was loud and exciting. He wanted to show everyone his drum. Mikey ran around the house and shouted, "Look what I found!" His mom and dad were proud of him. 
After a while, Mikey got tired and ran off to find somewhere to rest. He found a tree with a big leafy branch. He climbed up and sat on the branch with his drum. He started to play it and the sound echoed through the trees. Mikey smiled and he was so proud of his clear drum.

Once upon a time, there were two little worms, Joe and Yolanda. They were playing in a garden when, all of a sudden, a big hook appeared! Joe was scared, but Yolanda was very clever.
Yolanda thought for a moment and then said, "Let's count to ten before we move. Maybe the hook will go away!" So, Joe and Yolanda counted to ten and, sure enough, the hook had gone!
Joe and Yolanda were so excited! The moral of the story is: It pays to be clever. Being brave is important, but being clever can be even more helpful.

The sun was shining brightly and the birds were singing. It was a beautiful day.
But it was getting windy.
"Sally, you should get your umbrella," her mom said. "The wind is blowing."
Sally smiled and ran to get her umbrella. She put on her pink raincoat and opened the umbrella.
The wind was so strong that the umbrella started to move over her head. It was moving faster and faster. It was a race between the wind and the umbrella.
Suddenly, something unexpected happened. As the wind increased in speed, the umbrella started to snag on a tree branch until it snapped off.
Sally watched sadly as the dead umbrella was taken away in the wind. She looked up to the sky and the sun was shining again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She was very polite. Everywhere she went she said please and thank you. One day she wanted to take a march. She put on her shoes and started to walk.
As the little girl started walking, she saw a puddle. It was so big that if she walked in the middle, even her shoes would get wet. She didn't want to get her shoes wet, so she stopped and watched the puddle carefully.
Suddenly, a magical voice came from the sky. “Little girl, I can help you,” the voice said. “Yes, please help me!” the girl said. 
The voice said, “I will pour something over the puddle to make it go away. Just march the other way, so you don’t get wet.” 
The girl marched around the puddle, and the magical voice poured something on the puddle. When she looked back, the puddle was gone! The little girl was so happy and she thanked the magical voice.
The little girl thanked the magical voice for helping her stay polite and dry. Then she continued her march, surefooted and happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Allie. Allie was three years old and loved to play outside in the sunshine. One day, Allie's dad said to her, "Let's go get the swing!" The swing looked very impressive. Allie ran to it and said, "Daddy, can we swing on it?"
Daddy laughed and said, "Of course, my little one! I just need to release it from the tree first." Allie watched as Daddy released the swing from the tree. Once it was free, Allie hopped on and said, "This will be so much fun!"
 
Daddy pushed Allie on the swing, higher and higher until she reached the sky! Allie felt so happy and free as the wind flew through her hair. She felt so impressed by her swing and couldn't believe how lucky she was to have it. 
When Allie was done swinging, she jumped off and hugged her daddy. She said, "Thank you Daddy, I had so much fun!" Daddy smiled and said, "You're welcome sweetheart, I'm glad you like it!"
Allie and Daddy continued to play the rest of the day. Allie spent the rest of her days playing on her impressive swing.

One day, there was a thief. He wanted to steal something very special. He knew he needed a plan. He wanted something that was very heavy, so he came up with an idea. He decided to weigh things at the market. Every day he went to the market, he would look around and weigh different items.
One day, he came upon an open box. It was very heavy, so the thief was very excited. He thought it would be the perfect item to steal. He quickly took the box and ran away.
The thief did not know that the box was filled with coins and jewels. He was only focused on the fact that it was heavy. Little did he know, that he had just stolen the most valuable item in the market!

Mia was so excited to decorate the house for Christmas. She had a big red Santa sack and she ran around gathering up all the decorations she wanted to use. First, she found a big red poinsettia flower and placed it on the mantel. Then, she found a big wide cane with green and red stripes. She held it up and shouted, "Mommy, look, a cane!" Mommy smiled and tied a big golden bow around the cane. Mia was delighted with the cane, and ran around showing it to everyone. 
Next, Mia and Mommy went on a hunt for more decorations. After searching through all the boxes, they found some big white snowflakes and hung them in the windows. Mia was very proud of their work — the house looked so cool!
At last, Mia and Mommy sat down in the warm glow of Christmas and admired all their hard work. Mia smiled at Mommy and said, "Mommy, our decorations make this house look really wide!" Mommy smiled and gave Mia a big hug.

Jeremy woke up early one day and couldn't wait to go to the river. He was so excited because he was going to go there with his pet, Spot. Spot was a big, old, grey dog.
Jeremy and Spot hopped into the car and started driving. They passed trees and houses and finally, they reached the river. Jeremy opened the car door and said, "Let's go Spot!"
Spot jumped out and started running towards the river. Jeremy saw the river was organized, with a bridge and a dock in the middle. It was the perfect place to play.
Jeremy and Spot started having a lot of fun. Jeremy splashed around while Spot chased after rocks. Then Jeremy started scooping up water from the river and throwing it at Spot. Spot just seemed to enjoy everything.
Jeremy had so much fun that he didn't want to go back home. But when the sun started to set, it was time for them to go. Jeremy said, "Let's play here again, Spot!" and Spot barked happily in agreement. They both climbed back in to the car, happy and tired from the day's activities.

Once upon a time there was a bald boy called Thomas. He was three years old. One day, he was playing in his bedroom when he discovered a bookshelf. He got very excited and decided to explore it.
Inside the bookshelf, he found a box. He opened it up, but it was empty. He got very scared and ran out of the bookshelf.
Thomas looked around the room, but he couldn't find anyone. Suddenly, a voice from the bookshelf called out to him.
“Come closer, Thomas,” the voice said.
Thomas was scared, but he was also curious. He slowly walked towards the bookshelf and discovered an old man. The man was bald.
“What do you want?” Thomas asked.
The old man smiled and said, “I want to take you away.”
Without thinking, Thomas took the man’s hand. The old man took him away to a scary, dark place and disappeared. Thomas was never seen again.

Molly was very excited. She was going to the park with her mom and dad and they had brought a very special mug with them. The mug was bright and cheerful and it caught Molly's eye right away. She ran to it and grabbed it.
"Where did you find this great mug?". asked Molly.
"We found it at the store," said mom.
Molly couldn't believe it. She had never seen such a pretty mug in her life. She held it tightly and ran off to explore the park.
She was having so much fun that she didn't notice the sun going down. Suddenly she looked up and realised it was getting dark.
"Oh no," she said. "Where is my mug?".
Molly looked everywhere, but it was nowhere to be seen. It had vanished!
Molly started to cry. Her mom and dad rushed to her side.
"Don't worry Molly," said Dad. "We'll find it. Let's retrace our steps and we'll eventually find it."
They searched high and low and eventually, in a corner of the park they found the bright, cheerful mug. Molly couldn't have been happier.

Mommy was giving Peter a big hug and said "I love you!" Peter said, "I love you too, Mommy!" Mommy said, "How about we go to the bathroom and get a warm bath together?" 
So they went to the bathroom and Mommy helped Peter step into the nice warm bath. Peter was delighted with the warm water and said, "Oh, this feels so nice and warm Mommy!"
Mommy splashed some of the warm water on Peter's arms and said, "It's time for you to play in the water, Peter. Have fun!"
Then Peter started to splash around in the warm water, laughing and having a great time. He kept splashing and splashing and after a few minutes Mommy said, "Time to get out now. Let's get you dried off!"
Peter and Mommy got out of the warm bath and Mommy dried off Peter's back with a nice warm towel. Peter was so happy and said, "That felt wonderful Mommy, thank you!" Mommy smiled and said, "You're welcome Peter. Now let's go snuggle together and read a book!"

Once upon a time, there was an adorable little girl. She was three years old and lived with her mom and dad. Every day, the little girl was so excited to take her morning walk. Today was no exception!
As they walked, they saw a big bowl in front of them. It was filled with colorful flowers! The little girl was so excited, she shouted, “Mommy, look at the pretty bowl of flowers!”
Mommy smiled and said, “Yes, sweetheart, it’s so pretty! That’s why we call it an adorable bowl!” The little girl clapped her hands and said, “Thank you, Mommy! I love it!”
They continued to walk and soon the little girl saw a squirrel. She wanted to speak to it, so she said, “Hi, squirrel! How are you doing today?”
The squirrel hopped closer and said, “I’m doing very well, thank you!” The little girl smiled, then took Mommy’s hand and said, “Let’s keep walking, Mommy!” So they did, and the little girl felt so happy that day.

Once upon a time, there was a tight room filled with excited kids. Suddenly, a man with a trumpet entered. He was tall and smiled at everyone.
The man said, "Today I'm going to show everybody how to play this magical instrument. It's called a trumpet. Does anyone want to give it a try?"
All of the kids raised their hands. The man chose one of the kids, a three year old girl. She was really excited. With the help of the man, she put the trumpet up to her lips and tried to make a sound.
After a few tries, the girl made a beautiful sound. Everyone clapped and cheered. The girl was so proud and she smiled big. The man said, "With a little practice, you can really make this trumpet sing!" 
The girl was determined to practice and she kept the trumpet close. The man winked at her and said, "I just know that one day we'll hear your beautiful trumpet playing all around town!" 
The girl smiled and nodded. She was excited about the possibilities that could be in store.

Once upon a time there was a driver. He was very modest, and he worked hard all day long. He was so tired at the end of the day that he decided to take a nap. 
The driver pulled up to a large tree and reclined in his comfy chair. He closed his eyes and started snoring. 
Just then, he heard a voice. It was from a little three year old boy! 
"Mister Driver, why are you napping here in the middle of the afternoon?" asked the boy.
The driver was too tired to answer. All he wanted to do was take a nap. 
So he ignored the little boy and just kept snoring. 
The little boy was disappointed and he started to cry. Then a huge monster came out from behind the tree and scared the driver away. 
The little boy kept crying, but the driver never came back.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sarah. Sarah was walking in the woods and it was so quite. She saw some witch berries and she tried to pick one. Suddenly, she slipped and fell.
Sarah looked up and saw a big, scary witch! The witch said to Sarah in a loud voice, "What are you doing in the woods?!"
Sarah was so scared that she couldn't move. Then the witch spoke again, but in a more quiet voice. She said to Sarah, "I will not hurt you. I just want to know why you were trying to pick my witch berries."
Sarah apologized for taking the berries and told the witch she was hungry. The witch smiled and said, "I know a way for you to get some food. Pick the witch berries and take them home with you. They're very yummy!"
Sarah thanked the witch for her kindness and happily picked up a basket of witch berries. She said goodbye to the friendly witch, and skipped home with her basket of treats.

Once upon a time, there were two little friends, Jill and Jack.
One day, Jack opened up his cheese sack and saw it was empty. He was very sad and asked Jill, "Where did my cheese go?"
Jill felt a bit ashamed and said, "I ate it, I'm sorry." 
Jack was very surprised and said, "You ate it all? All of it?"
Jill hung her head low and said, "Yes, I ate it all."
Jack felt sad but gave Jill a hug and said, "It's okay, you don't need to feel ashamed. I forgive you." 
He took her hand and together they went off to get more cheese for Jack's cheese sack.

Once upon a time there was a family who lived in a big house. They had a big garden and lots of fun things to play with. But one day something happened. A big wire appeared in the garden and it stopped the family from playing. It was so thick that the family couldn't get past it.
The family were very confused and wanted to know what was happening. Then one day they found out that the wire was there to prevent them from getting too close to a distant hill. The family were not happy because they knew they wouldn't be able to play in the garden anymore.
But then the family had a great idea. They decided to look for a way around the wire. They searched and searched until they found a small path that went around the wire. When they got to the other side, they were so happy! Now they could play in the garden again.
The family learned a very important lesson that day. If they worked together they could prevent bad things from happening.

Once upon a time there was a little girl. Her name was Elle. She was three years old. One day, Elle went to the park to play. Suddenly, she heard a loud noise, and she froze with fear. She looked around and saw a racing car zooming across the park. Elle was very fearful, but also curious.
She slowly approached the car and said, "Hi! What's that noise?" The driver of the car looked at her and smiled. "I'm going really fast in my car," he said. "You should be careful and watch out for cars that go too fast like this one."
Elle touched the car gently. She felt the cold metal of the car against her fingertips. It felt strange and fast. She also felt a shiver of fear run through her body.
The driver said, "You know, Elle, speed can be very dangerous. But if you keep safe, it can also be a lot of fun!"
Elle smiled and nodded. She went home feeling excited, but also fearful of speed. From then on she was extra careful when crossing the street, and always thought twice before jumping into a fast lane.

Once there was a brave bear. He was walking through the forest when he stumbled upon a fierce fight. He had never seen anything like it before - ferocious animals were attacking each other! He cautiously made his way over to see what was happening.
As the bear got closer, he saw two rabbits fighting fiercely. He quickly stopped them, saying "hey, what are you-all doing?" They looked up and said "we're having a fight". The brave bear quickly told them that fighting was not the answer. He said calmly "I think you should just talk things out, not fight".
The rabbits realised that the bear was right and quickly stopped fighting. They talked it out instead, and found that they had a lot in common. After they were done talking, they thanked the brave bear and said goodbye. The bear waved goodbye, happy that the rabbits had found a better way to solve their problem.
As the bear continued walking, he stumbled and stumbled, until he fell. He fell down so hard that he got a big bump on his head! He was very brave, however, and he quickly got back up, determined to find his way out of the forest.

Sam had a regular seat in the park. Every day, he would receive a delicious snack.
One day, his regular seat was taken. He asked the person in the seat "Excuse me, this is my seat. Do you mind if I take it back?"
The person in Sam's seat frowned. "Sorry, I don't think this is your seat if you don't have a ticket. I have a ticket, so I'm taking it."
Sam smiled and said, "No worries! I have a special ticket that says I'm supposed to have this seat." He took out a special ticket from his pocket and showed it to the man.
The man's eyes widened. "Oh! Well, in that case, here you go, it's all yours!"
Sam received his regular seat back and enjoyed his snack. He was glad to know that his special ticket always got him the seat he wanted.

Once upon a time, there were two friends, a big one and a small one. They were both playing in the park when the big friend said, "Let's kneel on the ground, it’s fun!" The small friend was scared but the big friend said, "Don't worry, it's just a game!"
So the small friend kneeled with the big friend and they both laughed. But then, the big friend got an idea. He suggested, "Let's kneel and count to ten! Whoever stands up first is the loser."
The small friend felt scared and unhappy, but he started counting. When he got to ten he stood up, the big friend laughed and said, "Ha-ha, I win!"
The moral of the story is that you should not play games with friends which make them feel scared and unhappy. We should always be nice to our friends and never play games which have bad endings.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Lenny. He was three years old and was eager to complete any task his mom gave him.
One morning, she said, “Lenny, today I want you to jog around the block. Then you can have your favorite ice cream for a treat.”
Lenny got really excited. He put on his sneakers and started to jog in a normal way as fast as he could. Halfway through, he started to feel a bit tired, but he kept on going.
When he finally finished his jog, he saw his mom in the same spot where he had left her. She had a cone with the ice cream already waiting for him.
Lenny had completed the task and was happy. He ran to his mother and hugged her, grateful for the treat.
The end.

Once upon a time there was a furry bear named Sammy who liked to explore. One day, Sammy was looking for trouble and he got himself stuck in a tree. Sammy was scared and he shouted for help.
Luckily, a kind man heard his cries and ran to the tree. He said, "Don't worry Sammy, I will help you out". The kind man gave Sammy a hand and Sammy was free again. 
At the end of his adventure, Sammy knew that if he looked for trouble he would only get in trouble. He thanked the kind man and ran away.
The moral of the story is that it is better to be wise than to try and look for trouble.

Once upon a time, there was a big blue door. Every day, the door shut tight and made a terrible noise. One day, a 3 year old boy named Sam was playing near the door. He heard a strange noise coming from the door and put his hand in his pocket.
Sam: "What is that noise?"
Sam's mom: "That's the door. It shuts every day."
Sam: "Why does it make a terrible noise?"
Sam's mom: "That's just how it works. It shuts tight so it can stay closed."
Sam thought about this for a minute. He put his hand back in his pocket and looked at the door. He thought it was very strange that the door made such a terrible noise. But he decided he liked it anyway. He smiled and said, "I like the door."

Once there was a little boy who wanted to move around the world in a yacht. One day he went to the beach and saw a beautiful yacht. He wanted to go on the yacht so he was persistent. He worked hard and saved enough money to buy the yacht.
When the little boy had the yacht, he decided to move to a different place every day. Each time he got to a new place he would explore the area. He was so excited to discover so many wonderful places.
The little boy wanted to keep going and was so persistent about it. Finally he had moved around the world and he was so happy and proud. He had seen so many amazing places and had so many wonderful memories. He knew that his persistent hard work paid off.

Once upon a time, there lived a little boy named Jack. He was only three years old, but he was very curious. He wanted to know about everything around him.
One day, Jack found an axe in the forest. He had never seen an axe before, and he was very surprised. But he was also a bit scared.
Suddenly, he heard a voice call to him from the tree. "Listen," said the voice, "I'll tell you about this axe. It can be used to chop wood and make kindling." Jack listened closely and thought about what the voice had said.
The next day, Jack went back to the forest with some kindling. He was thoughtful, and he knew how to use the axe safely. He made a fire and was able to keep warm as he cooked dinner.
Jack smiled to himself as he felt a sense of satisfaction. He had been very brave and very thoughtful. He was proud of himself.

Once upon a time, there was a kind bear who was walking through the forest. As he was walking, he noticed something strange. It was a bright yellow twist that looked very strange and had a strange texture. Bear wondered what the twist was and decided to have a closer look. 
When he got to the twist, it turned out to be a very dangerous snake. Bear was so scared and the snake hissed at him. Bear quickly stepped back and asked the snake, "What are you doing here?"
The snake replied, "I'm looking for something to twist around. I was searching for a fun activity, but this is too dangerous!"
Bear thought for a moment and said, "Why don't you twist around this big tree? I'm sure you will have a lot of fun and it won't be so dangerous."
The snake thanked Bear and started to twist around the tree. He enjoyed it so much and thanked the kind Bear again. The two said goodbye and Bear continued to walk through the forest.

Once upon a time, there was a lazy girl named Lucy. She had a very special scooter she loved to ride and played with it every day.
One day, she thought it was time to organize her scooter. She really wanted it to be neat. She asked her mom for help.
“Mom, help me organize my scooter,” said Lucy.
“Yes, of course, sweetie,” said her mom.
Together, they cleaned up the scooter, organizing all its pieces. Lucy was so happy with the result! She was able to ride it for even longer periods of time now that it was all cleaned up and in order. 
Lucy was so proud of her neat scooter and from that day on, she always kept it organized. The end!

The big man went to work every day. He picked up his iron and was ready to go.
One day Mommy asked the big man why he always brought the iron to work.
"It's an important job that takes a lot of care," he said.
The big man liked to iron all the clothes so that it looked neat and tidy. He knew that it was an important job; so he worked hard to make sure everything was perfect.
When the big man was done with all the work, he took the iron back home. He was happy and proud of what he had done. He knew it was important work.

Once there was a little girl who owned a special wrap. It was a very colourful wrap and she always wore it. Everywhere she went she wore it and it made her very happy.
One day, a fake one appeared in the store. It was very similar to the one the little girl owned and the shopkeeper claimed it was the same. But the little girl knew something was wrong and that the one in the store was fake.
The little girl was sad and felt very angry that someone would try to sell a fake one. She wanted to get her wrap back and show it to the shopkeeper.
So the little girl set out to find her wrap and make sure no one else was tricked by the fake one. For days the girl searched for the wrap. Finally, she found it and was so happy. She thought of how she could show the shopkeeper that the one he was selling was not the real thing.
The next day she took her wrap to the shop and said, “This is the real wrap. The other one is fake!” The shopkeeper laughed and said, “Yes, you’re right. I guess I was wrong. You can take it home for free.”
The little girl was so happy to have her wrap back and the shopkeeper learned his lesson. From then on the shopkeeper told the truth about all his wraps.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called JoJo. JoJo was so excited because she had heard a tale that an angel was visiting her village. She ran outside to see if it was true. 
When she got there, she saw a big figure with wings. JoJo was so thrilled to see the angel that she skipped over to it. 
But the angel was very angry. It spoke in a deep voice and said, "Why are you here? You should be frightened of me!" 
JoJo was scared. She started to cry and said, "I'm so sorry, I just wanted to meet you". 
The angel was not pleased and said, "You shouldn't have come here. Now you must face the consequences!" Suddenly the angel flew away, leaving JoJo feeling very frightened. 
The end.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Lola. She was very curious, so one day she decided to collect all the moons in the sky. For this silly mission, Lola took a long ladder, some snacks and a bag. 
Lola started climbing the ladder but suddenly, her father called her name. "Lola, what are you doing?" he asked. 
"I'm collecting all the moons, Daddy," answered Lola. 
Her father laughed and said "That's a foolish idea! You can't collect moons in the sky because they are too far away. Come back inside, sweetheart."
Lola listened to her father and went back inside, giving up on her silly mission. She was sad, but she was also happy that her father was there to stop her from doing something so foolish.

Once there was a boy and a girl who went to school together. They were very excited to go and learn something new. The boy and the girl went into the classroom and saw a big, blackboard. The teacher told them it was filled with interesting things to share. 
The boy and the girl started to work together. They shared their ideas and discussed different topics. They enjoyed learning about animals and plants. 
The teacher liked that the boy and girl were sharing their thoughts. She encouraged them to keep doing it. 
The boy and girl were so proud of themselves! They had an interesting day of learning by sharing with each other.

There were two friends, Sam and Jay. Sam wanted to buy a helicopter. He had wanted one for a long time. 
"Let's buy a helicopter!" said Sam.
"Yes!" said Jay excitedly.
Suddenly, they saw an ancient helicopter parked in the sky. It had been flying around for over a hundred years. 
"We can buy that helicopter!" said Sam.
"No way! That helicopter is too old," said Jay. "It looks like it could break any minute."
"No, it won't," said Sam. "It will be perfect for us! We can ride it around the city, have fun and even explore new places."
Both friends looked at each other and smiled. They decided to buy the ancient helicopter. With a few clicks, the helicopter was bought and the two friends could hardly contain their excitement. Now they had an amazing new way to fly around and explore the world.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Jane. She was only three years old, but she was very brave. One day, she decided to take a journey. She wanted to see what was beyond her village.
As she was walking and exploring, she came across a big door. It was very tight and it wouldn't open. She felt sad. She wanted to explore what was behind the door.
Then, an old woman appeared. She was dressed all in black. She said to Jane: "I can help you open the door if you give me some oil". Jane didn't know what oil was but she trusted the old woman. 
The old woman gave Jane a bottle of oil. Jane thanked her and put some of the oil on the door. She rubbed it in with all her strength and - magic! - the door opened. 
Jane was so happy. The old woman smiled and gave her a hug. Jane wanted to say thank you, but all she could do was give the old woman a big smile.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Daisy. She was very excited because it was her birthday.
Her mummy and daddy had bought her an aeroplane. It was a big, colourful aeroplane made of metal. It was very expensive, but Daisy was very happy.
She put on her seatbelt and flew the aeroplane around the room. It was so much fun flying the aeroplane! She even tasted the air with her tongue and it was delicious.
At the end of the day, Daisy hugged her aeroplane and said goodbye. She was very happy with her birthday present and would always treasure it.

One day, there was a little girl walking in the sunshine. It was very warm and she felt very lucky to be outside. Suddenly, a strong wind blew and the girl started to shiver. She hugged her arms and ran to her house. She was cold, but she was happy that the sun still shone. 
When the little girl opened the door, she saw something was really special - inside there was a warm fire! She ran to the fireplace and held her hands up to the heat. It was so comfortable and cosy that she began to smile. 
The sun may have been hiding behind the clouds, but the little girl was still lucky. She was warm and safe in her own home, and that made her feel very happy.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Anna. Anna was three years old and was always curious about the world. One day, Anna's mum said to her, "Anna, you can unlock the door and go explore the world outside". Anna was so excited and couldn't wait to go out. 
Anna unlocked the door, opened it, and stepped through it. She was surprised at how dark and scary it was outside. The wind was blowing and trees were swaying. 
Anna was very scared and shouted to find her mum. But her mum wasn't there. Anna felt very lonely and the darkness made her more scared. Suddenly, she felt something moving in the bushes. It was a big, dark-coloured animal. It scared Anna and she started to cry. 
The animal stopped and looked at her. It said in a deep voice, "Don't be afraid little one. Just come with me and I'll show you something that will make you feel better". Anna was still scared, but she wanted to see the wonder. So she followed the animal.
The animal walked deeper and deeper into the dark forest. Anna kept walking with it, hoping to find the wondrous thing. But the animal did not take her to the wonder. In the end, Anna got lost in the dark forest and no one ever saw her again.

Once upon a time, there was a bright comet in the sky. Two little girls, Jacky and Ella, were looking up at it.
"Wow!" said Jacky. "Look at that comet!"
"It's so loud!" said Ella. Loud meant it was very big.
But then the comet started to shrink. Little by little, it became smaller and smaller until it was gone.
Jacky and Ella looked around, but the comet was nowhere to be found.
"Where did it go?" asked Jacky.
"I don't know," said Ella. "But maybe it flew away."

Once upon a time, there was a little rabbit called Barry that loved to nap in the sunshine. One day, Barry saw a big trap in the grass. He was worried that it might harm him so he hopped away to tell his friends.
“Please help me,” Barry said to his friends.
“Let’s make a plan,” said one of his friends, a bird called Bob. “We can be cheerful and make the trap look less scary.”
So the group of friends quickly got to work. They decorated the trap with bright colours and flower petals. Before long, the trap looked bright and cheerful.
Barry smiled, feeling much safer now that the trap didn’t look as scary.
The moral of the story is that if you work together, you can make unpleasant situations much better.

Once upon a time, there was a bunny named Benny. Benny loved to eat carrots, and he was always very lively. One day, he saw a big carrot in the garden, and he got very excited. He hopped over to the carrot and started eating it.
But then, a mean fox came along. The fox didn't like bunnies, and he wanted to eat Benny for dinner. Benny tried to run away, but the fox was too fast. Benny yelled for help, but nobody came.
Sadly, the fox caught Benny and ate him for dinner. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She wanted to go to the park to play. She asked her mommy to give her a bag for her toys. Her mommy gave her a pink bag with flowers on it. 
When they got to the park, Lily saw a serious looking boy playing with a ball. She wanted to play with him, but she was shy. She walked over to him and said hello. The boy smiled and they started to play together. 
After a while, it was time to go home. Lily put her toys back in her bag and said goodbye to the boy. She was happy that she made a new friend at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she got an invitation to a party. She was so happy! She ran to her mom and said, "Mommy, I got a party invitation! Can we go, please?"
Her mom said, "Of course, we can go. But first, let's buy a gift for the party."
Lily and her mom went to the store and bought a pretty ring as a gift. When they got to the party, all the kids were having fun. Lily gave her gift to the birthday girl and said, "Happy birthday! I hope you like the ring."
The birthday girl was so happy and said, "Thank you, Lily! You are so compassionate."
Lily didn't know what that word meant, so she asked her mom. Her mom said, "It means you are kind and caring. Just like you are to your friends." Lily smiled and felt proud of herself. She had a great time at the party and made new friends.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to listen to music. He would dance and sing along to his favorite songs all day long. One day, Timmy's mom asked him to clean up his toys. Timmy didn't want to stop listening to his music, so he said, "No, I don't want to clean up."
Later that day, Timmy's mom tripped over one of his toys and hurt her foot. Timmy felt guilty because he didn't clean up like he was supposed to. "I regret not cleaning up," Timmy said to his mom. "I'm sorry."
Timmy's mom forgave him and they hugged. From that day on, Timmy made sure to clean up his toys so that no one would get hurt again. And he still loved to listen to his music and dance along every day. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She had a special cabinet in her room where she kept her toys. One day, Lily was playing with her favorite doll when she accidentally bumped into the cabinet. The cabinet shook and made a loud ring sound.
Lily's hand hurt a little bit because she hit it on the cabinet. She looked at her hand and saw a small red mark. She knew it would be okay soon. She decided to be more careful next time she played near the cabinet.
From that day on, Lily always made sure to be extra careful when playing near her special cabinet. She didn't want to hurt herself again or make the cabinet ring too loudly.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and see all the pretty flowers. One day, she saw a big butterfly with pretty colors on its wings. Lily stopped and looked at it for a long time. She admired how beautiful it was.
Lily's mom called her inside for lunch, but she couldn't stop thinking about the butterfly. She asked her mom what the butterfly's name was. Her mom didn't know, but they looked it up in a book. It was called a monarch butterfly.
Later that day, Lily went outside again to see if the butterfly was still there. It was very quiet outside, and Lily didn't want to scare the butterfly away. She watched it fly from flower to flower, admiring its graceful movements. She was so happy to have seen such a pretty butterfly.

Once upon a time, there was a man with a big blue mustache. He lived in a house with a big door that he always locked before going to bed. One night, he forgot to lock the door and a little mouse came inside. The man woke up and saw the mouse, but he was not afraid. He picked up the mouse and put it outside. From that day on, the man always remembered to lock his door before going to bed. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to visit her grandma's house. One day, she asked her mom if she could go see her grandma. Her mom said yes and they went on their way.
When they got there, Lily's grandma gave her a coloring book. Lily loved to color and she picked out her favorite colors to use. She colored the pages with red, blue, and green.
After a while, Lily's mom said it was time to go home. When they stepped outside, Lily noticed that the ground was icy. She said, "Mommy, the ground is icy!" Her mom said, "Yes, be careful so you don't slip." They walked slowly to the car and drove home. Lily was happy to have visited her grandma's house and colored with her favorite colors.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside and explore the world around him. One day, he fell off his bike and hurt his knee. It hurt a lot and he started to cry.
His mom came running over and asked, "What's wrong, Timmy?"
"I fell off my bike and my knee hurts," Timmy said.
"Don't worry, sweetie. I'll get you a band-aid to help heal your boo-boo," his mom said.
While Timmy was waiting for his knee to heal, he decided to write a poem about his favorite things. He wrote about the birds singing, the flowers blooming, and the quiet of the night. When he was done, he showed his mom and she smiled.
"That's a beautiful poem, Timmy. You have a real talent," she said.
Timmy felt proud of himself and forgot all about his knee hurting. He knew that with time, it would heal and he could go back to playing outside and exploring the world around him.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play at the beach. She would build sandcastles and collect seashells. One day, she saw a seagull on the shore. It looked uncomfortable with a plastic bag stuck on its foot. Lily wanted to help the seagull, so she tried to catch it. 
Suddenly, the wind started to spin the seagull around. Lily was worried but she didn't give up. She chased the seagull until it fell down on the sand. She carefully removed the plastic bag from its foot and set the seagull free. The seagull flew away, and Lily felt happy that she helped it. From that day on, Lily made sure to pick up any trash she saw on the shore to keep the beach clean for all the animals that lived there.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play in her backyard. One day, she saw a chicken walking around. The chicken was very cute and Lily wanted to play with it.
Lily's mom told her, "Be careful, Lily. Chickens can be dangerous. They might peck you."
But Lily did not listen. She went to play with the chicken anyway. She tried to pick it up, but the chicken did not like it. It pecked her hand and ran away.
Lily started to cry and told her mom, "The chicken lied to me. It looked nice, but it hurt me. I don't like chickens anymore."

Once upon a time, there was a castle. It was big and strong. The king and queen lived there. They were glad to have such a nice home.
One day, a bad man came to the castle. He wanted to take the castle for himself. The king and queen were scared. They knew they had to lock the doors to keep the bad man out.
The king said to the queen, "Quickly, we must lock the doors!" And so they did. The bad man tried to get in, but he could not. He went away and never came back. The king and queen were glad they locked the doors and kept their castle safe.

Once upon a time, there was a playful dog named Max. Max liked to run and jump in the park. One day, Max found a shiny medal on the ground. Max was very happy and wanted to show the medal to his friend, a cat named Lily.
Max went to find Lily but she was not in the park. Max asked a bird if he had seen Lily. The bird said, "Yes, she left the park and went home." Max was sad because he wanted to show Lily his medal. Max went home too.
When Max got home, he saw that Lily was already there. Max ran to Lily and showed her his shiny medal. Lily was happy for Max and said, "You are very lucky to find this medal."
Max was very happy that Lily liked his medal. They played together for a while, but then Max got very sick. Max had eaten something bad in the park. Lily was very sad and said, "I am sorry Max, but I have to leave now." Max was too sick to play anymore. Lily left and Max went to sleep. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved to play with her board. She would ride it all around the park and have so much fun. One day, she found an ugly board lying on the ground. She felt sorry for it and decided to take it home with her.
The little girl loved her new board, even though it was ugly. She painted it pink and put stickers all over it. She was so happy to have a new friend to play with. But one day, while she was riding her board, she fell and hurt herself badly. She had to go to the hospital and couldn't play with her board anymore.
Days turned into weeks and the little girl got better, but when she went to play with her board again, she found out that it was broken. She was so sad and cried a lot. She realized that she loved her old board more than the new one, even though it was ugly. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the water with her mommy and daddy. They had a big red kayak that they would ride in together.
One day, Lily's mommy said, "Let's take a nap before we go on our kayak ride." Lily didn't want to nap, but she knew it was important to rest. So, she closed her eyes and fell asleep.
When she woke up, she felt tight in her tummy. She didn't know why, but she knew something was wrong. As they got in the kayak, Lily's daddy noticed that the kayak was too tight. He knew they couldn't ride in it like that.
So, they went back home and fixed the kayak. Lily was happy they didn't go on the water with a tight kayak. She knew it was better to be safe than sorry.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy lived in a house next to his neighbor, Mr. Johnson. One day, Timmy went outside to play in the snow. The snow was very icy and cold. Timmy's mom told him to be careful, so he walked slowly. 
As Timmy played, he looked over at Mr. Johnson's house. Mr. Johnson was outside too. He was looking up at the sky and gazing at the clouds. Timmy thought it looked fun, so he walked over to Mr. Johnson's yard. Mr. Johnson smiled and said hello. 
Timmy and Mr. Johnson gazed at the clouds together. They saw a cloud that looked like a puppy and another that looked like a bird. Timmy was happy to have a new friend to play with, even if it was just for a little while.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in her backyard. One day, she was playing with her dolls when she accidentally dropped one in the pond. She tried to reach for it, but she couldn't swim. 
Lily's mom saw what happened and quickly ran to rescue her. She jumped in the pond and grabbed Lily. "Are you okay?" her mom asked. 
Lily nodded her head and pointed to her doll. "My dolly," she said. 
Her mom saw the green cloth sticking out of the water and reached for it. She rescued the doll and gave it back to Lily. "Here you go," she said. 
Lily hugged her mom and said, "Thank you for rescuing me and my dolly." Her mom smiled and said, "Of course, I'll always be here to rescue you."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat spaghetti with sauce. One day, Lily's mommy made a beautiful plate of spaghetti with sauce for her. Lily was so happy and couldn't wait to eat it. 
As Lily was eating, her mommy asked her to pass the sauce. Lily reached over and handed the sauce to her mommy. Her mommy put a little more sauce on her plate and then passed it back to Lily. 
Lily took a big bite of spaghetti with sauce and thought it was the most beautiful thing she had ever tasted. She smiled and thanked her mommy for making such a yummy dinner. From that day on, Lily asked for spaghetti with sauce every time her mommy asked what she wanted for dinner.

Once upon a time, there was a little rabbit named Bun. Bun loved to hop and play in the fields. One day, Bun saw a pretty pattern on a butterfly's wings. Bun wanted to have a pattern too, so he asked the butterfly how to get one.
The butterfly said, "You can't get a pattern like mine, but you can make your own. Just be kind and polite to others."
Bun tried his best to be polite and kind. He helped his friends and family whenever he could. But one day, Bun saw a big fox and he panicked. He forgot to be polite and ran away as fast as he could.
Bun realized that he had made a mistake. He should have stayed calm and remembered to be polite. He learned that even when we are scared, it's important to be kind to others. From that day on, Bun always remembered to be polite and kind, even when he was scared.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily was playing outside when she found a weird rock. She picked it up and showed it to her friend, Tommy.
Tommy said, "That's a cool rock! Can I have it?"
Lily replied, "Sure, you can have it."
Tommy took the rock and said, "Thank you, Lily! You're a good friend."
Lily felt happy and peaceful inside because she knew that being kind to others was the right thing to do. She learned that finding peace in her heart was more important than keeping a weird rock.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sunshine. One day, she went to the park to play on the swings. She saw her friend Tommy there and ran over to say hello.
"Hi Tommy, do you want to swing with me?" asked Lily.
Tommy said, "Yes please, Lily. I wish we could swing all day!"
Lily giggled and said, "Me too! But first, let's see who can swing the highest!"
They both started swinging as high as they could. Suddenly, Lily's shoe fell off and went flying into the mud. Tommy stopped swinging and said, "Oh no, your shoe is dirty now. Do you want to go home and clean it?"
Lily looked at her dirty shoe and said, "I guess we have to go home now. But we can come back and swing again tomorrow!"

Once upon a time, there was a clumsy rabbit named Benny. Benny was always tripping and falling over his own feet. One day, Benny decided to start practicing his hopping so he wouldn't be so clumsy. He hopped and hopped until he got tired.
Suddenly, Benny noticed that his shoelaces were untied. He knew that if he didn't tie them up, he would trip and fall again. So, he sat down and tied his shoelaces in a big knot. Benny was proud of himself for starting to practice and for tying his own shoelaces. From that day on, Benny hopped around much more confidently and never tripped over his own feet again.

Once upon a time, there was a little duck named Ducky. Ducky loved to play in the water and splash around with his friends. One day, Ducky and his friends were playing in the pond when they saw a big exit sign. They decided to follow it and see where it led. 
As they waddled along, they noticed that the path was very organized with neat rows of flowers on either side. Ducky thought it looked very pretty. Finally, they came to a gate that led to a big field. Ducky and his friends were so excited to explore the new place. 
They ran around and played in the grass, but soon it was time to go back home. Ducky and his friends said goodbye to the new field and started to make their way back. As they passed by the pond again, Ducky couldn't resist one last splash before heading home for the day.

Once upon a time, there was a little frog named Freddy. Freddy loved to play in the pond with his friends. He would jump and swim all day long. One day, Freddy saw a big bug and he wanted to eat it. But the bug flew away and Freddy was sad.
Freddy wanted to grow bigger so he could catch the bug. He ate lots of flies and bugs, but he didn't grow much. One day, he saw a sign that said "magic beans available." Freddy thought the beans might help him grow bigger, so he bought them with all his money.
He planted the beans and waited for them to grow. But when they did, a giant beanstalk grew all the way up to the sky. Freddy climbed up the beanstalk and found a castle. Inside, he saw the big bug he had been trying to catch. But the bug was too big for Freddy to eat. Suddenly, he heard a loud noise and the castle shook. The giant who owned the castle had come home. Freddy was scared and ran down the beanstalk as fast as he could. But the giant saw him and chased him. Freddy was never seen again.

Once upon a time, there was a pirate named Jack. He was very tired because he had been sailing on his ship for many days. Jack wanted to find some treasure, but he couldn't because he was too tired. 
One day, Jack met another pirate named Tom. Tom was very funny and he liked to joke around. Tom saw that Jack was tired and he wanted to help him. Tom told Jack a joke and it made him laugh. 
After that, Jack felt better and he was no longer tired. Tom and Jack became friends and they sailed together on their ship. They found a big treasure and they shared it. 
The moral of the story is that sometimes, when we are tired or feeling down, a good joke can make us feel better. And it's always good to have friends to help us when we need it.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a stubborn puppy named Max. One day, Lily's teacher asked her to measure her pupil's height. Lily was confused and didn't know what to do. 
She went home and asked Max, "Max, do you know how to measure?" Max barked and wagged his tail. Lily took that as a yes and brought Max to school the next day. 
When her teacher asked her to measure her pupil's height, Lily used Max to measure. She placed Max next to her pupil and saw that Max was taller. 
Her teacher was surprised and asked, "How did you measure with your puppy?" Lily proudly replied, "Max helped me measure!" 
From that day on, Lily was known as the girl who measured with her puppy. And Max became the school's favorite pupil.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. He loved to play with his toys, especially his toy cars. One day, Timmy's mom gave him a present. It was a big box with a bow on top. Timmy was so excited to open it! 
When he opened the box, he saw that it was just an ordinary toy car. Timmy was disappointed. He wanted something special. But then, he decided to spin the toy car around and around. He watched it go round and round and felt happy. 
Timmy learned that sometimes things may seem ordinary, but if you look at them in a different way, they can be special. He learned to appreciate what he had and not always want something new. From that day on, Timmy played with his toy car and spun it around with joy. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the fields near her house. One day, her mom said, "Lily, don't forget to pick up some corn for dinner tonight."
Lily ran off to play, but her mom had to remind her again to get the corn. "Oh yeah, I almost forgot!" said Lily.
As she was picking the corn, she saw a scarecrow in the field. "Hey, Mr. Scarecrow, do you want to come play with me?" she asked.
The scarecrow didn't say anything, but Lily could tell he was a quiet friend. They played together until it was time to go home for dinner. Lily was happy to have a new friend and some fresh corn to eat.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to chew on gum all day long. One day, he found a shiny steel coin on the street. He was so happy and showed it to his friend, Sally.
Sally said, "Wow, Timmy! That's a really cool coin! But be careful, steel can be really hard and tough to chew on."
Timmy didn't listen and tried to chew on the steel coin anyway. He became frustrated and hurt his teeth. He learned that not everything can be chewed on and that it's important to listen to his friends.
The moral of the story is to listen to your friends and not chew on things that can hurt you.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play hide-and-seek with her friends. One day, Lily was playing in the park when she saw a man with an unknown face. He looked very scary to her. 
Lily decided to follow him to see where he was going. She kept her arm close to her body and tried to be very quiet. The man walked for a long time, but Lily kept following him. 
Finally, the man stopped in front of a big building. Lily was scared, but she knew she had to be brave. She looked at the man's arm and saw that he was holding a bag. She realized that he was just a delivery man, and he wasn't scary at all. Lily smiled and ran back to her friends to tell them about her adventure.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird. The bird liked to fly high up in the sky and look down at the world below. One day, the bird saw a computer on the ground. It had lots of buttons and was very shiny. The bird was curious and wanted to take a closer look.
The bird hopped down to the computer and started pecking at the buttons. Suddenly, the computer turned on and started making lots of noise. The bird was scared and flew away. 
Later, the bird saw a group of ants carrying tiny pieces of food. They were very organized and worked together to get everything done. The bird was impressed and decided to watch them for a while. As the sun began to set, the bird flew back to its nest and fell asleep, dreaming of flying and exploring the world.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a house with her family. One day, Lily's mom asked her to help gather some firewood for the fireplace. Lily was excited to help.
She went outside and saw a mysterious animal. It was a big, fluffy cat. Lily said, "Hello, cat! Do you want to help me gather firewood?" The cat meowed and followed her.
Lily and the cat gathered lots of firewood and brought it back to the house. Her mom was so happy and said, "Thank you, Lily and mysterious cat! Now we can have a warm fire in the fireplace tonight." Lily smiled and felt proud that she could help her family.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and chase her shadow. One day, she went to the park with her mom and saw a boy playing with his toy car. The boy was honest and shared his toy car with Lily. 
Lily was so happy and wanted to thank the boy. She saw a butterfly and tried to catch it, but it flew away. Then, she saw a bird and tried to catch it, but it flew away too. Finally, she saw a bug and tried to catch it, but it was too fast. 
The boy laughed and said, "You're as quick as a zipper!" Lily didn't know what a zipper was, but she was happy to hear the boy laugh. They played together all day and had so much fun. From that day on, Lily always remembered the honest boy who shared his toy car and they became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to explore the forest near her house. One day, she went on an adventure and discovered a secret cave. Inside the cave, she found a shiny cord that sparkled in the light. 
Lily was so excited about her discovery that she ran back home to tell her mother. "Mommy, I found a secret cave and a shiny cord!" she exclaimed. 
Her mother looked at the cord and said, "Lily, that cord is foolish. It's not real gold." Lily didn't care. She was still happy to have found something new and exciting. 
From that day on, Lily continued to explore the forest and discover new things. She learned that even if something seems foolish to others, it can still be valuable to her.

Once upon a time, there was a bald man named Bob. Bob loved to order food from his favorite restaurant. One day, he went to the restaurant and ordered his favorite burger. But when the burger came, it was cold and Bob didn't like it. He wanted to touch the burger to see if it was really cold, and it was! Bob was sad and angry because he spent his money on a bad burger.
Bob went to the restaurant owner and told him about the cold burger. The owner said sorry and made a new hot burger for Bob. Bob was happy and ate his delicious burger. He didn't have to touch it to know it was good! The end.

Once upon a time, there was a duck named Ducky. Ducky liked to row in the pond. One day, Ducky saw his friend Bunny driving a car. Bunny asked Ducky if he wanted to come for a ride. Ducky said yes and hopped in the car. Bunny drove the car around and they had a funny time. After the ride, Ducky went back to rowing in the pond, happy to have had a new adventure with his friend Bunny.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved playing outside and exploring the world around her. One day, while playing in the grass, Lily got an itch on her arm. She tried scratching it, but it wouldn't go away.
Lily's mom noticed her scratching and asked what was wrong. Lily told her about the itch and her mom said it was probably a bug bite. She put some cream on it and soon the itch went away.
Later that day, Lily went to the park with her friends. They were having so much fun playing on the swings and slides. But then, one of her friends started misbehaving. She was pushing and shoving the other kids. Lily knew that wasn't right, so she told her friend to behave and play nicely.
After that, they all had an amazing time playing together. Lily was happy that her friend listened and behaved. She went home that day feeling proud of herself for being a good friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird. The bird had pale feathers and loved to sing. One day, while singing, the bird flew into a net. The net was very tricky and the bird couldn't get out. The bird felt sad and scared. But then, a kind girl saw the bird and helped it out of the net. The bird was happy again and sang a beautiful song to thank the girl.

Once upon a time, there was a farmer named Jack. Jack had a big field where he grew wheat. Every day, Jack would go to his field and check on his wheat. He loved watching it grow and wondered how tall it would get.
One day, Jack noticed something strange about his wheat. It didn't look normal. The wheat was turning a funny color and wasn't growing as tall as it should be. Jack wondered what could be wrong.
