Once upon a time there was a pink garden. It was filled with different kinds of pretty flowers and green grass. Every day the garden was filled with lots of happy noises from different critters that lived there.
One day a little girl heard a noise from the garden. She was so curious that she decided to take a look and see what was making the noise. As she peeked outside the garden she saw a big pink car driving very fast. It was the most beautiful car she had ever seen.
The little girl was so excited that she ran to the garden to tell all the critters about it. She ran as fast as she could, but the car was already gone. She was so sad that she missed it. But then suddenly, the same pink car sped back past the garden. This time with a nice old man driving it. He waved and smiled at the little girl as he drove.
The little girl was so happy that she waved and ran through the garden, telling all the critters about her exciting day. She had seen a beautiful pink car speed past the garden and the old man had even waved at her.
 
From that day forward, the little girl always looked for the pink car to come back. But it never did.

Max and Ruth were walking one morning through a distant field. The sun shone brightly, and the air smelled sweet.
Suddenly, Max stumbled. Ruth looked at him and said, "Are you okay?"
Max rubbed his knee and shook his head. He had bumped it!
Ruth smiled and said, "Let's go find a special rock. We can put it on your knee and it'll make it feel better!" 
Max looked up at her, hopeful.
The two wandered together, looking for the perfect rock. Ruth finally found one near a clump of bushes. Max put it on his knee, and the pain began to fade away. He smiled.
Ruth smiled back. "See, what did I tell you?" 
Max hugged her, thankful for her help. He was so glad that his best friend had been there when he stumbled.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She had a chair in her bedroom which was very comfortable for her. Every day after lunch, she liked to take a nap in her chair.
The little girl was always hungry, and so she was excited when her mommy said it was time for dinner. She put on her yummy clothes and imagined what dinner would taste like.
When the little girl's dinner was ready, she sat in her chair and ate it. The dinner was so yummy, she barely had enough room for dessert.
When dinner was done, the little girl was very tired. She climbed into the chair and went to sleep.
The little girl had a wonderful nap and when she woke, she felt like she had enough energy to play all day.
The end.

Once upon a time, there was an adventurous goose. She wanted to go on an adventure, but she had no idea where to go. Then one day, she heard some loud clapping. It was so loud that she could hear it from far away. She wondered what it was and flew towards the clapping.
When she arrived, she saw a big crowd of people. Everyone was clapping and smiling, as if they were having fun. She was so curious that she had to get closer. As she flew down to the crowd, everyone stopped clapping and started to applaud the goose!
The goose was so surprised and happy. She had never expected her adventure to end up with so much appreciation! She flapped her wings and thanked everyone with a loud honk and continued her journey with a newfound joy.

One day, there was a bad man. He was a terrible man. He liked to steal things, like sunglasses. He crept into the house of a nice man and tried to steal his sunglasses.
But the nice man saw the bad man, and he was very angry. He shouted, "No! You must not steal!" The bad man was very scared and he ran away. He was very sad and he felt bad.
The nice man was happy. He was glad that the bad man had not stolen his sunglasses. He put them back on his head and enjoyed the sunshine. He was very glad that the bad man had not been successful.

One day, Bob and his sister Sally decided to go for a ride. As they headed outside, they saw their mom discussing something with their dad. The conversation seemed serious. 
"What are they discussing?", asked Sally.
Bob looked alert as he answered, "I think they're talking about the motor in the car."
So Bob and Sally decided to have a look. When they reached the car, they saw a big motor inside! It was shiny and brightly coloured. Bob and Sally were very curious and asked their parents a lot of questions about the motor. 
Mom and dad were very happy to explain everything to the children and told them all about how the motor worked.
Bob and Sally were very pleased to learn all about the motor and thanked their parents before heading back inside to play.

Bob was walking through the big park. He felt something tickle his nose. He stopped, and tried to stop himself from sneezing. He held his breath and pinched his nose, but it was no use. He let out a big "ACHOO!"
"Bless you!" said a voice.
Bob looked up and saw a girl standing nearby. She was wearing a pink dress and had pigtails. She smiled and waved at Bob.
"Are you okay?" she asked.
Bob nodded. "I'm okay," he said. "I just sneezed."
The girl giggled. "That's okay. I sneezed too, a minute ago. I'm Bertha."
Bertha and Bob sat down on a bench. Bob put his arm around Bertha's shoulder, and she leaned against him. They watched a lazy dog sleeping in the grass.
"That dog sure is lazy," said Bertha. "He must've been playing in the park all day."
Bob smiled. "Let's go play too," he said. And off they went, having fun in the sunshine.

There were three friends - Sid, Dave, and Mark. One day they were playing with their board in the park. Suddenly, it began to rain, so they decided to take their board and go to Sid's house. 
When they reached Sid's house, they knocked on the door and waited. Sid's mum answered and said they could come in. But she also said they had to be safe in the house.
Dave and Mark agreed and started playing with their board indoors. But Sid refused. He wanted to keep playing outside in the rain. Sid's mum tried to explain why it was not safe, but Sid was too stubborn to listen to reason.
At last, Dave stood up and said, "Sid, it's not wise to disobey your mum. If we do as she says, then we will be safe. We all have to work together to help each other stay safe." 
Everyone agreed, and that's how Sid and his friends found a safe way to play with their board in the rain.🎓

Once upon a time, there was a reliable chef named Chef Joe. Every night he cooked a delicious meal for his family. Tonight, he was cooking something special with avocado.
The family gathered around the dinner table, ready to give it a try. Little Hermione was especially excited to see what Chef Joe had cooked up. She asked, 'What is it?'
Chef Joe smiled and said, 'Can you guess?' Little Hermione thought about it for a moment. Suddenly, she figured it out and exclaimed, 'It's guacamole!'
Chef Joe nodded and said, 'That's right! I made guacamole with avocado.' Little Hermione smiled and took a big bite. It was delicious!
Chef Joe's family was very proud of him. They could always count on him to cook a reliable and delicious meal.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Jane. Jane woke up one day and she was very dry. She wanted to stir something up to make it a bit more interesting. So she thought of an idea! She went to tell the news to her mom.
When she found her mom she said, "Mom, I have news!" Her mom said, "What is it, Jane?" Jane said, "I want to stir something up and make it more fun!" 
Her mom said, "What do you want to stir?" Jane said, "Let's make some cake! We can stir the flour and eggs and make something yummy!" 
Her mom smiled and said, "That sounds like a great idea, Jane!" They both went to the kitchen and stirred all of the dry ingredients until they had a big, delicious cake ready. 
The end.

One day, William was very excited because he was going to the park with his mum. When he got there, he noticed a big machine with lots of colourful buttons on it. He thought it was a fan! William asked his mum what it was and she told him it was called an examine machine. 
She said, "Let's take a closer look." So they walked towards the examine machine and they saw lots of lights and sounds. William was so excited he started pressing all the buttons. His mum was a bit worried, but she knew he was curious.
Suddenly, the examine machine started spinning and making a loud noise. William jumped backwards and shouted, "What's happening?" His mum just laughed and said, "It's just a fan, William! It's ok." 
William smiled and ran up to the fan. He started touching it and feeling its wind on his face. It felt so nice! From then on every time William went to the park he was so excited to see the examine machine and the fan. 
The End

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She had a good friend and they loved to play together.
One day, they decided to pretend. The little girl got a peach and said, "Let's pretend this peach is our pet!"
Her friend smiled and said, "Good idea!" They pretended the peach was a puppy and that it liked to go for walks. They laughed and played with the peach. Pretending was so much fun.
After a few hours, the friends stopped pretending and enjoyed their real pet- a sweet little cat. They held and petted the cat, giving it lots of love.
The little girl and her friend had a very good day of play, both pretending and in real life.

Once upon a time, there were two friends named Frankie and Mary. They loved to race each other. Frankie had a number, five, and Mary had a number, one.
But before they could race, they had to be very quiet. They tiptoed to where they wanted to race and stopped in a quiet spot. They had to be extra quiet because there were other people around.
After they had been quiet for a long time, it was time for them to race. Frankie counted to three and started running. Mary counted to five, then started running. They raced and raced until they reached the finish line.
Frankie had won! He was so happy that he jumped for joy and gave Mary a big hug. They both smiled and laughed. After that, they raced each other again and again!

Once there was a great man called Tom. Tom loved to go fishing. Every day he would take his rod to the beach and stand by the sea. He waited for the fish to come by. One day, he saw a big fish swimming in the water. It was too far away, so he decided to dive in and try and catch it. 
Tom took a deep breath and then dived! In and out of the water he went, until eventually he was able to grab hold of the fish. It was a great catch! He quickly put it in his basket and then walked back to shore. 
Tom was delighted and wanted to show everyone his great catch. He asked his friends and family to come to the beach and they clapped and cheered when they saw the big fish! 
Tom was very proud of his rod. He had done a great job catching the fish, and he was ready to dive again tomorrow.

Once there was a little boy called Toby. He loved to go on nature walks. One day he went to the shore with his mommy. He saw something that made him very happy. It was a cute little boat! Toby demanded that his mommy take him for a ride in the boat.
They got in the boat and putted off to the middle of the sea. Toby looked all around and saw many fish swimming near the shore. They were so colourful and Toby thought they were so cute. As the boat continued to sail, Toby felt the breeze on his face. He loved feeling the wind blow against him.
When they finally reached the edge of the shore they got out of the boat. Toby was so happy he had gone on a boat ride with his mommy. He shouted in joy as he ran some more nature walks along the shore. He had a great day with his mommy, and he couldn't wait to do it all again!

One day, a boy saw a purple bird outside. The boy was excited, so he wanted to dive closer. He walked outside and found a twig on the ground. He picked up the twig and flew it in the air. The purple bird saw the twig and started to dive up and down around it. The boy was laughing so much that he was rolling around on the ground. The bird flew away and the boy was sad, but he still had the twig in his hands. He ran back inside his house and kept the twig as a special reminder.

Once upon a time, in a meadow deep in the woods, there was a wolf. Every day, the wolf would march around the meadow, always in the same path. He was a reliable animal, that the other creatures in the forest trusted.
One day, a little 3 year old girl was walking in the woods with her parents. When she saw the wolf marching around the meadow, the little girl asked her parents: "What's that?". Her parents told her that it was a wolf. The little girl smiled, and the parents told their daughter to march just like the wolf.
So the little girl put her hands on her hips, and began to march around the meadow, just like the wolf! She marched happily, and the wolf stopped to watch her. After a short while, the little girl stopped marching and hugged the wolf, who was very reliable. The wolf licked the little girl's face, and they both smiled. Together they ran back to the little girl's family and waved goodbye to the wolf.

Once there was a turkey. It was a big turkey and it liked to strut around in the meadow. One day it was walking around in the grass and it felt something pinch it. The turkey looked down and saw that it's leg was broken. The turkey was so sad.
The next day, the turkey hopped around to try and find help. It hopped to a farmer's house and asked for help. The farmer took a look and said he could fix it. He put some magic glue on the broken leg and soon it was fixed.
The turkey was so happy. It thanked the farmer and then hopped away. It was so happy that it couldn't stop singing! It went around the meadow, singing happily and nothing ever pinched it again.

Once upon a time there was a boy named Jack. One day Jack wanted to go for a run in the park, so he asked his mom for some shoes. His mom said yes and gave him a pair of red shoes with white laces. They had an attractive red bow on top.
Jack was excited, so he quickly put on the shoes. But when he tried to tie them, he couldn't make a knot. He thought and thought, but he just couldn't figure out how to do it.
So Jack made a request - he asked his mom for help. His mom smiled and took the laces from him. She showed him how to make a knot, then she tied the laces nicely together.
Jack thanked his mom and he ran off to enjoy his time in the park. He was so happy that his mom had helped him with his request.

Once upon a time there was a brave little boy named Max. Max lived by the sea. Every day he would go to the beach and watch people surf the waves.
Max really wanted to try surfing so he asked his mom if he could give it a go.
"No, Max," she said, "surfing is too dangerous for you."
But Max was a brave little boy and he didn't want to give up. 
"Please," he begged, "just this once?"
Max's mom finally agreed. 
Max was so excited he put on his rash guard and climbed out onto his surfboard. The waves were bigger than he expected and he started to feel a little scared. But then he noticed a big wave coming and he realized that he could do this!
Max started paddling with all his might and soon he was up and riding the wave. It was the most amazing feeling! Max caught wave after wave and kept surfing until the sun started to go down.
As Max climbed off his board he realized that he had been wrong to think surfing was dangerous. He had instead found a new way to enjoy the beach. From that day forward, Max was hooked on surfing.

The sun was shining. Mary went outside to the garden and saw a big egg. It was heavy, so she couldn't pick it up. Suddenly, something strange happened; the egg started to change. It became bigger and bigger until it was so big, Mary could move it. She was very excited and happy.
Mary quickly ran inside to get a friend. She asked Bob to come outside and help her. When Bob saw the egg, his eyes opened wide in surprise! He helped Mary pick up the egg and it was still very heavy. They carried the egg together until they found a place to put it. 
The next morning, the egg had changed again! It was not heavy anymore and when they looked closely, they could hear something inside it. They were amazed! It was a baby bird! It had changed from an egg into a bird. 
Mary and Bob were so excited. They watched the bird fly away, feeling very happy.

Once upon a time there was a beautiful girl called Ann. Ann was always playing and exploring. One day Ann came across an old switch. She touched it and the room filled with light. Ann was amazed and laughed with joy. 
"What is this?" asked Ann. 
A voice from the corner said, "It's a switch. When you touch it, it makes things shine!"
Ann was so excited that she touched the switch again and again, laughing at the beautiful lights. The switch made her feel so happy and she asked the voice if she could take the switch home with her. 
The voice said, "Of course my dear. You can take it and make something wonderful with it." 
Ann smiled, thanked the voice, and took her beautiful new switch home.

Once upon a time there was a shy little boy who loved to learn. He wanted to find a tutor to help him with school work, but he felt too shy to ask his parents. He thought about it for days until one day, he made a plan.
He wanted to shrink himself down so that he didn't feel so small. He gathered up some of his favorite things, like books and his stuffed bear and he shrunk them down. He was so excited when it worked!
The little boy now went around everywhere looking for a tutor. He knocked on the doors of all his neighbors and asked if they knew anyone who could help him. After a few tries, one of his neighbors offered to teach him herself.
The boy was so happy and he thanked her. And soon he was sitting at his kitchen table every day, learning with his tutor. He still felt shy when he wasn't at home, but with the help of his tutor, he was able to make amazing progress in school.
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She was very intelligent, and always loved to print pictures. One day, she wanted to show her friend something special, so she decided she wanted to print an animal.
The next day, she went to the store and saw something that made her smile. There was a printer, and it was printing out a beautiful picture of a big lion! Lucy was so excited, she bought it and ran off to find her friend.
When she found her friend, they both looked at the picture together. The lion was so proud and strong. Both Lucy and her friend were amazed! They talked about the lion and all the things it must be able to do.
Lucy and her friend had a great time learning about the lion. Lucy was so proud knowing that she had chosen such an intelligent animal to print. She was excited to go back to the store and print more animals so she and her friend could have even more adventures.

John and Jack were best friends. One day they were playing at Jack's house. John saw a tray of snacks on the table, yummy cookies and colourful pieces of fruit.
John said "Can I have some?" but then Jack started to tease him. He said "No, you can't have any. It's all mine!"
John felt sad but then he saw some disgusting food on the tray. There was a slimy green potato and a smelly fish. John made a face and said "Ew, that's disgusting!"
Jack laughed and said "Okay, you can try the disgusting food - but only if you dare!" John was brave and he decided to take the tray and try the food. He thought it was really yucky but he was really proud that he didn't let Jack tease him. They both had a good laugh.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Lucy. She had a red jug that she loved. Everywhere she went, she took the jug with her. 
One day, she went on a special journey. She waved goodbye to her family, and took the jug with her. She was very glad to have it.
On her journey, she walked through a dark forest. Suddenly, she heard a loud noise! She was scared but held her jug tightly.
After a while, Lucy came out of the forest. She sat down next to a river and sighed with relief. Then she noticed something - the jug was missing!
She immediately began to look for it. Soon, after searching in the forest, she found the jug. It was in the same spot where she heard the noise. The jug had been stolen by a sneaky animal, but was now returned to Lucy. 
She was so glad to have it back, and from that day on, she held onto her jug a bit tighter.

Once upon a time, there lived a purple mill who enjoyed her days in the countryside. Each day, the mill would turn its giant wheels and bring joy to the people of the nearby village.
One day, the mill noticed two children playing near the stream. The mill was amazed how happy they looked, but then she realised that they were just playing with a stick. 
The mill felt inspired by the children's joy, so she decided to offer them something much better. She opened her mouth and a large pile of coloured ribbons and sweets filled the air. The children were so delighted and they quickly ran to collect what the mill was offering.
The children enjoyed the surprise very much and thanked the mill. They then continued playing and feeling happy for the rest of the day. 
The purple mill learned a valuable lesson from the children: the simplest pleasures can bring the greatest joy.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Cathy. Cathy was three years old and loved rocks. Her favorite was a big, heavy one she found in the back yard. 
One day, Cathy decided to take the rock to school to show her friends. She was so excited to show them her rock! When she got there, her teacher had a surprise. It was a microscope.
Cathy looked into the microscope and saw the rock in amazing detail. She could not believe how amazing it looked! She looked closely and noticed small lines, colors and shapes she had never seen before. It was so incredible. 
After looking into the microscope, Cathy hugged the heavy rock tightly, so happy to have found such a fascinating rock in her own back yard. She told her friends all about her new discovery and then showed them the microscope too. 
From that day forward, Cathy understood that the world is full of amazing things if only she took the time to look closely. 
The End.

Once upon a time there was a crocodile who loved listening. Every day he would lay in the sun, closing his eyes and hearing the world around him. One day he heard a noise, like it was coming from a big tree. He looked up and saw a little bird singing up in its branches. 
The crocodile was so happy he could hear the birds music. He enjoyed listening to it so much he forgot to move, so he laid there in the sun smiling. As he listened the bird's sound started to get softer and softer. The crocodile was so peaceful he fell asleep. 
But then he heard something else! He jumped up and looked around, but he couldn't see anything. It was getting louder and louder, and finally he saw a little mouse creeping out of the grass. It was so soft and quiet, but he heard it near him. He smiled and closed his eyes again, happy to have such wonderful things to listen to.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Lulu. She was deaf and couldn't hear the world around her like other people.
One day, Lulu wanted to explore the universe. She imagined all the wonderful things she would find and the exciting places she could go. 
But on that day, something else happened. Lulu became friends with a kind, wise old lady and they talked until the sun went down. The old lady taught her all about the world and how it works. She showed Lulu that the universe isn't just about seeing and hearing, it's about helping and understanding too. 
Lulu learned that becoming deaf didn't mean she couldn't explore the world, she just had to find different ways to do it. She learned to listen with her heart, instead of her ears. 
The moral of the story is that no matter what, you can still explore the world by being kind and understanding. Even if you can't hear, you can still be part of the universe.

Once upon a time there was a large dog. He saw an invitation and really wanted it. So he decided to steal it. He grabbed the envelope in his mouth and ran away with it. 
But the dog got into some trouble. A kind policeman saw the large dog stealing the invitation and stopped him. The policeman was nice and said "No stealing!" He took the invitation from the dog and put it back where it belonged.
The large dog was sad, but he knew it was wrong to steal. He learned his lesson and from then on he was a good boy.

Once there was two friends, Jack and Molly. They raced everyday after school. Molly was always faster than Jack. One day it was especially hot.
Jack said to Molly, "let's race one last time before I go to do some work". Molly was excited and agreed.
They ran together, competing over the pink track. Fast, fast, faster they raced! But suddenly the track sloped downwards and Molly was in the lead. Jack was trying his hardest to make up his speed, but it was too late: Molly crossed the finish line first.
Jack was so sad. He wished that he had been faster and that he had won the race. Jack turned around and started walking to do his work. From behind him he heard a loud thud. Molly had tripped and fell down on the track. She was hurt, and there was no way Jack could help her. He sadly said goodbye, and continued on to do his work.

Once upon a time there was a brave bird called Lucy. Lucy had beautiful yellow feathers and she loved to soar in the sky. One day, Lucy decided to visit the big mall. She had never been there before and was so excited!
Once inside the mall, Lucy noticed there were lots of creative things to do. She tried to make a drawing and put together a puzzle. Lucy loved being creative and exploring the mall. 
Suddenly it started to rain and Lucy couldn't soar in the sky. She didn't want to leave the mall just yet, so she started to look for a way to keep exploring. Then she noticed a store window with a toy airplane inside. The airplane was made from shiny silver paper, and it could really fly!
Lucy was really impressed and she realised that even if she couldn't soar in the sky, she could still explore the mall and be creative. She smiled to herself and thought, "Being brave and exploring new places can be so fun!"
This story teaches us a valuable lesson: that even when things seem difficult, we can always find creative ways to explore and have fun.

Once there was a jolly pig. He lived on a farm and loved to sing. One day he wanted to perform on a stage, so he went in search of one. He kept walking and walking until he needed a rest. He stopped and asked a sheep, "Do you know where I might find a stage?"
The sheep smiled and said, "Yes, I know a place. It is over that hill. You should go there to find your stage."
The pig thanked the sheep and continued on his way. After a while, he came to a big field with a stage in the middle. He had found it! He was so excited and ran towards the stage. He sang his songs, and everyone was very happy.
The pig was so proud of himself. He made lots of friends and they all had a jolly time. He loved performing on the stage, and from then on it became his favourite place.

Once there was a brave little girl. She wanted to paint the world a beautiful color. So, she grabbed her paint and marched off to camp. 
At camp, she found the perfect place to paint. She spread out her paints on the grass and began creating a masterpiece. She used blues and greens and yellows. The colors danced in the sunshine. 
The little girl painted trees, clouds, birds, and sunshine. She had never been so creative. She was so brave to make something so beautiful. After she was done, she stepped back to admire her work. 
She had painted a world even more beautiful than the one she had found. The little girl smiled with satisfaction and knew she would always be brave enough to make something new and beautiful.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Jane. Jane loved to explore and play. One day, as she was playing in her garden, she found something very special. It was a shiny golden handle! It was rare and looked very unusual.
Jane thought carefully about what she should do with it. “I know! I will take it inside to show my mum!” she said.
When Jane brought the handle inside, her mum was amazed. She said, “What a rare find you have here! Where did you get it dear?”
“I found it in the garden,” Jane replied.
“Well, I think it would look very pretty in your room,” said her mum.
So, Jane took the handle to her room and put it on the dresser.
The next day, Jane had an idea. She grabbed the handle and went to the attic. She looked around and saw a big wooden box. She put the handle in the lock and it opened! Inside were many magical things!
As Jane explored further, she saw a secret book. She opened it and saw that it said, “Mind your handle and all its magical powers will be yours!”
Jane was intrigued and carefully minded her handle. She soon realised the handle had magical powers which were very rare and special. With this newfound power, Jane was able

Once there was a tall man named Steve. Steve was always so kind and friendly to everyone. One day Steve took a yoga class and he loved it so much! After the class was over, Steve felt so relaxed and happy that he started to dance around in joy.
Just then, his 3 year old daughter, Maya, came running into the room. Seeing her daddy dancing made her laugh. Maya asked, "Daddy what are you doing?" Steve happily replied, "I'm dancing, because I just took a yoga class and it made me feel so good that I had to release my happiness!"
Maya was so curious to try out yoga. She asked her daddy to teach her how to do it. Steve said he would be more than happy to show her. He put on some music and started showing her the movements. Maya felt so free and happy to be released in the movement.
At the end of the lesson, Maya was so happy and thanked daddy for teaching his yoga to her. She felt so at peace, giggled and gave her daddy a big hug!

Jimmy was very excited. His mummy and daddy had promised him a new roof for his bedroom.
He had asked for a purple one!
So today was the day when his new roof finally arrived.
When Jimmy saw it, his eyes lit up with happiness. It was purple, just like he wanted it to be. 
He ran outside to show it to his friends. He was so proud of the roof - he kept pointing to it and laughing with delight.
Jimmy knew this was the best roof ever. He was happy that his mummy and daddy had kept their promise!

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Anya. She was very polite and loved to skip around her house.
One day, Anya stepped outside of her house and she noticed something on the side of her house. It was a small, friendly bunny! Anya smiled and said hello to the bunny, and the bunny looked up at Anya and said, "Hi Anya!" 
Anya was so excited to meet the bunny that she started skipping around the yard. The bunny hopped around too and the two playmates soon became friends. 
Anya was so polite to the bunny. She always said hello and goodbye when she saw the bunny, and she always shared her vegetable treats with him. They had lots of fun playing together everyday. 
Anya and the bunny always skip around the side of the house together. The bunny felt so lucky to have Anya as a friend.

Once upon a time, there was a big peach tree. This tree was very special, because it had the most beautiful peaches in the world. Every day lots of animals would come to the tree to try and pick one of the peaches.
One day a little rabbit hopped up to the peach tree. She wanted to win the most beautiful peach of all. She hopped up onto the first branch of the tree, but it was too high. She hopped onto the second branch, and then onto the third. On the third branch, she found the most beautiful peach in the world!
The little rabbit was so happy, she was sure she had won the prize. She quickly picked the peach and hopped away with it. The little rabbit was so proud of her prize, and she enjoyed her peach very much. 
The end.

Once upon a time there was an oak tree in a big field. His name was James and he was very adventurous. One day James decided he wanted to go exploring. He looked up in the sky and saw a big white cloud.
“I want to go there!” said James the Oak.
Just then, a little blue bird flew by. “Why don’t you come with me? I know some great places to explore,” the bird said.
“That sounds great!” said James.
The pair flew together to some exciting places. The little blue bird suggested they explore an old castle that was high on a hill. James was very excited and couldn’t wait to explore.
They flew up and down the castle walls and found lots of wonderful things. It was the most adventurous day of James' life!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Kate. Kate wanted to play with her friends at the club. But when she got there, she saw that her friends were spinning around the club like crazy.
They were so busy playing, that they didn't even notice Kate. She felt sad and left out of their game. So, she thought of a plan.
First, she found a big stick and spun it really fast. Her friends were so surprised that they stopped spinning and asked her to join in. 
But then, one of Kate's friends was not so nice. She was selfish and did not want to share the stick. So, Kate found another stick and shared it with her friends.
Soon enough, everyone was happily spinning around the club. Kate was so proud that she could play with her friends and share the stick. Happy and content, they all went home.

Once there was a grumpy old man. He was always so grumpy no matter what anybody said. He had a very special whip that he liked to carry around with him.
One day a small bird flew over to the grumpy old man. The bird gently whispered "Hello" to him. This time the old man was not grumpy. He listened to the bird and smiled.
The bird was very curious about the old man's whip. The old man thought to himself that he should show the bird what his whip could do. He waved his whip around and the bird was so impressed it could barely contain its excitement.
The old man and the bird became good friends, and they would spend hours together talking and playing. Every once in awhile the bird would whisper sweet things to the old man, and the old man would never be grumpy again.

Once there was a sun that was shining very bright in the sky. One day it started to get dark and the wind began to blow. It made the trees sway and the leaves dance. Suddenly, a storm start! Big dark clouds came in and the thunder roared. Little Pete was outside and he was scared.
His mommy came to take him home. They both grabbed hands and started to run back. But it was too late - the storm had started! Rain was coming down hard and it was loud. Little Pete was still scared, but his mommy held him tight and told him it would be alright. 
They stayed inside until the storm was over and the sun came out again. Everything was different. All the trees and plants were clean from the rain and the sky was blue and shiny. Little Pete and his mommy looked at the rainbow in the sky and they smiled. Now they knew it was time to go play again!

Jill was walking in the park, where she could see a beautiful view. There were lots of birds singing and the wind gently blowing.
Suddenly the trees began to move and the wind became strong. Jill was scared, until she realized it was only a big gust of wind that had sprung up.
But then she heard a loud noise, like thunder in the distance. She looked up and saw dark storm clouds rolling in. She started to worry she wouldn't be able to see the beautiful view anymore.
Jill was scared, but she was also brave. She held out her hand and let the strong wind blow on it. It felt like the wind was telling her that she could make it through the storm.
Jill was brave and kept walking. When the storm passed, she could still see the beautiful view in the park. She was so proud of herself for being strong and brave.

Mommy was mad. She had an ugly cat. The cat meowed and meowed.
"Why do you have such an ugly cat?" said Mommy.
The little girl didn't want to make Mommy mad. She said, "It's my friend, Mommy."
Mommy shook her head. "That cat is too ugly," said Mommy.
The little girl started to cry. She begged Mommy, "Please don't make her go away."
But Mommy didn't listen. She threw the cat out of the house. The little girl was sad. She never saw her friend again.

Once upon a time, there was a hill. It was a very tidy hill. The grass was short and the trees were neatly trimmed. Every day the sun shined brightly on the hill. Then one day, it began to rain. The rain made everything very wet. All of the grass and trees on the hill were covered in water. The gentle sound of the rain made the hill sound happy. After a while, the rain stopped and the sun came back out again. The hill looked even tidier than before. Everything glistened and sparkled in the bright daylight. The hill was so beautiful that everyone walking past would stop and admire it. From that day forward, the hill always stayed neat and tidy, no matter if it rained or shone.

Once upon a time, there was a boy whose name was Andy. He loved to play outside on the swing, trying to balance his body as he moved up and down. One day, Andy was playing neatly with his toy engine when his father came in. 
"What is this?" asked his father, inspecting the engine curiously.
Andy smiled and said, "It's my toy engine. I can make it balance on my fingertips."
His father smiled, "That's perfect, Andy. Now, let's see how perfect this balancing is."
Andy eagerly smiled as he placed the engine on his finger with careful precision. He quickly moved his hand up and down, making sure it was perfectly balanced. Everyone was pleased with Andy's skill and admired his perfect balancing. 
And with that, Andy and his father went off to play another fun game, happy and delighted.

Once upon a time there was a rabbit named Max. He was very curious, so one day he decided to watch a video.
When the video began, Max paused. He had never seen one before, and it looked a bit strange. He saw a silly man on the screen doing something very foolish.
Max shook his head in disbelief. He thought the man in the video was being very silly. He took a moment to think.
Max decided he wanted to try being foolish, so he jumped up and started hopping around the room. He laughed and smiled, and the video paused for a moment. He felt silly, but he was having a lot of fun.
Max kept hopping and laughing until he was too tired. He lay down on the floor to rest, and the video started playing again. Max had a great time, and he learned a valuable lesson - it's ok to be silly once in a while!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Nell. Nell was three years old and loved jelly. Every day, Nell asked her mom to give her some jelly.
One day, Mom said yes and gave Nell a jelly. Nell took a bite and realized it was the most delicious jelly she had ever tasted. It was so sweet and so yummy!
Nell asked her mom where the jelly had come from. Mom said it was a harmless jelly bug she had found in the garden. Nell was amazed that something so sweet and delicious came from a harmless bug!
Nell thanked her mom for giving her the jelly and they enjoyed it together. Nell was so thankful that she would never forget the wonderful jelly gift her mom had given her.

Once upon a time there was a car. The car was a bright red and its windows were shiny. The car felt so happy, but it didn't have any friends to play with. 
One day while the car was out driving, it heard a noise coming from the sky. It looked up and saw a helicopter! The car was so excited!
The car called out to the helicopter, “Hey, do you want to play with me?” The helicopter replied, “Sure! What do you want to do?”
The car said, “Let's have a race! We can race to the other side of town.” The helicopter agreed, so they both revved up their engines and started to race.
The car was moving really fast, but the helicopter had more speed. The car was worried that it would lose. But then it had an idea. 
The car said, “Let's turn the speed down so that it's more available for both of us. That way we can both have a fair race!” The helicopter agreed and they both turned down their speed, so that the race was now fair.
They both raced to the other side of town and, in the end, the car won! The helicopter was so proud of the car and congratulated it for coming in first. 
The car was so happy that it had made a friend and

Once upon a time there was a boy who was very gifted. Every day he would explore and find new things. 
One day, he found a hill. He was so excited, he ran up as fast as he could. When he reached the top, he looked around and saw a lot of plants and trees. 
He looked up at the sky and noticed there were some shiny stars. They were twinkling in the dark night sky. 
The boy waved to the stars and smiled. He was so happy to find the hill and see the stars. He knew that he would come back there again soon.

Once upon a time, there was a generous pigeon. Everywhere she went, she tried to help animals by sharing some of her food. All the other animals welcomed her with a smile.
But one day, the pigeon had eaten all of her food. She was very hungry and had nowhere to go. Then, she heard a voice in the distance. It was an old fox. 
The fox said, "I will give you some food, dear pigeon if you help me with a task I have. I need you to collect some stones that are lying around my den. Can you help me?"
The generous pigeon happily agreed to help the fox. Once she had collected the stones, the fox gave her a feast of food to eat.
The moral of the story: If you are generous and helpful to others, you will be rewarded.

Once upon a time there was a little boy. He loved to mix things together. One day, he was playing with some paint. He decided to mix the paint on the floor.
He splashed and dripped the paint all over the floor. His mom saw the floor and it was so busy with paint! She was really mad.
She told the little boy that he was in big trouble. He was so sad. He had to clean up all the paint and it was so hard.
When he did all the cleaning, his mom told him he could never mix on the floor anymore. The little boy was so sad. 
He learned his lesson, and never mixed on the floor anymore. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a mighty bear named Grandpa. Grandpa lived deep in the forest and loved playing all sorts of games with his friends. One day, Grandpa found a long, thick rope in the woods. Grandpa got so excited, he couldn't wait to show his friends.
When Grandpa's pals saw the rope, they got so happy! They began to hop and cheer. "Let's have fun!" one of them exclaimed. The friends began to think of games they could play with the rope.
"Let's make a rope swing!" yelled one of the friends. And so, they strung the rope to the tallest tree around. Grandpa held tight and gave a mighty push, sending himself swing through the air. Grandpa laughed louder than ever!
The friends were so excited they wanted to swing, too. Great Grandpa, being so kind annd generous, invited his friends to join him. With a smile, he said, "Climb on board, everyone. We're going to swing like mighty bears!"

Once upon a time, there was a reliable dog who liked to pull things. He loved to pull all kinds of things, like sticks, logs, and anything else he could find.
One day, he went to the park, pulled a stick and started to itch. He was so itchy that he kept on scratching himself all over the park. He even tried to pull his collar off because it was so itchy.
Finally, he found a tiny hole in the ground and he decided to jump in it. He figured he could itch away from everyone, so he started to scratch, pull and squirm.
When he finished all of his itches, the reliable dog jumped out of the hole and back into the park. He was a very relieved and happy pup who learned an important lesson that day- never scratch an itch in public!

Sue was an adventurous girl. She loved to explore and find exciting stuff. One day, Sue decided she wanted to deliver a special package. She went to the post office and asked the mailman to help. The mailman said he was too busy, but he did provide Sue with a special box and some directions.
Sue was so excited that she quickly went home to try and deliver the package. But when she got there, she realized something was wrong. The box was too heavy and she couldn't pick it up. Sue tried her best to deliver the package, but it was too difficult.
Eventually, Sue had to give up. She was very sad and disappointed that she couldn't deliver the special package. She ended up leaving it behind, never to be seen again. It was a bad ending for a very adventurous girl.

Once upon a time there was a little bird who loved to fly. Every day the bird would fly high in the sky and sing her sweet songs.
One day the bird was getting tired from all her flying, so she decided to take a nap. She looked for a place to take a nap and finally she found the perfect spot. She settled down in the grass and made herself really comfortable.
The bird closed her eyes, ready for a long and deep nap. Suddenly, a small voice said, "Excuse me, can I join you for your nap?"
The bird opened her eyes and saw a little bug had come to join her. They both snuggled up together in the warm grass and started to take a long, deep nap.
And so, the little bird and the little bug cuddled up and took a deep, peaceful nap, safe and secure in the warm grass.

Once upon a time there was a True, who wanted to visit some friends. She was fit and ready for a day of fun.
True's friends lived far away, so it took a long time to get there. She walked and skipped, trying her best to keep up. When True reached her friends, she was so happy.
True's friends were very excited to see her. They hugged her tight and laughed a lot. They showed her their games and toys, and True had so much fun.
After playing for hours and hours, True said goodbye to her friends. She was fit again and ready to go home. On the walk home, she smiled, happy to have visited her friends.
The end.

Once upon a time there was a king who had a very special sword. The king had a joyful heart and wanted to share his cheerfulness with the people. But he was scared they wouldn't like him. So, he delayed showing them his sword. 
One day, the kind decided it was time to show everyone his sword. He was scared but he was also excited. He had made the right choice to wait. Once the people saw the sword they cheered! They said the sword was splendid and they felt happy the king wanted to share it with them. 
From that day on, the moral was clear: although it can be hard to share something special with people, it is worth it in the end! Sharing joy and happiness can lead to very cheerful results.

One cold morning, an old man was walking through the woods. He had a bag in his hand and was looking around. Suddenly, he noticed a copper coin on the ground. He quickly picked it up and put it in the bag. Just then, he heard a voice.
A little girl was walking towards him. She asked, "Did you take that copper coin?" 
The old man shivered. He couldn't believe it. He looked down guiltily and said, "Yes, I did take it." 
The little girl glared at him. "That's not fair," she said. "That copper coin doesn't belong to you. You should give it back!" 
The old man felt guilty and shivered again. He knew the little girl was right. He gave back the copper coin and apologized to her. The little girl thanked him and walked away.
The old man watched her go. He learned his lesson that day. It was wrong to take something that belonged to someone else.

Once upon a time there was an ancient big cat. His name was Tigger. He lived in a forest and liked to go for long walks in the woods.
One day, Tigger was walking through the forest when he saw something. It was an old paw! Tigger knew that it must have been an ancient paw, so he decided to take it home.
Tigger picked up the paw and started walking home. As he walked, he shouted out "I found an ancient paw!" 
When he got home, his family heard him shouting and came out to see what he had found. They were amazed when they saw the paw.
Tigger was so happy and proud that he shouted out "Look what I found!"
The family celebrated with Tigger and everyone shouted with joy. 
It was a happy day and Tigger's ancient paw will be forever remembered.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Tia. She was three years old and she loved to play with her toys. One day, Tia decided to do something special. She took her toys and weighed them against each other.
She took a doll and a cauliflower and carefully weighed them, but when she was done, they were the same weight! Tia was embarrassed, but she didn't give up. She tried weighing the cauliflower with different things, but it still weighed the same. 
Suddenly, Tia had an idea. She asked her mom for help. Her mom taught her that sometimes, we need to ask for help to solve our problems.
Tia was so excited. With her mom's help, she found something that was heavier than the cauliflower. She was proud of herself for asking for help.
This story has a moral value, which is that it is okay to ask for help when we need it. We should never be embarrassed to do so.

One day, a dark cloud brought a flood. The flood was big and strong. Everybody was scared and ran home. All the animals ran away too! 
The water came higher and higher. It was dark outside and the water was very cold. The trees and houses were all wet. 
But the sun came out and brought the flood back down. Everybody was happy and could go outside again. They all cheered and hugged each other when the water was gone. 
It was a happy day when the dark cloud brought the flood but the sun and everyone brought it back down.

Once upon a time, there was a small sack. The sack contained lots of things that were difficult to understand. One day, the sack started to talk. It asked the little three year old for help.
The child was surprised and scared, but was also curious. So, the child decided to listen to the sack. The sack told the child about all the difficult things that were inside it.
The child thought about how to help the sack. They decided to try and explain the difficult things inside. The child talked to the sack and told it that everything would be okay.
Afterwards, the child was very proud of themselves. The sack thanked the little one and said it was ready to face the difficult things. Finally, the sack and the child said goodbye and went on their own ways.

Once there was a little frog who liked to hop around his pond. Every morning, he would get up early and go for a hop around the pond before everyone else was up.
One morning, he saw a strange land close to his pond and he got curious. He wondered what it was, so he hopped over and had a look. He saw it was a very flexible land, that moved as he hopped on it!
The little frog was surprised and couldn't quite understand what was happening. Suddenly, he heard a voice from behind him. It was an older frog who said, "That is a very special land. It is flexible because it is made of a special material - it only moves when you jump on it!"
The little frog was so excited to hear this news and thanked the old frog for all the help. After that he hopped around the flexible land and had a wonderful time. He never got tired of exploring, and he was always sure to hop there whenever he had the chance.

Once upon a time there were two friends, Tom and Cat. Tom was a three year old and Cat was a cat. Tom loved cats.
One day Tom said to Cat, "Let's play a game. I will hide and you have to find and catch me!" Cat jumped around excitedly, ready to play.
So Tom ran and found a great spot to hide behind a couch. He heard Cat meowing out his name and looking for him, but he just stayed still and quiet.
After a few minutes, Cat finally found Tom behind the couch. "Caught you!" said Cat. Tom laughed and giggled.
Then, Tom found a bathrobe in the couch. It was soft and cozy. He put it on and said, "Look Cat, I look different!" Cat was very surprised. They both laughed and hugged each other.
That was a great day! Tom and Cat were best friends forever.

Once upon a time, there was a brave bumblebee named Baloo. He always knew what was the right thing to do, but one day he didn't know what should happen. Baloo came across a will and he thought it was very useful. He wanted to know what it said so he picked it up and set off.
Baloo soon came across a bear who was his good friend. The bear asked him why he had the will in his hands. Baloo told the bear he thought it was useful. The bear said that the will would only be useful if it was used properly.
The bear then told Baloo that it was important to always do what was right and to think of others before himself. The opinion had an effect on Baloo and he decided to put the will into action and use it for good.
He shared the will with all of his animal friends and with their help, they were able to do great things. Baloo had learned a valuable lesson that day: always think of others before yourself and use the things you find in a helpful and positive way.

Once upon a time, there were two friends, Bear and Rabbit. Bear was big and tall and Rabbit was tiny and small. One day, Rabbit wanted to find the dragon. Bear told Rabbit it was too dangerous to go. But Rabbit wanted to explore and examine the dragon for himself.
Bear and Rabbit went on an adventure to find the dragon. Finally, they arrived at a clearing in the forest and there was a tall dragon! Rabbit was so excited but Bear felt scared. They stood looking at the dragon for a long time.
Rabbit wanted to take a closer look and started to step closer but Bear stopped him. Bear said it was too dangerous and they needed to leave. Rabbit didn't want to listen and stepped closer to the dragon. Suddenly, the ground started to shake and the dragon opened its mouth and roared!
Bear and Rabbit quickly ran back to safety and Bear was glad they had listened to him. They both knew it was too dangerous to examine the dragon, but they were happy they had gone on an adventure. The end.

Once upon a time there was a giant who lived in the woods. He was very big, bigger than any trees.
One day, the giant saw a little girl all alone in the woods. He smiled at her and gave her a friendly nod.
The little girl smiled back and looked up at the giant. He nodded and said, "Come follow me and I'll keep you safe from all the things that go bump in the night!"
The little girl smiled again, took the giant's hand, and followed him deep into the woods.
The giant showed her many wonderful things - goodberries, secret streams, and even friendly animals like deer and birds.
The little girl enjoyed every moment with the giant, and when it was time to go home, the giant nodded to her one last time.
The little girl felt safe, happy and good inside as she followed the giant out of the woods. 
And they both lived happily ever after!

Once there was a lonely hunter. He had nothing, but his bow and his arrows. He would go out to shoot and bring back food for himself.
One day, he shot his arrow into the forest and on his way back home, he heard a loud noise! It was a baby deer!
He was so surprised at the sight of the tiny creature that he couldn't bring himself to shoot it. So, instead, he looked around and found some berries to feed it.
The baby deer seemed very happy with the food and followed the hunter home. From that day on, the hunter was never lonely as he had made a new friend. He and his baby deer lived together happily and the hunter was able to feed them both with his bows and arrows.

Once there was a humble player. Everywhere they went they filled people with happiness and joy. One day they went to a park with a few friends. Suddenly, they heard a loud sound coming from the playground. It was a young 3 year old child who had Trip the ball into the sand pit.
The humble player decided to help the little one. They picked up the ball, gave it a gentle pat and tossed it back up to the child. The youngster was so delighted with the help they had received and ran over cheerfully to give the player a warm hug. 
Their humble actions filled not only the child, but also the bystanders with a sense of pleasure. Everyone cheered with joy and clapped for the small gesture of kindness. From that day onwards, the player was known for being humble and for always filling others with warmth and cheer.

Once upon a time, there was a nosy lion who loved to count. One day, he was walking through the woods and came across a beautiful music box. He was so excited he started counting the notes he could hear.
But as he was counting, he made too much noise and disturbed a sleeping bear. The bear was so mad, he roared and chased the lion away. 
The lion was scared and ran all the way home. He was so embarrassed and sad that he couldn't enjoy the music and counting anymore. 
The next day, the lion tried to count again, but very quietly this time. He enjoyed the music just as much and had more fun. 
The lion learned that being nosy and making too much noise is not always a good idea. Everyone else is trying to enjoy the music as well - it's always important to be considerate of others.

Once upon a time, there was a judge who was very serious. She was always trying to help people and did her very best to be fair and kind.
One day the judge was sitting in a courtroom when a little boy came in and the judge smiled. The boy was carrying a big picture that he had made. He could hardly wait to show it to the judge.
The judge asked the boy what was in the picture, so the boy pointed to a big tree in the corner. He then started to explain that the tree was leaning - it was very crooked and it looked like it might fall down.
The judge had to think carefully, because she wanted to make sure she was being fair. Finally the judge decided that the tree should be cut down, because it was unsafe. The boy was sad, but he knew that the judge had been serious.

Once upon a time, there was a sad little girl. She was feeling very frustrated, because she couldn't find her safe place. She looked all around in her room, but it was nowhere to be found.
The little girl began to feel even sadder. She missed having a safe place to go to when she felt frustrated.
She decided to go outside, in the hope that she might find her safe place there. As she looked around, she saw a big tree. It looked strong and protective, like it could be a safe place for her. Suddenly she was filled with joy!
The little girl ran to the tree and hugged it tightly. She knew that it was just the kind of place she was searching for. Whenever she felt frustrated or scared, she went to the tree. She's never felt so happy, or so safe.

Once upon a time, there was a famous king who liked to mark the walls of his castle. He thought it made his castle more special and grand. One day, his young daughter asked to help mark the walls too.
The king thought it was a sweet idea, so he let her help him. But the daughter marked the walls too much, and soon it was covered in markings. 
The King was quite angry and spoke in an angry voice: "Why did you mark the walls so much?"
The daughter was a bit scared and replied: "I just wanted to help you."
The King was still very mad and said: "No more marking the walls! If you do it again, I will be very cross."
The daughter didn't want to displease her king, so she never marked the walls again. She was a very obedient daughter and she and the King lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Amanda. She loved to play with her toys and she was very happy. One day she went to the park to play and when she arrived there, she saw something very special. It was a big red box with a secret inside.
But when she opened the box, it was empty. She was sad and she tried to remember what was inside the box. She thought hard but the memory was gone. She felt so tight in her little heart.
Suddenly, a fairy appeared in front of her and said she had the power to restore the box's memory. Amanda was so happy that she agreed to the fairy's offer. The fairy waved her wand and then the box had a memory again.
But then suddenly the box made a loud sound and a huge monster appeared. The monster was so angry that it wanted to destroy Amanda! Amanda was very scared but the fairy told her to run away quickly.
But it was too late and the monster got her and ruined her happy day. Amanda's toys were broken and she couldn't restore her happy day. She was so sad and all she wanted was to have her happy day back but it was all gone.

Mommy was worried. She had to find something special to decorate the house. Then she had an idea. She went outside and found a very cute caterpillar in the garden.
The caterpillar was very colourful. Red and yellow! Mommy thought it would look good in the house. She carefully picked it up and brought it inside.
Mommy put the caterpillar in the middle of the room and gave it lots of decorations to play with. She gave it a paintbrush, some paper and some colourful glitter.
The caterpillar had so much fun decorating the house. When it was finished, the caterpillar looked very happy. Mommy was no longer worried. She was so happy that she gave the caterpillar a big hug.

Once there was a little girl and she loved to dance. Every day she would do special dances and try on new fashion. One day, she saw a dress in the store that was weird. She thought it was beautiful, so she went inside to try it on. 
But when the girl put on the weird dress, it started to twirl around and before she knew it, she was dancing wildly. Other people in the shop started to laugh and point. The girl was very embarrassed.
Suddenly, she felt tired and dizzy. She collapsed in the store, but no one helped her. Eventually, the store owners called an ambulance, but it was too late. The girl had died from dancing in the weird fashion.

Once upon a time there was a brother and sister playing with their toys. They had a wonderful time playing with their blocks and dolls. The brother was being silly and put the dolls too close to the edge of the table. Suddenly the dolls fell and broke! 
The brother was so sorry. He said to his sister, "I'm sorry! I didn't mean to break your dolls." But his sister was very mad. She shouted at him, "That wasn't very nice! You should be more careful!"
The brother felt really bad, so he decided to try and fix the dolls. He put the pieces all back together until they looked almost like new. He gave them back to his sister and said, "I'm sorry, I'm really sorry." 
His sister was so happy to see her dolls fixed. She said, "Thank you, dear brother. I forgive you." The brother and sister hugged, and then went back to having a wonderful time playing together.

Once upon a time there was a man. He loved to make incredible noises. All the kids in the neighborhood called him the Sound Man. When Sound Man would come around, the kids would run outside to listen. He could make sounds that were like nothing they had ever heard before.
One day, the Sound Man made an incredible sound that made the whole neighborhood smile. All the kids clapped and cheered as the sound got louder and louder. They kept calling him back for more.
The Sound Man kept coming back to the neighborhood to perform. Every time he did, the kids would be so excited to hear what incredible noises he could make. He quickly became the favorite person in the neighborhood and everyone looked forward to his visits.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Emma. She was very small and very obedient.
One day, her mom told her to put on her dress. Emma did what she was told, and was very happy to wear her dress.
Next, her mom told Emma to wipe the floor clean. Emma grabbed a cloth and wiped the floor. When she was finished, it was as clean as a new penny.
Finally, her mom asked her to wipe the table. Emma did as she was told and wiped the table until it shone.
Emma was so obedient that her mom was very proud of her. She hugged her and told her how happy she was.
Emma was glad that she had been so obedient, and she felt proud of herself too.

Once upon a time there was a big, scary monster. It had big, sharp teeth and big, scary ears. It lived in a forest far away from a little village. 
The people in the village were scared of the monster and they tried to stay away from the forest. But one day a little girl called Sarah was lost and she ended up in the forest. 
The monster saw Sarah and he wanted to eat her because she looked so yummy. He chased her and Sarah was so scared. But then Sarah remembered she had her big, strong dad at home and she shouted at the monster. 
The monster was so shocked he ran away and Sarah was safe. Sarah ran back home to her dad and she never went back to the forest again. She knew it was a dangerous place to be.

Once there was a little girl named Susie. She was three and she loved to explore. One day she saw a silly little snake in the garden. It was orange and yellow.
Susie was scared of snakes, but she was brave. She stepped closer and watched the snake. She saw that it was eating flowers and leaves. Before long, she didn't feel scared anymore.
That day, Susie decided to help the snake. She brought some of her mom's special fertilizer, and sprinkled it onto the soil. She also found some plants to help it find food.
After a few days, the garden started to look better. The weeds were gone and the plants were growing. The snake was getting bigger and happier.
Susie was so proud of her work! She had helped the silly little snake improve its home.

One day, Sam was walking to the park. He saw a big building and stepped inside. He stared up at the tall walls and wondered what was inside. Suddenly, he heard a voice.
The voice said, "Hey Sam, if you want to go outside, look for the exit."
Sam was puzzled, so he asked, "What's an exit?"
The voice laughed. "It's the way out. Look for the door with a big sign that says 'exit'."
Sam nodded, and ran off to find the exit. He stepped up to the door, and tried to open it, but it was locked. Suddenly, he heard the voice again.
"Sam, this door is too tight. Look around for another one. See if you can find a door that isn't shut."
Sam nodded, and ran off again. He searched around, and eventually found an open door. He stepped through it, and found himself outside in the sunshine. He smiled, and stepped down the path to the park.

Once upon a time there was a small village. In that village was a very special musician. He played the most beautiful music and everyone in the village loved it. 
One day, the musician was packing his instruments to go on a long journey. The villagers were very sad to see him go.
The musician smiled and said to them, "I will bring something special back for you if I can."
Before he left, the villager's knew the musician may never come back. As days passed, everyone in the village was sad without the musician and his music.
Many weeks passed and the villagers started to lose hope. Then, one morning, they were awoken by the most beautiful music. Everyone could recognize it was the musician playing his instruments. 
The musician had returned and he had brought something with him. It was a fragile glass jar with colorful lights moving inside of it. The villagers were mesmerized by this. 
The musician had brought them something even better than music. He had brought them a gift of wonder and joy! 
The villagers thanked the musician and celebrated wildly. They had never seen something so beautiful and the fragile glass jar stayed with them forever.

One day, Tom was jogging in the backyard. It was a fine day and he was feeling good about the jog. Suddenly he saw a big dog in the backyard. The dog was barking at him and it didn't look very friendly. Tom stopped his jog and was scared. He didn't know what to do. 
He tried to run away but the dog was too fast. The dog kept growling and got closer to him. He felt so scared that he closed his eyes. Suddenly, he heard a soft voice. It was his friend Jane. She came out of the house carrying a big stick. Jane told the dog to go away in a loud voice and the dog ran away.
Tom was so happy and relieved that Jane had come to help him. They hugged each other and Tom thanked her for coming to his rescue. Everything was fine and Tom continued his jog. He was happy and thankful for his friend and the nice day.

Once upon a time, there was a brilliant girl named Lucy. She was very curious and wanted to learn new things. One day, her mom and dad took her to the park. She saw a fountain with splashing water. She asked her mom to teach her how to play with it.
"Sure, Lucy," said her mom. She showed Lucy how to move her hands and make the water spray around. Lucy enjoyed it very much and played with the fountain for a long time.
When it was time to go home, her mom said, "This fountain teaches us to think about how our actions affect ourselves and others around us. Let's remember to think before we do things or speak words that may cause harm to someone else. This way we can stay kind and helpful to all."
Lucy thought about it for a moment and nodded. She had learned a very important lesson from the fountain. As they walked home, Lucy couldn't help but smile with joy.

Once upon a time, there was a kind old man who lived in the forest. His rake was painted white and it helped him keep the yard clean.
The man was always very generous, and always willing to forgive people when they did wrong. He knew it was important to show kindness towards others.
One day, a naughty little boy came to the old man's house and tried to steal his white rake. He ran away with it even when the man told him to stop.
The man was sad about it because he knew that it would be hard to get another rake. He tried to find the little boy but he was nowhere to be seen.
He was too late, and the little boy was gone with his white rake. The old man was sad and angry, but he knew that he must forgive the boy because he knew it was the only thing to do.

Once upon a time there was a boy called John who loved to try new things. One day he decided to go on an adventure and collect different stamps. 
He saw a smelly stamp in the bush, so he tried to grab it. Just as he was about to pick it up, he heard a voice.
"Hi there, what are you doing?" it said.
John looked up and saw a man with a friendly face. He said, "I'm trying to find some stamps for my collection." 
The man said, "I have some stamps too - would you like to see them?"
John said yes. So the man took him to his house and showed John his collection of stamps. Some were old and some were new, and some of them even smelled funny. Together they looked through the stamps until they found the smelly one. 
John thanked the man and made his way home. He was very happy with his new stamp and couldn't wait to show it to his friends. 
The end.

Dave was grumpy. He was not in the mood to share anything he had. He was sitting alone, looking at a pattern he had drawn in the sand. Suddenly, Peter came beside him and asked if he could share Dave's pattern. Dave thought for a minute and slowly nodded. Together, they looked at the pattern and started to make changes to make it even better. They smiled and laughed as they shared their ideas. After a while, Dave was happy again. He realized that it was fun to share with others. He thanked Peter for coming over and asked him to come again tomorrow. Peter said he would and they both went home with big smiles on their faces.

Once upon a time there was a happy tank. He was eager to explore the world around him. So he began to swim and splash through the cool waters.
Wherever he went he looked for new friends. One day, he met a little fish who welcomed him with a warm smile. The tank was excited, and the fish quickly became his best friend.
They spent many days playing together and discovering new things. Whenever the tank saw a new creature, the fish would say, "Welcome!". It was a cute little habit that the tank had grown to love.
The two friends made all sorts of wonderful memories. Sometimes they raced, other times they played tag. Even when they were apart, the tank was always eager to reunite with his best friend. 
And they lived happily ever after!

Once upon a time there was a big orange drawer. It was filled with all kinds of fun goodies.
One day a little girl wanted to play with them. But she didn't know where to find them.
So she asked her mom to lend her the orange drawer. Her mom said yes, and gave the girl the orange drawer.
The girl was so happy! She opened the drawer and found lots of fun stuff. She played with the things in the orange drawer all day.
When it was time to go home, the girl thanked her mom for lending her the orange drawer. Her mom was glad she had her fun. And the little girl was very happy with all the things she played with!

Once upon a time there was a brave little girl. She was a bit scared, but she really wanted to solve a problem. She had to get to the top of a big hill. She looked at it and felt a bit scared, but she told herself she could do it.
She put one foot in front of the other, and before she knew it, she was already halfway up the hill! She kept going, even when it seemed hard and she was feeling a bit fearful.
Finally she reached the top! There was a big cheer from everyone that she had made it, and she was so proud of herself. She had solved the problem and felt so powerful!

Once upon a time there was a child who wanted to be successful. Every day, the child would turn the pages of books to learn new things. One day, the child felt very tired, so he decided to take a nap.
While the child was sleeping, he dreamed of turning into a successful person. Suddenly, a voice said, “You can be successful! All you have to do is turn this door handle.” 
The child was so happy that he jumped out of bed and ran to the door. He looked at the handle and thought to himself, “I can do this!” With a big smile, the child turned the handle. 
But when the child opened the door, he was not successful. Instead, he was back in his bedroom! The child was very sad and wished he had never turned the door handle.

Once upon a time, there was a little furry rabbit that lived on a planet far away. The rabbit just loved to wave at people and explore the world. 
One day the rabbit was hopping around and waving at the birds that flew above. Suddenly, a friendly fairy appeared in front of them. The fairy waved back at the rabbit and said, "Hi there! What are you up to?".
The rabbit smiled, "I'm just hopping around and waving at the birds!" The fairy replied, "That's so much fun! Why don't you wander around and explore the planet?" 
The rabbit was excited and started hopping away. The fairy waved goodbye and the rabbit waved back. 
The rabbit wandered around and explored the planet for hours. Every time the fairy passed by, the rabbit would wave and the fairy would wave back. What a special friendship!  
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Sam. He was a very nice boy and he loved making new friends. One day, Sam came across a flea in the park. He said hello to the flea and they soon became good friends.
Sam and the flea played together every day and Sam would tell the flea all his secrets. Everyone in the park started to like the flea and to join in their games. 
But one day, Sam heard some kids talking about how jealous they were of the flea. It made Sam feel sad that anyone would be jealous of his friend.
So, Sam told the kids that there was no reason to be jealous of the flea, because it was more important to value kindness and friendship over silly things like how popular somebody was.
The kids learned their lesson and from that day forward, everyone in the park got along because they valued friendship and kindness. 
And Sam and his flea friend stayed friends forever.

Once there was a farmer who was very bossy. He lived on a farm and he had lots of animals. The farmer was always shouting orders and scolding the animals.
One day when the farmer was mucking out the pigs, he noticed one of his little ducks was looking very tired.
He said to the duck, "What are you doing? Come over here, I'm going to show you something."
The duck waddled over and the farmer put some polish in his hands. He said to the duck, "We need to polish your feathers. Let me show you how."
The farmer then began to rub the polish all over the duck's feathers. The duck liked it, he began quacking contentedly.
When he had finished polishing the duck, the farmer said, "There, now don't you look fine? This will make you look much better."
The duck loved his polished feathers and kept waddling around the farm showing them off. From then on, all the animals on the farm knew the farmer was bossy, but also kind-hearted.

Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was very spoiled, and always got what she wanted.
One day, she was watching her favorite cartoon on TV. She was so excited to see the characters perform their silly dances!
But then something unexpected happened. Suddenly, the TV switched off and she couldn't watch the cartoon anymore. She was so upset and began to cry.
Her mom came into the room and saw what had happened. She knew her daughter was spoiled, so she decided to try something special. She took her daughter to the theater to watch a live performance of the cartoon!
The little girl was so surprised and happy to see her favorite cartoon characters on stage. She clapped and cheered as they performed all of their fun dances. She had never seen anything like it before and it was a moment she would never forget.
The little girl was so spoiled, but sometimes it is nice to spoil someone you love. She never forgot that special day at the theater and continued to watch her favorite cartoon with a big smile.

The wealthy man went hunting. He had a big gun with him. He wanted to shoot something. After a long time looking, he saw a deer. He was very excited and he shot at it. But he missed and the deer ran away.
He kept walking around and then he saw a bottle of wine. He smiled and thought it was a lucky day! He took the wine and walked away. 
The man was happy and he decided to sit down and enjoy his wine. He drank it and felt very pleased. He was so happy that he started to dance around the woods.
When he stopped dancing, he was very happy and he thanked God for the wine. Then he went home and enjoyed the rest of his day with a big smile on his face.

Once upon a time there was a whale. He was swimming in the deep blue sea, enjoying being free. Suddenly he felt something touch his fin. He looked around and noticed a big, empty bowl.
He swam closer and peeked inside the bowl. It was full of yummy things! He couldn't resist and tasted a little bit of everything. It was delicious.
The whale was so happy that he went up to the surface of the ocean and shouted with joy. He stayed up there for a while, until it was time to go back under the sea.
The whale swam away with a smile on his face, still tasting the delicious flavours of the things he had eaten from the empty bowl.

Sam was a generous three year old who loved to cook. He had his own grill and was always inviting his friends over to cook together. His friends loved eating the delicious treats that he prepared for them.
One day, he was so busy cooking that he didn't notice a mean, old sign that had been posted in the park. It said that grills were not allowed in the park. Sam was worried that he might get in trouble if someone saw him with his grill. 
But just when he was about to turn around and leave, one of his friends saw him and screamed out in delight. Soon enough, all the kids in the park were gathered around the grill, rubbing their tummies and excitedly watching Sam prepare the food.
